translated: Good man, listen to me, lord of the earth, ruler of the land, I ask for a boon from you today, O king, grant it.

original: abhiprāyu mahya yatha cittamanaḥpraharṣaṃ tanme śṛṇuṣva bhava prītamanā udagraḥ // / //
analyzed: citta manaḥ praharṣam tat me śṛṇuṣva bhava prīta manāḥ udagraḥ
translated: My intention is to delight my mind and heart, listen to it, be joyful and elated.

original: gṛhṇāmi deva vrataśīlavaropavāsaṃ aṣṭāṅgapoṣadhamahaṃ jagi maitracittā /
analyzed: gṛhṇāmi deva vrata śīla vara upavāsam aṣṭāṅga poṣadham aham maitra cittā
translated: O god, I take the vow of moral conduct and fasting, the eight-part fast, with a friendly mind towards the world.

original: prāṇeṣu hiṃsaviratā sada śuddhabhāvā premaṃ yathātmani pareṣu tathā karomi // / //
analyzed: prāṇeṣu hiṃsa viratā śuddha bhāvā pra imam yathā ātmani pareṣu tathā karomi
translated: I will abstain from harming living beings, always pure in intention, and love others as I do myself.

analyzed: vaidya
translated: Physician

original: stainyādvivarjitamanā madalobhahīnā kāmeṣu mithya nṛpate na samācariṣye /
analyzed: stainyāt vivarjita manāḥ mada lobha hīnā kāmeṣu nṛpate na samācariṣye
translated: I will refrain from stealing, free from pride and greed, and not engage in sexual misconduct with others' wives, O King.

original: satye sthitā apiśunā paruṣaprahīṇā saṃdhipralāpamaśubhaṃ na samācariṣye // / //
analyzed: satye sthitā a piśunā paruṣa prahīṇā saṃdhi pralāpam aśubham na samācariṣye
translated: I will abide in truth, avoid slander, abandon harsh speech, and not engage in frivolous or unwholesome conversation.

original: vyāpādadoṣakhilamohamadaprahīṇā sarvā abhidhya vigatā svadhanena tuṣṭā /
analyzed: vyāpāda doṣa khila moha mada prahīṇā sarvāḥ vigatā sva dhanena tuṣṭā
translated: Free from ill-will, hatred, hypocrisy, delusion, and pride, and abandoning all covetousness, content with my own wealth,

original: samyakprayukta akuhānilayā anirṣyu karmā yathā daśa ime kuśalā cariṣye // / //
analyzed: karmā yathā daśa ime cariṣye
translated: I will practice these ten wholesome actions properly, without deceit, flattery, or envy.

original: mā tvaṃ narendra mayi kāmatṛṣāṃ kuruṣva śīlavrateṣvabhiratāya susaṃvṛtāya /
analyzed: mā tvam narendra mayi kāma tṛṣām kuruṣva śīla vrateṣu abhiratāya su saṃvṛtāya
translated: O King, do not be consumed by desire for me. I delight in discipline and vows, and am well-controlled.

original: mā te apuṇya nṛpate bhavi dīrgharātramanumodayā hi mama śīlavratopavāsam // / //
analyzed: mā te apuṇya nṛpate bhavi dīrgharātram anumodaya hi mama śīla vrata upavāsam
translated: Do not let unwholesome karma befall you, O King, for a long time. Rejoice in my observance of discipline and vows.

original: chando mameṣa nṛpate praviśādya śīghraṃ prāsādaharmyaśikhare sthita dhārtarāṣṭre /
analyzed: chandaḥ mama iṣa nṛpate praviśa adya śīghram prāsāda harmya śikhare sthita dhārtarāṣṭre
translated: O King, if you desire, enter my palace quickly, to the top of the palace pavilion, O son of Dhṛtarāṣṭra.

original: sakhibhiḥ sadā parivṛtā sukha modayeyaṃ puṣpābhikīrṇaśayane mṛduke sugandhe // / //
analyzed: sakhibhiḥ sadā parivṛtā sukha modayeyam puṣpa abhikīrṇa śayane mṛduke sugandhe
translated: Surrounded by friends, I would rejoice in happiness, on a soft and fragrant bed strewn with flowers.

original: na ca kāñcukīya puruṣā na pi dārakāśca na ca istri prākṛta mamā purataḥ sthiheyā /
analyzed: na ca kāñcukīya puruṣāḥ na dārakāḥ ca na ca puratas
translated: No chamberlains, no men, no children, no women or ordinary people should stand before me.

original: no cāmanāpa mama rūpa na śabdagandhān nānyatra iṣṭamadhurā śṛṇuyā suśabdān // / //
analyzed: mama na śabda gandhāt na anyatra iṣṭa madhurā śṛṇuyā su śabdān
translated: I should not hear unpleasant forms, sounds, smells, or tastes, but only pleasant and delightful sounds.

original: ye rodhabandhanagatāḥ parimuñca sarvān dravyāmbarāśca puruṣāndhaninaḥ kuruṣva /
analyzed: ye rodha bandhana gatāḥ parimuñca sarvān dravya ambarāḥ ca puruṣān dhaninaḥ kuruṣva
translated: Those who are in bondage or captivity, release them all. Make men wealthy with goods and clothes.

original: vastrānnapāna rathayugya tathāśvayānaṃ dada saptarātrikamidaṃ jagataḥ sukhārtham // / //
analyzed: vastra anna pāna ratha yugya tathā aśva yānam dada sapta rātrikam idam jagataḥ sukha artham
translated: For the sake of the world's happiness, give food, drink, carts, yokes, and horse-drawn vehicles for seven nights.

original: no co vivādakalahā na ca roṣavākyā cānyonyamaitramanaso hitasaumyacittā /
analyzed: vivāda kalahāḥ na ca roṣa vākyā ca anyonya maitra manasaḥ hita saumya cittā
translated: No quarrels, disputes, or angry words, but mutual friendship, benevolent and gentle thoughts.

original: asmin pure puruṣa iṣṭika dārakāśca devāśca nandanagatā sahitā ramantām // / //
analyzed: asmin pure puruṣa iṣṭika dārakāḥ ca devāḥ ca nandana gatā sahitāḥ ramantām
translated: In this city, let men, children, and gods, united, rejoice like in the Nandana grove.

analyzed: vaidya
translated: Vidy

original: na ca rājadaṇḍanabhaṭā na tathā kudaṇḍā notpīḍanā na pi ca tarjanatāḍanā vā /
analyzed: na ca rāja daṇḍana bhaṭāḥ na tathā kudaṇḍāḥ na utpīḍanāḥ na ca tarjana tāḍanāḥ vā
translated: No royal punishments, no bad punishments, no oppression, no threats or beatings.

original: sarvān prasannamanaso hitamaitracitta vīkṣasva deva janatāṃ yatha ekaputram // / //
analyzed: sarvān prasanna manasaḥ hita maitra citta vīkṣasva deva janatām eka putram
translated: With a serene mind and a heart full of benevolence and love, look upon all the people as if they were your only son.

original: śrutvaiva rāja vacanaṃ paramaṃ udagraṃ prāhāstu sarvamidameva yathā tavecchā /
analyzed: śrutvā eva rāja vacanam paramam udagram prāha astu sarvam idam eva yathā tava icchā
translated: Having heard the king's supremely joyful words, he said, Let it all be as you wish.

original: abhiprāyu tubhya manasā svanucintitāni yadyācase tava varaṃ tadahaṃ dadāmi // / //
analyzed: manasā su anucintitāni yat yācase tava varam tat aham dadāmi
translated: The thoughts in your mind, if you ask for a boon, I will give it to you.

original: ājñāpyaḥ pārthivavaraḥ svakapāriṣadyāṃ prāsādaśreṣṭhaśikhare prakarotha ṛddhim /
analyzed: ājñāpyaḥ pārthiva varaḥ svaka pāriṣadyām prāsāda śreṣṭha śikhare prakarotha ṛddhim
translated: The best of kings ordered his retinue, On the peak of the best palace, create prosperity.

analyzed: puṣpa abhikīrṇa ruciram vara dhūpa gandham chatrā patāka samalaṃkṛta tāla paṃktim
translated: With flowers scattered beautifully, with the fragrance of excellent incense, with a row of palm trees adorned with parasols and flags.

analyzed: nārāca śūla śara śakti gṛhīta khaṅgāḥ
translated: Twenty thousand warriors, with various armors, holding javelins, spears, arrows, and swords,

analyzed: parivāraya atha dhṛta rājya manojña ghoṣam devyāḥ bhaya artha karuṇā sthita rakṣamāṇā
translated: Surround the one who holds the kingdom, with a pleasant voice, protecting out of compassion for the sake of the queen's safety.

original: strībhistu sā parivṛtā yatha devakanyā snātānuliptapravarāmbarabhūṣitāṅgī /
analyzed: strībhiḥ tu sā parivṛtā deva kanyā snāta anulipta pravara ambara bhūṣita aṅgī
translated: Surrounded by women like a goddess, with her body anointed with oil and adorned with the best garments,

analyzed: tūryaiḥ sahasram anugīta manojña ghoṣaiḥ āruhya devī upaviveśa marut snuṣā iva
translated: With thousands of musical instruments playing delightful sounds, she ascended and sat down, like the daughter-in-law of the Maruts.

analyzed: divyaiḥ mahārtha su vicitra su ratna pādaiḥ su āstīrṇa puṣpa vividhaiḥ śayane manojñe
translated: On a bed with divine, very valuable, and wonderfully variegated jeweled feet, strewn with various beautiful flowers,

original: śayane sthitā vigalitā maṇiratnacūḍā yatha miśrakāvanagatā khalu devakanyā // / //
analyzed: śayane sthitā vigalitā maṇi ratna cūḍā miśrakāvana gatā khalu deva kanyā
translated: Standing on the bed, her jeweled crown fallen off, like a celestial maiden in the Mīśraka grove.

original: atha khalu bhikṣavaścatvāro mahārājānaḥ śakraśca devānāmindraḥ suyāmaśca devaputraḥ
analyzed: atha khalu bhikṣavaḥ catvāraḥ mahārājānaḥ śakraḥ ca devānām indraḥ suyāmaḥ ca deva putraḥ
translated: Then, monks, the four great kings, Śakra, lord of the gods, and the god Suyāma,

original: saṃtuṣitaśca sunirmitaśca paranirmitavaśavartī ca sārthavāhaśca māraputrabrahmā ca
analyzed: saṃtuṣitaḥ ca sunirmitaḥ ca paranirmitavaśavartī ca sārthavāhaḥ ca māraputrabrahmā ca
translated: Santuṣita, Sunirmita, Parinirmita-vaśavartin, Sārthavāha, the son of Māra, and Brahmā,

original: sahāṃpatirbrahmottaraśca purohitaḥ subrahmā ca purohitaḥ prabhāvyūhābhāsvaraśca maheśvaraśca
analyzed: sahāṃpatiḥ brahmottaraḥ ca purohitaḥ subrahmā ca purohitaḥ prabhā vyūha ābhāsvaraḥ ca maheśvaraḥ ca
translated: lord of the Sahā world, Brahmottara, the priest, Subrahmā, the priest, Prabhāvyūhābhāsvara, Maheśvara,

original: śuddhāvāsakāyikā niṣṭhāgataścākaniṣṭhaśca etāni cānyāni cānekāni devaśatasahasrāṇi🔽saṃnipatya anyonyamevāhuḥ ayuktametanmārṣā asmākaṃ syādakṛtajñatā ca /
analyzed: śuddhāvāsa kāyikāḥ niṣṭhāgataḥ ca a kaniṣṭhaḥ ca etāni ca anyāni ca anekāni deva śata sahasrāṇi  saṃnipatya anyonyam eva āhuḥ ayuktam etat mārṣāḥ asmākam syāt akṛtajña tā ca
translated: the Śuddhāvāsika gods, Niṣṭhāgata, and Akaniṣṭha, and many hundreds of thousands of other gods,🔽having assembled, said to each other: Friends, it would not be right for us to abandon the Bodhisattva alone and without a companion.

analyzed: yat vayam ekākinam advitīyam bodhisattvam utsṛjema
translated: That would be ingratitude on our part.

analyzed: kaḥ smākam mārṣāḥ utsahate vaidya
translated: Who among us, friends, is able to go to the Licchavi Vimalakīrti to inquire about his illness?🔽

analyzed: bodhisattvam satata samitam anubaddhum avakramaṇa garbha sthāna janma yauvana bhūmi dāraka krīḍā antaḥpura nāṭaka saṃdarśana abhiniṣkramaṇa duṣkara caryā bodhi maṇḍa upasaṃkramaṇa māra dharṣaṇa bodhi abhisaṃbodhana dharma cakra pravartanam
translated: Who among us, friends, is able to follow the Bodhisattva continuously, from his descent in the womb, through his stay in the womb, birth, youth, life on earth, play as a child, life in the inner palace, watching the dance, renunciation, practice of austerities, approach to the seat of awakening, subjugation of Mara, enlightenment, turning of the wheel of Dharma,

analyzed: yāvat mahāparinirvāṇāt hita citta tayā snigdha citta tayā priya citta tayā maitra citta tayā saumya citta tayā
translated: up to the great parinirvana, with a beneficial mind, a loving mind, a friendly mind, a compassionate mind, a gentle mind?

analyzed: tasyām velāyām imām gāthām abhāṣata
translated: At that time, he spoke this verse:

original: ko votsaheta vararūpadharam anubandhayituṃ satataṃ prītamanāḥ /
analyzed: kaḥ vā utsaheta vara rūpa dharam anubandhayitum satatam prīta manāḥ
translated: Who is able to follow the one with supreme form, always with a joyful mind?

original: kaḥ puṇyateja yaśasā vacasā svayamātmanecchati vibaddhayitum // / //
analyzed: kaḥ puṇya teja yaśasā vacasā svayam ātmanā icchati
translated: Who wishes to bind himself with merit, radiance, fame, and speech?

original: yasyepsitaṃ tridaśadevapure divyaiḥ sukhairhi ramituṃ satatam /
analyzed: yasya īpsitam tridaśa deva pure divyaiḥ sukhaiḥ hi ramitum satatam
translated: For whom it is desired to always enjoy divine pleasures in the city of the thirty-three gods,

analyzed: parama apsarobhiḥ iha kāma guṇaiḥ anubaddhitām vimala candra mukham
translated: bound by the supreme apsaras and the qualities of desire, with a face like a pure moon?🔽 Likewise, in the delightful and supreme mixed forest, in the divine abode of the gods,

original: tatha miśrake vanavare rucire divyākare ramitu devapure /
analyzed: miśrake vana vare rucire divya ākare deva pure
translated: in the city of the gods,

analyzed: puṣpa utkare kanaka cūrṇa nime anubandhatām vimala teja dharam
translated: And a multitude of flowers, like golden dust, may follow the one who holds pure radiance.

original: yasyepsitaṃ ramituḥ citrarathe tatha nandane suravadhūsahitaḥ /
analyzed: yasya īpsitam ramituḥ citrarathe nandane sura vadhū sahitaḥ
translated: For one who wishes to enjoy in the delightful Citraratha and Nandana groves, together with the divine maidens,

analyzed: māndāravaiḥ kusuma patra cite anubandhatām imu mahā puruṣam
translated: Covered with mandāra flowers and petals, may they follow this great being.

original: yāmādhipatyamatha vā tuṣitairatha vāpi prārthayati ceśvaratām /
analyzed: yām ādhipatyam atha vā tuṣitaiḥ atha vā api prārthayati ca īśvara tām
translated: If one desires the lordship of the Yāma gods or the Tuṣita gods, or even the sovereignty of the gods,

analyzed: pūjā rahaḥ sarva jage ananta yaśam
translated: Worthy of worship by all beings, may they follow this one of infinite fame.

original: yo icchati nirmitapure rucire vaśavartidevabhavane ramitum /
analyzed: icchati nirmita pure rucire vaśa varti deva bhavane ramitum
translated: If one wishes to enjoy in the delightful Nirmāṇarati, the abode of the Vaśavartin gods,

analyzed: manasā eva sarvam anubhokti kriyāḥ anubandha tām imu guṇa agra dharam  vaidya
translated: With all experiences accomplished by the mind alone, may they follow this one who holds the highest qualities.

analyzed: māra īśvaraḥ na ca praduṣṭa manāḥ sarvavidha aiśvarya pāra gataḥ
translated: The lord of Māra, with an untroubled mind, who has attained perfection in all kinds of sovereignty,

analyzed: kāmeśvaraḥ vaśita pāra gataḥ gacchatu asau hitakareṇa saha
translated: The lord of desire, who has attained perfection in mastery, may he go with the benefactor.

original: tatha kāmadhātu samatikramituṃ mati yasya brahmapuramāvasitum /
analyzed: kāmadhātu samatikramitum yasya brahmapuram āvasitum
translated: If one wishes to transcend the realm of desire and dwell in the abode of Brahmā,

analyzed: catur apramāṇa prabha teja dharaḥ mahāpuruṣam
translated: The one who holds the light of the four immeasurables, may he follow the great being today.

original: atha vāpi yasya manujeṣu mati varacakravartiviṣaye vipule /
analyzed: atha vā api yasya manujeṣu mati vara cakravarti viṣaye vipule
translated: Or if one wishes for the status of a supreme universal monarch in the human realm, with a vast dominion,

analyzed: ratnākaram abhaya saukhya dadam anubandha tām vipula puṇya dharam
translated: May he attain vast merit, the bestower of the ocean of jewels and the giver of fearlessness and happiness.

original: pṛthivīśvarastatha pi śreṣṭhisuto āḍhyo mahādhanu mahānicayaḥ /
analyzed: āḍhyaḥ mahā dhanu mahā nicayaḥ
translated: May the lord of the earth, the son of a merchant, the wealthy one, the one with great bows and great wealth,

analyzed: parivāravān nihata śatru gaṇaḥ gacchatu asau hita kareṇa saha
translated: Surrounded by his retinue, with his hordes of enemies destroyed, may he go forth with the benefactor.

original: rūpaṃ ca bhogamapi ceśvaratā kīrtiryaśaśca balatā guṇavatī /
analyzed: rūpam ca bhogam api ca īśvara tā kīrtiḥ yaśaḥ ca bala tā guṇavatī
translated: Form, enjoyment, and lordship, fame, glory, and virtuous strength,

original: ādeyavākya bhavi grāhyaruto brahmeśvaraṃ samupayātu vidum // / //
analyzed: ādeya vākya bhavi grāhya rutaḥ brahma īśvaram samupayātu vidum
translated: May he become one whose words are accepted and whose voice is heeded, may he approach the wise lord of Brahma.

original: ye divya kāma tatha mānuṣakāṃ yo icchatī tribhavi sarvasukham /
analyzed: mānuṣakām
translated: Whoever desires the divine, human, and all the happiness in the three worlds,

original: dhyāne sukhaṃ ca pravivekasukhaṃ dharmeśvaraṃ samanubandhayatām // / //
analyzed: dhyāne sukham ca praviveka sukham dharma īśvaram samanubandhayatām
translated: The happiness of meditation and the happiness of solitude, may he follow the lord of Dharma.

original: rāgaprahāṇu tatha doṣamapī yo icchate tatha kileśajaham /
analyzed: rāga prahāṇu icchate
translated: Whoever wishes to abandon passion and likewise aversion, and to abandon the afflictions,

original: śānta praśānta upaśāntamanā so dāntacittamanuyātu laghum // / //
analyzed: śānta praśāntaḥ upaśānta manāḥ saḥ dānta cittam anuyātu laghum
translated: With a mind peaceful, tranquil, and calm, may he quickly follow the one with a disciplined mind.

analyzed: śaikṣāḥ pratyeka jināḥ sarvajña jñānam anuprāpuḥ itum
translated: The learners, the non-learners, and the pratyekabuddhas, in order to attain omniscient knowledge,

analyzed: vaidya
translated: physician

original: daśabhirbalairnaditu siṃha iva guṇasāgaraṃ samanuyātu vidum // / //
analyzed: daśabhiḥ balaiḥ naditu siṃhaḥ iva guṇa sāgaram samanuyātu vidum
translated: With the ten powers, let him follow the ocean of qualities, the wise one, like a lion's roar.

original: pithituṃ apāyapatha yeṣa matir vivṛtuṃ ca ṣaṅgatipathaṃ hyamṛtam /
analyzed: pithitum apāya patha yā iṣa matiḥ vivṛtum ca ṣaṅgati patham hi amṛtam
translated: Those who wish to close the paths to the lower realms and open the path to the six perfections,

analyzed: aṣṭāṅga mārga gamanena gatim anubandha tām gati patha anta karam
translated: Let them follow the one who brings an end to the paths of existence by traveling on the eightfold path.

original: yo icchate sugata pūjayituṃ dharmaṃ ca teṣu śrutikāruṇike /
analyzed: icchate sugata pūjayitum dharmam ca teṣu śruti kāruṇike
translated: Those who wish to make offerings to the Sugata and listen to the Dharma of the compassionate ones,

original: prāpto guṇānapi ca saṃghagatān guṇasāgaraṃ samanuyātu imam // / //
analyzed: prāptaḥ guṇān api ca saṃgha gatān guṇa sāgaram samanuyātu imam
translated: Let them follow the ocean of qualities, the Saṅgha, which has attained the qualities.

analyzed: jāti jarā maraṇa duḥkha kṣaye saṃsāra bandhana vimokṣayitum
translated: Those who wish to end the suffering of birth, old age, and death, to liberate from the bonds of saṃsāra,

analyzed: caritum viśuddha gamana anta samam saḥ śuddha sattvam anubandhayatām
translated: And to practice the pure path to the end, let them follow the pure being.

original: iṣṭo manāpa priyu sarvajage varalakṣaṇo varaguṇopacitaḥ /
analyzed: iṣṭaḥ sarva jage vara lakṣaṇaḥ vara guṇa upacitaḥ
translated: The one who is desired, pleasing, and loved by all beings, endowed with the supreme marks and excellent qualities,

original: ātmā paraṃ ca tatha mocayituṃ priyadarśanaṃ samupayātu vidum // / //🔽śīlaṃ samādhi tatha prajñamayī gambhīradurdaśaduropagamam /
analyzed: ātmā param ca mocayitum priyadarśanam samupayātu  śīlam gambhīra durdaśa duropagamam
translated: The one who liberates both self and others, let the wise ones quickly follow the one who is delightful to behold.🔽Those who wish to attain liberation through morality, concentration, and wisdom, which is profound, difficult to see, and difficult to attain,

original: yo icchate vidu vimukti labhe so vaidyarājamanuyātu laghum // / //
analyzed: icchate vimukti labhe saḥ vaidya rājam anuyātu laghum
translated: Let them quickly follow the king of physicians.

original: ete ca anya guṇa naikavidhā upapatti saukhya tatha nirvṛtiye /
analyzed: ete ca anya guṇa na ekavidhā upapatti saukhya
translated: These and other various qualities lead to the happiness of rebirth and to nirvana.

original: sarvairguṇebhi pratipūrṇa siddhaye siddhavrataṃ samanuyātu vidum // / //
analyzed: sarvaiḥ guṇebhiḥ siddhaye siddha vratam samanuyātu
translated: In order to fully accomplish all qualities, follow the one who has perfected the vows, the wise one.

analyzed: iti
translated: Thus it is said.

original: idaṃ khalu vacanaṃ śrutvā caturaśītisahasrāṇi cāturmahārājikānāṃ devānāṃ śatasahasraṃ
analyzed: idam khalu vacanam śrutvā caturaśīti sahasrāṇi cāturmahārājikānām devānām śata sahasram
translated: Having heard these words, 84,000 gods from the realm of the Four Great Kings,

original: trayatriṃśānāṃ śatasahasraṃ yāmānāṃ śatasahasraṃ tuṣitānāṃ śatasahasraṃ nirmāṇaratīnāṃ
analyzed: trayatriṃśānām śata sahasram yāmānām śata sahasram tuṣitānām śata sahasram nirmāṇaratīnām
translated: 100,000 from the Heaven of the Thirty-Three, 100,000 from the Heaven of Yāma, 100,000 from the Heaven of Joy,

original: śatasahasraṃ paranirmitavaśavartīnāṃ devānāṃ ṣaṣṭisahasrāṇi mārakāyikānāṃ pūrvaśubhakarmaniryātānāṃ
analyzed: śata sahasram paranirmitavaśavartīnām devānām ṣaṣṭi sahasrāṇi māra kāyikānām pūrva śubha karma niryātānām
translated: 100,000 from the Heaven of Delighting in Emanations, 100,000 from the Heaven of Controlling Others' Emanations, 60,000 from the realm of Māra who had previously accomplished good deeds,

original: aṣṭaṣaṣṭisahasrāṇi brahmakāyikānāṃ bahūni śatasahasrāṇi yāvadakaniṣṭhānāṃ devānāṃ
analyzed: aṣṭaṣaṣṭi sahasrāṇi brahmakāyikānām bahūni śata sahasrāṇi yāvat akaniṣṭhānām devānām
translated: 68,000 from the realm of Brahmā, and many hundreds of thousands of gods up to the highest heaven

analyzed: saṃnipatitāni abhūvan
translated: had assembled.

analyzed: anye ca vaidya
translated: And other physicians

original: bhūyaḥ pūrvadakṣiṇapaścimottarebhyo digbhyo bahūni devaśatasahasrāṇi saṃnipatitānyabhūvan /
analyzed: bhūyas pūrva dakṣiṇa paścima uttarebhyaḥ digbhyaḥ bahūni deva śata sahasrāṇi saṃnipatitāni abhūvan
translated: many hundreds of thousands of gods from the eastern, southern, western, and northern directions had also assembled.

original: tebhyo ye udāratamā devaputrāste tāṃ mahatīṃ devaparṣadaṃ gāthābhirabhyabhāṣantaḥ
analyzed: tebhyaḥ ye udāratamāḥ deva putrāḥ te tām mahatīm deva parṣadam gāthābhiḥ abhyabhāṣantaḥ
translated: The gods who were the most exalted among them addressed the great assembly of gods with these verses:

original: hanta śṛṇotha vacanaṃ amareśvarāho asmin vidhānamati yādṛśatatvabhūtā /
analyzed: hanta śṛṇotha vacanam amara īśvara aho asmin vidhānam ati yādṛśa tatva bhūtā
translated: Listen, O lords of the immortals, to the truth of this matter, which is such:

analyzed: tyakta arthi kāma rati dhyāna sukham praṇītam anubandhayāmaḥ imam uttama śuddha sattvam
translated: We follow this supreme pure being, who has abandoned the delightful pleasures of wealth and the excellent bliss of meditation.

original: okrāntapāda tatha garbhasthitaṃ mahātmaṃ pūjārahaṃ atiśayamabhipūjayāmaḥ /
analyzed: garbha sthitam mahātmam atiśayam abhipūjayāmaḥ
translated: We honor with the highest worship the great being, who has entered the womb and whose feet are placed in the womb, who is worthy of worship.

original: puṇyaiḥ surakṣitamṛṣiṃ parirakṣisanto yasyāvatāra labhate na manaḥ praduṣṭam // / //
analyzed: puṇyaiḥ su rakṣitam ṛṣim yasya avatāra labhate na manaḥ praduṣṭam
translated: We protect the sage, well-protected by his merits, whose mind is not corrupted by anyone who approaches him.

analyzed: saṃgīti tūrya racitaiḥ ca su vādyakaiḥ ca kathayataḥ guṇa sāgarasya
translated: With beautiful musical instruments and songs, we praise the qualities of the ocean of virtues.

original: kurvāma devamanujāna praharṣaṇīyaṃ yaṃ śrutva bodhivaracitta jane janeryā // / //
analyzed: kurvāma praharṣaṇīyam yam bodhi vara citta jane
translated: We bring joy to gods and humans, hearing whom, people everywhere arouse the supreme mind of enlightenment.

analyzed: puṣpa abhikīrṇa nṛpateḥ ca karoma geham kālāguru uttama su dhūpita saumya gandham
translated: We make the king's house strewn with flowers, with a pleasant fragrance of the finest black agarwood.

original: yaṃ ghrātva devamanujāśca bhavantyudagrā vigatajvarāśca sukhinaśca bhavantyarogāḥ // / //
analyzed: yam ghrātvā deva manujāḥ ca bhavanti udagrāḥ vigata jvarāḥ ca sukhinaḥ ca bhavanti arogāḥ
translated: Having smelled which, gods and humans become uplifted, free from fever and happy, and become free from disease.

original: māndāravaiśca kusumaistatha pārijātaiścandraiḥ sucandra tatha sthālavirocamānaiḥ /
analyzed: māndāravaiḥ ca kusumaiḥ tathā pārijātaiḥ candraiḥ su candra sthāla virocamānaiḥ
translated: With māndārava flowers, pārijāta flowers, candra, sucandrā, and sthāla flowers,

original: puṣpābhikīrṇa kapilāhvaya taṃ karoma pūjārtha pūrvaśubhakarmasamudgatasya // / //
analyzed: puṣpa abhikīrṇa kapila āhvaya tam karoma pūjā artha pūrva śubha karma samudgatasya
translated: We will strew them over Kapilavastu to make offerings to the one who has arisen through the power of his previous good karma.

original: yāvacca garbhi vasate trimalairalipto yāvajjarāmaraṇa cāntakaraḥ prasūtaḥ /
analyzed: yāvat ca garbhi vasate tri malaiḥ aliptaḥ yāvat jarā maraṇa ca anta karaḥ prasūtaḥ
translated: As long as he dwells in the womb, unstained by the three defilements, and as long as he is born, ending old age and death,

original: tāvatprasannamanaso anubandhayāma eṣā matirmatidharasya karoma pūjām // / //
analyzed: tāvat prasanna manasaḥ anubandhayāmaḥ eṣā matiḥ mati dharasya karoma pūjām
translated: With minds full of joy, we will follow him. This is the thought of the one who holds wisdom. We will make offerings.

original: lābhā sulabdha vipulāḥ suramānuṣāṇāṃ drakṣyanti jānu imu saptapadāṃ kramantam /
analyzed: sura mānuṣāṇām drakṣyanti jānu saptapadām kramantam
translated: The gods and humans have gained great profit. They will see him taking seven steps with his knees,

original: śakraiśca brahmaṇakaraiḥ parigṛhyamānaṃ gandhodakaiḥ snapiyamāni suśuddhasattvam // /
analyzed: śakraiḥ ca parigṛhyamānam gandha udakaiḥ su śuddha sattvam
translated: Being held by Śakra and Brahmā, and being bathed with fragrant water, that one of pure being.

analyzed: vaidya
translated: The doctor

original: yāvacca loki anuvartanatāṃ karoti antaḥpure vasati kāmakileśaghātī /
analyzed: yāvat ca loki anuvartana tām karoti antaḥpure vasati kāma kileśa ghātī
translated: As long as he acts in accordance with the world, living in the harem, the slayer of the defilements of desire,

original: yāvacca niṣkramati rājyamapāsya sarvaṃ tāvatprasannamanaso anubandhayāmaḥ // / //
analyzed: yāvat ca niṣkramati rājyam apāsya sarvam tāvat prasanna manasaḥ anubandhayāmaḥ
translated: As long as he leaves his kingdom and renounces everything,

original: yāvadupaiti mahimaṇḍi tṛṇāṃ gṛhītvā yāvacca bodhi spṛśate vinihatya māram /
analyzed: yāvat upaiti mahi maṇḍi tṛṇām gṛhītvā yāvat ca bodhi spṛśate vinihatya māram
translated: As long as he goes to the Bodhi tree and takes grass, and as long as he touches enlightenment and defeats Mara,

original: adhyeṣṭu brāhmaṇayutebhi pravarti cakraṃ tāvatkaroma vipulāṃ sugatasya pūjām // / //
analyzed: adhyeṣṭu cakram tāvat karoma vipulām sugatasya pūjām
translated: As long as he turns the wheel with the assembly of Brahmins, for that long we will make vast offerings to the Sugata.

original: yada buddhakāryu kṛtu bheṣyati trisahasre sattvāna koṭinayutā amṛte vinītā /
analyzed: yada buddha kāryu tri sahasre
translated: When he has done the Buddha's work in the three thousand worlds, and has disciplined koṭis of nayutas of beings in immortality,

original: nirvāṇamārgamupayāsyati śītibhāvaṃ tāvanmahāśayamṛṣiṃ na jahāma sarve // / //
analyzed: nirvāṇa mārgam upayāsyati śīti bhāvam tāvat mahā āśayam ṛṣim na jahāma sarve
translated: And has gone to the path of nirvana, to the state of coolness, for that long we will not abandon the great-minded Rishi.

analyzed: iti
translated: Thus.🔽Then, monks, the deva maidens of the Kama realm,

original: atha khalu bhikṣavaḥ kāmadhātvīśvarāṇāṃ devakanyānāṃ bodhisattvasya rūpakāyapariniṣpattiṃ
analyzed: atha khalu bhikṣavaḥ kāmadhātu īśvarāṇām deva kanyānām bodhisattvasya rūpa kāya pariniṣpattim
translated: seeing the perfection of the Bodhisattva's physical form,

original: dṛṣṭvā etadabhavat kīdṛśī tvasau kanyā bhaviṣyati yā imaṃ varapravaraśuddhasattvaṃ dhārayiṣyati /
analyzed: dṛṣṭvā etat abhavat kīdṛśī tu asau kanyā bhaviṣyati yā imam vara pravara śuddha sattvam dhārayiṣyati
translated: thought, What kind of a maiden will she be who will bear this supreme pure being?

analyzed: tāḥ kautūhala jātāḥ vara pravara puṣpa dhūpa dīpa gandha mālya vilepana cūrṇa cīvara parigṛhītā
translated: They, filled with curiosity, holding excellent flowers, incense, lamps, perfumes, garlands, ointments, powders, and robes,

analyzed: divya manaḥ maya ātmabhāva pratilabdhāḥ puṇya vipāka adhisthāna adhisthitāḥ tasmin kṣaṇe marapura bhavanāt antarhitāḥ
translated: They had attained divine mental bodies, and by the power of the ripening of their merit, they disappeared in an instant from the palace of the gods and

original: kapilāhvaye mahāpuravare udyānaśatasahasraparimaṇḍite rājñaḥ śuddhodanasya gṛhe dhṛtarāṣṭre🔽mahāprāsāde amarabhavanaprakāśe vigalitāmbaradhāriṇyaḥ śubhavimalatejapratimaṇḍitā
analyzed: kapila āhvaye mahā pura vare udyāna śata sahasra parimaṇḍite rājñaḥ śuddhodanasya gṛhe dhṛtarāṣṭre  mahā prāsāde amara bhavana prakāśe vigalita ambara dhāriṇyaḥ śubha vimala teja pratimaṇḍitā
translated: in the great city of Kapila, surrounded by a hundred thousand gardens, in the palace of King Shuddhodana, in the great palace Dhritarashtra,🔽which was like the palace of the gods, wearing loose garments, adorned with pure and radiant light,

analyzed: divya ābharaṇa stambhita bhujāḥ śayana vara gatām māyādevīm eka aṅgulikayā upadarśayantyaḥ gagana tala gatāḥ
translated: with their arms adorned with divine ornaments, they pointed out to Maya Devi, who was lying on an excellent bed, with one finger, and said, In the sky,

analyzed: parasparam gāthābhiḥ abhyabhāṣanta
translated: they spoke to each other in verses:

original: amarapuragatāna apsarāṇāṃ rūpa manorama dṛṣṭva bodhisattve /
analyzed: apsarāṇām bodhisattve
translated: The apsaras in the city of the gods saw the beautiful form of the Bodhisattva

original: matiriyamabhavattadā hi tāsāṃ pramada nu kīdṛśa bodhisattvamātā // / //🔽tāśca sahitapuṣpamālyahastā upagami veśma nṛpasya jātakāṅkṣā /
analyzed: matiḥ iyam abhavat tadā hi tāsām nu bodhisattva mātā  tāḥ ca sahita puṣpa mālya hastāḥ upagami veśma nṛpasya jāta kāṅkṣā
translated: and had this thought: 'What kind of woman is the mother of the Bodhisattva?'🔽They came to the king's palace with flowers and garlands in their hands, desiring to know,

analyzed: gṛhītvā daśa nakha añjalibhiḥ namasyamānāḥ
translated: holding flowers and ointments, bowing with folded hands.

original: vigalitavasanāḥ salīlarūpāḥ karatala dakṣiṇi aṅgulīṃ praṇamya /
analyzed: vigalita vasanāḥ sa līla rūpāḥ aṅgulīm praṇamya
translated: With their garments loosened, their forms playful, they bowed with the fingers of their right hands,

original: śayanagata vidarśi māyadevīṃ sādhu nirīkṣatha rūpa mānuṣīṇām // / //
analyzed: śayana gata vidarśi māya devīm sādhu nirīkṣatha mānuṣīṇām
translated: And showed Māyādevī lying in bed, saying, Look well at the human form!

analyzed: vaidya
translated: Vidy

original: vayamiha abhimanyayāma anye paramamanorama surūpa apsarāṇām /
analyzed: vayam iha anye parama manorama surūpa apsarāṇām
translated: We here consider others, the most delightful and beautiful celestial nymphs,

original: ima nṛpativadhūṃ nirīkṣamāṇā jihma vipaśyatha divya ātmabhāvām // / //
analyzed: nṛpati vadhūm nirīkṣamāṇāḥ vipaśyatha divye ātmabhāvām
translated: But looking at this queen, we see the divine form as distorted.

original: ratiriva sadṛśī guṇānvitā ca jananiriyaṃ pravarāgrapudgalasya /
analyzed: ratiḥ iva sadṛśī guṇa anvitā ca jananiḥ iyam pravara agra pudgalasya
translated: She is like Rati, endowed with virtues, the mother of the supreme individual,

original: maṇiratana yathā subhājanastha tatha iva bhājana devi devadeve // / //
analyzed: maṇi ratana yathā subhājana stha tatha iva bhājana devi devadeve
translated: Just as a precious jewel placed in a fine vessel, so is the vessel, O Queen, of the god of gods.

original: karacaraṇatalebhi yāvadūrdhvaṃ aṅga mahorama divya ātirekāḥ /
analyzed: kara caraṇa talebhiḥ aṅga mahorama divyaḥ
translated: From the soles of her feet up to the top, her limbs are extremely delightful, surpassing the divine,

original: prekṣatu nayanānna cāsti tṛptiṃ bhūya praharṣati citta mānasaṃ ca // / //🔽śaśiriva gagane virājate 'syā vadanu varaṃ ca virāja gātrabhāsā /
analyzed: prekṣatu nayanāt na ca asti tṛptim praharṣati mānasam ca  śaśiḥ iva gagane virājate syāḥ vadanu varam ca virāja gātra bhāsā
translated: One never tires of looking at them with the eyes, but the mind and thoughts are further delighted.🔽Her face shines like the moon in the sky, and her body shines with the best radiance,

original: raviriva vimalā śaśīva dīptā tatha prabha niścarate 'sya ātmabhāvāt // / //
analyzed: raviḥ iva vimalā śaśī iva dīptā niścarate syaḥ ātmabhāvāt
translated: Just as the sun shines, the moon is radiant, so does light emanate from her body.

original: kanakamiva sujātajātarūpā varṇa virocati deviye tathaiva /
analyzed: kanakam iva sujāta jātarūpā virocati deviye tathā eva
translated: Just as gold is well-formed and well-refined, so the complexion of the goddess shines forth.

original: bhramaravaranikāśa kuntalānī mṛdukasugandhaśravāsya mūrdhajāni // / //🔽kamaladalanibhe tathāsya netre daśanaviśuddha nabheva jyotiṣāṇi /
analyzed: bhramara vara nikāśa mūrdhajāni  kamala dala nibhe tathā asya netre daśana viśuddha nabhā iva jyotiṣāṇi
translated: Her hair is like the finest bees, soft, fragrant, and sweet-smelling.🔽Her eyes are like lotus petals, her teeth are pure like the stars in the sky.

original: cāpa iva tanūdarī viśālā pārśva samudgata māṃsi nāsti saṃdhiḥ // / //
analyzed: cāpaḥ iva tanūdarī viśālā pārśva samudgata māṃsi nā asti saṃdhiḥ
translated: Her waist is slender and broad, her flesh rises on her sides, there is no joint.

analyzed: gaja bhuja sadṛśe syaḥ ūru jaṅghe jānu su jātu anupūrvam udgatā asya
translated: Her thighs and calves are like the trunk of an elephant, her knees are well-formed and gradually rise.

original: karatalacaraṇā samā suraktā vyaktamiyaṃ khalu devakanya nānyā // / //
analyzed: kara tala caraṇā samā su raktā vyaktam iyam khalu devakanya nā anyā
translated: Her palms and soles are even and red, it is clear that she is a goddess, no other.

original: eva bahuvidhaṃ nirīkṣya devīṃ kusuma kṣipitva pradakṣiṇaṃ ca kṛtvā /
analyzed: eva bahuvidham nirīkṣya devīm kusuma pradakṣiṇam ca kṛtvā
translated: Having thus observed the goddess in many ways, having thrown flowers and circumambulated her,

analyzed: vaidya
translated: Vaishampayana

original: supiya yaśavatī jinasya mātā punarapi devapuraṃ gatā kṣaṇena // / //
analyzed: yaśavatī jinasya mātā punar api devapuram gatā kṣaṇena
translated: The glorious mother of the Victor, having gone to the city of the gods in an instant,

original: atha caturi caturdiśāsu pālāḥ śakra suyāma tathaiva nirmitāśca /
analyzed: atha caturi catur diśāsu pālāḥ śakra suyāma tathā eva nirmitāḥ ca
translated: Then the four guardians of the directions, Shakra, and the magically created Suyama and others,

original: devagaṇa kumbhāṇḍa rākṣasāśca asura mahoraga kinnarāśca vocan // / //
analyzed: deva gaṇa kumbhāṇḍa rākṣasāḥ ca asura mahoraga kinnarāḥ ca vocan
translated: The hosts of gods, kumbhandas, rakshasas, asuras, mahoragas, and kinnaras spoke:

original: gacchata purato narottamasya puruṣavarasya karotha rakṣaguptim /
analyzed: gacchata puratas nara uttamasya puruṣa varasya karotha rakṣa guptim
translated: Go ahead, you best of men, you supreme being, protect and guard him!

original: mā kuruta jage manaḥpradoṣaṃ mā ca karota viheṭha mānuṣāṇām // / //
analyzed: mā kuruta jage manaḥ pradoṣam mā ca karota viheṭha mānuṣāṇām
translated: Do not harbor ill will towards the world, and do not harm humans.

original: yatra gṛhavarasmi māyadevī tatra samagra sapāriṣadya sarve /
analyzed: tatra sarve
translated: Where Queen Māyā was in the best of houses, all of you with your retinues,

analyzed: asi dhanu śara śakti khaṅga hastāḥ sthitāḥ
translated: Holding swords, bows, arrows, spears, and scimitars, stand in the sky and watch.

original: jñātva cyavanakāla devaputrā upagami māyasakāśa hṛṣṭacittā /
analyzed: jñātvā cyavana kāla deva putrāḥ upagami māyasa kāśa hṛṣṭa cittā
translated: Knowing the time of the Bodhisattva's passing, the gods approached Māyā with joyful minds,

analyzed: gṛhītvā daśa nakha añjalibhiḥ namasyamānāḥ
translated: Holding flowers and ointments, bowing with palms joined in prayer.

original: cyava cyava hi narendra śuddhasattvā ayu samayo bhavato 'dya vādisiṃha /
analyzed: hi narendra śuddha sattvāḥ samayaḥ bhavataḥ vādi siṃha
translated: The time has come for you, O king of men, O pure being, O lion of speech, today!

original: kṛpakaruṇa janitva sarvaloke asmi adhyeṣama dharmadānahetoḥ // / //
analyzed: sarva loke asmi dharma dāna hetoḥ
translated: Out of compassion and pity for the whole world, I request you for the sake of the gift of the Dharma.

analyzed: iti
translated: Thus it is said.

original: atha khalu bhikṣavo bodhisattvasya cyavanakālasamaye pūrvasyā diśo bahūni bodhisattvaśatasahasrāṇi
analyzed: atha khalu bhikṣavaḥ bodhisattvasya cyavana kāla samaye pūrvasyāḥ diśaḥ bahūni bodhisattva śata sahasrāṇi
translated: Then, monks, at the time of the Bodhisattva's passing, from the eastern direction, many hundreds of thousands of bodhisattvas

analyzed: sarve eka jāti pratibaddhāḥ tuṣita vara bhavana vāsinaḥ yena bodhisattvaḥ tena upasaṃkrāman
translated: All of them were bound to one more birth, and were dwelling in the excellent Tusita realm. They approached the Bodhisattva

analyzed: bodhisattvasya pūjā karmaṇe
translated: in order to make offerings to the Bodhisattva.

original: evaṃ daśabhyo digbhyo ekaikasyā diśo bahūni bodhisattvaśatasahasrāṇi sarva ekajātipratibaddhāstuṣitavarabhavanavāsino yena bodhisattvastenopasaṃkrāman
analyzed: evam daśabhyaḥ digbhyaḥ ekaikasyāḥ diśaḥ bahūni bodhisattva śata sahasrāṇi sarve eka jāti pratibaddhāḥ tuṣita vara bhavana vāsinaḥ yena bodhisattvaḥ tena upasaṃkrāman
translated: In the same way, from the ten directions, from each direction, there were many hundreds of thousands of bodhisattvas, all of them bound to one more birth, dwelling in the excellent Tusita realm. They approached the Bodhisattva

analyzed: bodhisattvasya pūjā karmaṇe
translated: in order to make offerings to the Bodhisattva.

analyzed: cāturmahārājakāyikebhyaḥ devebhyaḥ caturaśīti apsaraḥ śata sahasrāṇi evam
translated: From the gods of the realm of the Four Great Kings, 84,000 times a hundred thousand celestial maidens, and likewise from the Heaven of the Thirty-Three,

analyzed: yāmebhyaḥ tuṣitebhyaḥ nirmāṇaratibhyaḥ paranirmitavaśavartibhyaḥ devebhyaḥ caturaśīti apsaraḥ
translated: from the Yāma gods, the Tuṣita gods, the Nirmāṇarati gods, and the Paranirmitavaśavartin gods, 84,000 times a hundred thousand celestial maidens

original: śatasahasrāṇi nānātūryasaṃgītivāditena yena bodhisattvastenopasaṃkrāman bodhisattvasya pūjākarmaṇe //
analyzed: śata sahasrāṇi nānā tūrya saṃgīti vāditena yena bodhisattvaḥ tena upasaṃkrāman bodhisattvasya pūjā karmaṇe
translated: approached the Bodhisattva, playing various musical instruments and singing, in order to make offerings to the Bodhisattva.

original: atha khalu bodhisattvaḥ śrīgarbhasiṃhāsane sarvapuṇyasamudgate sarvadevanāgasaṃdarśane
analyzed: atha khalu bodhisattvaḥ śrī garbha siṃhāsane sarva puṇya samudgate sarva deva nāga saṃdarśane
translated: Then the Bodhisattva, on the glorious womb lion throne, which was produced from all merit, which was seen by all gods and nāgas,

analyzed: mahā kūṭāgāre niṣadya sārdham bodhisattvaiḥ deva nāga yakṣa koṭi niyuta śata sahasraiḥ parivṛtaḥ  puraskṛtaḥ tuṣita vara bhavanāt vaidya
translated: the Bodhisattva, the Great Being, the god Śikhin,

analyzed: pracalati sma

analyzed: udaram upagataḥ gaja pradhānaḥ lalita gatiḥ dṛḍha vajra gātra saṃdhiḥ
translated: The foremost of elephants, with graceful movements and joints as firm as a vajra, entered my womb.

original: na ca mama sukha jātu evarūpaṃ dṛṣṭamapi śrutaṃ nāpi cānubhūtam /
analyzed: na ca mama sukha jātu evarūpam dṛṣṭam api śrutam na api ca anubhūtam
translated: I have never seen, heard of, or experienced such happiness before.

analyzed: kāya sukha citta saukhya bhāvā dhyāna samāhitā abhūvam
translated: My body, mind, and heart were filled with bliss, as if I were in meditative concentration.

original: atha khalu māyādevī ābharaṇavigalitavasanā prahlāditakāyacittā prītiprāmodyaprasādapratilabdhā
analyzed: atha khalu māyā devī ābharaṇa vigalita vasanā prahlādita kāya cittā prīti prāmodya prasāda pratilabdhā
translated: Then Queen Māyā, her ornaments and clothes loosened, her body and mind delighted, having attained joy, rapture, and faith,

original: śayanavaratalādutthāya nārīgaṇaparivṛtā puraskṛtā prāsādavaraśikharādavatīrya yenāśokavanikā tenopajagāma /
analyzed: śayana vara talāt utthāya nārī gaṇa parivṛtā puraskṛtā prāsāda vara śikharāt avatīrya yena aśoka vanikā tena upajagāma
translated: She rose from the excellent bed, surrounded and honored by a group of women, descended from the peak of the excellent palace, and went to the Aśoka grove.

original: sā aśokavanikāyāṃ sukhopaviṣṭā rājñaḥ śuddhodanasya dūtaṃ preṣayati sma āgacchatu devo devī te draṣṭukāmeti //
analyzed: sā aśoka vanikāyām sukha upaviṣṭā rājñaḥ śuddhodanasya dūtam preṣayati smaḥ āgacchatu devaḥ devī te draṣṭu kāmā iti
translated: Having sat down comfortably in the Aśoka grove, she sent a messenger to King Śuddhodana, saying, Let the king come. The queen wishes to see him.

original: atha sa rājā śuddhodanastadvacanaṃ śrutvā praharṣitamanā ākampitaśarīro bhadrāsanādutthāya amātyanaigamapārṣadyabandhujanaparivṛto yenāśokavanikā
analyzed: atha sa rājā śuddhodanaḥ tat vacanam śrutvā praharṣita manāḥ ākampita śarīraḥ bhadrāsanāt utthāya amātya naigama pārṣadya bandhu jana parivṛtaḥ yena aśoka vanikā
translated: Then King Śuddhodana, having heard those words, with a delighted mind and trembling body, rose from his excellent seat, surrounded by his ministers, townspeople, attendants, and relatives, and went to the Aśoka grove.

original: upasaṃkrāntaśca na śaknoti sma aśokavanikāṃ praveṣṭum /
analyzed: upasaṃkrāntaḥ ca na śaknoti sma aśoka vanikām praveṣṭum
translated: But he was unable to enter the Aśoka grove.

analyzed: gurutaram iva ātmānam manyate sma
translated: He thought his body was heavier than before.

original: aśokavanikādvāre sthito muhūrtaṃ saṃcintya tasyāṃ velāyāmimāṃ gāthāmabhāṣata
analyzed: aśoka vanikā dvāre sthitaḥ muhūrtam saṃcintya tasyām velāyām imām gāthām abhāṣata
translated: Standing at the gate of the Aśoka grove, he reflected for a moment and at that time spoke this verse:

original: na smari raṇaśauṇḍi mūrdhasaṃsthasya mahyam eva guru śarīraṃ manyamī yādṛśo 'dya /
analyzed: na smari raṇa śauṇḍi mūrdha saṃsthasya mahyam eva guru śarīram yādṛśaḥ
translated: I do not remember my body ever feeling as heavy as it does now, even when I was intoxicated with battle and stood on the head of my enemy.

original: svakulagṛhamadya na prabhomi praveṣṭuṃ kimiha mama bhave 'ṅgo kānva pṛccheya cāham // / //
analyzed: sva kula gṛham adya na prabhomi praveṣṭum kim iha mama bhave pṛccheya ca aham
translated: I am not able to enter my own house today. What is this? Whom should I ask?

analyzed: iti
translated: Thus.

analyzed: vaidya
translated: Vidy

original: atha khalu śuddhāvāsakāyikā devaputrā gaganatalagatā ardhakāyamabhinirmāya rājānaṃ gāthayādhyabhāṣanta
analyzed: atha khalu śuddhāvāsa kāyikāḥ devaputrāḥ gagana tala gatāḥ ardha kāyam abhinirmāya rājānam gāthayā adhyabhāṣanta
translated: Then the gods of the Pure Abodes, hovering in the sky, manifested half their bodies and addressed the king with a verse:

analyzed: vrata tapa guṇa yuktaḥ tisra lokeṣu pūjyaḥ maitra karuṇa lābhī puṇya jñāna abhiṣiktaḥ
translated: Endowed with the qualities of austerities and vows, worshipped in the three worlds, attaining loving-kindness and compassion, consecrated with merit and wisdom,

original: tuṣitapuri cyavitvā bodhisattvo mahātmā nṛpati tava sutatvaṃ māyakukṣaupapannaḥ // / //
analyzed: tuṣitapuri cyavitvā bodhisattvaḥ mahātmā nṛpati tava suta tvam māya kukṣi upapannaḥ
translated: The Bodhisattva, the Great Being, having passed away from the city of Tuṣita, has been born in the womb of Māyā, your wife, O King.

original: daśanakha tada kṛtvā svaṃ śiraṃ kampayanto nṛpatiranupraviṣṭaścitrikārānuyuktaḥ /
analyzed: daśanakha tada kṛtvā svam śiram kampayantaḥ nṛpatiḥ anupraviṣṭaḥ citrikāra anuyuktaḥ
translated: Having made the gesture of ten fingers, shaking his head, the King entered, filled with wonder.

original: māya tada nirīkṣya mānadarpopanītāṃ vadahi kurumi kiṃ te kiṃ prayogo bhaṇāhi // / //
analyzed: nirīkṣya māna darpa upanītām vadahi kurumi kim te kim prayogaḥ bhaṇāhi
translated: Seeing that Māyā, brought by pride and vanity, he said, Tell me, what can I do for you? Speak, what is your intention?

analyzed: devī āha
translated: The Queen said:

analyzed: hima rajata nikāśaḥ candra sūrya atirekaḥ su caraṇa su vibhaktaḥ ṣaṣ viṣāṇaḥ mahātmā
translated: Your son is like snow and silver, surpassing the moon and sun, with beautiful feet, well-proportioned, six-tusked, a Great Being,

original: gajavaru dṛḍhasaṃdhirvajrakalpaḥ surūpaḥ udari mama praviṣṭastasya hetuṃ śruṇuṣva // / //
analyzed: dṛḍha saṃdhiḥ vajra kalpaḥ surūpaḥ udari mama praviṣṭaḥ tasya hetum śruṇuṣva
translated: A fine elephant, with firm joints, like a diamond, handsome, has entered my womb. Listen to the reason for that.

original: vitimira trisahasrāṃ paśyamī bhrājamānāṃ devanayuta devā ye stuvantī sayānā /
analyzed: vitimira tri sahasrām paśyamī bhrājamānām devanayuta devāḥ ye stuvanti sa yānā
translated: I see the three thousand worlds without darkness, shining, and the millions of gods who praise me from the sky,

original: na ca mama khiladoṣo naiva roṣo na moho dhyānasukhasamaṅgī jānamī śāntacittā // / //
analyzed: na ca mama khila doṣaḥ nā eva roṣaḥ na mohaḥ dhyāna sukha samaṅgī śānta cittā
translated: I have no anger, hatred, or delusion, I am endowed with the bliss of meditation, I know my mind is peaceful.

original: sādhu nṛpati śīghraṃ brāhmaṇānānayāsmin vedasupinapāṭhā ye gṛheṣū vidhijñāḥ /
analyzed: sādhu nṛpati śīghram brāhmaṇān ānaya asmin veda supina pāṭhāḥ ye vidhi jñāḥ
translated: Well then, O king, quickly bring the brahmins who know the Vedas and the rules of interpretation of dreams from the houses.

original: supinu mama hi yemaṃ vyākarī tattvayuktaṃ kimida mama bhaveyā śreyu pāpaṃ kulasya // / //
analyzed: mama hi tattva yuktam kim idam mama pāpam kulasya
translated: They will explain this dream of mine correctly. What will happen to me, good or bad, for the family?

analyzed: vacanam imu śruṇitvā pārthivaḥ tad kṣaṇena brāhmaṇa kṛtavedān ānayat śāstra pāṭhān
translated: Having heard these words, the king immediately brought the brahmins who were skilled in the Vedas and the scriptures.🔽Having stood before the brahmins, she said, I have seen such a dream. Listen to the reason for that.🔽The brahmins said, Speak, O queen, what kind of dream did you see?

original: māya purata sthitvā brāhmaṇānāmavocat supina mayi ha dṛṣṭastasya hetuṃ śṛṇotha // / //
analyzed: puratas sthitvā brāhmaṇānām avocat supina mayi ha dṛṣṭaḥ tasya hetum śṛṇotha
translated: Having heard, we will know.

analyzed: vaidya
translated: The queen said:🔽I saw a lion, the king of beasts, with a body like a mountain peak, with a mane,🔽 Translation: A fine elephant, with firm joints, like a diamond, handsome, has entered my womb. Listen to the reason for that.🔽I see the three thousand worlds without darkness, shining, and the millions of gods who praise me from the sky,🔽I have no anger, hatred, or delusion, I am endowed with the bliss of meditation, I know my mind is peaceful.🔽Well then, O king, quickly bring the brahmins who know the Vedas and the rules of interpretation of dreams from the houses.🔽They will explain this dream of mine correctly. What will happen to me, good or bad, for the family?🔽Having heard these words, the king immediately brought the brahmins who were skilled in the Vedas and the scriptures.🔽Having stood before the brahmins, she said, I have seen such a dream. Listen to the reason for that.

original: brāhmaṇā āhuḥ brūhi devi tvayā kīdṛśaṃ svapnaṃ dṛṣṭam /
analyzed: brāhmaṇāḥ āhuḥ brūhi devi tvayā kīdṛśam svapnam dṛṣṭam
translated: The brahmins said, Speak, O queen, what kind of dream did you see?

analyzed: śrutvā jñāsyāmaḥ
translated: Having heard, we will know.

analyzed: devī āha
translated: The queen said:🔽I saw a lion, the king of beasts, with a body like a mountain peak, with a mane,

analyzed: hima rajata nikāśaḥ candra sūrya atirekaḥ su caraṇa su vibhaktaḥ ṣaṣ viṣāṇaḥ mahātmā
translated: Having a body like snow, silver, or the moon, surpassing the sun and moon, with beautiful feet, well-proportioned, with six tusks, great-souled,

original: gajavaru dṛḍhasaṃdhirvajrakalpaḥ surūpaḥ udari mama praviṣṭastasya hetuṃ śṛṇotha // / //
analyzed: dṛḍha saṃdhiḥ vajra kalpaḥ surūpaḥ udari mama praviṣṭaḥ tasya hetum
translated: A supreme elephant with firm joints, like a diamond, of beautiful form, has entered my womb. Listen to the reason for this.

original: vacanamimu śruṇitvā brāhmaṇā evamāhuḥ prīti vipula cintyā nāsti pāpaṃ kulasya /
analyzed: vacanam imu śruṇitvā brāhmaṇāḥ evam āhuḥ na asti pāpam kulasya
translated: Having heard these words, the brahmins said this: There is no sin in the family, vast and inconceivable joy.

original: putra tava janesī lakṣaṇairbhūṣitāṅgaṃ rājakulakulīnaṃ cakravarti mahātmaṃ // / //
analyzed: putra tava lakṣaṇaiḥ bhūṣita aṅgam rāja kula kulīnam cakravarti mahātmam
translated: You will give birth to a son, adorned with auspicious marks, born into a royal family, a great-souled universal monarch.

original: sa ca pura vijahitvā kāmarājyaṃ ca gehaṃ pravrajita nirapekṣaḥ sarvalokānukampī /
analyzed: sa ca vijahitvā kāma rājyam ca geham nirapekṣaḥ sarva loka anukampī
translated: He will leave the city, the kingdom of desire, and his home, and go forth, indifferent, compassionate towards all the world.

original: buddho bhavati eṣo dakṣiṇīyastriloke amṛtarasavareṇā tarpayet sarvalokam // / //
analyzed: buddhaḥ bhavati eṣaḥ dakṣiṇīyaḥ triloke amṛta rasa vareṇa tarpayet sarva lokam
translated: He will become a Buddha, worthy of offerings in the three worlds, and will satisfy the whole world with the excellent nectar-like taste.

analyzed: vyākaritva giram saumyām bhuktvā pārthiva bhojanam
translated: Having uttered these gentle words, and having eaten the king's food,

analyzed: ācchādanāni ca udgṛhya prakrāntāḥ brāhmaṇāḥ tatas
translated: and having accepted the robes, the brahmins then departed.🔽Thus, monks, King Shuddhodana to the brahmins who were skilled in the interpretation of signs, in palmistry,

original: iti hi bhikṣavo rājā śuddhodano brāhmaṇebhyo lakṣaṇanaimittikavaipañcakebhyaḥ svapnādhyāyīpāṭhakebhyaḥ
analyzed: iti hi bhikṣavaḥ rājā śuddhodanaḥ brāhmaṇebhyaḥ lakṣaṇa naimittika vaipañcakebhyaḥ svapnādhyāyī pāṭhakebhyaḥ
translated: and in the reading of dreams,

original: pratiśrutya hṛṣṭastuṣṭa udagra āttamanāḥ pramuditaḥ prītisaumanasyajātastān brāhmaṇān
analyzed: pratiśrutya hṛṣṭaḥ tuṣṭaḥ udagraḥ ātta manāḥ pramuditaḥ prīti saumanasya jātaḥ tān brāhmaṇān
translated: Having promised, he was delighted, satisfied, elated, and overjoyed. He was filled with joy and happiness, and he said to those brahmins:

original: prabhūtena khādanīyabhojanīyāsvādanīyena saṃtarpya saṃpravāryācchādanāni ca datvā visarjayati sma /
analyzed: prabhūtena khādanīya bhojanīya āsvādanīyena saṃtarpya saṃpravārya ācchādanāni ca da tvā visarjayati sma
translated: Having promised, he was delighted, satisfied, elated, and overjoyed. With a joyful mind and a sense of bliss, he satisfied and served those brahmins with abundant food, drink, and delicacies, and after giving them clothes, he dismissed them.

original: tasyāṃ velāyāṃ kapilavastuni mahānagare caturṣu nagaradvāreṣu sarvanagaracatvaraśṛṅgāṭakeṣu ca dānaṃ dāpayati sma annamannārthikebhyaḥ /🔽pānaṃ pānārthikebhyaḥ /
analyzed: tasyām velāyām kapilavastuni mahā nagare caturṣu nagara dvāreṣu sarva nagara catvara śṛṅgāṭakeṣu ca dānam dāpayati sma annam anna arthikebhyaḥ  pānam pāna arthikebhyaḥ
translated: At that time, in the great city of Kapilavastu, at the four city gates and in all the crossroads and markets, he caused gifts to be given - food to those who needed food,🔽drink to those who needed drink,

analyzed: vastrāṇi vastra arthikebhyaḥ
translated: clothes to those who needed clothes,

analyzed: yānāni yāna arthikebhyaḥ
translated: vehicles to those who needed vehicles.

original: evaṃ gandhamālyavilepanaśayyopāśrayaṃ prājīvikaṃ prājīvikārthibhyo yāvadeva bodhisattvasya pūjākarmaṇe //
analyzed: evam gandha mālya vilepana śayyā upāśrayam prājīvikam prājīvika arthibhyaḥ yāvat eva bodhisattvasya pūjā karmaṇe
translated: In the same way, he gave perfumes, garlands, ointments, beds, seats, and provisions to those who needed provisions, up to whatever was needed for the worship of the Bodhisattva.

original: atha khalu bhikṣavo rājñaḥ śuddhodanasyaitadabhavat katamasmin gṛhe māyādevī sukhamanupakliṣṭā viharediti /
analyzed: atha khalu bhikṣavaḥ rājñaḥ śuddhodanasya etat abhavat katamasmin gṛhe māyādevī sukham anupakliṣṭā viharet iti
translated: Then, monks, King Śuddhodana thought, In which house will Queen Māyā dwell happily and without affliction?

original: atha tatkṣaṇameva catvāro mahārājāno rājānaṃ śuddhodanamupasaṃkramyaivamāhuḥ
analyzed: atha tad kṣaṇam eva catvāraḥ mahā rājānaḥ rājānam śuddhodanam upasaṃkramya evam āhuḥ
translated: At that very moment, the Four Great Kings approached King Śuddhodana and said this:

original: alpotsuko deva bhava sukhaṃ tiṣṭha upekṣako /
analyzed: alpa utsukaḥ deva bhava sukham tiṣṭha
translated: Be little concerned, O King, be happy and indifferent,

original: vayaṃ hi bodhisattvasya veśma vai māpayāmahe // / //
analyzed: vayam hi bodhisattvasya veśma vai māpayāmahe
translated: for we are building a palace for the Bodhisattva.

analyzed: vaidya
translated: Vaidya

original: atha khalu śakro devānāmindro rājānaṃ śuddhodanamupasaṃkramyaivamāha
analyzed: atha khalu śakraḥ devānām indraḥ rājānam śuddhodanam upasaṃkramya evam āha
translated: Then Śakra, Lord of the Gods, approached King Śuddhodana and said:

analyzed: pālānām
translated: The palaces of the guardians are inferior, those of the Thirty-Three are excellent,

analyzed: vaijayanta samam veśma bodhisattvasya dāmi aham
translated: I will give a palace equal to Vaijayanta to the Bodhisattva.

original: atha khalu suyāmo devaputro rājānaṃ śuddhodanamusaṃkramyaivamāha
analyzed: atha khalu suyāmaḥ deva putraḥ rājānam śuddhodanam usaṃkramya evam āha
translated: Then the god Suyāma approached King Śuddhodana and said:

analyzed: madīyam bhavanam dṛṣṭvā vismitāḥ śakra koṭayaḥ
translated: Seeing my abode, millions of Śakras are amazed.

analyzed: suyāma bhavanam śrīmat bodhisattvasya dāmi aham
translated: I will give the glorious abode of Suyāma to the Bodhisattva.

original: atha khalu saṃtuṣito devaputro rājānaṃ śuddhodanamupasaṃkramyaivamāha
analyzed: atha khalu saṃtuṣitaḥ deva putraḥ rājānam śuddhodanam upasaṃkramya evam āha
translated: Then the god Santuṣita approached King Śuddhodana and said:

analyzed: yatra eva uṣitaḥ pūrvam tuṣiteṣu mahā yaśāḥ
translated: Where the greatly renowned one dwelt in the past in the Tuṣita realm,

analyzed: tat eva bhavanam ramyam bodhisattvasya dāmi aham
translated: I will give that very delightful abode to the Bodhisattva.

original: atha khalu sunirmito devaputro rājānaṃ śuddhodanamupasaṃkramyaivamāha
analyzed: atha khalu sunirmitaḥ deva putraḥ rājānam śuddhodanam upasaṃkramya evam āha
translated: Then the god Sunirmita approached King Śuddhodana and said:

analyzed: manaḥ mayam aham śrīmat vaśma tad rata nāmayam
translated: I will bring that glorious, jewel-made palace, made of mind,

analyzed: bodhisattvasya pūjā artham upaneṣyāmi pārthiva
translated: For the worship of the Bodhisattva, O King.

original: atha khalu paranirmitavaśavartī devaputro rājānaṃ śuddhodanamupasaṃkramyaivamāha
analyzed: atha khalu paranirmitavaśavartī devaputraḥ rājānam śuddhodanam upasaṃkramya evam āha
translated: Then the god Paranimitavaśavartin, having approached King Śuddhodana, said this:

analyzed: yāvantaḥ kāmadhātu sthāḥ vimānāḥ śobhanāḥ kvacid
translated: Whatever beautiful palaces there are in the realm of desire,

analyzed: bhābhiḥ te mad vimānasya bhavanti abhihata prabhāḥ
translated: Their radiance is outshone by the light of my palace.

analyzed: tat prayacchāmi aham śrīmat veśma ratna mayam śubham
translated: Therefore I will offer that glorious, beautiful, jewel-made house,

analyzed: bodhisattvasya pūjā artham ānayiṣyāmi pārthiva
translated: For the worship of the Bodhisattva, O King.

analyzed: divyaiḥ puṣpaiḥ samākīrṇam divya gandha upavāsitam
translated: Filled with divine flowers, perfumed with divine scents,

analyzed: upanāmayiṣye vipulam yatra devī vasiṣyati
translated: I will bring a vast one where the queen will dwell.

original: iti hi bhikṣavaḥ sarvaiḥ kāmāvacarraidaiveśvarairbodhisattvasya pūjārthaṃ kapilāhvaye mahāpuravare svakasvakāni gṛhāṇi māpitānyabhūvan /
analyzed: iti hi bhikṣavaḥ sarvaiḥ kāmāvacarraiḥ daiva īśvaraiḥ bodhisattvasya pūjā artham kapila āhvaye mahā pura vare svaka svakāni gṛhāṇi māpitāni abhūvan
translated: Thus, monks, for the worship of the Bodhisattva, all the lords of the gods dwelling in the realm of desire erected their own houses in the great city of Kapilavastu.

original: rājñā capi śuddhodanena manuṣyātikrāntaṃ divyāsaṃprāptaṃ gṛhataraṃ pratisaṃskāritamabhūt /
analyzed: rājñā ca pi śuddhodanena manuṣya atikrāntam divya a saṃprāptam gṛhataram pratisaṃskāritam abhūt
translated: And King Śuddhodana also had a house constructed that surpassed human [works] but was not quite divine.

original: tatra bodhisattvo mahāsattvo mahāvyūhasya samādheranubhāvena sarveṣu teṣu gṛheṣu māyādevīmupadarśayati sma /
analyzed: tatra bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ mahāvyūhasya samādheḥ anubhāvena sarveṣu teṣu gṛheṣu māyādevīm upadarśayati sma
translated: There, the Bodhisattva Mahasattva, through the power of the Samadhi of Great Array, showed Maya Devi in all those houses.

original: abhyantaragataśca bodhisattvo māyādevyāḥ kukṣau dakṣiṇe pārśve paryaṅkamābhujya niṣaṇṇo 'bhūt /
analyzed: abhyantara gataḥ ca bodhisattvaḥ māyādevyāḥ kukṣau dakṣiṇe pārśve paryaṅkam ābhujya niṣaṇṇaḥ bhūt
translated: And the Bodhisattva, having entered, sat cross-legged in Maya Devi's right side.

original: sarve ca te deveśvarā ekaikamevaṃ saṃjānīte sma mamaiva gṛhe bodhisattvamātā prativasati nānyatreti //
analyzed: sarve ca te deva īśvarāḥ ekaikam evam saṃjānīte sma mama eva gṛhe bodhisattva mātā prativasati na anyatra iti
translated: And all those lords of gods each thought thus: The mother of the Bodhisattva dwells in my house alone, not elsewhere.

analyzed: vaidya
translated: Vidy

analyzed: tatra idam ucyate
translated: This is said there:

original: mahāvyūhāya sthitaḥ samādhiye acintiyā nirmita nirmiṇitvā /
analyzed: mahāvyūhāya sthitaḥ acintiyā nirmita nirmiṇitvā
translated: Abiding in the samadhi of great array, he emanated inconceivable emanations.

original: sarveṣa devānabhiprāya pūritā nṛpasya pūrṇaśca tadā manorathaḥ // / //
analyzed: pūritā nṛpasya pūrṇaḥ ca tadā manorathaḥ
translated: The wishes of all gods were fulfilled, and then the king's desire was also fulfilled.

original: atha khalu tasyāṃ devaparṣadi keṣāṃciddevaputrāṇāmetadabhavat ye 'pi tāvaccāturmahārājakāyikā devāste 'pi tāvanmanuṣyāśrayagatatvena nirvidyāpakramanti
analyzed: atha khalu tasyām deva parṣadi keṣāṃcid deva putrāṇām etat abhavat ye pi tāvat cāturmahārājakāyikāḥ devāḥ te pi tāvat manuṣya āśraya gata tvena nirvidya apakramanti
translated: Then, in that assembly of gods, some gods thought: Even the gods of the Four Great Kings, because they are in human abodes, become disenchanted and depart.

original: kaḥ punarvādo ye tadanye udāratamā devāḥ trāyatriṃśā vā yāmā vā tuṣitā vā /
analyzed: kaḥ punar vādaḥ ye tad anye udāratamāḥ devāḥ trāyatriṃśāḥ vā yāmāḥ vā tuṣitāḥ vā
translated: How much more so the gods who are even more exalted than them, the gods of the Thirty-Three, the Yamas, or the Tushitas.

original: tatkathaṃ hi nāma sarvalokābhyudgato bodhisattvaḥ śucirnirāmagandhaḥ sattvaratnaḥ saṃtuṣitāddevanikāyāccyutvā durgandhe manuṣyāśraye daśamāsān
analyzed: tat katham hi nāma sarva loka abhyudgataḥ bodhisattvaḥ śuciḥ nirāma gandhaḥ sattva ratnaḥ saṃtuṣitāt devanikāyāt cyutvā durgandhe manuṣya āśraye daśa māsān
translated: How is it that the Bodhisattva, who is exalted above all worlds, pure, free from defilement, a jewel among beings, having passed away from the Tusita host of gods,

analyzed: mātuḥ kukṣau sthitaḥ iti
translated: remained for ten months in his mother's womb, in a human abode filled with foul smells?

original: atha khalvāyuṣmānānando buddhānubhāvena bhagavantametadavocat āścaryaṃ bhagavan yāvajjugupsanīyaśca mātṛgrāmastathāgatenokto yāvadrāgacaritaśca
analyzed: atha khalu āyuṣmān ānandaḥ buddha anubhāvena bhagavantam etat avocat āścaryam bhagavan yāvat jugupsanīyaḥ ca mātṛgrāmaḥ tathāgatena uktaḥ yāvat rāga caritaḥ ca
translated: Then the Venerable Ānanda, through the Buddha's power, said this to the Blessed One: It is amazing, Blessed One, that the Tathāgata has spoken of women as being so disgusting and lustful,

analyzed: idam tu bhagavan āścaryataram
translated: but this, Blessed One, is even more amazing.🔽How is it that the Blessed One, who is exalted above all worlds, having passed away from the Tusita host of gods while still a Bodhisattva,

original: kathaṃ hi nāma sarvalokābhyudgato bhagavān pūrvaṃ bodhisattvabhūta eva tuṣitāddevanikāyāccyavitvā manuṣyāśraye durgandhe
analyzed: katham hi nāma sarva loka abhyudgataḥ bhagavān pūrvam bodhisattva bhūtaḥ eva tuṣitāt devanikāyāt cyavitvā manuṣya āśraye durgandhe
translated: in a human abode filled with foul smells,

analyzed: mātuḥ dakṣiṇe pārśve
translated: entered his mother's right side

analyzed: kukṣau upapanne iti
translated: and took birth in her womb?

original: nāhaṃ bhagavan idamutsahe evaṃ vaktaṃ yathaiva pūrve bhagavatā vyākṛtamiti /
analyzed: na aham bhagavan idam utsahe evam vaktam yathā eva pūrve bhagavatā vyākṛtam iti
translated: I do not dare, Blessed One, to say this as the Blessed One has declared it.

original: bhagavānāha icchasi tvamānanda ratnavyūhaṃ bodhisattvaparibhogaṃ draṣṭuṃ yo mātuḥ kukṣigatasya bodhisattvasya paribhogo 'bhūt /
analyzed: bhagavān āha icchasi tvam ānanda ratna vyūham bodhisattva paribhogam draṣṭum yaḥ mātuḥ kukṣi gatasya bodhisattvasya paribhogaḥ bhūt
translated: The Blessed One said, Ānanda, do you wish to see the jeweled structure used by the Bodhisattva, which was used by the Bodhisattva while he was in his mother's womb?

analyzed: ānandaḥ āha ayam asya bhagavan kālaḥ
translated: Ānanda said, This is the time for that, Blessed One!

analyzed: ayam sugata samayaḥ
translated: This is the time for that, Sugata!

original: yattathāgatastaṃ bodhisattvaparibhogamupadarśayed yaṃ dṛṣṭvā prītiṃ vetsyāmaḥ //
analyzed: yat tathāgataḥ tam bodhisattva paribhogam upadarśayet yam dṛṣṭvā prītim vetsyāmaḥ
translated: May the Tathāgata show us that jeweled structure used by the Bodhisattva, seeing which we will rejoice.

analyzed: atha khalu bhagavān tathārūpa nimittam akarot
translated: Then the Blessed One made a sign

original: yad brahmā sahāpatiḥ sārdhamaṣṭaṣaṣṭibrahmaśatasahasrairbrahmaloke 'ntarhito bhagavataḥ purataḥ pratyasthāt /
analyzed: yat brahmā sahā patiḥ sārdham aṣṭaṣaṣṭi brahma śata sahasraiḥ brahma loke ntarhitaḥ bhagavataḥ puratas pratyasthāt
translated: so that Brahmā, lord of the Sahā World, together with sixty-eight hundred thousand Brahmas, disappeared from the Brahma world and stood in the presence of the Blessed One.

original: sa bhagavataḥ pādau śirasābhivandya bhagavantaṃ tripradakṣiṇīkṛtyaikānte 'sthāt prāñjalībhūto bhagavantaṃ namasyan /
analyzed: sa bhagavataḥ pādau śirasā abhivandya bhagavantam tri pradakṣiṇīkṛtya ekānte sthāt prāñjalībhūtaḥ bhagavantam namasyan
translated: He bowed his head at the feet of the Blessed One, circumambulated the Blessed One three times, and stood to one side with palms joined in homage to the Blessed One.

original: tatra khalu bhagavān jānanneva brahmāṇaṃ sahāpatimāmantrayate sma gṛhītastvayā
analyzed: tatra khalu bhagavān jānan eva brahmāṇam sahā patim āmantrayate sma gṛhītaḥ tvayā
translated: There the Blessed One, knowing full well, addressed Brahmā, lord of the Sahā World: Have you

original: brahman sa bodhisattvaparibhogo daśamāsiko yo mama pūrvaṃ bodhisattvabhūtasya mātuḥ kukṣigatasyābhūt /
analyzed: brahman sa bodhisattva paribhogaḥ daśa māsikaḥ yaḥ mama pūrvam bodhisattva bhūtasya mātuḥ kukṣi gatasya abhūt
translated: “Brahmā, that enjoyment of the Bodhisattva that I had for ten months when I was in my mother’s womb as a bodhisattva in the past is now in the realm of Brahmā.”

analyzed: brahmā āha evam etat bhagavan
translated: Brahmā said, “It is so, Blessed One.

analyzed: evam etat sugata
translated: It is so, Sugata.”

analyzed: bhagavān āha kva saḥ idānīm brahman
translated: The Blessed One said, “Where is it now, Brahmā?

analyzed: upadarśaya tam
translated: Show it to me.”

analyzed: brahmā ca āha brahma loke sa bhagavan
translated: Brahmā said, “Blessed One, it is in the Brahma realm.”

original: bhagavānāha tena hi tvaṃ brahman upadarśaya taṃ daśamāsikaṃ bodhisattvaparibhogam /
analyzed: bhagavān āha tena hi tvam brahman upadarśaya tam daśa māsikam bodhisattva paribhogam
translated: The Blessed One said, “Then, Brahmā, show me that ten-month-old enjoyment of the Bodhisattva.

analyzed: jñāsyanti kiyat saṃskṛtam iti
translated: They will know how much has been created.”

original: atha khalu brahmā sahāpatistān brāhmaṇānetadavocat tiṣṭhatu tāvadbhavanto yāvadvayaṃ ratnavyūhaṃ bodhisattvaparibhogamānayiṣyāmaḥ //
analyzed: atha khalu brahmā sahā patiḥ tān brāhmaṇān etat avocat tiṣṭhatu tāvat bhavantaḥ yāvat vayam ratna vyūham bodhisattva paribhogam ānayiṣyāmaḥ
translated: Then Brahmā, Lord of the Sahā World, said to those brahmins, “Wait, sirs, while I bring the bodhisattva’s enjoyment, the Jewel Adornment.”

original: atha khalu brahmā sahāpatirbhagavataḥ pādau śirasābhivanditvā bhagavataḥ purato 'ntarhitastatkṣaṇameva brahmaloke pratyasthāt //
analyzed: atha khalu brahmā sahā patiḥ bhagavataḥ pādau śirasā abhivanditvā bhagavataḥ puratas ntarhitaḥ tad kṣaṇam eva brahma loke pratyasthāt
translated: Then Brahmā, Lord of the Sahā World, bowed his head to the Blessed One’s feet, disappeared from the Blessed One’s presence, and instantly appeared in the Brahma realm.

original: atha khalu brahmā sahāpatiḥ subrahmāṇaṃ devaputrametadavocat gaccha tvaṃ mārṣā ito brahmalokamupādāya yāvattrāyatriṃśadbhavanam śabdamudīraya /
analyzed: atha khalu brahmā sahā patiḥ subrahmāṇam deva putram etat avocat gaccha tvam mārṣaiḥ itas brahma lokam upādāya yāvat trāyatriṃśat bhavanam śabdam udīraya
translated: Then Brahmā, lord of the Sahā World, said to the god Subrahmā, “Go, friend, from this Brahma world up to the realm of the Thirty-Three, and proclaim the sound.

analyzed: ghoṣam anuśrāvaya
translated: Let the sound be heard.

analyzed: ratna vyūham bodhisattva paribhogam vayam tathāgatasya antikam upanāmayiṣyāmaḥ
translated: We will bring the jeweled structure, the enjoyment of the Bodhisattva, to the Thus-Gone One.

analyzed: yaḥ yuṣmākam draṣṭu kāmaḥ sa śīghram āgacchatu iti  vaidya
translated: Whoever among you wishes to see it should come quickly.”

original: atha khalu brahmā sahāpatiścaturaśītyā devakoṭyā nayutaśatasahasraḥ sārdhaṃ taṃ ratnavyūhaṃ
analyzed: atha khalu brahmā sahā patiḥ caturaśītyā deva koṭyā nayuta śata sahasraḥ sārdham tam ratna vyūham
translated: Then Brahmā, lord of the Sahā World, together with 84 trillion gods, took up that jeweled structure,

original: bodhisattvaparibhogaṃ parigṛhya mahati brāhme vimāne triyojanaśatike pratiṣṭhāpyānekairdaivakoṭīnayutaśatasahasraiḥ
analyzed: bodhisattva paribhogam parigṛhya mahati brāhme vimāne tri yojana śatike pratiṣṭhāpya anekaiḥ daiva koṭī nayuta śata sahasraiḥ
translated: the enjoyment of the Bodhisattva, and placed it in a great Brahma palace 350 leagues in size. Surrounded by many hundreds of thousands of billions of trillions of gods,

analyzed: samantataḥ nu parivārya jambūdvīpam avatārayati sma
translated: he descended to Jambudvīpa.

original: tena khalu punaḥ samayena kāmāvacarāṇāṃ devānāṃ mahāsaṃnipāto 'bhūt bhagavatsakāśe gantum /
analyzed: tena khalu punar samayena kāmāvacarāṇām devānām mahā saṃnipātaḥ bhūt bhagavat sakāśe gantum
translated: At that time, there was a great gathering of gods from the desire realm who had come into the presence of the Blessed One.

original: sa khalu puna ratnavyūho bodhisattvaparibhogo divyairvastrairdivyairmālyairdivyairgandhairdivyaiḥ puṣpairdivyairvādyairdivyaiśca paribhaugairabhisaṃskṛto 🔽'bhūt /
analyzed: sa khalu punar ratnavyūhaḥ bodhisattva paribhogaḥ divyaiḥ vastraiḥ divyaiḥ mālyaiḥ divyaiḥ gandhaiḥ divyaiḥ puṣpaiḥ divyaiḥ vādyaiḥ divyaiḥ ca paribhaugaiḥ abhisaṃskṛtaḥ  bhūt
translated: That special enjoyment of the Bodhisattvas, the Jewel Array, was adorned with divine garments, divine garlands, divine perfumes, divine flowers, divine music, and divine enjoyments.

original: tāvanmaheśākhyaiśca devaiḥ parivṛto 'bhūd yacchakro devānāmindraḥ sumerausamudre
analyzed: tāvat maheśākhyaiḥ ca devaiḥ parivṛtaḥ bhūt yat śakraḥ devānām indraḥ sumerau samudre
translated: It was surrounded by such greatly powerful gods that Śakra, Lord of the Gods, standing on Mount Sumeru in the ocean,

original: sthitvā dūrata eva mukhe tālacchatrakaṃ dattvā śīrṣavyavalokanenānuvilokayati sma unmeṣadhyāyikayā vā /
analyzed: sthitvā dūratas eva mukhe tāla chatrakam dattvā śīrṣa vyavalokanena anuvilokayati smaḥ unmeṣa dhyāyikayā vā
translated: from afar offered a palm-leaf parasol to his face and looked at him with the gaze of his head, or with the gaze of a moment's opening of the eyes.

analyzed: na ca śaknoti sma draṣṭum
translated: But he was not able to see him.

analyzed: tat kasmāt maheśākhyāḥ hi devāḥ brāhmaṇāḥ
translated: Why was that? Because the greatly powerful gods are the Brahmas.

analyzed: itarāḥ trāyatriṃśāḥ yāmāḥ tuṣitāḥ nirmāṇaratayaḥ paranirmitavaśavartinaḥ
translated: The others are the gods of the Heaven of the Thirty-Three, the Yāma gods, the Tuṣita gods, the Nirmāṇarati gods, and the Paranirmitavaśavartin gods.

analyzed: kaḥ punar vādaḥ śakraḥ devānām indraḥ
translated: What to speak of Śakra, Lord of the Gods?

analyzed: moham te vai yānti sma
translated: They became confused.

original: atha khalu bhagavāṃstaṃ divyaṃ vādyanirghoṣamantardhāpayati sma /
analyzed: atha khalu bhagavān tam divyam vādya nirghoṣam antardhāpayati sma
translated: Then the Blessed One made that divine sound of music disappear.

original: tatkasmāt / yatsahaśravaṇādeva jāmbudvīpakā manuṣyā unmādamāpatsyanta iti //
analyzed: tat kasmāt yat saha śravaṇāt eva jāmbudvīpakāḥ manuṣyāḥ unmādam āpatsyante iti
translated: Why was that? Because merely by hearing it, the humans of Jambudvīpa would have gone mad.

original: atha khalu catvāro mahārājānaḥ śakraṃ devānāmindramupasaṃkramyaivamāhuḥ kathaṃ devānāmindra kariṣyāmo na labhāmahe ratnavyūhaṃ bodhisattvaparibhogaṃ 🔽draṣṭum /
analyzed: atha khalu catvāraḥ mahā rājānaḥ śakram devānām indram upasaṃkramya evam āhuḥ katham devānām indra kariṣyāmaḥ na labhāmahe ratna vyūham bodhisattva paribhogam  draṣṭum
translated: Then the Four Great Kings approached Śakra, Lord of the Devas, and said, Lord of the Devas, what shall we do? We cannot see the jeweled structure that is the Bodhisattva's abode.

analyzed: sa tān avocat kim aham mārṣāḥ kariṣyāmi
translated: Śakra replied, Friends, what can I do?

analyzed: aham api na labhe draṣṭum
translated: I too cannot see it.

original: api tu khalu punarmārṣā bhagavatsamīpamupanītaṃ drakṣyāmaḥ /
analyzed: api tu khalu punar mārṣāḥ bhagavat samīpam upanītam drakṣyāmaḥ
translated: But friends, we will see it when it is brought into the presence of the Blessed One.

original: te tadā āhuḥ tena hi devānāmindra tathā kuru yathāsya kṣipraṃ darśanaṃ bhavet /
analyzed: te tadā āhuḥ tena hi devānām indra tathā kuru yathā asya kṣipram darśanam bhavet
translated: They said, Well then, Lord of the Devas, do what you can so that we may see it soon.

original: śakra āha āgamayata mārṣā muhūrtaṃ yāvadatikrāntātikrāntatamā devaputrā bhagavantaṃ pratisaṃmodayante sma /
analyzed: śakraḥ āha āgamayata mārṣāḥ muhūrtam yāvat atikrānta atikrāntatamāḥ deva putrāḥ bhagavantam pratisaṃmodayante sma
translated: Śakra said, Wait a moment, friends, while the gods who have gone beyond and are the most excellent converse with the Blessed One.

analyzed: tad ekānte sthitvā śīrṣa unmiñjitakayā bhagavantam anuvilokayanti sma
translated: Having said that, they stood to one side, gazing at the Blessed One with their eyes upturned.

original: atha khalu brahmā sahāpatiḥ sārdhaṃ taiścaturaśītyā devakoṭīnayutaśatasahasraistaṃ ratnavyūhaṃ bodhisattvaparibhogaṃ gṛhītvā yena bhagavāṃstenopasaṃkrāmayati
analyzed: atha khalu brahmā sahā patiḥ sārdham taiḥ caturaśītyā deva koṭī nayuta śata sahasraiḥ tam ratna vyūham bodhisattva paribhogam gṛhītvā yena bhagavān tena upasaṃkrāmayati  /
translated: Then Brahmā, Lord of the Sahā World, together with 8,400,000,000 devas, took up that jeweled structure that was the Bodhisattva's abode and approached the Blessed One.

analyzed: sma
translated: [The Buddha said:]🔽The mind is the forerunner of phenomena.

original: sa khalu puna ratnavyūho bodhisattvaparibhogo 'bhirūpaḥ prāsādiko darśanīyaścaturasraścatuṣṭhūṇaḥ /
analyzed: sa khalu punar ratna vyūhaḥ bodhisattva paribhogaḥ bhirūpaḥ prāsādikaḥ darśanīyaḥ catur asraḥ catuṣṭhūṇaḥ
translated: Moreover, that jeweled array, the enjoyment of the bodhisattvas, was beautiful, pleasing to the eye, and square with four corners.

analyzed: upariṣṭāt ca kūṭāgāra samalaṃkṛtaḥ
translated: And above it was adorned like a multi-storied building.

analyzed: evaṃpramāṇaḥ tat yathā api nāma ṣaṣ māsa jātaḥ
translated: It was of such a size, namely, like a child six months old,

analyzed: dārakaḥ uccaistvena
translated: in height.

original: tasya khalu punaḥ kūtāgārasya madhye paryaṅkaḥ prajñaptaḥ tadyathāpi nāma ṣaṇmāsajātasya dārakasya bhittīphalakaḥ /
analyzed: tasya khalu punar kūtāgārasya madhye paryaṅkaḥ prajñaptaḥ tat yathā api nāma ṣaṣ māsa jātasya dārakasya bhittī phalakaḥ
translated: In the middle of that multi-storied building, a couch was arranged, like a pillow for a child six months old.

original: sa khalu puna ratnavyūho bodhisattvaparibhoga evaṃ varṇasaṃsthāno yasya na kaścit sadevake loke samārake sabrahmake sadṛśo 'sti ākṛtyā vā varṇena 🔽vā /
analyzed: sa khalu punar ratna vyūhaḥ bodhisattva paribhogaḥ evam varṇa saṃsthānaḥ yasya na kaścid sa devake loke sa mārake sa brahmake sadṛśaḥ sti ākṛtyā vā varṇena  vā
translated: Moreover, that jeweled array, the enjoyment of the bodhisattvas, had such a color and form that there was none in the world with its gods, Māras, and Brahmās who was equal to it in appearance or color.

original: devāḥ khalvapi taṃ dṛṣṭvā āścaryaprāptā abhuvan /
analyzed: devāḥ khalu api tam dṛṣṭvā āścarya prāptāḥ abhuvan
translated: The gods, having seen it, were amazed.

analyzed: cakṣūṃṣi teṣām vibhramanti sma
translated: Their eyes became confused.

original: sa ca tathāgatasyāntika upanīto 'tīva bhāsate tapati virocate sma /
analyzed: sa ca tathāgatasya antike upanītaḥ tīva bhāsate tapati virocate sma
translated: And when it was brought into the presence of the Tathāgata, it shone, glowed, and radiated.

original: tadyathāpi nāma dvinirdhāntaṃ suvarṇaṃ kuśalena karmakāreṇa supariniṣṭhitamapagatakācadoṣam /
analyzed: tat yathā api nāma dvi nirdhāntam suvarṇam kuśalena karmakāreṇa su pariniṣṭhitam apagata kāca doṣam
translated: It was like well-refined gold, well-worked by a skilled goldsmith, free from impurities.

analyzed: evam tasmin samaye
translated: In the same way, at that time,

analyzed: sa kūṭāgāraḥ virājate sma
translated: that peaked dwelling shone.

original: tasmin khalu punarbodhisattvaparibhoge paryaṅkaḥ prajñapto yasya sadevake loke nāsti kaścit sadṛśo varṇena vā saṃsthānena vā anyatra kambugrīvāyā
analyzed: tasmin khalu punar bodhisattva paribhoge paryaṅkaḥ prajñaptaḥ yasya sa devake loke na asti kaścid sadṛśaḥ varṇena vā saṃsthānena vā anyatra kambu grīvāyāḥ
translated: In that enjoyment of the Bodhisattva, a couch was prepared, which in the world with its gods had no equal in color or shape, except for the conch-shell neck of the Bodhisattva.

analyzed: vaidya
translated: physician

analyzed: bodhisattvasya
translated: of the Bodhisattva.

analyzed: yat khalu mahābrahmaṇā cīvaram prāvṛtam abhūt
translated: The robe that Great Brahmā put on

original: tattasya bodhisattvaparyaṅkasyāgrato na bhāsate sma tadyathāpi nāma vātavṛṣṭyābhihataḥ kṛṣṇakambalaḥ /
analyzed: tat tasya bodhisattva paryaṅkasya agratas na bhāsate sma tat yathā api nāma vāta vṛṣṭyā abhihataḥ kṛṣṇa kambalaḥ
translated: did not shine in front of that Bodhisattva's couch, just as a black blanket beaten by the wind and rain.

original: sa khalu punaḥ kūṭāgāra uragasāracandanamayo yasyaikasuvarṇadharaṇī sāhasraṃ lokadhātuṃ mūlyaṃ kṣamate /
analyzed: sa khalu punar kūṭāgāraḥ uragasāracandana mayaḥ yasya eka suvarṇa dharaṇī sāhasram lokadhātum mūlyam kṣamate
translated: Moreover, that peaked dwelling was made of uragasāra sandalwood, the value of a single square of which could cover a thousand world systems.

analyzed: tathāvidhena uragasāra candanena sa kūṭāgāraḥ samantāt an upaliptaḥ
translated: That peaked dwelling was completely unadorned with such uragasāra sandalwood.

original: tādṛśa eva dvitīyaḥ kūṭāgāraḥ kṛto yastasmin prathame kūṭāgāre 'bhyantarataḥ asakto 'baddhasthitaḥ /
analyzed: tādṛśaḥ eva dvitīyaḥ kūṭāgāraḥ kṛtaḥ yaḥ tasmin prathame kūṭāgāre bhyantaratas asaktaḥ baddha sthitaḥ
translated: A second kūṭāgāra was made like the first one, which was suspended in the air without any support inside the first kūṭāgāra.

original: tādṛśa eva tṛtīyo 'pi kūṭāgāro yastasmin dvitīye kūṭāgāre 'bhyantare 'sakto 'baddhasthitaḥ /
analyzed: tādṛśaḥ eva tṛtīyaḥ pi kūṭāgāraḥ yaḥ tasmin dvitīye kūṭāgāre bhyantare saktaḥ baddha sthitaḥ
translated: A third kūṭāgāra was made like the first two, which was suspended in the air without any support inside the second kūṭāgāra.

original: sa ca paryaṅkastasmin gandhamaye tṛtīye kūṭāgāre vyavasthitaḥ saṃpraticchannaḥ /
analyzed: sa ca paryaṅkaḥ tasmin gandha maye tṛtīye kūṭāgāre vyavasthitaḥ saṃpraticchannaḥ
translated: That couch was placed inside the third kūṭāgāra made of perfume, and it was covered.

original: tasya khalu punaruragasāracandanasyaivaṃrūpo varṇaḥ tadyathāpi nāma abhijātasya nīlaivaḍūryasya /
analyzed: tasya khalu punar uragasāracandanasya evaṃrūpaḥ varṇaḥ tat yathā api nāma abhijātasya nīla evaḍūryasya
translated: The color of that uragasāra sandalwood was like that of a fine blue beryl.

original: tasya khalu punargandhakūṭāgārasyopari samantādyāvanti kāniciddivyātikrāntāni puṣpāṇi santi /
analyzed: tasya khalu punar gandhakūṭāgārasya upari samantāt yāvanti kānicid divya atikrāntāni puṣpāṇi santi
translated: Above that kūṭāgāra of perfume, all the flowers that exist, surpassing those of the gods,

original: tāni sarvāṇi tasmin kūṭāgāre bodhisattvasya pūrvakuśalamūlavipākenānuprāptānyeva jāyante sma /
analyzed: tāni sarvāṇi tasmin kūṭāgāre bodhisattvasya pūrva kuśala mūla vipākena anuprāptāni eva jāyante sma
