analyzed: ṣaṣṭyā ca sahasraiḥ rājñaḥ śuddhodanasya antaḥpureṇa gīta vādya samyak tūrya tāḍāva cara saṃgīti saṃpravāditena parivṛtā
translated: She was surrounded by the sixty thousand women of King Śuddhodana's harem, who played music, percussion, and sang in harmony.

analyzed: caturaśītyā ca deva kanyā sahasraiḥ parivṛtā
translated: She was surrounded by eighty-four thousand celestial maidens,

original: caturaśītyā ca nāgakanyāsahasraiḥ caturaśītyā ca gandharvakanyāsahasraiḥ caturaśītyā
analyzed: caturaśītyā ca nāga kanyā sahasraiḥ caturaśītyā ca gandharva kanyā sahasraiḥ caturaśītyā
translated: eighty-four thousand nāga maidens, eighty-four thousand gandharva maidens,

analyzed: ca kinnara kanyā sahasraiḥ caturaśītyā ca asura kanyā sahasraiḥ nānā vyūha alaṃkāra alaṃkṛtābhiḥ
translated: eighty-four thousand kinnara maidens, and eighty-four thousand asura maidens, all adorned with various ornaments,

analyzed: nānā gīta vādya varṇa bhāṣiṇībhiḥ anugamyamānā niryāti sma
translated: following her as they sang and played various instruments.

analyzed: sarvam ca lumbinī vanam gandha udaka siktam divya puṣpa abhikīrṇīkṛtam abhūt
translated: The entire Lumbini Grove was sprinkled with fragrant water and strewn with divine flowers.

analyzed: sarva vṛkṣāḥ ca tasmin vana vare akāla patra puṣpa phalāni dadanti sma
translated: All the trees in that excellent grove bore untimely leaves, flowers, and fruits.

original: devaiśca tathā tadvanaṃ samalaṃkṛtamabhūt tadyathāpi nāma miśrakāvanaṃ devānāṃ samalaṃkṛtam //
analyzed: devaiḥ ca tathā tat vanam samalaṃkṛtam abhūt tat yathā api nāma miśrakā vanam devānām samalaṃkṛtam
translated: The gods also adorned the grove in such a way that it resembled the adorned Mīśraka Grove of the gods.

original: atha khalu māyādevī lumbinīvanamanupraviśya tasmādrathavarādavatīrya naramarukanyāparivṛtā
analyzed: atha khalu māyādevī lumbinīvanam anupraviśya tasmāt ratha varāt avatīrya nara maru kanyā parivṛtā
translated: Then, Queen Māyā entered the Lumbini Grove, descended from that excellent chariot, and, surrounded by divine and human maidens,

original: vṛkṣeṇa vṛkṣaṃ paryaṭantī vanādvanaṃ caṃkramyamāṇā drumād drumaṃ nirīkṣamāṇā anupūrveṇa
analyzed: vṛkṣeṇa vṛkṣam paryaṭantī vanāt vanam caṃkramyamāṇā drumāt drumam nirīkṣamāṇā anupūrveṇa
translated: roamed from tree to tree, wandered from grove to grove, and gazed from tree to tree. In due course,

translated: adorned with various divine and human flowers in full bloom, with various fragrant and colorful garments hanging from it,🔽blazing with the light of various precious gems, adorned with all jewels in its roots, trunk, branches, and leaves, with well-arranged and extensive branches,

analyzed: kara tala nibhe bhūmi bhāge suvibhakta vistīrṇa nīla tṛṇa mayūra grīvā saṃnibhe kācilindika sukha saṃsparśe
translated: standing on the ground that was like the palm of a hand, well-arranged and extensive with blue grass like a peacock's neck, soft to the touch like kācilindika cloth,

analyzed: dharaṇī tale saṃsthitaḥ pūrva jina jana tryā abhinivāsitaḥ deva saṃgīti anugītaḥ śubha vimala viśuddhaḥ
translated: the ground where the mothers of former victorious ones had resided, praised by the songs of devas, auspicious, pure, and immaculate.

analyzed: śuddhāvāsa deva śata sahasraiḥ praśānta cittaiḥ abhinata jaṭā makuṭa avalambita avanata mūrdhabhiḥ abhinandyamānaḥ tam
translated: He was praised by hundreds of thousands of gods from the Pure Abodes, with peaceful minds, their topknots and crowns bowed down and hanging,

analyzed: plakṣa vṛkṣam upajagāma
translated: and approached the fig tree.

original: atha sa plakṣavṛkṣo bodhisattvasya tejonubhāvenāvanamya praṇamati sma /
analyzed: atha sa plakṣa vṛkṣaḥ bodhisattvasya tejaḥ nubhāvena avanamya praṇamati sma
translated: Then that fig tree, through the power and majesty of the Bodhisattva, bowed down and paid homage.

original: atha māyādevī gaganatalagateva vidyut dṛṣṭiṃ dakṣiṇaṃ bāhuṃ prasārya plakṣaśākhāṃ gṛhītvā salīlaṃ gaganatalaṃ prekṣamāṇā vijṛmbhamānā sthitābhūt
analyzed: atha māyādevī gagana tala gatā iva vidyut dṛṣṭim dakṣiṇam bāhum prasārya plakṣa śākhām gṛhītvā sa līlam gagana talam prekṣamāṇā vijṛmbhamānā sthitā abhūt
translated: Then Queen Māyā, like lightning in the sky, extended her right arm, took hold of a branch of the fig tree, playfully gazed at the sky, and stood stretching.

original: atha tasmin samaye ṣaṣṭyapsaraḥśatasahasrāṇi kāmāvacaradevebhya upasaṃkramya māyādevyā upasthāne paricaryāṃ kurvanti sma //
analyzed: atha tasmin samaye ṣaṣṭi apsaraḥ śata sahasrāṇi kāmāvacara devebhyaḥ upasaṃkramya māyādevyāḥ upasthāne paricaryām kurvanti sma
translated: Then at that time, six hundred thousand celestial maidens came from the gods of the desire realm and performed service and veneration to Queen Māyā.

analyzed: evaṃrūpeṇa khalu punar ṛddhi prātihāryeṇa samanvāgataḥ bodhisattvaḥ mātuḥ kukṣi gataḥ sthāt

original: sa paripūrṇānāṃ daśānāṃ māsānāmatyayena māturdakṣiṇapārśvānniṣkramati sma smṛtaḥ saṃprajānannanupalipto garbhamalairyathā nānyaḥ kaściducyate
analyzed: sa paripūrṇānām daśānām māsānām atyayena mātuḥ dakṣiṇa pārśvāt niṣkramati sma smṛtaḥ saṃprajānan an upaliptaḥ garbha malaiḥ yathā na anyaḥ kaścid ucyate  /
translated: After ten full months had passed, he emerged from his mother's right side, mindful and clearly aware, unstained by any impurities of the womb, as is said of no one else.

analyzed: ni eṣām garbha male iti
translated: while the others are the impurities of the womb.”

original: tasmin khalu punarbhikṣavaḥ samaye śakro devānāmindro brahmā ca sahāpatiḥ purataḥ sthitāvabhūtām /
analyzed: tasmin khalu punar bhikṣavaḥ samaye śakraḥ devānām indraḥ brahmā ca sahā patiḥ puratas sthitau abhūtām
translated: Bhikṣus, at that time Śakra, lord of the gods, and Brahmā, lord of the Sahā World, stood in front of the Bodhisattva.

original: yau bodhisattvaṃ paramagauravajātau divyakāśikavastrāntaritaṃ sarvāṅgapratyaṅgaiḥ smṛtau saṃprajñau pratigṛhṇāte sma //
analyzed: yau bodhisattvam parama gaurava jātau divya kāśika vastra antaritam sarva aṅga pratyaṅgaiḥ smṛtau saṃprajñau pratigṛhṇāte sma
translated: Out of the highest respect, they received the Bodhisattva with all their limbs and minor parts, while being mindful and fully aware, and covered him with divine Kāśika cloth.

analyzed: yasmin ca kūṭāgāre bodhisattvaḥ mātuḥ kukṣi gataḥ sthāt
translated: The palace where the Bodhisattva resided in his mother’s womb

original: taṃ brahmā sahāpatirbrahmakāyikāśca devaputrā abhyutkṣipya brahmalokaṃ caityārthaṃ pūjārthaṃ copanāmayāmāsuḥ /
analyzed: tam brahmā sahā patiḥ brahmakāyikāḥ ca devaputrāḥ abhyutkṣipya brahma lokam caitya artham pūjā artham ca upanāmayāmāsuḥ
translated: was lifted up by Brahmā, lord of the Sahā World, and the gods of the Brahmā group, and brought to the Brahma world to be worshipped as a holy site.

analyzed: a parigṛhītaḥ khalu punar bodhisattvaḥ kenacid manuṣya bhūtena
translated: The Bodhisattva was not received by anyone born as a human.

original: atha tahi bodhisattvaṃ devatāḥ prathamataraṃ pratigṛhṇanti sma //
analyzed: atha tahi bodhisattvam devatāḥ prathamataram pratigṛhṇanti sma
translated: Then the gods received the Bodhisattva first.

analyzed: atha bodhisattvaḥ jāta mātraḥ pṛthivyām avatarati sma
translated: Then, as soon as he was born, the Bodhisattva descended to the ground.

original: samanantarāvatīrṇasya ca bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya mahāpṛthivīṃ bhittvā mahāpadmaṃ prādurabhūt /
analyzed: samanantara avatīrṇasya ca bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya mahā pṛthivīm bhittvā mahāpadmam prādurabhūt
translated: As soon as the Bodhisattva, the Great Being, descended, a great lotus appeared, breaking through the great earth,

analyzed: nanda upanandau ca nāga rājānau gagana tale ṛdha kāyau vaidya
translated: The nāga kings Nanda and Upananda, standing in the sky with half their bodies,

original: sthitvā śītoṣṇe dve vāridhāre 'bhinirbhiṃttvā bodhisattvaṃ snāpayataḥ sma /
analyzed: sthitvā śīta uṣṇe dve vāri dhāre bhiniḥ bhiṃttvā bodhisattvam snāpayataḥ sma
translated: emitted two streams of water, one cold and one warm, and bathed the Bodhisattva.

original: śakrabrahmalokapālāḥ pūrvaṃgamāścānye ca bahavo devaputrāḥ śatasahasrā ye bodhisattvaṃ jātamātraṃ nānāgandhodakamuktakusumaiḥ snāpayantyabhyavakiranti
analyzed: śakra brahma lokapālāḥ pūrvaṃgamāḥ ca anye ca bahavaḥ devaputrāḥ śata sahasrāḥ ye bodhisattvam jāta mātram nānā gandha udaka mukta kusumaiḥ snāpayanti abhyavakiranti  /
translated: Śakra, Brahmā, the Lokapālas, and many other hundreds of thousands of devas, with the Bodhisattva at the forefront, bathed and sprinkled the newly born Bodhisattva with scented water and flowers.

analyzed: sma
translated: They did this.

original: antarikṣe ca dve cāmare ratnacchatraṃ ca prādurbhūtam /
analyzed: antarikṣe ca dve cāmare ratna chatram ca prādurbhūtam
translated: Two yak-tail fans appeared in the sky, and a jeweled parasol.

original: sa tasmin mahāpadme sthitvā caturdiśamavalokayati sma /
analyzed: sa tasmin mahāpadme sthitvā caturdiśam avalokayati sma
translated: Standing on that great lotus, he looked to the four directions.

analyzed: caturdiśam avalokya
translated: Having looked to the four directions,

analyzed: siṃha avalokitam mahāpuruṣa avalokitam vyavalokayati sma
translated: he looked with the lion's gaze, the great man's gaze.

original: tasmin khalu punaḥ samaye bodhisattvaḥ pūrvakuśalamūlavipākajenāpratihatena divyacakṣuprādurbhūtena
analyzed: tasmin khalu punar samaye bodhisattvaḥ pūrva kuśala mūla vipāka jena apratihatena divya cakṣu prādurbhūtena
translated: At that time, the Bodhisattva, with the eyes of a god that appeared due to the ripening of his previous roots of goodness,

original: divyena cakṣuṣā sarvāvantaṃ trisāhastraṃ mahāsāhastraṃ lokadhātuṃ sanagaranigamajanapadarāṣṭrarājadhānīṃ
analyzed: divyena cakṣuṣā sarvāvantam tri sāhastram mahā sāhastram lokadhātum sa nagara nigama janapada rāṣṭra rājadhānīm
translated: with those divine eyes, saw the entire great trichiliocosm, with its cities, towns, villages, countries, capital cities,

analyzed: sa deva mānuṣam paśyati sma
translated: He saw the world with its gods, humans, and asuras.

original: sarvasattvānāṃ ca cittacaritaṃ ca prajānāti sma /
analyzed: sarva sattvānām ca citta caritam ca prajānāti sma
translated: He knew the thoughts and deeds of all beings.

original: jñātvā ca vyavalokayati sma asti tvasau kaścitsattvo yo mayā sadṛśaḥ śīlena vā samādhinā vā prajñayā vā kuśalamūlacaryayā vā /
analyzed: jñātvā ca vyavalokayati sma asti tu asau kaścid sattvaḥ yaḥ mayā sadṛśaḥ śīlena vā samādhinā vā prajñayā vā kuśala mūla caryayā vā
translated: Knowing this, he looked around and thought, “Is there any being who is my equal in morality, concentration, wisdom, or the practice of the roots of virtue?”

original: yadā ca bodhisattvaḥ trisāhasramahāsāhasralokadhātau na kaṃcitsattvamātmatulyaṃ paśyati sma /
analyzed: yadā ca bodhisattvaḥ tri sāhasra mahā sāhasra lokadhātau na kaṃcid sattvam ātma tulyam paśyati sma
translated: When the Bodhisattva saw no being in the great trichiliocosm who was his equal,

original: atha tasminsamaye bodhisattvaḥ siṃha iva vigatabhayabhairavo 'saṃtrastaḥ astambhī
analyzed: atha tasmin samaye bodhisattvaḥ siṃhaḥ iva vigata bhaya bhairavaḥ saṃtrastaḥ a stambhī
translated: then at that time the Bodhisattva, like a fearless lion, without fear, terror, or trembling,

original: sucintitaṃ smṛtvā cintayitvā sarvasattvānāṃ cittacaritāni jñātvā aparigṛhīto bodhisattvaḥ
analyzed: su cintitam smṛtvā cintayitvā sarva sattvānām citta caritāni jñātvā a parigṛhītaḥ bodhisattvaḥ
translated: remembering and contemplating his good thoughts, knowing the thoughts and deeds of all beings, the Bodhisattva, who was not held back by any attachment,

original: pūrvāṃ diśamabhimukhaḥ sapta padāni prakrāntaḥ pūrvaṃgamo bhaviṣyāmi sarveṣāṃ kuśalamūlānāṃ dharmāṇām /
analyzed: pūrvām diśam abhimukhaḥ sapta padāni prakrāntaḥ pūrvaṃgamaḥ bhaviṣyāmi sarveṣām kuśala mūlānām dharmāṇām
translated: went forward in the eastern direction, taking seven steps. He thought, “I will be the forerunner of all wholesome dharmas.”

original: tasya prakramata uparyantarīkṣe 'parigṛhītaṃ divyaśvetavipulachatraṃ cāmaraśubhe gacchantamanugacchanti sma yatra yatra ca bodhisattvaḥ padamutkṣipati
analyzed: tasya prakramataḥ upari antarīkṣe parigṛhītam divya śveta vipula chatram cāmara śubhe gacchantam anugacchanti sma yatra yatra ca bodhisattvaḥ padam utkṣipati
translated: As he was proceeding, a divine white parasol, vast and unsupported, and a pair of beautiful yak-tail fans moved through the sky, following him wherever he went.

original: tatra tatra padmāni prādurbhavanti sma /🔽dakṣiṇāṃ diśamabhimukhaḥ sapta padāni prakrāntaḥ dakṣiṇīyo bhaviṣyāmi devamanuṣyāṇām /
analyzed: tatra tatra padmāni prādurbhavanti sma  dakṣiṇām diśam abhimukhaḥ sapta padāni prakrāntaḥ dakṣiṇīyaḥ bhaviṣyāmi deva manuṣyāṇām
translated: And wherever the Bodhisattva placed his feet, lotuses would appear.🔽Facing the southern direction, he took seven steps and said, I will be worthy of offerings from gods and humans.

analyzed: paścimām diśam abhimukhaḥ sapta padāni prakāntaḥ
translated: Facing the western direction, he took seven steps and said, This is my last birth.

original: saptame sthitvā siṃha ivāhlādanātmikāṃ vācaṃ bhāṣate sma ahaṃ loke jyeṣṭho 'haṃ loke śreṣṭhaḥ /
analyzed: saptame sthitvā siṃhaḥ iva āhlādana ātmikām vācam bhāṣate sma aham loke jyeṣṭhaḥ ham loke śreṣṭhaḥ
translated: Standing on the seventh step, he spoke words of delight like a lion, saying, I am the eldest in the world, I am the best in the world.

analyzed: iyam me paścimā jātiḥ

analyzed: kariṣyāmi jāti jarā maraṇa duḥkhasya antam
translated: I will put an end to the suffering of birth, old age, and death.

original: uttarāṃ diśamabhimukhaḥ sapta padāni prakrāntaḥ anuttaro bhaviṣyāmi sarvasattvānām /
analyzed: uttarām diśam abhimukhaḥ sapta padāni prakrāntaḥ anuttaraḥ bhaviṣyāmi sarva sattvānām
translated: Facing the northern direction, he took seven steps and said, I will be unsurpassed by all beings.

original: adhastāddiśamabhimukhaḥ sapta padāni prakrāntaḥ nihaniṣyāmi māraṃ ca mārasenāṃ ca /
analyzed: adhastāddiśam abhimukhaḥ sapta padāni prakrāntaḥ nihaniṣyāmi māram ca māra senām ca
translated: Facing the lower direction, he took seven steps and said, I will defeat Mara and Mara's army.

analyzed: yena te sukha samarpitāḥ bhaviṣyanti

analyzed: upariṣṭāt diśam abhimukhaḥ sapta padāni prakrāntaḥ

analyzed: samanantara bhāṣitā ca iyam bodhisattvena vākū
translated: As soon as the Bodhisattva spoke these words,

analyzed: atha tasmin samaye ayam tri sāhasra mahā sāhasra lokadhātuḥ svareṇa abhivijñāptaḥ bhūt  iyam bodhisattvasya karma vipāka jā abhijñā dharmatā
translated: at that time this great trichiliocosm was made known through his voice.

analyzed: yadā bodhisattvaḥ caramabhavikaḥ upajāyate
translated: This is the nature of the supernormal knowledge of the Bodhisattva, born from the ripening of karma.🔽When the Bodhisattva is born in his last existence,

analyzed: yadā ca anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbudhyate
translated: and when he attains supreme perfect enlightenment,

original: tadā asyemānyevaṃrūpāṇi ṛddhiprātihāryāṇi bhavanti tasmin khalu punarbhikṣavaḥ samaye saṃhṛṣitaromakūpajātāḥ sarvasattvā abhūvan /
analyzed: tadā asya imāni evaṃrūpāṇi ṛddhi prātihāryāṇi bhavanti tasmin khalu punar bhikṣavaḥ samaye saṃhṛṣita romakūpa jātāḥ sarva sattvāḥ abhūvan
translated: then he has these kinds of miraculous wonders. Monks, at that time all beings had their hairs stand on end.

analyzed: a ghaṭṭitāni ca divya mānuṣyakāni tūryāṇi saṃpravāditāni

translated: And all the trees in season,

analyzed: viśuddhāt ca gagana talāt megha śabdaḥ śrūyate sma  apagata meghāt ca gaganāt śanais sūkṣma sūkṣmaḥ devaḥ pravarṣati sma

original: paramasukhasaṃsparśayā ca sarvasattvakāyacittasukhasaṃjananyā lokottarayā anekaśatasahasravarṇaprabhayā sarvatrisāhasramahāsāhasralokadhātuḥ

translated: Free from attachment, aversion, delusion, pride, discontent, depression, fear, greed, envy, and stinginess, refraining from all unwholesome actions, the illnesses of sick beings were pacified.🔽The hunger and thirst of hungry and thirsty beings were relieved.

analyzed: bandhana baddhāḥ ca bandhanebhyaḥ vimuktāḥ

analyzed: parama sukha samarpitāḥ ca sarva sattvāḥ abhūvan

analyzed: katham etat yojyate
translated: How is this to be understood?

original: na punaste mohapuruṣā evaṃ jñāsyanti na sukṛtakarmaṇāṃ sattvānāmuccāraprasrāvamaṇḍe kāyaḥ saṃbhavatīti /

translated: But those deluded people will not know that the bodies of beings who have done good deeds do not arise in a cesspool of urine and feces.

analyzed: bhadrikā khalu api tathārūpāṇām sattvānām garbhāvakrāntiḥ bhavati
translated: Indeed, the conception of such beings is auspicious.

analyzed: na deva bhūtaḥ eva dharmacakram pravartayati

analyzed: tat kasmāt mā khalu ānanda sattvāḥ kausīdyam āpatsyante

analyzed: vayam tu manuṣya mātrāḥ
translated: But we are mere humans.

analyzed: na vayam samarthāḥ tat sthānam paripūrayitum iti kausīdyam āpadyeran
translated: We are not able to fulfill that state. They would become lazy.

original: na khalu punasteṣāṃ mohapuruṣāṇāṃ dharmastainyakānāmevaṃ bhaviṣyati acintyo hi sa sattvaḥ /

translated: But those deluded people who steal the Dharma will not think: That being is inconceivable.

analyzed: na asau asmābhiḥ prāmāṇikaḥ kartavyaḥ iti
translated: We should not make him authoritative.

original: api tu khalvānanda buddhaṛddhiprātihāryamapi te tasmin kāle nāvakalpayiṣyanti /
analyzed: api tu khalu ānanda buddha ṛddhi prātihāryam api te tasmin kāle na avakalpayiṣyanti

analyzed: kim aṅga punar bodhisattva bhūtasya tathāgatasya bodhisattva prātihāryāṇi
translated: How much less the bodhisattva's miraculous powers of the Tathāgata when he was a bodhisattva?

original: paśya ānanda kiyantaṃ te mohapuruṣā bahvapuṇyābhisaṃskāramabhisaṃskariṣyanti /
analyzed: paśya ānanda kiyantam te moha puruṣāḥ bahu apuṇya abhisaṃskāram abhisaṃskariṣyanti
translated: See, Ānanda, how much demerit those deluded people will create,

analyzed: ye buddha dharmān pratikṣepsyanti lābha satkāra śloka abhibhūtāḥ uccāra lagnāḥ lābha satkāra abhibhūtāḥ itara jātīyāḥ
translated: who will reject the Buddha's teachings, overwhelmed by gain, honor, and fame, attached to gain and honor, and of a different kind.

analyzed: ānandaḥ āha mā mā evaṃrūpāḥ bhagavan anāgate dhvani bhikṣavaḥ bhaviṣyanti ye imām evam bhadrikām sūtrāntām pratikṣepsyanti pratipakṣam pakṣanti  / ca
translated: Ānanda said, May such monks not exist in the future, Blessed One, who will reject such excellent sūtras as this, and oppose them.

original: bhagavānāha evaṃrūpāśca te ānanda sūtrāntāṃ prapikṣepsyanti /
analyzed: bhagavān āha evaṃrūpāḥ ca te ānanda sūtrāntām prapikṣepsyanti

translated: and will create many kinds of other evil actions.

analyzed: anarthikāḥ ca te śrāmaṇyena bhaviṣyanti

original: ānanda āha kā punarbhagavan teṣāṃ tathārūpāṇāmasatpuruṣāṇāṃ gatirbhaviṣyati /

translated: Just as humans see the gods and the gods see humans,

analyzed: heṭhayanti na ca anyonyam sārthavāhaḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: They do not harm each other, he will become the leader of a caravan.

original: yathā ca jvalanaḥ śāntaḥ sarvā nadyaśca visthitāḥ /
analyzed: yathā ca jvalanaḥ śāntaḥ sarvāḥ nadyaḥ ca visthitāḥ
translated: Just as the fire is extinguished and all the rivers have stopped flowing,

original: sūkṣmaṃ ca kampate bhūmiḥ bhavitā tattvadarśakaḥ // / //🔽iti //
analyzed: sūkṣmam ca kampate bhūmiḥ bhavitā tattva darśakaḥ 🔽iti
translated: And the earth trembles slightly, he will become the one who sees the truth.

original: iti hi bhikṣavaḥ saptarātrajātasya bodhisattvasya mātā māyādevī kālamakarot /
analyzed: iti hi bhikṣavaḥ sapta rātra jātasya bodhisattvasya mātā māyādevī kālam akarot
translated: Thus, monks, seven days after the Bodhisattva’s birth, Queen Māyā passed away.

original: sā kālagatā trāyatriṃśati deveṣūpapadyata /🔽syāt khalu punarbhikṣavo yuṣmākamevaṃ bodhisattvāparādhena māyādevī kālagateti /
analyzed: sā kālagatā trāyatriṃśati deveṣu upapadyata  syāt khalu punar bhikṣavaḥ yuṣmākam evam bodhisattva aparādhena māyādevī kālagatā iti
translated: Having passed away, she was reborn among the gods of the Heaven of the Thirty-Three.

analyzed: na khalu evam draṣṭavyam
translated: Monks, you may think that Queen Māyā passed away because of some wrongdoing on the part of the Bodhisattva, but that is not the case.

analyzed: tat kasmāt hetoḥ
translated: Why is it not the case?

analyzed: etat paramam hi tasyāḥ āyuṣpramāṇam abhūt
translated: That was the maximum length of her life.

original: atītānāmapi bhikṣavo bodhisattvānāṃ saptarātrajātānāṃ janetryaḥ kālamakurvanta /
analyzed: atītānām api bhikṣavaḥ bodhisattvānām sapta rātra jātānām janetryaḥ kālam akurvanta
translated: Monks, the mothers of all bodhisattvas of the past have also passed away seven days after giving birth.

analyzed: tat kasmāt hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

original: vivṛddhasya hi bodhisattvasya paripūrṇendriyasyābhiniṣkrāmato māturhṛdayaṃ sphuṭet //🔽Vaidya
analyzed: vivṛddhasya hi bodhisattvasya paripūrṇa indriyasya abhiniṣkrāmataḥ mātuḥ hṛdayam sphuṭet  vaidya
translated: Because when a bodhisattva has grown and his faculties are fully developed, if he were to be born, his mother’s heart would burst.

original: iti hi bhikṣavaḥ saptame divase yādṛśenaiva vyūhena māyādevī kapilavastuno mahānagarādudyānabhūmimabhiniṣkrāntābhūt /
analyzed: iti hi bhikṣavaḥ saptame divase yādṛśena eva vyūhena māyādevī kapilavastunaḥ mahā nagarāt udyāna bhūmim abhiniṣkrāntā abhūt
translated: Thus, monks, on the seventh day, with the same display with which Queen Māyā had left the great city of Kapilavastu for the pleasure grove,

original: tataḥ koṭīśatasahasraguṇottareṇa mahāvyūhena bodhisattvaḥ kapilavastu mahānagaraṃ prāvikṣat /
analyzed: tatas koṭī śata sahasra guṇa uttareṇa mahā vyūhena bodhisattvaḥ kapilavastu mahā nagaram prāvikṣat
translated: the Bodhisattva entered the great city of Kapilavastu with a great display that was a thousand times greater than that.

original: tasya ca praviśataḥ pañca pūrṇakumbhasahasrāṇi gandhodakaparipūrṇāni purato nīyante sma /🔽evaṃ pañcakanyāsahasrāṇi mayūrahastakamparigṛhītāni purato gacchanti sma /🔽pañca ca kanyāsahasrāṇi tālavṛkṣakaparigṛhītāni purato gacchanti sma /
analyzed: tasya ca praviśataḥ pañca pūrṇa kumbha sahasrāṇi gandha udaka paripūrṇāni puratas nīyante sma  evam pañca kanyā sahasrāṇi mayūra hastakam parigṛhītāni puratas gacchanti sma  pañca ca kanyā sahasrāṇi tālavṛkṣaka parigṛhītāni puratas gacchanti sma
translated: As he entered, five thousand full jars filled with scented water were carried in front of him.🔽Five thousand maidens holding peacock-feather fans went in front of him.🔽Five thousand maidens holding palm-leaf fans went in front of him.

original: pañca sa kanyāsahasrāṇi gandhodakabhṛṅgāraparigṛhītāni purato gacchanti sma /
analyzed: pañca sa kanyā sahasrāṇi gandha udaka bhṛṅgāra parigṛhītāni puratas gacchanti sma
translated: Five thousand maidens holding censers filled with incense went in front of him.

analyzed: mārgam avasiñcanti sma
translated: They sprinkled the road with scented water.

original: pañca ca kanyāsahasrāṇi vicitrapaṭalakaparigṛhītāni purato gacchanti sma /🔽pañca ca kanyāsahasrāṇi navavicitrapralambanamālāparigṛhītāni purato gacchanti sma /
analyzed: pañca ca kanyā sahasrāṇi vicitra paṭalaka parigṛhītāni puratas gacchanti sma  pañca ca kanyā sahasrāṇi nava vicitra pralambana mālā parigṛhītāni puratas gacchanti sma
translated: Five thousand maidens holding various canopies went in front of him.🔽Five thousand maidens holding garlands of fresh flowers went in front of him.

original: pañca ca kanyāsahasrāṇi ratnabhadrālaṃkāraparigṛhītāni purato gacchanti sma /
analyzed: pañca ca kanyā sahasrāṇi ratna bhadra alaṃkāra parigṛhītāni puratas gacchanti sma
translated: Five thousand maidens holding jeweled ornaments went in front of him.

analyzed: mārgam śodhayanti sma
translated: They cleared the road.

original: pañca ca kanyāsahasrāṇi bhadrāsanaparigṛhītāni purato gacchanti sma /
analyzed: pañca ca kanyā sahasrāṇi bhadrāsana parigṛhītāni puratas gacchanti sma
translated: Five thousand maidens holding fine seats went in front of him.

original: pañca ca brāhmaṇasahasrāṇi ghaṇṭāparigṛhītāni māṅgalyaśabdaṃ śrāvayantaḥ purato gacchanti sma /🔽viṃśati nāgasahasrāṇi sarvālaṃkāravibhūṣitāni purato gacchanti sma /
analyzed: pañca ca brāhmaṇa sahasrāṇi ghaṇṭā parigṛhītāni māṅgalya śabdam śrāvayantaḥ puratas gacchanti sma  viṃśati nāga sahasrāṇi sarva alaṃkāra vibhūṣitāni puratas gacchanti sma
translated: Five thousand brahmins holding bells and making auspicious sounds went in front.🔽Twenty thousand elephants adorned with all ornaments went in front.

original: viṃśati hayasahasrāṇi suvarṇālaṃkārasaṃchannāni sarvālaṃkāravibhūṣitāni purato gacchanti sma /
analyzed: viṃśati haya sahasrāṇi suvarṇa alaṃkāra saṃchannāni sarva alaṃkāra vibhūṣitāni puratas gacchanti sma
translated: Twenty thousand horses covered with golden ornaments and adorned with all ornaments went in front.

analyzed: aśīti ratha sahasrāṇi uchrita chatra dhvaja patākā kiṅkiṇī jāla samalaṃkṛtāni bodhisattvasya pṛṣṭhatas nucchanti sma
translated: Eighty thousand chariots adorned with parasols, banners, flags, and nets of bells followed behind the Bodhisattva.

original: cattvāriṃśatpadātisahasrāṇi śūrāṇāṃ vīrāṇāṃ varāṅgurūpiṇāṃ saṃnaddhadṛḍhavarmakavacānāṃ bodhisattvaṃ gacchantamanugacchanti sma /
analyzed: cattvāriṃśat padāti sahasrāṇi śūrāṇām vīrāṇām vara aṅgu rūpiṇām saṃnaddha dṛḍha varma kavacānām bodhisattvam gacchantam anugacchanti sma
translated: Forty thousand foot soldiers, heroes, warriors, and the most handsome men, wearing solid armor and shields, followed the Bodhisattva as he went.

analyzed: gagana tala gatāni ca aprameya asaṃkhyeyāni abhijñātāni kāmāvacarāṇām rūpāvacara devaputra koṭī nayuta śata sahasrāṇi nānā prakrāram aneka vyūhaiḥ bodhisattvasya
translated: Innumerable and countless hundreds of thousands of millions of billions of gods of the desire realm and form realm, with higher knowledge, who were in the sky,

analyzed: pūjām kurvantaḥ anugacchanti sma
translated: made offerings to the Bodhisattva and followed him with various appearances and many arrays.

analyzed: yasmin ca vara pravara rathe bodhisattvaḥ samabhirūḍhaḥ bhūt
translated: And the excellent chariot in which the Bodhisattva was to ascend

analyzed: sa kāmāvacaraiḥ devaiḥ anekaiḥ mahā vyūhaiḥ samalaṃkṛtaḥ bhūt
translated: was adorned by many great arrays of gods belonging to the desire realm.

original: viṃśati ca devakanyāsahasrāṇi sarvālaṃkāravibhūṣitāni ratnasūtraparigṛhītāni taṃ rathaṃ vahanti sma /
analyzed: viṃśati ca deva kanyā sahasrāṇi sarva alaṃkāra vibhūṣitāni ratna sūtra parigṛhītāni tam ratham vahanti sma
translated: Twenty thousand celestial maidens, adorned with all ornaments and holding jeweled threads, pulled that chariot.

original: dvayoścāpsarasormadhye ekā mānuṣī kanyā dvayormānuṣīkanyayormadhye ekāpsarā /
analyzed: dvayoḥ ca apsarasoḥ madhye ekā mānuṣī kanyā dvayoḥ mānuṣī kanyayoḥ madhye ekā apsarā
translated: Between two celestial maidens was one human maiden, and between two human maidens was one celestial maiden.

analyzed: na ca apsarasaḥ mānuṣīṇām āma gandham jighranti sma
translated: And the celestial maidens did not smell the foul odor of the humans,

original: na ca mānuṣā apsarasāṃ rūpaṃ dṛṣṭvā pramādamāpadyante sma yadidaṃ bodhisattvasya tejonubhāvena //
analyzed: na ca mānuṣāḥ apsarasām rūpam dṛṣṭvā pramādam āpadyante sma yat idam bodhisattvasya tejaḥ nubhāvena
translated: and the humans, seeing the beauty of the celestial maidens, did not become heedless. This was due to the power of the Bodhisattva's splendor.

original: iti hi bhikṣavaḥ kapilāhvaye puravare sarvārthasiddhāya pañcamātraiḥ śākyaśataiḥ pañcagṛhaśatāni nirmāpitānyabhūvan bodhisattvamuddiśya /
analyzed: iti hi bhikṣavaḥ kapila āhvaye pura vare sarvārthasiddhāya pañca mātraiḥ śākya śataiḥ pañca gṛha śatāni nirmāpitāni abhūvan bodhisattvam uddiśya
translated: Thus, monks, in the excellent city of Kapila, five hundred Śākyas built five hundred houses for the sake of the Bodhisattva, the one who has accomplished all goals.

original: te bodhisattvaṃ nagaraṃ praviśantaṃ svasvagṛhadvāramūle sthitvā kṛtāñjalipuṭā abhinatakāyāḥ sagauravā evamāhuḥ iha bhoḥ sarvārthasiddha praviśa
analyzed: te bodhisattvam nagaram praviśantam sva sva gṛha dvāra mūle sthitvā kṛta añjali puṭāḥ abhinata kāyāḥ sa gauravāḥ evam āhuḥ iha bhoḥ sarvārthasiddha praviśa
translated: They, standing at the door of their own houses as the Bodhisattva entered the city, with folded hands, their bodies bowed down, with respect, said this: Come in here, O Sarvārthasiddha!

analyzed: iha bho devātideva praviśa
translated: Come in here, O god above the gods!

original: iha bhoḥ śuddhasattva praviśa /🔽iha bhoḥ sārathivara praviśa /
analyzed: iha bhoḥ śuddhasattva praviśa  iha bhoḥ sārathi vara praviśa
translated: Come in here, O pure being!🔽Come in here, O best of charioteers!

analyzed: iha bhoḥ prīti prāmodya kara praviśa
translated: Come in here, O bringer of joy and delight!

analyzed: iha bho anindita yaśaḥ praviśa
translated: Come in here, O one of unblemished fame!

analyzed: iha bhoḥ samantacakṣu praviśa
translated: Come in here, O all-seeing one!

analyzed: iha bho asamasama praviśa
translated: Come in here, O unequaled one!

analyzed: iha bho asadṛśa guṇa tejaḥ dhara lakṣaṇa anuvyañjana su alaṃkṛtakāya praviśa iti
translated: Come in here, O bearer of incomparable qualities and splendor, your body adorned with the major and minor marks!

original: tataścopādāya kumārasyeha sarvārthasiddhaḥ sarvārthasiddha iti saṃjñāmagamat //
analyzed: tatas ca upādāya kumārasya iha sarvārthasiddhaḥ sarvārthasiddhaḥ iti saṃjñām agamat
translated: And from that time on, the prince became known as Sarvārthasiddha (Accomplished in All Aims) here.🔽There, King Śuddhodana, in order to please them all, having brought the Bodhisattva into all the houses, after four months had passed, brought the Bodhisattva into his own house.

original: tatra rājā śuddhodanasteṣāṃ sarveṣāmanuvartanārthaṃ bodhisattvaṃ sarvagṛheṣu praveśya caturṇāṃ māsānāmatyayādbodhisattvaṃ svagṛhe praveśayati 🔽sma /
analyzed: tatra rājā śuddhodanaḥ teṣām sarveṣām anuvartana artham bodhisattvam sarva gṛheṣu praveśya caturṇām māsānām atyayāt bodhisattvam sva gṛhe praveśayati  / sma
translated: And there, the Bodhisattva's father, King Śuddhodana,

analyzed: tatra ca nānāratnavyūhaḥ nāma vaidya
translated: had a physician named Nāḍīka

analyzed: mahā prāsādaḥ tam bodhisattvaḥ samārūḍhaḥ bhūt
translated: The Bodhisattva ascended that great palace.

original: tatra te bṛddhavṛddhāḥ śākyāḥ saṃnipatyaivaṃ mataṃ cārayanti sma kā nu khalu samarthā
analyzed: tatra te bṛddha vṛddhāḥ śākyāḥ saṃnipatya evam matam cārayanti sma kā nu khalu samarthā
translated: There the very old Śākyas gathered and discussed this matter: Who is able

original: bodhisattvaṃ gopāyituṃ kelayituṃ mamāyituṃ hitacittatayā maitracittatayā guṇacittatayā
analyzed: bodhisattvam gopāyitum kelayitum mamāyitum hita citta tayā maitra citta tayā guṇa citta tayā
translated: to protect, cherish, and possess the Bodhisattva with a beneficial mind, a friendly mind, a virtuous mind,

analyzed: saumya citta tayā ca iti
translated: and a gentle mind?

analyzed: tatra pañca mātrāṇi śākya vadhū śatāni
translated: There were about five hundred Śākya women.

analyzed: ekaikāḥ evam āhūḥ aham kumāram upasthāsye iti
translated: Each one said, I will attend to the prince.

original: tatra mahallakamahallikāḥ śākyā evamāhuḥ sarvā etā vadhūkā navā dahnāstaruṇyaḥ rūpayauvanamadamattāḥ /
analyzed: tatra mahallaka mahallikāḥ śākyāḥ evam āhuḥ sarvāḥ etāḥ vadhūkāḥ navāḥ dahnāḥ taruṇyaḥ rūpa yauvana mada mattāḥ
translated: There the old men and women of the Śākyas said, All these women are young, fresh, youthful, and intoxicated with the pride of beauty and youth.

analyzed: na etāḥ samarthāḥ bodhisattvam kālena kālam upasthāpayitum
translated: They are not able to attend to the Bodhisattva in a timely manner.

original: atha ca punariyaṃ mahāprajāpatī gautamī kumārasya mātṛsvasā /🔽eṣā samarthā kumāraṃ samyaksukhena saṃvardhayitum /
analyzed: atha ca punar iyam mahāprajāpatī gautamī kumārasya mātṛ svasā  eṣā samarthā kumāram samyak sukhena saṃvardhayitum
translated: However, this Mahāprajāpatī Gautamī is the prince's maternal aunt.🔽She is able to properly and happily raise the prince.

analyzed: rājānam ca śuddhodanam abhidhārayitum
translated: And she is able to please King Śuddhodana.

original: iti hi te sarve samagrā bhūtvā mahāprajāpatīṃ gautamīmutsāhayanti sma /
analyzed: iti hi te sarve samagrāḥ bhūtvā mahāprajāpatīm gautamīm utsāhayanti sma
translated: Thus, all of them together encouraged Mahāprajāpatī Gautamī.

original: iti hi mahāprajāpatī gautamī kumāraṃ saṃvardhayati sma /
analyzed: iti hi mahāprajāpatī gautamī kumāram saṃvardhayati sma
translated: Thus, Mahāprajāpatī Gautamī raised the prince.

original: tatra bodhisattvasyārthe dvātriṃśaddhātryaḥ saṃsthāpitā abhuvan aṣṭāvaṅgadhātryaḥ /🔽aṣṭau kṣīradhātryaḥ /
analyzed: tatra bodhisattvasya arthe dvātriṃśat dhātryaḥ saṃsthāpitāḥ abhuvan aṣṭāvaṅga dhātryaḥ  aṣṭau kṣīradhātryaḥ
translated: There, for the sake of the Bodhisattva, thirty-two nurses were appointed: eight nurses to hold him,🔽eight nurses to feed him milk,

analyzed: aṣṭau maladhātryaḥ
translated: eight nurses to clean him,

analyzed: aṣṭau krīḍā dhātryaḥ
translated: and eight nurses to play with him.

original: tato rājā śuddhodanaḥ sarvaṃ śākyagaṇaṃ saṃnipātyaivaṃ mīmāṃsate sma kiṃ nu khalvayaṃ kumāro rājā bhaviṣyati cakravartī /
analyzed: tatas rājā śuddhodanaḥ sarvam śākya gaṇam saṃnipātya evam mīmāṃsate sma kim nu khalu ayam kumāraḥ rājā bhaviṣyati cakravartī
translated: Then King Śuddhodana, having assembled all the Śākya clans, pondered thus: Will this prince become a universal monarch,

analyzed: āhosvit abhiniṣkramiṣyati pravrajyāyai
translated: or will he go forth into homelessness?

original: tena ca samayena himavataḥ parvatarājasya pārśve asito nāma maharṣiḥ prativasati sma pañcābhijñaḥ sārdhaṃ naradattena bhāgineyena /
analyzed: tena ca samayena himavataḥ parvata rājasya pārśve asitaḥ nāma mahā ṛṣiḥ prativasati sma pañca abhijñaḥ sārdham naradattena bhāgineyena
translated: At that time, on the side of the Himalayas, the king of mountains, there lived a great sage named Asita, who possessed the five higher knowledges, together with his grand-nephew Naradatta.

analyzed: sa bodhisattvasya jāta mātrasya bahūni āścarya adbhuta prātihāryāṇi adrākṣīt
translated: He saw many wonderful and marvelous miracles as soon as the Bodhisattva was born.

original: gaganatalagatāṃśca devaputrān buddhaśabdamanuśrāvayato 'mbarāṇi ca bhrāmayata itastataḥ pramuditān bhramato 'drākṣīt /
analyzed: gagana tala gatān ca devaputrān buddha śabdam anuśrāvayataḥ mbarāṇi ca bhrāmayataḥ itas tatas pramuditān bhramataḥ drākṣīt
translated: He saw gods in the sky, making the sound of the Buddha, waving their garments, and joyfully moving around.

analyzed: tasya etat abhūt yat nu aham vyavalokayeyam iti
translated: He thought, Let me investigate this.

original: sa divyena cakṣuṣā sarvaṃ jambudvīpamanuvilokayannadrākṣīt kapilāhvaye mahāpuravare
analyzed: sa divyena cakṣuṣā sarvam jambudvīpam anuvilokayan adrākṣīt kapila āhvaye mahā pura vare
translated: With his divine eye, he looked all over Jambudvīpa and saw in the great city of Kapilavastu,

original: rājñaḥ śuddhodanasya gṛhe kumāraṃ jātaṃ śatapuṇyatejastejitaṃ sarvalokamahitaṃ dvātriṃśanmahāpuruṣalakṣaṇaiḥ samalaṃkṛtagātram /
analyzed: rājñaḥ śuddhodanasya gṛhe kumāram jātam śata puṇya tejaḥ tejitam sarva loka mahitam dvātriṃśat mahāpuruṣa lakṣaṇaiḥ samalaṃkṛta gātram
translated: in the house of King Śuddhodana, a prince had been born, shining with the splendor of a hundred merits, revered by the whole world, his body adorned with the thirty-two marks of a great being.

original: dṛṣṭvā ca punarnaradattaṃ māṇavakamāmantrayate sma yat khalu māṇavaka jānīyā jambudvīpe mahāratnamutpannam /
analyzed: dṛṣṭvā ca punar naradattam māṇavakam āmantrayate sma yat khalu māṇavaka jānīyāḥ jambudvīpe mahā ratnam utpannam
translated: Having seen this, he addressed the young brahmin Naradatta, saying, Young brahmin, know that a great jewel has appeared in Jambudvīpa.

original: kapilavastuni mahānagare rājñaḥ śuddhodanasya gṛhe kumāro jātaḥ śatapuṇyatejastejitaḥ sarvalokamahito dvātriṃśanmahāpuruṣalakṣaṇaiḥ samanvāgataḥ
analyzed: kapilavastuni mahā nagare rājñaḥ śuddhodanasya gṛhe kumāraḥ jātaḥ śata puṇya tejaḥ tejitaḥ sarva loka mahitaḥ dvātriṃśat mahāpuruṣa lakṣaṇaiḥ samanvāgataḥ
translated: In the great city of Kapilavastu, in the house of King Śuddhodana, a prince has been born, shining with the splendor of a hundred merits, revered by the whole world, endowed with the thirty-two marks of a great being.

analyzed: saced saḥ gāram adhyāvasiṣyati
translated: If he remains in the household life,

original: rājā bhaviṣyati caturaṅgaścakravartī vijitavān dhārmiko dharmarājo jānapadasthāmavīryaprāptaḥ saptaratnasamanvāgataḥ /
analyzed: rājā bhaviṣyati caturaṅgaḥ cakravartī vijitavān dhārmikaḥ dharma rājaḥ jānapada sthāma vīrya prāptaḥ sapta ratna samanvāgataḥ
translated: He will become a king, a universal monarch, victorious, a righteous Dharma king, possessing the seven treasures, and having an army of four limbs.

analyzed: tasya imāni sapta ratnāni bhavanti
translated: He will have these seven treasures:

original: tadyathā cakraratnaṃ hastiratnaṃ aśvaratnaṃ maṇiratnaṃ strīratnaṃ gṛhapatiratnaṃ pariṇāyakaratnam /
analyzed: tat yathā cakra ratnam hasti ratnam aśva ratnam maṇi ratnam strī ratnam gṛhapati ratnam pariṇāyaka ratnam
translated: namely, the precious wheel, the precious elephant, the precious horse, the precious wife, the precious jewel, the precious steward, and the precious minister.

analyzed: evam sapta ratna saṃpūrṇaḥ ca
translated: Thus he will be endowed with the seven treasures.

original: asya putrasahasraṃ bhaviṣyati śūrāṇāṃ vīrāṇāṃ varāṅgarūpiṇāṃ parasainyapramardakānām /
analyzed: asya putra sahasram bhaviṣyati śūrāṇām vīrāṇām vara aṅga rūpiṇām para sainya pramardakānām
translated: He will have a thousand sons, who will be brave, heroic, of excellent appearance, and crushers of enemy armies.🔽He will rule this great earth, with its oceans and mountains, without stick or sword,

original: sa imaṃ mahāpṛthivīmaṇḍalaṃ samudraparikhamadaṇḍenāśastreṇa svena dharmeṇa🔽balenābhibhūyābhinirjitya rājyaṃ kariṣyatyaiśvaryādhipatyena /
analyzed: saḥ imam mahā pṛthivī maṇḍalam samudra parikhama daṇḍena aśastreṇa svena dharmeṇa  balena abhibhūya abhinirjitya rājyam kariṣyati aiśvarya ādhipatyena
translated: but by the Dharma, through his own power and might.

analyzed: saced punar agārāt anagārikām pravrajiṣyati
translated: If, however, he leaves home for homelessness,

original: tathāgato bhaviṣyati arhan samyaksaṃbuddho netā ananyaneyaḥ śāstā loke saṃbuddhaḥ /
analyzed: tathāgataḥ bhaviṣyati arhan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ netā an anya neyaḥ śāstā loke saṃbuddhaḥ
translated: he will become a thus-gone one, a worthy one, a perfectly enlightened one, a guide, a teacher of gods and humans, a blessed one, a fully awakened one.

analyzed: tat etarhi upasaṃkramiṣyāvaḥ tat draṣṭum iti
translated: Let us now go to see him.

original: atha khalvasito maharṣiḥ sārdhaṃ naradattena bhāgineyena rājahaṃsa iva gaganatalādabhyudgamya samutplutya yena kapilavastu mahānagaraṃ tenopasaṃkrāmat
analyzed: atha khalu asitaḥ mahā ṛṣiḥ sārdham naradattena bhāgineyena rājahaṃsaḥ iva gagana talāt abhyudgamya samutplutya yena kapilavastu mahā nagaram tena upasaṃkrāmat
translated: Then the great sage Asita, together with his grand-nephew Naradatta, rose up from the ground like a royal swan, flew to the great city of Kapilavastu,

original: upasaṃkramya ṛddhiṃ pratisaṃhṛtya padbhyāmeva kapilavastu mahānagaraṃ praviśya yena rājñaḥ śuddhodanasya niveśanaṃ tenopasaṃkrāmat /
analyzed: upasaṃkramya ṛddhim pratisaṃhṛtya padbhyām eva kapilavastu mahā nagaram praviśya yena rājñaḥ śuddhodanasya niveśanam tena upasaṃkrāmat
translated: and after arriving, withdrew his miraculous power and entered the great city of Kapilavastu on foot, going to the residence of King Shuddhodana.

analyzed: upasaṃkramya rājñaḥ śuddhodanasya gṛha dvāre sthāt
translated: Having arrived, he stood at the door of King Shuddhodana's house.

analyzed: vaidya
translated: [Sutra on the] Medicine

original: iti hi bhikṣavo 'sito maharṣiḥ paśyati sma rājñaḥ śuddhodanasya gṛhadvāre 'nekāni prāṇiśatasahasrāṇi saṃnipatitāni /
analyzed: iti hi bhikṣavaḥ sitaḥ mahā ṛṣiḥ paśyati sma rājñaḥ śuddhodanasya gṛha dvāre nekāni prāṇi śata sahasrāṇi saṃnipatitāni
translated: Thus, monks, the great sage Asita saw many hundreds of thousands of living beings gathered at the door of King Shuddhodana's house.

original: atha khalvasito maharṣirdauvārikamupasaṃkramyaivamāha gaccha tvaṃ bhoḥ puruṣa rājñaḥ śuddhodanasya /
analyzed: atha khalu asitaḥ mahā ṛṣiḥ dauvārikam upasaṃkramya evam āha gaccha tvam bhoḥ puruṣa rājñaḥ śuddhodanasya
translated: Then the great sage Asita approached the doorkeeper and said, Go, my good man, to King Shuddhodana,

analyzed: nivedaya dvāre ṛṣiḥ vyavasthitaḥ iti
translated: and say that a sage is waiting at the door.

original: parameti dauvāriko 'sitasya maharṣeḥ pratiśrutya yena rājā śuddhodanastenopasaṃkrāmat /
analyzed: paramā iti dauvārikaḥ sitasya mahā ṛṣeḥ pratiśrutya yena rājā śuddhodanaḥ tena upasaṃkrāmat
translated: The doorkeeper, having heard from the great sage Asita, approached King Shuddhodana,🔽and said:

original: upasaṃkramya kṛtāñjalipuṭo rājānaṃ śuddhodanamevamāha yat khalu deva jānīyā ṛṣirjīrṇo vṛddho mahallako dvāre sthitaḥ /
analyzed: upasaṃkramya kṛta añjali puṭaḥ rājānam śuddhodanam evam āha yat khalu deva jānīyāḥ ṛṣiḥ jīrṇaḥ vṛddhaḥ mahallakaḥ dvāre sthitaḥ
translated: He approached and, with palms joined, said to King Śuddhodana, “Your Majesty, please know that a sage, old, aged, and advanced in years, is standing at the gate.

original: evaṃ ca vadati rājānamahaṃ draṣṭukāma iti /
analyzed: evam ca vadati rājānam aham draṣṭu kāmaḥ iti
translated: He says, ‘I wish to see the king.’”

original: atha rājā śuddhodano 'sitasya maharṣerāsanaṃ prajñāpya taṃ puruṣamevamāha praviśatu ṛṣiriti /
analyzed: atha rājā śuddhodanaḥ sitasya mahā ṛṣeḥ āsanam prajñāpya tam puruṣam evam āha praviśatu ṛṣiḥ iti
translated: Then King Śuddhodana, having prepared a seat for the great sage Asita, said to that man, “Let the sage enter.”

original: atha sa puruṣo rājakulānniṣkramyāsitaṃ maharṣimevamāha praviśeti //
analyzed: atha sa puruṣaḥ rāja kulāt niṣkramya asitam mahā ṛṣim evam āha praviśa iti
translated: Then that man, having come out from the royal palace, said to the great sage Asita, “Enter.”

analyzed: atha khalu asitaḥ mahā ṛṣiḥ yena rājā śuddhodanaḥ tena upasaṃkrāmat
translated: Then the great sage Asita approached King Śuddhodana.

original: upasaṃkramya purataḥ sthitvā rājānaṃ śuddhodanamevamāha jaya jaya mahārāja /
analyzed: upasaṃkramya puratas sthitvā rājānam śuddhodanam evam āha jaya jaya mahā rāja
translated: Having approached, he stood in front and said to King Śuddhodana, “Be victorious, be victorious, great king!

analyzed: ciram āyuḥ pālaya
translated: May you live long.

analyzed: dharmeṇa rājyam kāraya iti
translated: Rule your kingdom righteously.”

original: atha sa rājā śuddhodano 'sitasya maharṣerarghapādyamarcanaṃ ca kṛtvā sādhu suṣṭhu ca parigṛhya āsanenopanimantrayate sma /
analyzed: atha sa rājā śuddhodanaḥ sitasya mahā ṛṣeḥ arghapādyam arcanam ca kṛtvā sādhu suṣṭhu ca parigṛhya āsanena upanimantrayate sma
translated: Then King Śuddhodana, having offered water for washing the feet and respectful greeting to the great sage Asita, received him well and invited him to sit down.

original: sukhopaviṣṭaṃ cainaṃ jñātvā sagauravaḥ supratīta evamāha na smarāmyahaṃ tava ṛṣe darśanam /
analyzed: sukha upaviṣṭam ca enam jñātvā sa gauravaḥ su pratītaḥ evam āha na smarāmi aham tava ṛṣe darśanam
translated: Knowing that he was comfortably seated, with respect and great joy he said, Sage, I do not remember seeing you.

analyzed: tat kena arthena iha abhyāgataḥ si
translated: For what purpose have you come here?

analyzed: kim prayojanam
translated: What is your aim?

original: evamukte 'sito maharṣī rājānaṃ śuddhodanametadavocat putraste mahārāja jātastamahaṃ draṣṭukāma ihāgata iti //
analyzed: evam ukte sitaḥ mahā ṛṣiḥ rājānam śuddhodanam etat avocat putraḥ te mahā rāja jātaḥ tam aham draṣṭu kāmaḥ iha āgataḥ iti
translated: When this was said, the great sage Asita said to King Shuddhodana, Great king, a son has been born to you. I have come here wishing to see him.

analyzed: rājā āha svapiti mahā ṛṣe kumāraḥ
translated: The king said, Great sage, the prince is sleeping.

analyzed: muhūrtam āgamaya yāvat utthāsyati iti
translated: Please wait a moment until he wakes up.

original: ṛṣiravocat na mahārāja tādṛśā mahāpuruṣāściraṃ svapanti /
analyzed: ṛṣiḥ avocat na mahā rāja tādṛśāḥ mahā puruṣāḥ ciram svapanti
translated: The sage said, Great king, such great beings do not sleep for long.

analyzed: jāgara śīlāḥ tādṛśāḥ sat puruṣāḥ bhavanti
translated: Such good people are accustomed to staying awake.

original: iti hi bhikṣavo bodhasattvo 'sitasya maharṣeranukampayā jāgaraṇanimittamakarot /
analyzed: iti hi bhikṣavaḥ bodhasattvaḥ sitasya mahā ṛṣeḥ anukampayā jāgaraṇa nimittam akarot
translated: Thus, monks, the Bodhisattva, out of compassion for the great sage Asita, made a sign of staying awake.

original: atha khalu rājā śuddhodanaḥ sarvārthasiddhaṃ kumāramubhābhyāṃ pāṇibhyāṃ sādhu ca suṣṭhu cānuparigṛhya asitasya maharṣerantikamupanāmayati sma
analyzed: atha khalu rājā śuddhodanaḥ sarvārthasiddham kumāram ubhābhyām pāṇibhyām sādhu ca suṣṭhu ca anuparigṛhya asitasya mahā ṛṣeḥ antikam upanāmayati sma
translated: Then King Shuddhodana, having taken Prince Sarvārthasiddha with both hands, held him well and properly, and brought him to the great sage Asita.

original: iti hi asito maharṣirbodhisattvamavalokya dvātriṃśatā mahāpuruṣalakṣaṇaiḥ samanvāgatamaśītyanuvyañjanasuvicitragātraṃ
analyzed: iti hi asitaḥ mahā ṛṣiḥ bodhisattvam avalokya dvātriṃśatā mahāpuruṣa lakṣaṇaiḥ samanvāgatam aśīti anuvyañjana su vicitra gātram
translated: Thus, the great sage Asita, having seen the Bodhisattva endowed with the thirty-two marks of a great being, with a body adorned with the eighty minor marks,

analyzed: śakra brahma lokapāla atireka vapuṣam dinakara śata sahasra atireka tejasam sarva aṅga sundaram
translated: with a form surpassing that of Śakra, Brahmā, and the Lokapālas, with a radiance surpassing that of a hundred thousand suns, with a body beautiful in all limbs,

original: dṛṣṭvā codānamudānayati sma āścaryapudgalo batāyaṃ loke prādurbhūta /
analyzed: dṛṣṭvā ca udānam udānayati smaḥ āścarya pudgalaḥ bata ayam loke prādurbhūta
translated: and having seen him, he exclaimed, This is a wondrous being who has appeared in the world.

original: mahāścaryapudgalo batāyaṃ loke prādurbhūtaḥ ityutthāyāsanātkṛtāñjalipuṭo bodhisattvasya
analyzed: mahā āścarya pudgalaḥ bata ayam loke prādurbhūtaḥ iti utthāya āsanāt kṛta añjali puṭaḥ bodhisattvasya
translated: This is a greatly wondrous being who has appeared in the world. Having arisen from his seat, with palms joined,

original: caraṇayoḥ praṇipatya pradakṣiṇīkṛtya ca bodhisattvamaṅkena parigṛhya nidhyāyannavasthito 'bhūt /
analyzed: caraṇayoḥ praṇipatya pradakṣiṇīkṛtya ca bodhisattvam aṅkena parigṛhya nidhyāyan avasthitaḥ bhūt
translated: he bowed at the feet of the Bodhisattva, circumambulated him, and taking the Bodhisattva on his lap, he remained contemplating.

original: so 'drākṣīdbodhisattvasya dvātriṃśanmahāpuruṣalakṣaṇāni yaiḥ samanvāgatasya puruṣapudgalasya dve gatī bhavato nānyā /
analyzed: saḥ drākṣīt bodhisattvasya dvātriṃśat mahāpuruṣa lakṣaṇāni yaiḥ samanvāgatasya puruṣa pudgalasya dve gatī bhavataḥ na anyā
translated: He saw the thirty-two marks of a great being on the Bodhisattva, endowed with which, a male person has two destinies, no other.

analyzed: saced agāram adhyāvasati rājā bhavati catur aṅgaḥ cakravartī pūrvavat yāvat eva aiśvarya ādhipatyena
translated: If he dwells in the household, he becomes a wheel-turning king with the four armies, as before, up to sovereignty and dominion.

original: sacetpunaragārādanagārikāṃ pravrajati tathāgato bhaviṣyati vighuṣṭaśabdaḥ samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ /
analyzed: saced punar agārāt anagārikām pravrajati tathāgataḥ bhaviṣyati vighuṣṭa śabdaḥ samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ
translated: If he leaves the household life and goes forth, he will become a thus-gone one, a worthy one, a completely perfect buddha, renowned far and wide.’

original: sa taṃ dṛṣṭvā prārodīdaśrūṇi ca pravartayan gambhīraṃ ca niśvasati sma //
analyzed: sa tam dṛṣṭvā prārodīt aśrūṇi ca pravartayan gambhīram ca niśvasati sma
translated: Seeing this, he wept and shed tears, and sighed deeply.”

analyzed: vaidya
translated: Vidy

original: adrākṣīdrājā śuddhodano 'sitaṃ maharṣiṃ rudantamaśrūṇi ca pravartayamānaṃ gambhīraṃ ca niśvasantam /
analyzed: adrākṣīt rājā śuddhodanaḥ sitam mahā ṛṣim rudantam aśrūṇi ca pravartayamānam gambhīram ca niśvasantam
translated: King Śuddhodana saw the great sage Asita weeping, shedding tears, and sighing deeply.

original: dṛṣṭvā ca saṃharṣitaromakūpajātastvaritatvaritaṃ dīnamanā asitaṃ maharṣimetadavocat kimidamṛṣe rodasi aśrūṇi ca pravartayasi gambhīraṃ ca
analyzed: dṛṣṭvā ca saṃharṣita romakūpa jātaḥ tvarita tvaritam dīna manāḥ asitam mahā ṛṣim etat avocat kim idam ṛṣe rodasi aśrūṇi ca pravartayasi gambhīram ca
translated: Having seen this, with his body hair standing on end, with a distressed mind, he quickly said to the great sage Asita, “Sage, why are you weeping and shedding tears, and sighing deeply?

analyzed: mā khalu kumārasya kācid vipratipattiḥ
translated: Is there any misfortune for the prince?”

original: evamukte 'sito maharṣī rājānaṃ śuddhodanamevamāha nāhaṃ mahārāja kumārasyārthena rodimi /
analyzed: evam ukte sitaḥ mahā ṛṣiḥ rājānam śuddhodanam evam āha  na aham mahā rāja kumārasya arthena rodimi
translated: When this was said, the great sage Asita said to King Śuddhodana, “Great King, I am not weeping for the sake of the prince.

analyzed: na api asya kācid vipratipattiḥ
translated: Nor is there any misfortune for him.

analyzed: kim tu ātmānam aham rodimi
translated: But I am weeping for myself.

analyzed: tat kasmāt hetoḥ
translated: What is the reason for that?

original: ahaṃ ca mahārāja jīrṇo vṛddho mahallakaḥ /
analyzed: aham ca mahā rāja jīrṇaḥ vṛddhaḥ mahallakaḥ
translated: Great King, I am old, aged, and decrepit.

analyzed: ayam ca sarvārthasiddhaḥ kumāraḥ vaśyam anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbhotsyati
translated: And this Prince Sarvārthasiddha will certainly attain unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.

original: abhisaṃbudhya cānuttaraṃ dharmacakraṃ pravartayiṣyati apravartitaṃ śramaṇena vā brāhmaṇena vā devena vā māreṇa vā anyena vā punaḥ kenacilloke
analyzed: abhisaṃbudhya ca anuttaram dharmacakram pravartayiṣyati a pravartitam śramaṇena vā brāhmaṇena vā devena vā māreṇa vā anyena vā punar kenacid loke  /
translated: And having attained enlightenment, he will turn the unsurpassed Dharma wheel that has not been turned by ascetics, brahmins, gods, Māra, Brahmā, or anyone else in the world.

analyzed: sahadharmeṇa
translated: Together with the Dharma.

original: sadevakasya lokasya hitāya sukhāya dharmaṃ deśayiṣyati ādau kalyāṇaṃ madhye kalyāṇaṃ paryavasāne kalyāṇam /
analyzed: sa devakasya lokasya hitāya sukhāya dharmam deśayiṣyati ādau kalyāṇam madhye kalyāṇam paryavasāne kalyāṇam
translated: He will teach the Dharma for the benefit and happiness of the world, including the gods, which is good in the beginning, good in the middle, and good in the end.

original: svarthaṃ suvyañjanaṃ kevalaṃ paripūrṇaṃ pariśuddhaṃ paryavadātaṃ brahmacaryaṃ sattvānāṃ saṃprakāśayiṣyati /
analyzed: su artham su vyañjanam kevalam paripūrṇam pariśuddham paryavadātam brahmacaryam sattvānām saṃprakāśayiṣyati
translated: He will reveal the holy life that is good in meaning, good in words, complete, pure, and refined, to beings.

original: asmāttaṃ dharmaṃ śratvā jātidharmāṇaḥ sattvā jātyā parimokṣante /
analyzed: asmāt tam dharmam śratvā jāti dharmāṇaḥ sattvāḥ jātyā parimokṣante
translated: Having heard that Dharma from him, beings subject to birth will be liberated from birth.

analyzed: evam jarā vyādhi maraṇa śoka parideva duḥkha daurmanasya upāyāsebhyaḥ parimokṣante
translated: Similarly, they will be liberated from old age, sickness, death, sorrow, lamentation, pain, grief, and despair.

analyzed: rāga dveṣa moha agni saṃtaptānām sattvānām saddharma jala varṣeṇa prahlādanam kariṣyati
translated: He will cool those beings tormented by the fires of passion, hatred, and delusion with the rain of the true Dharma.

analyzed: nānā kudṛṣṭi grahaṇa praskandhānām sattvānām kupatha prayātānām ṛju mārgeṇa nirvāṇa patham upaneṣyati
translated: He will lead to nirvana by the straight path those beings who are attached to various wrong views and who have entered wrong paths.

analyzed: saṃsāra pañjara cāraka avaruddhānām kleśa bandhana baddhānām bandhana nirmokṣam kariṣyati
translated: He will liberate from bondage those beings who are imprisoned in the cage of saṃsāra, bound by the fetters of afflictions.

analyzed: ajñāna tamaḥ timira paṭala paryavanaddha nayanānām sattvānām prajñā cakṣuḥ utpādayiṣyati
translated: He will open the eye of wisdom for beings whose eyes are covered by the darkness, cataracts, and veils of ignorance.

analyzed: kleśa śalya viddhānām sattvānām śalya uddharaṇam kariṣyati
translated: He will extract the splinters for beings who are wounded by the splinters of afflictions.

analyzed: tat yathā mahā rāja audumbara puṣpam kadācid karhicit loke utpadyate
translated: Just as, Your Majesty, the udumbara flower appears in the world only once in a long while,

original: evameva mahārāja kadācitkarhicidbahubhiḥ kalpakoṭinayutairbuddhā bhagavanto loke utpadyante /
analyzed: evam eva mahā rāja kadācid karhicit bahubhiḥ kalpa koṭi nayutaiḥ buddhāḥ bhagavantaḥ loke utpadyante
translated: in the same way, Your Majesty, the Blessed Buddhas appear in the world only once in many quintillions of eons.

analyzed: saḥ yam kumāraḥ vaśyam anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbhotsyate
translated: This prince will certainly attain supreme perfect enlightenment.

analyzed: abhisaṃbudhya ca sattva koṭī niyuta śata sahasrāṇi saṃsāra sāgarāt pāram uttārayiṣyati
translated: And having attained enlightenment, he will lead many hundreds of thousands of millions of billions of beings across the ocean of saṃsāra to the other shore.

analyzed: amṛte ca pratiṣṭhāpayiṣyati
translated: And he will establish them in immortality.

original: vayaṃ ca taṃ buddharatnaṃ na drakṣyāmaḥ /
analyzed: vayam ca tam buddha ratnam na drakṣyāmaḥ
translated: But we will not see that jewel of a Buddha.

original: ityeva tadahaṃ mahārāja rodimi paridīnamanā dīrghaṃ ca niśvasāmi yadahamimaṃ nārogye 'pi rādhayiṣyāmi //
analyzed: iti eva tat aham mahā rāja rodimi paridīna manāḥ dīrgham ca niśvasāmi yat aham imam na ārogye rādhayiṣyāmi
translated: Thus, Your Majesty, I weep and sigh deeply, with a troubled mind, that I will not be able to please him even in his illness.

original: yathā hyasmākaṃ mahārāja mantravedaśāstreṣvāgacchati nārhati sarvārthasiddhaḥ kumāro 'gāramadhyāvasitum /
analyzed: yathā hi asmākam mahā rāja mantra veda śāstreṣu āgacchati na arhati sarvārthasiddhaḥ kumāraḥ gāram adhyāvasitum
translated: For it is said in our scriptures, Your Majesty, that Prince Sarvārthasiddha should not remain in the household.

analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: What is the reason for that?

original: tathā hi mahārāja sarvārthasiddhaḥ kumāro dvātriṃśatā mahāpuruṣalakṣaṇaiḥ samānvāgataḥ /
analyzed: tathā hi mahā rāja sarvārthasiddhaḥ kumāraḥ dvātriṃśatā mahāpuruṣa lakṣaṇaiḥ samānvāgataḥ
translated: Because, Your Majesty, Prince Sarvārthasiddha is endowed with the thirty-two marks of a great being.

analyzed: katamaiḥ dvātriṃśatā tat yathā
translated: What are the thirty-two? They are:

analyzed: uṣṇīṣa śīrṣaḥ mahā rāja sarvārthasiddhaḥ kumāraḥ
translated: Your Majesty, Prince Sarvārthasiddha has a head with a crown protrusion.

original: anena mahārāja prathamena mahāpuruṣalakṣaṇena samanvāgataḥ sarvārthasiddhaḥ kumāraḥ /
analyzed: anena mahā rāja prathamena mahāpuruṣa lakṣaṇena samanvāgataḥ sarvārthasiddhaḥ kumāraḥ
translated: Your Majesty, Prince Sarvārthasiddha is endowed with this first mark of a great being.

analyzed: bhinnāñjana mayūra kalāpa abhinīla vallita pradakṣiṇa āvarta keśaḥ

original: jaya deva nityamanupālaya dīrghamāyuḥ dvāre sthitā vipulapuṇyaviśuddhabhāsaḥ /
analyzed: jaya deva nityam anupālaya dīrgham āyuḥ dvāre sthitāḥ vipula puṇya viśuddha bhāsaḥ
translated: Be victorious, O God, always protect the long life, standing at the door, with vast merit, pure radiance,

analyzed: maṇi ratna cūḍa su vibhūṣitaḥ iryavantaḥ paripūrṇa candra vadanā śaśi nirmala ābhāḥ
translated: Adorned with the crest jewel of gems, with dignified bearing, with a face like the full moon, with the radiance of the moon,

original: chāyāṃ na teṣa nṛpate kvacidapyapaśyan śabdaṃ na caiva caraṇotkṣipaṇe śṛṇomi /
analyzed: chāyām na nṛpate kvacid api a paśyan śabdam na ca eva caraṇa utkṣipaṇe śṛṇomi
translated: I do not see their shadow anywhere, and I do not hear the sound of their feet being lifted up.

original: na ca medinīṃ vicarato rajamutkṣipanti tṛptiṃ na yānti ca janāḥ samudīkṣatāṃ vai // / //
analyzed: na ca medinīm vicarataḥ rajam utkṣipanti tṛptim na yānti ca janāḥ samudīkṣatām vai
translated: Even when walking, they do not stir up dust. People who look at them are never satisfied.

original: kāyaprabhā suvipulā ca vibhāti teṣāṃ vācā manojña yatha nāsti ha mānuṣāṇām /
analyzed: kāya prabhā su vipulā ca vibhāti teṣām vācā manojña na asti ha mānuṣāṇām
translated: Their bodily radiance shines brightly, their speech is pleasing, unlike that of humans.

original: gambhiraślakṣṇasuśilā ca suākarā ca śaṅkā hi me suragaṇā na hi te manuṣyāḥ // / //
analyzed: gambhira ślakṣṇa su śilā ca su ākarā ca śaṅkā hi me sura gaṇāḥ na hi te manuṣyāḥ
translated: Their voices are deep, smooth, clear, and well-sounding. I suspect they are not humans, but gods.

analyzed: pāṇī gauraveṇa
translated: Holding in their hands excellent flowers, garlands, ointments, and silken cloths, they look on with reverence.

original: niḥsaṃśayaṃ nṛpati draṣṭu kumāramete devādhideva marutāgata pūjanārtham // / //
analyzed: niḥsaṃśayam nṛpati draṣṭu kumāram ete deva adhideva maruta āgata pūjana artham
translated: There is no doubt, O king, that they have come to see the prince. They are the gods, the lords of the gods, who have come to worship.

analyzed: vaidya
translated: Vaidya

original: rājā niśāmya vacanaṃ paramaṃ udagro gacchā bhaṇāhi praviśantu gṛhaṃ bhavantaḥ /
analyzed: rājā niśāmya vacanam paramam udagraḥ gaccha ā bhaṇāhi praviśantu gṛham bhavantaḥ
translated: The king, hearing these supreme words, was overjoyed and said, Go and tell them to enter the house.

original: na hi mānuṣāṇa iyamīdṛśa ṛddhi kāci yatha bhāṣase ca guṇa teṣa yathā ca iryā // / //🔽dauvārikaḥ kṛtapuṭo marutaivamāha praviśī bhavanta anujñātu narādhipena /
analyzed: na hi iyam īdṛśe yathā ca iryā  dauvārikaḥ kṛta puṭaḥ marutā evam āha bhavanta narādhipena
translated: For humans there is no such power as you describe, nor such qualities and conduct as you speak of.🔽The doorkeeper, folding his hands, said this: You are permitted to enter by the king.

original: te hṛṣṭatuṣṭamanaso varamālyahastā gehaṃ praviṣṭa nṛpateramarālayaṃ vā // / //
analyzed: te hṛṣṭa tuṣṭa manasaḥ vara mālya hastāḥ geham praviṣṭa nṛpateḥ amara ālayam vā
translated: They, with joyful and contented minds, with garlands of the best flowers in their hands, entered the king's house, like the abode of the immortals.

original: dṛṣṭvā ca tāṃ suravarāṃ praviśanta gehaṃ pratyutthito nṛpatirañjali saṃpragṛhya /
analyzed: dṛṣṭvā ca tām sura varām praviśanta geham pratyutthitaḥ nṛpatiḥ añjali saṃpragṛhya
translated: Seeing those excellent gods entering the house, the king rose to meet them, with folded hands.

original: saṃvidyayanta ima āsana ratnapādā atrā niṣīdata bhavannanukampya buddhyā // / //
analyzed: ime āsana ratna pādāḥ atrā niṣīdata bhavan anukampya buddhyā
translated: Here are seats with jeweled feet, sit down, sirs, out of compassion for me.

original: te mānadarpavigatā sthita āsaneṣu yasyārthi āgata ihā nṛpate śṛṇuṣva /
analyzed: te māna darpa vigatā sthitaḥ āsaneṣu yasya arthi āgataḥ iha ā nṛpate śṛṇuṣva
translated: They, free from pride and arrogance, sat on the seats. For whose sake have you come here, O king? Listen.

analyzed: putraḥ tava ati pṛthu puṇya viśuddha kāyaḥ jātaḥ su jāta caraṇam draṣṭu kāmāḥ
translated: Your son, whose body is purified by vast merit, has been born. We desire to see the one whose feet are well-formed.

original: asmo vidhijña varalakṣaṇalakṣaṇajñā yeṣāṃ tathā bhavati yā gati yaḥ prayogaḥ /
analyzed: yeṣām tathā bhavati yaḥ prayogaḥ
translated: We know the rules, we know the signs of the excellent marks, and the destiny and practice of those who have them.

original: tatsādhu pārthivavara prajahasva khedaṃ paśyāma lakṣaṇavicitravibhūṣitāṅgam // / //
analyzed: tat sādhu pārthiva vara prajahasva khedam paśyāma lakṣaṇa vicitra vibhūṣita aṅgam
translated: Therefore, O best of kings, give up your sorrow and look at the one whose body is adorned with various auspicious marks.

original: sa strīgaṇaiḥ parivṛto nṛpatiḥ prahṛṣṭo gṛhya kumāramasamaṃ jvalanārcivarṇam /
analyzed: sa strī gaṇaiḥ parivṛtaḥ nṛpatiḥ prahṛṣṭaḥ gṛhya kumāram asamam jvalana arci varṇam
translated: The delighted king, surrounded by the assembly of women, took the incomparable prince, whose complexion was like a blazing flame,

original: upanāmayan suravarāṃ suvilambacūḍāṃ dvārāttu niṣkramatu kampita trisahasrāḥ // / //
analyzed: upanāmayan suravarām su vilamba cūḍām dvārāt tu niṣkramatu kampita tri sahasrāḥ
translated: And brought him to the excellent gods, his hair hanging down. As he left the door, the three thousand worlds trembled.

original: dṛṣṭvaiva te suravarā krama nāyakasya tāmrā nakhāṃ vimalapatraviśuddhatejā /
analyzed: dṛṣṭvā eva te sura varā krama nāyakasya tāmrā nakhām vimala patra viśuddha tejā
translated: As soon as the excellent gods saw the leader's steps, their copper-colored nails, pure like a stainless leaf, and their radiant splendor,

original: te utthitā tvarita rūpavilambacūḍā mūrdhnābhivandiṣu kramāṃ vimalaprabhasya // / //
analyzed: te utthitā rūpa vilamba cūḍā mūrdhnā abhivandiṣu vimala prabhasya
translated: They rose up quickly, their hair hanging down, and bowed their heads to the steps of the one with pure light.

original: yatha lakṣaṇā yatha ca darśita lakṣitā ca yatha puṇyateji śiri mūrdha vilokitaṃ ca /
analyzed: yatha lakṣaṇā yatha ca darśita lakṣitā ca ca
translated: As the auspicious marks are shown and observed, and as the crown of the head of the one with meritorious splendor is seen,

analyzed: vaidya
translated: Vidy

original: yatha irya netra vimalāprabha ūrṇakośā niḥsaṃśayaṃ spṛśati bodhi vijitya māram // / //
analyzed: niḥsaṃśayam spṛśati bodhi vijitya māram
translated: As the eyes and the tuft of hair hanging down are like the pure light of the moon, there is no doubt that he will attain enlightenment by conquering Mara.

original: te taṃ stuvanti guṇabhūta yathārthadarśī dhyāyī guṇāṃ vigatakleśatamonudasya /
analyzed: te tam stuvanti guṇa bhūta yathā artha darśī dhyāyī guṇām vigata kleśa tamonudasya
translated: They praise him, seeing his qualities as they truly are, the meditator on the qualities of the one who has dispelled the darkness of afflictions,

analyzed: su cireṇa sattva ratanasya hi prādurbhāvaḥ
translated: After a long time, the Jewel of Beings, who removes the suffering of birth, old age, death, and afflictions, has appeared.

analyzed: sarva tri bhavam tribhiḥ agni taptam saṃkalpa rāga viṣaya araṇi ucchritena
translated: The three realms are ablaze with the three fires, fanned by the kindling of conceptualization, passion, and objects.

original: tvaṃ dharmamegha trisahasra spharitva dhīrā amṛtodakena praśameṣyasi kleśatāpam // / //
analyzed: tvam dharma megha tri sahasra dhīrāḥ amṛta udakena kleśa tāpam
translated: O Dharma Cloud, you have filled the trichiliocosm with your wisdom. With the nectar-like water, you will extinguish the suffering of afflictions.

original: tvaṃ maitravākya karuṇānvita ślakṣṇavākya brahmasvarāracitaghoṣa manojñavāṇi /
analyzed: tvam maitra vākya karuṇā anvita ślakṣṇa vākya brahma svara a racita ghoṣa manojña vāṇi
translated: You speak with loving words, full of compassion, with gentle speech, with a voice as melodious as Brahma's, with a delightful voice.

analyzed: tri sahasre ājña parivijñapanī jagasya kṣipram pramuñca bhagavat mahā buddha ghoṣam
translated: In the trichiliocosm, you are known as the one who commands. O Blessed One, quickly release the great Buddha's voice.

original: bhagnā kutīrthikagaṇā viparītadṛṣṭiḥ bhavarāgabandhananimagna sthitā bhavāgre /
analyzed: bhagnā kutīrthika gaṇā viparīta dṛṣṭiḥ sthitā bhava agre
translated: The hordes of non-Buddhist teachers, with their wrong views, are defeated. Those who are immersed in the bondage of passion for existence, who remain at the peak of existence,

analyzed: dharmā siṃhasya kroṣṭuka gaṇā eva palāyinā āste
translated: Having heard the Dharma, which arises dependently and is empty, like the cry of a jackal before a lion, they flee.

analyzed: bhittvā avidya paṭalam maha kleśa dhūmam paryutthitāḥ janataye niyata prakāśe

analyzed: jñāna arci prajña prabha vidyut vilokitena sarvam jage vidhamaye mahat andhakāram
translated: With the light of wisdom, the radiance of wisdom, and the vision of wisdom, may you dispel the great darkness for all beings.

original: lābhā sulabdha vipulā marumānuṣāṇāṃ yatrodbhavā 'dbhuta ihedṛśi śuddhasattve /
analyzed: vipulā maru mānuṣāṇām yatra udbhavāḥ dbhute iha īdṛśi śuddha sattve
translated: The gods and humans have gained great and excellent benefits, where such a wondrous pure being has appeared here.

original: pithitā apāyapatha sphīta marutpathāni bheṣyanti sattvaratanena vibodhakena // / //
analyzed: sphīta marut pathāni sattva ratanena vibodhakena
translated: The paths to the lower realms will be closed, and the paths to the god realms will flourish, through this jewel of a being, the Awakened One.

original: varṣitva divyakusumāṃ kapilāhvaye 'smin kṛtvā pradakṣiṇa stavitva ca gauraveṇa /
analyzed: varṣitvā divya kusumām kapila āhvaye smin kṛtvā pradakṣiṇaḥ stavitvā ca gauraveṇa
translated: Having rained down divine flowers in Kapilavastu, having circumambulated and praised with reverence,

analyzed: buddha subuddhaḥ iti vākyam udīrayantaḥ prakrānta te sura gaṇāḥ gagane sa līlāḥ
translated: uttering the words Buddha, well-awakened one, those joyful hosts of gods departed into the sky.

analyzed: iti
translated: Thus it is.

analyzed: tāḥ ca sarvāḥ mātā pitṛbhiḥ bodhisattvāya dattāḥ upasthāna paricaryāyai
translated: All of them were given to the Bodhisattva by their parents for the purpose of attending and serving him.

analyzed: viṃśati ca kanyā sahasrāṇi amātya pārṣadyaiḥ dattāni bodhisattvasya upasthāna paricaryāyai
translated: Twenty thousand girls were given to the Bodhisattva by the ministers and courtiers for the purpose of attending and serving him.

analyzed: tadā ca bhikṣavaḥ mahallaka mahallikāḥ śākyāḥ saṃnipatya rājānam śuddhodanam upasaṃkramya evam āhuḥ yat khalu deva jānīyāḥ devakulam kumāraḥ upanīyatām iti
translated: At that time, monks, the elderly Śākyas gathered and approached King Śuddhodana, saying, Your Majesty, please know that the prince should be brought to the temple.

analyzed: rājā āha sādhu
translated: The king said, Good.

analyzed: upanīyatām kumāraḥ
translated: Let the prince be brought.

analyzed: tena hi maṇḍyatām nagaram  upaśobhyantām vīthi catvara śṛṅgāṭaka antarāpaṇa rathyā mukhāni
translated: Then, let the city be adorned.🔽Let the streets, crossroads, intersections, markets, and entrances to the lanes be beautifully decorated.

analyzed: apanīyantām amaṅgalyāḥ kāṇa kubja badhira andha mūka visaṃsthita virūpa rūpāḥ a paripūrṇa indriyāḥ

analyzed: tāḍyantām maṅgalya ghaṇṭāḥ  samalaṃkriyantām puravara dvārāṇi
translated: Let auspicious bells be rung.🔽Let the gates of the excellent city be adorned.

analyzed: vādyantām su manojña tūrya tālāvacarāṇi

analyzed: saṃnipātyantām sarva koṭṭa rājānaḥ

analyzed: ekībhavantu śreṣṭhi gṛhapati amātya dauvārika pāriṣadyāḥ
translated: Let the guild masters, householders, ministers, gatekeepers, and courtiers unite.

analyzed: yujyantām kanyā rathāḥ
translated: Let the girls' chariots be prepared.

analyzed: upanāmyantām pūrṇa kumbhāḥ
translated: Let full water pots be presented.

analyzed: saṃnipātyantām adhīyānāḥ brāhmaṇāḥ
translated: Let the reciting brahmins assemble.

analyzed: alaṃkriyantām devakulāni
translated: Let the temples be adorned.

original: iti hi bhikṣavo yathoktapūrvaṃ sarvaṃ kṛtamabhūt //🔽tato rājā śuddhodanaḥ svagṛhaṃ praviśya mahāprajāpatīṃ gautamīmāmantryaivamāha alaṃkriyantāṃ kumāraḥ devakulamupaneṣyata iti /
analyzed: iti hi bhikṣavaḥ yathā ukta pūrvam sarvam kṛtam abhūt  tatas rājā śuddhodanaḥ sva gṛham praviśya mahāprajāpatīm gautamīm āmantrya evam āha alaṃkriyantām kumāraḥ devakulam upaneṣyate iti
translated: Thus, monks, everything was done as previously stated.🔽Then, King Śuddhodana, having entered his own house, addressed Mahāprajāpatī Gautamī, saying, Adorn the prince, we will take him to the temple.

original: sādhviti pratiśrutya mahāprajāpatī gautamī kumāraṃ maṇḍayati sma //
analyzed: sādhu iti pratiśrutya mahāprajāpatī gautamī kumāram maṇḍayati sma
translated: Very well, she agreed, and Mahāprajāpatī Gautamī adorned the prince.

original: tataḥ kumāro maṇḍyamānaḥ prahasitavadano vyapagatabhṛkuṭikaḥ paramamadhurayā vācā mātṛsvasāramevamāha amba kutrāhamupaneṣyata iti /

translated: Then, as the prince was being adorned, with a smiling face, free from frowns, he spoke to his maternal aunt with supremely sweet words, Mother, where will they take me for my initiation?

analyzed: āha devakulam putra iti
translated: She said, To the temple, my son.

original: tataḥ kumāraḥ smitamupadarśayan prahasitavadano mātṛsvasāraṃ gāthābhiradhyabhāṣata
analyzed: tatas kumāraḥ smitam upadarśayan prahasita vadanaḥ mātṛ svasāram gāthābhiḥ adhyabhāṣata
translated: Then the prince, displaying a smile, with a laughing face, spoke to his maternal aunt in verses:

analyzed: jātasya mahyam iha kampita tri sahasram śakraḥ ca brahma asurāḥ ca mahā uragāḥ ca
translated: When I was born, this trichiliocosm trembled, and Shakra, Brahma, the asuras, and the great serpents,

analyzed: candraḥ ca vaiśravaṇaḥ kumāraḥ mūrdhnā krameṣu nipatitvā namasyayanti
translated: The moon, the sun, and also the youthful Vaishravana, having fallen at my feet, bowed down to me.

original: katamo 'nyu deva mama uttari yo viśiṣṭo yasmin mama praṇayase tvamihādya amba /
analyzed: katamaḥ deva mama uttari yaḥ viśiṣṭaḥ yasmin mama praṇayase tvam iha adya amba
translated: What other god is superior to me, O mother, whom you are dedicating me to today?

original: devātideva ahu uttamu sarvadevaiḥ devo na me 'sti sadṛśaḥ kuta uttaraṃ vā // / //
analyzed: sarva devaiḥ devaḥ na me sti sadṛśaḥ kutas uttaram vā
translated: I am the god of gods, the supreme one among all gods. There is no god equal to me, let alone superior.

original: lokānuvartana pratī iti amba yāsye dṛṣtvā vikurvita mamā janatā udagrāḥ /
analyzed: loka anuvartana pratī iti amba yāsye dṛṣtvā janatā udagrāḥ
translated: Mother, I will go to him, following worldly ways, so that the people, seeing my transformation, will be overjoyed.

analyzed: vaidya
translated: Vidy

translated: The devas, nāgas, yakṣas, gandharvas, asuras, garuḍas, kinnaras, and mahoragas, their bodies half visible, were hanging garlands of flowers and cloth from the sky.

analyzed: samanantara praveśitaḥ ca bodhisattvaḥ lipi śālām
translated: As soon as the Bodhisattva entered the writing school,
