analyzed: puri guṇa dhara mṛgapati puruṣaḥ
translated: In the past, when you were a deer with good qualities, a man fell into a mountain river with many rapids.

original: hita bhava tvayi naru sthalapathi sthapito upanayi tava ari na ca manu kṣubhito // / //
analyzed: hita bhava tvayi naru sthalapathi sthapitaḥ upanayi tava ari na ca manu kṣubhitaḥ
translated: You saved him and placed him on the dry land. You brought him to your enemy, but you were not agitated.

original: puri tuma naravara tyaji sutu yadabhū maṇi tava prapatitu jaladhari vipule /
analyzed: puri nara vara tyaji maṇi tava prapatitu jaladhari vipule
translated: In the past, O best of men, when you were a king, you gave up your son, who fell into the great ocean.

original: cyavayitu kṣapayitu tvaya mahaudadhiṃ labhi tada dhanamaṇi dṛḍhabala vaṣabhī // / //
analyzed: mahā odadhim mahā odadhim
translated: You dried up the great ocean to get back your son and the precious jewel. You obtained the wealth and the jewel, O one with firm strength and great power.

original: puri tuma supuruṣa ṛṣivaru yadabhū dvija tava upagatu bhava mama śaraṇam /
analyzed: puri dvija tava upagatu bhava mama śaraṇam
translated: In the past, O good man, when you were a great sage, a twice-born one approached you and said, Be my refuge.

original: bhaṇi ṛṣi dvijavara mama ripuupane tyaji tvaya svaki tanu na ca dvija tyajase // / //
analyzed: ṛṣi dvijavara mama tyaji svaki tanu na ca dvija tyajase
translated: The sage said, O best of twice-born ones, my enemy has come. I give up my own body, but I do not give up the twice-born one.

original: syamu ṛṣi upagatu puri drumanilaye ruci bhaṇi taruruha kati ima gaṇaye /
analyzed: ṛṣi upagatu puri druma nilaye ruci bhaṇi taruruha kati ima gaṇaye
translated: In the past, when a sage approached a tree dwelling, he said with joy, How many trees are there to count?

original: suvidita sugaṇita yatha tahi kiśalā tatha tava avitatha samagira racitā // / //
analyzed: su vidita su gaṇita kiśalā tatha tava avitatha samagira racitā
translated: Well-known, well-calculated, just as it is, O Kiśala, so is your true and consistent speech composed.

original: sukula suguṇadhara puri drumi vasato kṣayagatu na ca tyaji kṛtu smari purimam /
analyzed: su kula su guṇa dhara puri drumi na ca tyaji kṛtu smari
translated: In the past, while dwelling in a tree, O one of good family and good qualities, though subject to decay, you did not abandon it, remembering your former deeds.

original: marupati pramuditu tava guṇa smarato śriyakari drumavari yathariva purimā // / //
analyzed: marupati tava guṇa smarato
translated: The lord of death, remembering your qualities, was delighted, and made you a glorious tree, just as in the past.

original: iti tava asadṛśa vratatapacaraṇā bahuguṇa guṇadhara guṇapathi carato /
analyzed: iti tava asadṛśa vrata tapa caraṇā bahuguṇa guṇa dhara guṇa pathi carataḥ
translated: Thus, O one of incomparable vows, austerities, and conduct, O bearer of many qualities, walking on the path of qualities,

original: tyaji mahi sanagari ayu tava samayo laghu jagu sthapayahi jinaguṇacaraṇe // / //
analyzed: tava samayaḥ laghu tava samayaḥ laghu sthapayahi jina guṇa caraṇe
translated: You abandoned the earth with its cities - this is the time for you. Quickly establish the world in the qualities and conduct of the Victorious Ones.

original: yada pramadaratanā śubhavastrā bhūṣitagātrā varapravaru turiyā sumanojñā saṃprabhaṇīṣu /
analyzed: śubha vastrā bhūṣita gātrā su manojñā
translated: When the jewel of women, adorned with beautiful garments and ornaments, and the most excellent and delightful musical instruments, were playing,

original: atha daśasū diśato jinatejairgātha vicitrā iti raviṣū madhurā rutaghoṣā tūryasvarebhyaḥ // / //
analyzed: atha vicitrā iti raviṣū madhurā ruta ghoṣā tūrya svarebhyaḥ
translated: Then from the sounds of the musical instruments, the verses of the ten directions, with their various meanings, were heard in a sweet and pleasant voice.

analyzed: vaidya  tava praṇidhī pur ime bahu kalpām loka pradīpā
translated: Vaishampayana🔽In the past, for many eons, you made aspirations to be a lamp for the world,

analyzed: jara maraṇa grasite ahu loke trāṇu bhaviṣye
translated: In a world devoured by old age and death, you would be a protector.

original: smara purimapraṇidhiṃ narasiṃhā yā ti abhūṣī
analyzed: smara purima praṇidhim nara siṃhā yā ti
translated: Remember your former aspirations, O Lion among Men, which you made

analyzed: dvipadā indrāḥ niṣkramaṇāya
translated: This is the time for you, O Lord of Men, to go forth.

analyzed: bhavana yute tvam iha ā bahu dānam dattam anekam
translated: In this world, you have given many kinds of offerings, countless

analyzed: dhana kanakā ratanā śubha vastrā ratna vicitrā
translated: Wealth, gold, jewels, fine clothes, and bejeweled ornaments.

analyzed: kara caraṇā nayanā priya putrā rājya samṛddham
translated: Your hands, feet, eyes, beloved sons, and prosperous kingdom

original: tvayi tyajitaṃ na ca te khiladoṣā yācanakeṣu // / //
analyzed: tvayi tyajitam na ca te khila doṣāḥ yācanakeṣu
translated: You have given up, and you have never been angry or spiteful towards beggars.

original: śiśunṛpati tvamihā śaśiketo āsi sudaṃṣṭro kṛpa karuṇāmanaso maṇicūḍo candrapradīpaḥ /
analyzed: śiśu nṛpati tvam iha ā śaśiketo āsi su daṃṣṭraḥ kṛpa karuṇā manasaḥ maṇi cūḍaḥ candra pradīpaḥ
translated: Here in this world, you were a young king, a moon-like beacon, with beautiful teeth, compassionate, with a crown jewel like the moon.

original: iti pramukhā kariyā dṛḍhaśūro rājasunetro bahu nṛpati nayutā rata dāne tvaṃ savikurvan // / //
analyzed: iti dṛḍha śūraḥ rāja sunetraḥ bahu nṛpati nayutā rata dāne tvam
translated: Thus, you have performed these and other deeds, O Firm Hero, O Beautiful Eyes of the King, you have given in charity for many millions of years, O One of Good Deeds.

original: tava sugatā carito bahukalpāṃ śīlacarīye maṇiratnā vimalā sadṛśābhūcchīlaviśuddhiḥ /
analyzed: tava sugatā caritaḥ bahu kalpām śīlacarīye maṇi ratnā vimalā sadṛśā abhūt śīla viśuddhiḥ
translated: O Sugata, for many eons you have practiced discipline, and your discipline has been as pure as a flawless jewel.

original: tvayi caratā camarī yatha bālaṃ rakṣitu śīlaṃ kṛtu tvamihā jagati vipulārthaṃ śīlaratenā // / //
analyzed: tvayi caratā bālam rakṣitu śīlam tvam iha ā jagati vipula artham
translated: While practicing, you protected your discipline like a she-camel protects her young. You have accomplished vast benefit for the world through your love of discipline.

original: gajavaru tvamihā ripulubdhe viddhu iṣūṇā kṛpa karuṇā janiyā atiraudre chāditu śobhe /
analyzed: ripu lubdhe viddhu iṣūṇām kṛpa karuṇā ati raudre śobhe
translated: You, O excellent elephant, were pierced by an arrow in the midst of your enemies, but out of compassion and great cruelty, you covered them with your beautiful body.

original: parityaji te rucirā śubhadantā na ca tyaji śīlaṃ iti pramukhā kariyā bahu tubhyaṃ śīlavikurvī // / //
analyzed: parityaji te rucirā śubha dantā na ca tyaji śīlam iti pramukhā kariyā bahu tubhyam śīla vikurvī
translated: You abandoned your beautiful and auspicious tusks, but did not abandon your morality. Thus, you performed many such principal acts of moral transformation.

original: tvayi sahitā jagato 'hita anekā duḥkhasahasrā bahukaṭukāvacanaṃ vadhabandhā kṣāntiratenā /
analyzed: tvayi sahitāḥ jagataḥ hita anekāḥ duḥkha sahasrāḥ bahu kaṭukā vacanam vadha bandhā
translated: You, who delight in patience, endured many thousands of sufferings and harsh words, as well as beatings and bondage, from those who harm the world.

original: paricārita purime nara ye te sarvasukhenā puna vadhakāstava teha abhūvan tacca ti kṣāntam // / //
analyzed: paricārita ye te sarva sukhena puna vadhakāḥ tava abhūvan tat ca ti kṣāntam
translated: In the past, you served those who were hostile to you with all forms of happiness, and later they became your executioners, but you forgave them.

analyzed: giri pravara anilaye nāthāḥ ṛkṣu
translated: O Lord, when you were a bear dwelling in an excellent mountain cave,

original: himakiraṇā salilā bhayabhītaṃ tvaṃ naru gṛhya /
analyzed: hima kiraṇā salilā bhaya bhītam tvam naru gṛhya
translated: you rescued a frightened man from the snow and water.

analyzed: paricarasi vividhā phala mūlaiḥ sarva sukhena
translated: You served him with various fruits and roots and all forms of happiness.

original: laghu vadhakāṃ sa tavā upanetrī taṃ ca ti kṣāntam // / //
analyzed: tam ca ti
translated: He quickly brought your executioners to you, but you forgave them.

analyzed: vaidya
translated: O physician!

analyzed: dṛḍhu saṃsthitam acalam akampyam tava āsīt
translated: Your patience was firm, unwavering, and unshakable.

analyzed: vrata tapasā vividhāḥ guṇa jñānam bodhim
translated: Seeking enlightenment through various austerities and virtues, you attained knowledge.

analyzed: abalaḥ namucī vaśavartī
translated: Through the power of your patience, you brought the powerless Namuci under your control.

analyzed: nara siṃhāḥ niṣkramaṇāya
translated: The time has come for you, Lion among Men, to leave here.

analyzed: haya pravarū tvam iha ā puri āsīḥ hema suvarṇo
translated: In the past, you were a supreme horse named Golden Suvarṇa,

analyzed: laghu gagane kṛpa jātaḥ rākṣasidvīpam
translated: Swiftly soaring in the sky, out of compassion you went to Rākṣasa Island.

original: vyasanagata manujāṃ tada gṛhyā kṣemi thapesī
analyzed: vyasana gata manujām gṛhyā
translated: You rescued people who were in distress and brought them to safety.

original: iti pramukhā kariyā bahu tubhyaṃ vīryavikurvā // / //
analyzed: iti pramukhā kariyā bahu tubhyam vīrya vikurvā
translated: You performed many such principal acts of heroism.

analyzed: dama śamatheḥ niyama āhata kleśāḥ dhyāyinaḥ agrā
translated: You are the foremost meditator, your afflictions conquered through self-control and tranquility.

original: laghu capalaṃ viṣayai ratilolaṃ cittu damitvā /
analyzed: laghu capalam viṣayaiḥ rati lolam cittu damitvā
translated: Having swiftly subdued the fickle and restless mind that delights in objects,

analyzed: tvam iha ā jagataḥ rthe dhyāna ratenā
translated: You have accomplished your own qualities here for the sake of the world, delighting in meditation.

analyzed: vara sattvā
translated: The time has come for you, Supreme Being, to display your meditation prowess here.

original: tvaṃ purime ṛṣi susthitu āsī dhyānaratīye nṛparahitā manujā tvamu gṛhyā rājyabhiṣiñcī /
analyzed: tvam purime ṛṣi gṛhyāḥ
translated: In the past, you were a sage named Susthita, delighting in meditation. When people were abandoned by the king, you took them and consecrated them in a kingdom.

original: daśakuśalī janitā thapitā te brahmapatheṣu cyuta manujā vrajiṣū tada sarve brahmaniketam // / //
analyzed: te brahma patheṣu cyuta manujāḥ sarve brahma niketam
translated: You caused them to be born and established them in the ten wholesome paths. When they passed away, all of them went to the abode of Brahmā.

original: diśividiśi vividhāgatijñāne tvaṃ suvidhijño paracaritā jagati rutajñāne indriyajñāne /
analyzed: diśi vidiśi vividha āgati jñāne tvam para caritā jagati ruta jñāne indriya jñāne
translated: In all directions, you are skilled in various ways of knowing, skilled in the conduct of others, skilled in the sounds of the world, skilled in the faculties,

original: nayavinaye vividhāmatidhāre pāragatastvaṃ ayu samayo tvamihā nṛpasūno niṣkramaṇāya // / //
analyzed: naya vinaye vividha amati dhāre pāra gataḥ tvam nṛpa sūno niṣkramaṇāya
translated: You have perfected the various high insights into the ways of discipline, this is the time for you, prince, to go forth here.

original: tvayi purimā janatā ima dṛṣṭvā dṛṣṭivipannā jaramaraṇā vividhā bahuduḥkhe kṛchragatā hi /
analyzed: tvayi purimāḥ janatāḥ dṛṣṭvā dṛṣṭi vipannāḥ jara maraṇāḥ vividhāḥ bahu duḥkhe kṛchra gatāḥ hi
translated: Having seen this world with its people fallen into wrong views, into old age, death, and various great sufferings,

original: bhavavibhavaṃkaraṇo ṛjumārge svāmanubaddhā hatatamasa tvamihā kṛtu loke arthu mahanto // / //
analyzed: ṛju mārge tvam iha kṛtu loke
translated: you have set out on the straight path to end the cycle of existence, you have conquered darkness and accomplished great benefit for the world.

original: iti vividhā rucirā guṇayuktā gātha vicitrā
analyzed: iti vividhā rucirā guṇa yuktā vicitrā
translated: Thus, various delightful and beautiful verses,

original: tatu raviṣu turiyebhī jinatejā codayi vīram /
analyzed: raviṣu jina tejā codayi vīram
translated: the splendor of the Victorious Ones, urged the hero with musical instruments.

analyzed: duḥkha bharita janate iha dṛṣṭvā mā tvam upekṣā
translated: Having seen the people here filled with suffering, do not be indifferent,

analyzed: tvam iha ā varabuddhe niṣkramaṇāya
translated: this is the time for you, O best of Buddhas, to go forth.

analyzed: vaidya
translated: Vidy

analyzed: vicitra vastra ratna hāra gandha mālya bhūṣitā prasanna citta prema jāta praharṣitā
translated: Adorned with various garments, jewels, necklaces, perfumes, and garlands, the women, with joyful minds and love born, were delighted.

original: prabodhayanti ye 'grasattva tūryasaṃpravāditaiḥ jinānubhāvi ekarūpa gātha tūrya niścarī // / //
analyzed: prabodhayanti ye gra sattva tūrya saṃpravāditaiḥ jina anubhāvi ekarūpa gātha tūrya niścarī
translated: They awakened the supreme being with the sounds of musical instruments, and by the power of the Victorious Ones, a verse emerged from the instruments:

original: yasyārthi tubhya kalpa naika tyaktu tyāga dustyajā
analyzed: yasya arthi tubhya kalpa na eka tyaktu tyāga dustyajā
translated: For whose sake you have given up many difficult-to-give-up gifts for many eons,

original: sucīrṇa śīlu kṣānti vīrya dhyāna prajña bhāvitā /
analyzed: sucīrṇa śīlu kṣānti vīrya dhyāna prajña bhāvitā
translated: Well-practiced morality, patience, diligence, concentration, and wisdom developed,

original: jagaddhitārtha so ti kālu sāṃprataṃ upasthito
analyzed: jagat hita artha saḥ ti kālu sāṃpratam upasthitaḥ
translated: For the benefit of the world, now the time has come for you.

analyzed: naiṣkramya buddhi cintaya āśu mā vilamba nāyaka
translated: Do not delay, O Leader, quickly think of going forth.

original: tyuktu pūrvi ratnakośa svarṇarūpyabhūṣaṇā yaṣṭā ti yajña naikarūpa tāsu tāsu jātiṣu /
analyzed: ratna kośa svarṇa rūpya bhūṣaṇāḥ tāsu tāsu jātiṣu
translated: In the past, you offered Ratnakosha, gold, silver ornaments, and performed many sacrifices in those various births.

original: tyakta bhārya putra dhīta kāyu rājyu jīvitaṃ bodhiheturaprameya tyaktuḥdustyajā tvayā // / //
analyzed: bodhi hetuḥ aprameya tvayā
translated: You abandoned wife, children, kingdom, and life for the sake of enlightenment, and gave away immeasurable things difficult to abandon.

analyzed: tvam adīna puṇya rāja viśruta śriyaḥ
translated: You were King Adinpunya, renowned for your glory,

analyzed: nimiṃdharaḥ nimiḥ ca kṛṣṇa bandhu
translated: Nimindhara, Nimi, Krishnabandhu,

analyzed: brahmadatta kesarī
translated: Brahmadatta, Kesari,

analyzed: sahasra yajña dharma cinti arcimān dṛḍha dhanu
translated: Sahasrayajna, Dharmacinta, Arciman, Dridhadhanu,

analyzed: dīna sattva tyakta dustyajā
translated: Suchintitartha, Dinapati, and gave away what is difficult to abandon.

analyzed: suta soma dīpta vīrya puṇya raśmi yaḥ saḥ bhū
translated: You were Sutasoma, Diptavirya, Punyarashmi,

original: mahatyāgavantu sthāmavantu yaḥ kṛtajña tvaṃ abhūḥ /🔽rājarṣi candrarūpavantu śūra satyavardhano
analyzed: mahatyāgavantu sthāmavantu yaḥ kṛtajña tvam abhūḥ  rājarṣi candra rūpavantu śūra satya vardhanaḥ
translated: You had great generosity and strength, and were grateful,🔽You were a royal sage with the beauty of the moon, a hero, increasing truth,

original: subhāṣitaṃgaveṣi rāji asi sumatiṃ ca sūrato // / //
analyzed: rāji asi sumatim ca sūrataḥ
translated: Seeking well-spoken words, you were a king, and also a wise and virtuous one.🔽

original: candraprabho viśeṣagāmi reṇubhū diśāṃpati pradānaśūra kāśirāju ratnacūḍa śāntagaḥ /
translated: Chandra, Prabha, Vishesha, Gama, Renubhu, Disha, Pati, Pradana, Shura, Kashi Raja, Ratna, Chuda, Shanti, and Gau.

original: eti cānyi pārthivendra yebhi tyakta dustyajā yathā ti vṛṣṭa tyāgavṛṣṭi eṣa dharma varṣahī // / //
analyzed: eti ca anyi pārthiva indra tyakta dustyajā yathā ti vṛṣṭa tyāga vṛṣṭi eṣa dharma varṣa hī
translated: And other such kings who have given up what is difficult to give up, may they rain down the rain of generosity, this Dharma rain.

original: dṛṣṭā ti pūrviṃ sattvasāra gaṅgavālukopamā kṛtā ti teṣa buddhapūja aprameyacintiyā /
analyzed: dṛṣṭā ti sattva sāra gaṅga vālukā upamā kṛtā ti teṣa buddha pūja aprameya cintiyā
translated: The essence of beings, seen before, as numerous as the sands of the Ganges, to them immeasurable and inconceivable offerings were made to the Buddhas.

original: varāgrabodhi eṣamāṇa sattvamokṣakāraṇādū ayaṃ sa kālu prāptu sūru niṣkramā purottamāt // / //
analyzed: sattva mokṣa kāraṇāt ayam sa kālu prāptu pura uttamāt
translated: Seeking supreme enlightenment, for the sake of liberating beings, this is the time, O Hero, to emerge from the supreme city.

analyzed: vaidya
translated: Vidy

original: prathamena te amoghadarśi śālapuṣpapūjito virocanaḥ prasannacitta prekṣitaḥ kṣaṇāntaram /
analyzed: prathamena te amogha darśi śāla puṣpa pūjitaḥ virocanaḥ prasanna citta prekṣitaḥ kṣaṇa antaram
translated: First, you were worshipped with shala flowers by Amoghdashi, Virochana, with a clear mind, was looked at for a moment.

original: harītakī ca eka datta dundubhisvarāya te tṛṇottha gṛhya dhāritā ti dṛṣṭa candanaṃ gṛham // / //
analyzed: harītakī ca datta dundubhisvarāya te tṛṇa uttha gṛhya dhāritā ti dṛṣṭa candanam gṛham
translated: And one haritaki was given to Dundubhisvara, grass was taken and held, and sandalwood was seen in the house.

original: purapraveśi reṇu dṛṣṭa kṣiptu cūrṇamuṣṭikā dharmeśvarāya sādhukāru dattu dharma bhāṣato /
analyzed: dharmeśvarāya sādhukāru dattu dharma
translated: Entering the city, Renu was seen, a handful of powder was thrown, to the Lord of Dharma, good wishes were given, Dharma was spoken.

original: namo namaḥ samantadarśi dṛṣṭa vāca bhāṣitā mahārciskandhi svarṇamāla kṣipta harṣitena te // / //
analyzed: namaḥ namaḥ samanta darśi dṛṣṭa vāca bhāṣitā mahā arci skandhi svarṇa māla kṣipta harṣitena te
translated: Homage, homage to Samantadarshi, to Vadisrestha, to Mahaarciskandhi, to Suvarnamalin, to Kshtiptaharisita.

original: dharmadhvajo daśāpradāni rodhu muṅga muṣṭinā aśokapuṣpi jñānaketu yvāgupāna sārathiḥ /🔽ratnaśikhī ca dīpadāni padmayoni oṣadhī sarvābhibhūśca muktahāri padmadāni sāgaro // / //
analyzed: dharma dhvajaḥ daśa apradāni muṅga muṣṭinā aśoka puṣpi jñāna ketu sārathiḥ  ratnaśikhī ca dīpa dāni padmayoni oṣadhī muktahāri padma dāni
translated: To Dharmadhvaja, to Dashaprade, to Rodhu, to Mungamushti, to Asokapushpi, to Jnanaketu, to Yvagupa, to Sarathi.🔽To Ratnasikhi, to Deepadani, to Padmagarbhi, to Sagaro, to Vitanadani, to Padmagarbhi, to Simha, to Varsasantra.

original: vitānadāni padmagarbhi siṃhu varṣasaṃstare śālendrarāja sarpidāni kṣīratyāgi puṣpitī /🔽yaśodattu kuruṇṭapuṣpi satyadarśi bhojane kāyu praṇāmi jñānameru nāgadattu cīvare // / //🔽atyuccagāmi candanāgri tīkṣṇalohamuṣṭinā mahāviyūha padmadāni raśmirāja ratnabhiḥ /
analyzed: vitāna dāni padma garbhi siṃhu varṣa saṃstare  yaśodattu kuruṇṭapuṣpi satyadarśi bhojane kāyu praṇāmi jñāna meru nāgadattu cīvare  atyucca gāmi candana agri tīkṣṇa loha muṣṭinā mahā viyūha padma dāni raśmirāja ratnabhiḥ
translated: To Shaleendraraja, to Sarpiadani, to Kshiratyagi, to Pushpiti, to Yasodatta, to Kurundapushpi, to Satyadarsi, to Bhojana.🔽To Kayu, to Pranami, to Jnanameru, to Nagadatta, to Ceevari, to Atyucchagama, to Chandanagri, to Teekshnalomushti.

original: śākyamuni ca suvarṇamuṣṭi indraketu saṃstuto sūryānano vataṃsake hi svarṇapaṭṭi sūmatī // / //
analyzed: śākyamuni ca suvarṇa muṣṭi sūrya ānanaḥ
translated: To Mahaavyuha, to Padma, to Rashmiraja, to Ratna, to Shakyamuni, to Suvarnamushi, to Indraketu, to Samstuta.🔽To Suryanana, to Vatanaka, to Suvarnapatti, to Suumati.

original: nāgābhibhū maṇipradāni puṣya dūṣyasaṃstare bhaiṣajyarāju ratnachatri siṃhaketu āsane /
analyzed: maṇi pradāni puṣya dūṣya saṃstare
translated: Nagabhibhu, Manipradani, Pushya, Dushyasamstara, Bhaisajyaraja, Ratnachchhatri, Simhasana, and Kesari.

original: guṇāgradhāri ratnajāli sarvavādi kāśyapo gandhāgri cūrṇi mukta arciketu puṣpacaityake // / //
analyzed: guṇa agra dhāri sarva vādi
translated: Gunagradhari, Ratnajali, Sarva-Vadi, Kashyapa, Gandhagri, Chunni, Mukta, Archiketa, Pushpa, Chaityaka, and Akshobhya.

original: akṣobhyarāja kūṭāgāri mālya lokapūjito tagaraśikhi ca rājyatyāgi sarvagandhi durjayo /
analyzed: ca
translated: Raja, Kutagarbhi, Malya, Lokapujita, Tagara-Shikhi, Rajayatagi, Sarvagandhi, Durjaya, and Maha-Pradipa.

original: mahāpradīpa ātmatyāgi bhūṣaṇe padmottaro vicitrapuṣpi dharmaketu dīpakāri utpalaiḥ // / //
analyzed: mahā pradīpaḥ ātmatyāgi bhūṣaṇe padmottaraḥ vicitrapuṣpi dharmaketu dīpakāri utpalaiḥ
translated: Atma-Tyagi, Bhusana, Padmottara, Vicitra-Pushpi, Dharmaketu, Dipaka, and Utpalaka.

analyzed: vaidya
translated: Vidy

original: eti cānyi sattvasāra ye ti pūrva pūjitā nānārūpa vicitra pūja anyajanyakurvatā /
analyzed: sattva sāra ye pūrva pūjitāḥ nānā rūpa vicitra
translated: And these other Sattva-Sagara who were worshipped in the past, with various forms and diverse offerings made by others.

original: smarāhi te atīta buddha tā ca pūja śāstunāṃ anāthasattva śokapūrṇa mā upekṣi niṣkramā // / //
analyzed: smarāhi te atīta buddha tā ca pūja śāstunām anātha sattva śoka pūrṇa mā upekṣi
translated: Remember those past Buddhas and the worship of the teachers, do not neglect the suffering beings without a protector, go forth...

original: dīpaṃkareti dṛṣṭamātri labdha kṣānti uttamā abhijña pañca acyutā ti labdha ānulomikā /
analyzed: dīpaṃkara iti labdha kṣānti uttamā
translated: As soon as Dipankara was seen, the supreme acceptance was attained, the five unmoving superknowledges and the favorable conditions were attained.

original: atottareṇa ekameka buddha pūjacintiyā pravartitā asaṃkhyakalpa sarvalokadhātuṣū // / //
analyzed: atas uttareṇa ekameka buddha pūja cintiyā pravartitā asaṃkhya kalpa sarva lokadhātuṣu
translated: After that, for each Buddha, inconceivable worship is performed for countless eons in all the world systems.

original: kṣīṇā ti kalpa aprameya te ca buddha nirvṛtā tavāpi sarva ātmabhāvi te ca nāma kva gatā /
analyzed: kṣīṇā ti kalpa aprameya te ca buddha nirvṛtā tava api sarva ātma bhāvi te ca nāma kva gatā
translated: The eons have passed, those Buddhas have entered nirvana, and all your bodies have also disappeared - where have those names gone?

original: kṣayāntadharmi sarvi bhāvu nāsti nityu saṃskṛte anitya kāma rājyabhoga niṣkramā purottamāt // / //
analyzed: sarvi bhāvu nā asti nityu saṃskṛte anitya kāma rājya bhoga niṣkramā pura uttamāt
translated: All things have the nature of ending in destruction; there is nothing permanent in the conditioned. O Prince, the enjoyments of the impermanent kingdom - leave them and go forth!

original: jarā ca vyādhi mṛtyu enti dāruṇā mahābhayā
analyzed: jarā ca vyādhi mṛtyu enti dāruṇā mahā bhayā
translated: Old age, disease, and death come, terrible and greatly frightening,

analyzed: hutāśanaḥ vaḥ ugra teja bhīma kalpa saṃkṣaye
translated: like a forest fire with fierce energy, terrible, at the end of the eon.

original: kṣayāntadharmi sarvi bhāvu nāsti nityu saṃskṛte
analyzed: sarvi bhāvu na asti nityu saṃskṛte
translated: All things have the nature of ending in destruction; there is nothing permanent in the conditioned.

original: sukṛcchra prāpta sattva niṣkramā guṇaṃdharā // / //🔽yada nārigaṇastuṇaveṇuravaiḥ vividhaisturiyaiḥ pratibodhayiṣu /
analyzed: sukṛcchra prāpta sattva niṣkramā guṇaṃdharā  nāri gaṇa stuṇa veṇu ravaiḥ vividhaiḥ turiyaiḥ
translated: O Prince, leave and go forth, O bearer of virtues, for beings are in great difficulty.🔽When the group of women tried to awaken the lord of men, who was lying in a comfortable bed, with the sounds of flutes, veenas, and various musical instruments,

original: sukhaśayanagataṃ manujādhipatiṃ tada tūryaravo ayu niścarate // / //
analyzed: sukha śayana gatam manuja adhipatim tada tūrya ravaḥ niścarate
translated: then this sound came forth from those musical instruments:

analyzed: jvalitam tri bhavam jara vyādhi dukhaiḥ maraṇa agni pradīptam anātham idam
translated: The three realms are burning with the sufferings of old age, disease, and death, and are ablaze with the fire of death, helpless.

original: bhavani śaraṇe sada mūḍha jagat bhramatī bhramaro yatha kumbhagato // / //
analyzed: śaraṇe jagat bhramatī bhramaraḥ
translated: The world is always deluded in the refuge of existence, wandering like a bee trapped in a jar.

original: adhruvaṃ tribhavaṃ śaradabhranibhaṃ naṭaraṅgasamā jagi rūrmicutī /
analyzed: adhruvam tri bhavam śarad abhra nibham naṭa raṅga samāḥ rūrmi cutī
translated: The three worlds are impermanent, like autumn clouds; the world's waves are like a stage performance.

original: girinadyasamaṃ laghuśīghrajavaṃ vrajatāyu jage yatha vidyu nabhe // / //
analyzed: giri nadī asamam laghu śīghra javam vraja tāyu jage nabhe
translated: Life passes quickly like a mountain river, like lightning in the sky.

analyzed: vaidya
translated: Vidy

analyzed: bhuvi deva pure tri apāya pathe bhava tṛṣṇā avidya vaśā jana tā
translated: The people are under the control of craving for existence, ignorance, and thirst in the world, the city of gods, and the three lower realms.

original: parivartiṣu pañcagatiṣvabudhāḥ yatha kumbhakarasya hi cakrabhramī // / //
analyzed: parivartiṣu kumbhakarasya hi cakra bhramī
translated: The ignorant revolve in the five destinies, like the spinning wheel of a potter.

analyzed: priya rūpa varaiḥ saha snigdha rutaiḥ śubha gandha rasaiḥ vara sparśa sukhaiḥ
translated: This world is smeared with pleasant forms, endearing sounds, delightful smells, tastes, and the blissful touch of the best,

original: pariṣiktamidaṃ kalipāśa jagat mṛgalubdhakapāśi yathaiva kapi // / //
analyzed: pariṣiktam idam kali pāśa jagat mṛga lubdhaka pāśi yathā eva kapi
translated: Like a monkey caught in the snare of a hunter.

original: sabhayā saraṇāḥ sada vairakarāḥ bahuśoka upadrava kāmaguṇāḥ /
analyzed: sabhayā saraṇāḥ sada vairakarāḥ bahuśoka upadrava kāmaguṇāḥ
translated: The sense pleasures are always dangerous, fearful, and quarrelsome, full of sorrow and afflictions.

analyzed: asi dhāra samāḥ viṣa patra nibhāḥ jahita ārya janaiḥ yathā mīḍha ghaṭāḥ
translated: They are like the edge of a sword, like a leaf of poison, abandoned by noble people like a pot of filth.

analyzed: smṛti śoka karāḥ tamasīkaraṇāḥ bhaya hetu karāḥ sadā
translated: They cause forgetfulness and sorrow, create darkness, are the cause of fear, and are always the root of suffering.

original: bhavatṛṣṇalatāya vivṛddhikarāḥ sabhayā saraṇā sada kāmaguṇāḥ // / //
analyzed: bhava tṛṣṇa latāya vivṛddhi karāḥ sabhayā saraṇā kāma guṇāḥ
translated: The desirable qualities are dangerous, fearful, and full of bondage, causing the vine of craving for existence to grow.

original: yatha agnikhadā jvalitā sabhayā tatha kāma ime viditāryajanaḥ /
analyzed: yatha agni khadā jvalitā sabhayā kāma ime vidita ārya janaḥ
translated: Like a blazing and fearful pit of fire, these desires are known to the noble ones.

original: mahapaṅkasamā asisundhusamāḥ madhudigdha iva kṣuradhāra yathā // / //
analyzed: maha paṅka samāḥ asi sundhu samāḥ madhu digdhaḥ iva kṣuradhāra yathā
translated: Like a great swamp, like a river of swords, like a razor's edge smeared with honey.

original: yatha sarpisaro yatha mīḍhaghaṭāḥ tatha kāma ime viditā viduṣām /🔽tatha śūlasamā dvijapeśisamāḥ yatha śvāna karaṅka savairamukhāḥ // / //
analyzed: yathā sarpisaraḥ yathā mīḍhaghaṭāḥ tatha kāma ime viditāḥ viduṣām  śūla samāḥ dvija peśi samāḥ yatha
translated: Like a pit of snakes, like a covered well, these desires are known to the wise ones.🔽Like a stake, like a bird's feather, like a dog's mouth with food in it.

original: udacandrasamā imi kāmaguṇāḥ pratibimba iva girighoṣa yathā /
analyzed: uda candra samāḥ imi kāma guṇāḥ pratibimbaḥ iva giri ghoṣa yathā
translated: These desirable qualities are like the moon in water, like a reflection, like the echo of a mountain.

analyzed: svapna samāḥ
translated: Like an apparition, like a stage performance, like a dream, they are known by the noble ones.

analyzed: vaidya
translated: Vidy

original: kṣaṇikā vaśikā imi kāmaguṇāḥ tatha māyamarīcisamā alikāḥ /
analyzed: kāma guṇāḥ
translated: These desirable qualities are momentary, powerless, like an illusion, a mirage, a goblin.

analyzed: uda budbuda phena samā vitathā buddha budhaiḥ
translated: Like bubbles, foam, and water, they are false, accumulated through conceptualization by the wise ones.

original: prathame vayase vararūpadharaḥ priya iṣṭa mato iya bālacarī /
analyzed: prathame vayase vara rūpa dharaḥ priyaḥ bāla carī
translated: In the prime of youth, possessing an excellent form, loved, desired, and cherished, this is childish conduct.

original: jaravyādhidukhai hatatejavapuṃ vijahanti mṛgā iva śuṣkanadīm // / //
analyzed: jara vyādhi dukhaiḥ hata teja vapum vijahanti mṛgāḥ iva śuṣka nadīm
translated: They abandon him, like deer an exhausted river.

original: dhanadhānyavaro bahudravyabalī priya iṣṭa mato iya bālacarī /
analyzed: dhana dhānya varaḥ bahu dravya balī priyaḥ
translated: When he is wealthy, with abundant grain and goods, powerful, and beloved, people follow him like children.

original: parihīnadhanaṃ puna kṛcchragataṃ vijahanti narā iva śūnyaṭavīm // / //
analyzed: parihīna dhanam puna kṛcchra gatam vijahanti narāḥ iva śūnya aṭavīm
translated: But when he loses his wealth and falls into misfortune, they abandon him like a deserted forest.

original: yatha puṣpadrumo saphaleva drumo naru dānaratastatha prītikaro /
analyzed: yathā puṣpa drumaḥ sa phala iva drumaḥ
translated: Just as a tree with flowers or fruits brings joy to people,

original: dhanahīna jarārtitu yācanako bhavate tada apriyu gṛdhrasamaḥ // / //
analyzed: yācanakaḥ bhavate gṛdhra samaḥ
translated: but when it is poor and old, a beggar becomes unpleasant, like a vulture.
When a master is wealthy, powerful, and has a beautiful form, he brings joy to the senses and is loved by those who enjoy companionship.

original: jaravyādhidukhārditu kṣīṇadhano bhavate tada apriyu mṛtyusamaḥ // / //🔽jarayā jaritaḥ samatītavayo druma vidyuhateva yathā bhavati /
analyzed: kṣīṇa dhanaḥ bhavate mṛtyu samaḥ  jarayā jaritaḥ samatīta vayaḥ druma vidyu hatā iva yathā bhavati
translated: But when he is afflicted by old age, sickness, and suffering, and his wealth is exhausted, he becomes unpleasant, like death.🔽When a person is aged and his youth has passed, he becomes like a tree struck by lightning.

original: jarajīrṇa agāru yathā sabhayo jaraniḥsaraṇaṃ laghu brūhi mune // / //
analyzed: yathā sa bhayaḥ jara niḥsaraṇam laghu brūhi mune
translated: Just as an old and dilapidated house is dangerous, so too is old age. O Sage, quickly tell us the escape from old age.

original: jara śoṣayate naranārigaṇaṃ yatha mālulatā ghanaśālavanam /
analyzed: śoṣayate nara nāri gaṇam mālu latā ghana śāla vanam
translated: Old age withers men and women like a maluva vine a dense grove of sal trees.

original: jara vīryaparākramavegaharī jara paṅkanimagna yathā puruṣo // / //
analyzed: vīrya parākrama vega harī jara paṅka nimagna yathā
translated: Old age robs one of vigor, heroism, and strength, like a man sunk in the mud.

analyzed: rūpa surūpa virūpa karī jara teja harī bala sthāma harī
translated: Old age makes one's beauty, good looks, and form ugly, old age robs one of splendor, strength, and power.

analyzed: vaidya
translated: physician

original: sada saukhyaharī paribhāvakarī jara mṛtyukarī jara ojaharī // / //
analyzed: sada saukhya harī paribhāva karī jara mṛtyu karī jara oja harī
translated: Old age always robs one of happiness, makes one contemptible, old age brings death, old age robs one of vitality.

analyzed: bahu roga śataiḥ ghana vyādhi dukhaiḥ mṛgāḥ
translated: The world is afflicted by many hundreds of diseases and the suffering of dense illnesses, as if burning like deer.

original: jaravyādhigataṃ prasamīkṣva jagat dukhaniḥsaraṇaṃ laghu deśayahī // / //
analyzed: jarā vyādhi gatam prasamīkṣva jagat dukha niḥsaraṇam laghu
translated: Consider the world afflicted by old age and disease, quickly teach the escape from suffering.

original: śiśire hi yathā himadhātu mahān tṛṇagulmavanauṣadhiojaharo /
analyzed: śiśire hi yathā hima dhātu mahān
translated: Just as in winter the great snow mass robs the vitality of grass, shrubs, forests, and herbs,

original: tatha ojaharo ahu vyādhijaro parihīyati indriya rūpa balam // / //
analyzed: tatha ojaharaḥ ahu vyādhijaraḥ parihīyati indriya rūpa balam
translated: So old age and disease rob vitality, and the faculties, form, and strength decline.

analyzed: paritāpa karaḥ
translated: The destroyer of wealth, grain, and great wealth, the bringer of torment, together with disease and old age,

original: pratighātakaraḥ priyu dveṣakaraḥ paridāhakaro yatha sūrya nabhe // / //
analyzed: pratighāta karaḥ dveṣa karaḥ paridāha karaḥ sūrya nabhe
translated: The bringer of obstacles, the bringer of hatred towards loved ones, the bringer of burning, like the sun in the sky.

original: maraṇaṃ cavanaṃ cuti kālakriyā priyadravyajanena viyogu sadā /
analyzed: maraṇam cavanam kālakriyā priya dravya janena sadā
translated: Death, passing away, decease, the end, is always separation from loved ones and possessions.

original: apunāgamanaṃ ca asaṃgamanaṃ drumapatraphalā nadisrota yathā // / //
analyzed: ca a saṃgamanam yathā
translated: And not returning again, not meeting again, like the leaves and fruits of trees, or the current of a river.

original: maraṇaṃ vaśitāmavaśīkurute maraṇaṃ harate nadi dāru yathā /
analyzed: maraṇam vaśitām avaśīkurute maraṇam harate nadi dāru yathā
translated: Death overpowers those who are powerful. Death carries away like a river its wood.

analyzed: naraḥ vrajate svaka karma phala anugataḥ vivaśaḥ
translated: A man goes forth alone, without a companion, powerless, following the fruits of his own actions.

original: maraṇo grasate bahuprāṇiśataṃ makareva jalā hari bhūtagaṇam /
analyzed: maraṇaḥ grasate bahu prāṇi śatam makarā iva jalā hari bhūta gaṇam
translated: Death devours many hundreds of living beings, like a crocodile in the water its multitude of beings.

original: garuḍo uragaṃ mṛgarāju gajaṃ jvalaneva tṛṇoṣadhibhūtagaṇam // / //
analyzed: garuḍaḥ uragam mṛga rāju gajam jvalanā iva tṛṇa uṣadhi bhūta gaṇam
translated: Like Garuḍa the king of birds, like the king of beasts a mighty elephant, like a fire its mass of grass and trees.

original: ima īdṛśakai bahudoṣaśataiḥ jagu mocayituṃ kṛta yā praṇidhi /
analyzed: bahu doṣa śataiḥ mocayitum
translated: For the sake of liberating the world from these and many other hundreds of faults, you made a vow.

original: smara tāṃ purimāṃ praṇidhānacarīṃ ayu kālu tavā abhiniṣkramitum // / //
analyzed: smara tām purimām praṇidhāna carīm ayu kālu abhiniṣkramitum
translated: Remember that vow from the past. This is the time for you to go forth.

analyzed: vaidya
translated: Physician

analyzed: nāri gaṇaḥ praharṣitaḥ bodhayatī turiyaiḥ mahā munim
translated: When the assembly of women joyfully awakens the great sage with music,

original: tada gātha vicitra niścarī tūryaśabdāt sugatānubhāvataḥ // / //
analyzed: tūrya śabdāt sugata anubhāvataḥ
translated: Then from the sound of the musical instruments, through the power of the Sugata, a verse emerges:

original: laghu tadbhañjati sarvasaṃskṛtaṃ acirasthāyi nabheva vidyataḥ /
analyzed: laghu tat bhañjati sarva saṃskṛtam acira sthāyi nabhā iva vidyataḥ
translated: This conditioned existence is quickly destroyed, it does not last long, like a drawing in water.

original: ayu kālu tavā upasthitaḥ samayo niṣkramaṇāya suvrata // / //
analyzed: samayaḥ niṣkramaṇāya suvrata
translated: This is the time that has come for you, O one of good vows, it is time for you to go forth.

analyzed: saṃskāra anitya adhruvāḥ āmakumbha upama bhedana ātmakāḥ
translated: Formations are impermanent and unstable, like an unbaked clay pot, prone to breaking.

original: parakeraka yācitopamāḥ pāṃśunagaropama tāvakālikāḥ // / //🔽saṃskāra pralopadharmime varṣakāli calitaṃ ca lepanam /
analyzed: para keraka yācita upamāḥ pāṃśu nagara upama tāvakālikāḥ  saṃskāra pralopa dharmi me varṣa kāli calitam ca lepanam
translated: Like something borrowed or rented, like a city of sand, they last only a short while.🔽Formations have the nature of destruction, like a painting in the rainy season.

analyzed: nadi kūle sa vālukam
translated: Dependent on conditions, their nature is weak, like a riverbank without reeds.

original: saṃskāra pradīpaacivat kṣiprautpattinirodhadharmikāḥ /🔽anavasthita mārutopamāḥ phenapiṇḍave asāra durbalāḥ // / //
analyzed: saṃskāra pradīpa aci vat kṣipra utpatti nirodha dharmikāḥ  māruta upamāḥ phenapiṇḍave durbalāḥ
translated: Formations are like a lamp's flame, quickly arising and ceasing.🔽Unstable like the wind, like a ball of foam, they are insubstantial and weak.

analyzed: saṃskāra nirīha śūnyakāḥ kadalī skandha samāḥ nirīkṣataḥ
translated: Formations are without power, empty, like a plantain tree when examined.

analyzed: māyā upama citta mohanā muṣṭi vat
translated: Like an illusion, deluding the mind, like a lullaby to lull the foolish.

original: hetūbhi ca pratyayebhi cā sarvasaṃskāragataṃ pravartate /
analyzed: hetūbhi ca pratyayebhi ca sarva saṃskāra gatam pravartate
translated: All formations arise from causes and conditions.

original: anyonya pratītya hetutaḥ tadidaṃ bālajano na budhyate // / //
analyzed: anyonya pratītya hetutaḥ tat idam bāla janaḥ na budhyate
translated: They arise in mutual dependence, but the foolish do not understand this.

original: yatha muñja pratītya balvajaṃ rajju vyāyāmabalena vartitā /
analyzed: muñja pratītya balvajam rajju vyāyāma balena vartitā
translated: Just as a rope is made by combining muñja grass and balbaja grass, and is spun by the power of effort,

analyzed: vaidya
translated: Vaidya

original: ghaṭiyantra sacakra vartate eṣa ekaikaśa nāsti vartanā // / //
analyzed: ghaṭiyantra sa cakra vartate eṣa ekaikaśa na asti vartanā
translated: Like a potter's wheel or a water wheel, it turns, but each part does not turn by itself.

analyzed: sarva bhava aṅga vartinī anyam anya upacayena niśritā
translated: Likewise, all the components of existence are based on the accumulation of other things.

analyzed: ekaikaśas teṣu vartinī na upalabhyate
translated: Each of them is based on the others, but their beginning and end are not perceived.

original: bījasya sato yathāṅkuro na ca yo bīja sa caiva aṅkuro /
analyzed: bījasya sataḥ yathā aṅkuraḥ na ca yaḥ sa ca eva aṅkuraḥ
translated: Just as a sprout arises from a seed, but the seed is not the sprout,

original: na ca tato na caiva tat evamanuccheda aśāśvata dharmatā // / //
analyzed: na ca tatas na ca eva tat dharma tā
translated: and it is neither from that nor from anything else - thus, the nature of phenomena is neither annihilation nor eternalism.

original: saṃskāra avidyapratyayāḥ te saṃskāre na santi tattvataḥ /
analyzed: saṃskāra avidya pratyayāḥ te saṃskāre na santi tattvataḥ
translated: Conditioned phenomena are conditioned by ignorance; they do not truly exist in conditioned phenomena.

original: saṃskāra avidya caiva hi śūnya eke prakṛtīnirīhakāḥ // / //
analyzed: saṃskāra avidyā ca eva hi śūnye eke prakṛtīnirīhakāḥ
translated: Conditioned phenomena and ignorance are empty, naturally inactive.

analyzed: mudrāt pratimudra dṛśyate mudrā saṃkrānti na ca upalabhyate
translated: A seal is seen to produce an impression, but the transfer of the seal is not perceived.

original: na ca tatra na caiva śāśvato eva saṃskārānucchedaśāśvatāḥ // / //
analyzed: na ca tatra na ca eva eva saṃskāra anuccheda śāśvatāḥ
translated: It is neither there nor is it eternal - thus, conditioned phenomena are neither annihilated nor eternal.

analyzed: cakṣuḥ ca pratītya rūpataḥ cakṣu vijñānam iha upajāyate
translated: The eye and form, in dependence on these, eye-consciousness arises here.

original: na ca cakṣuṣi rūpa niśrita rūpasaṃkrānti na caiva cakṣuṣi // / //
analyzed: na ca cakṣuṣi rūpa niśrita rūpa saṃkrānti na ca eva cakṣuṣi
translated: But form is not based in the eye, and the transfer of form is not in the eye.

analyzed: nairātmya śubhāḥ ca dharma ime punar ātmā iti śubhāḥ ca kalpitāḥ
translated: These phenomena, which are selfless and impure, are imagined to be a self and pure.

analyzed: viparītam asat vikalpitam
translated: The eye-consciousness arises from that, wrongly imagined as real.

analyzed: vijñāna nirodha saṃbhavam vijñāna utpāda vyayam vipaśyati

original: rātrau praśāntāyāmabhiniṣkramantaṃ devagaṇaparivṛtam /🔽abhiniṣkramya pravrajitaṃ cādrākṣīt kāṣāyavastraprāvṛtam /
analyzed: rātrau praśāntāyām abhiniṣkramantam deva gaṇa parivṛtam  abhiniṣkramya pravrajitam ca adrākṣīt kāṣāya vastra prāvṛtam
translated: At night, when it was quiet, he saw him leaving, surrounded by a group of gods.🔽After leaving, he saw him gone forth, wearing saffron robes.

original: sa pratibuddhaḥ tvaritaṃ tvaritaṃ kāñcukīyaṃ paripṛcchati sma kaccit kumāro 'ntaḥpure 'sti /
analyzed: sa pratibuddhaḥ tvaritam tvaritam kāñcukīyam paripṛcchati sma kaccit kumāraḥ ntaḥpure sti
translated: He woke up and quickly asked the chamberlain, Is the prince still in the inner palace?

analyzed: saḥ vocat asti deva iti
translated: He replied, Yes, Your Majesty.

original: tato rājñaḥ śuddhodanasyāntaḥpure śokaśalyo hṛdaye 'nupraviṣṭo 'bhūt abhiniṣkramiṣyati avaśyaṃ kumāro 'yam /
analyzed: tatas rājñaḥ śuddhodanasya antaḥpure śoka śalyaḥ hṛdaye nupraviṣṭaḥ bhūt abhiniṣkramiṣyati avaśyam kumāraḥ yam
translated: Then a dart of grief entered King Śuddhodana's heart, thinking, The prince will surely go forth.

analyzed: yat ca imāni pūrva nimittāni saṃdṛśyante sma
translated: And these are the signs that are seen.

analyzed: na khalu avyayam kumāreṇa kadācid udyāna bhūmim abhinirgantavyam
translated: He thought, The prince should never go out to the pleasure groves.

analyzed: strī gaṇa madhye bhirataḥ iha eva ramyate
translated: Delighting in the midst of the assembly of women, he will enjoy himself right here.

analyzed: na abhiniṣkramiṣyati iti
translated: He will not go forth.

original: tato rājñā śuddhodanena kumārasya paribhogārthaṃ trayo yathartukāḥ prāsādāḥ kāritā abhūvan graiṣmiko vārṣiko haimantikaśca /
analyzed: tatas rājñā śuddhodanena kumārasya paribhoga artham trayaḥ yathartukāḥ prāsādāḥ kāritāḥ abhūvan graiṣmikaḥ vārṣikaḥ haimantikaḥ ca
translated: Then King Śuddhodana had three palaces built for the prince's enjoyment, for each of the three seasons: for the summer, the rainy season, and the winter.

analyzed: tatra yaḥ graiṣmikaḥ saḥ ekānta śītalaḥ
translated: The summer palace was cool all by itself,

analyzed: yaḥ vārṣikaḥ sa sādhāraṇaḥ
translated: The one for the rainy season is common.

analyzed: yaḥ haimantikaḥ sa svabhāva uṣṇaḥ
translated: The one for the winter is naturally warm.

original: ekaikasya ca prāsādasya sopānāni pañca pañca puruṣaśatānyutkṣipanti sma /
analyzed: ekaikasya ca prāsādasya sopānāni pañca pañca puruṣa śatāni utkṣipanti sma
translated: For each palace, five hundred men each lifted and lowered the stairs.

analyzed: nikṣipanti sma
translated: They lowered them.

original: teṣāṃ tathotkṣipyamāṇānāṃ nikṣipyamāṇānāṃ ca śabdo 'rdhayojane śrūyate sma mā khalu kumāro 'nabhijñāta evābhiniṣkramiṣyatīti /
analyzed: teṣām tathā utkṣipyamāṇānām nikṣipyamāṇānām ca śabdaḥ ṛdha yojane śrūyate sma mā khalu kumāraḥ n abhijñātaḥ eva abhiniṣkramiṣyati iti
translated: As they were being lifted and lowered in this way, the sound was heard for half a yojana, thinking, Surely the prince will not depart without being known.

analyzed: naimittikaiḥ vaipañcikaiḥ ca vyākṛtam abhūt maṅgaladvāreṇa kumāraḥ bhiniṣkramiṣyati iti
translated: It was declared by astrologers and diviners, The prince will depart through the Auspicious Gate.

original: tato rājā maṅgaladvārasya mahānti kapāṭāni kārayati sma /
analyzed: tatas rājā maṅgaladvārasya mahānti kapāṭāni kārayati sma
translated: Then the king had great doors made for the Auspicious Gate.

original: ekaikaṃ ca kapāṭaṃ pañca pañca puruṣaśatānyuddhāṭayanti sma /
analyzed: ekaikam ca kapāṭam pañca pañca puruṣa śatāni uddhāṭayanti sma
translated: And each door was opened by five hundred men each.

analyzed: apaghāṭayanti sma
translated: They closed them.

analyzed: teṣām ca ardha yojanam śabdaḥ gacchati sma
translated: And the sound went for half a yojana.

analyzed: pañca ca asya kāma guṇān sadṛśān upasaṃharati sma
translated: And he provided him with five sensual qualities that were equal.

analyzed: gīta vādita nṛtyaiḥ ca enam sadā eva yuvatayaḥ upatasthuḥ
translated: And young women always attended him with singing, music, and dancing.

original: atha bhikṣavo bodhisattvaḥ sārathiṃ prāha śīghraṃ sārathe rathaṃ yojaya /
analyzed: atha bhikṣavaḥ bodhisattvaḥ sārathim prāha śīghram sārathe ratham yojaya
translated: Then, monks, the Bodhisattva said to his charioteer, “Charioteer, quickly harness the chariot.

analyzed: udyāna bhūmim gamiṣyāmi iti
translated: I am going to the park.”

original: tataḥ sārathī rājānaṃ śuddhoddhanamupasaṃkramyaivamāha deva kumāra udyānabhūmimabhiniryāsyatīti //
analyzed: tatas sārathiḥ rājānam śuddhoddhanam upasaṃkramya evam āha deva kumāraḥ udyāna bhūmim abhiniryāsyati iti
translated: Then the charioteer went to King Śuddhodana and said, “Your Majesty, the prince wishes to go out to the park.”

original: atha rājñaḥ śuddhodanasyaitadabhavat na kadācinmayā kumāra udyānabhūmimabhiniṣkramitaḥ /
analyzed: atha rājñaḥ śuddhodanasya etat abhavat na kadācid mayā kumāraḥ udyāna bhūmim abhiniṣkramitaḥ
translated: Then King Śuddhodana thought, “The prince has never gone out to the park.

analyzed: su bhūmi darśanāya
translated: He should see the beautiful grounds.

analyzed: yat nu aham kumāram udyāna bhūmim abhiniṣkrāmayeyam
translated: I will take the prince out to the park.

analyzed: tatas kumāraḥ strī gaṇa parivṛtaḥ ratim vetsyate
translated: Then the prince, surrounded by a group of women, will experience pleasure.

analyzed: na abhiniṣkramiṣyati iti
translated: He will not go forth.”

original: tato rājā śuddhodanaḥ snehabahumānābhyāṃ bodhisattvasya nagare ghaṇṭāvaghoṣaṇāṃ kārayati sma saptame divase kumāra udyānabhūmiṃ niṣkramiṣyatīti
analyzed: tatas rājā śuddhodanaḥ sneha bahu mānābhyām bodhisattvasya nagare ghaṇṭā avaghoṣaṇām kārayati sma saptame divase kumāraḥ udyāna bhūmim niṣkramiṣyati iti
translated: Then King Śuddhodana, out of affection and respect for the Bodhisattva, had a proclamation made with a bell throughout the city: “In seven days the prince will go out to see the beautiful grounds.

analyzed: su bhūmi darśanāya
translated: He will go out to see the beautiful grounds.

original: tatra bhavadbhiḥ sarvāmanāpāni cāpanayitavyāni mā kumāraḥ pratikūlaṃ paśyet /
analyzed: tatra bhavadbhiḥ sarva amanāpāni ca apanayitavyāni mā kumāraḥ pratikūlam paśyet
translated: There you should remove all that is unpleasant, so that the prince does not see anything disagreeable.

analyzed: sarva manāpāni ca upasaṃhartavyāni viṣaya abhiramyāṇi
translated: All that is unpleasant should be removed, and all that is delightful in terms of objects should be brought in.”

analyzed: vaidya
translated: physician

original: tataḥ saptame divase sarvaṃ nagaramalaṃkṛtamabhūt udyānabhūmimupaśobhitaṃ nānāraṅgadūṣyavitānīkṛtaṃ chatradhvajapatākāsamalaṃkṛtam /
analyzed: tatas saptame divase sarvam nagaram alaṃkṛtam abhūt udyāna bhūmim upaśobhitam nānā raṅga dūṣya vitānīkṛtam chatra dhvaja patākā samalaṃkṛtam
translated: Then, on the seventh day, the entire city was adorned, the park grounds were beautified, canopies of various colored silk were spread, and it was well-adorned with parasols, banners, and flags.

original: yena ca mārgeṇa bodhisattvo 'bhinirgacchati sma /🔽sa mārgaḥ siktaḥ saṃmṛṣṭo gandhodakapariṣikto muktakusumāvakīrṇo nānāgandhaghaṭikānirdhūpitaḥ
analyzed: yena ca mārgeṇa bodhisattvaḥ bhinirgacchati sma  sa mārgaḥ siktaḥ saṃmṛṣṭaḥ gandha udaka pariṣiktaḥ mukta kusuma avakīrṇaḥ nānā gandha ghaṭikā nirdhūpitaḥ
translated: And the road by which the Bodhisattva was to depart🔽was sprinkled and swept, perfumed with scented water, strewn with loose flowers, and fumigated with incense.

analyzed: pūrṇa kumbha upaśobhitaḥ kadalī vṛkṣa ucchritaḥ nānā vicitra paṭa vitāna vitataḥ ratna kiṅkiṇī jāla hāra ardha hāra abhipralambitaḥ bhūt
translated: It was adorned with full water pots, tall banana trees, and canopies of various beautiful cloths, and hung with garlands, half-garlands, and nets of jeweled bells.

analyzed: caturaṅga sainya vyūhitaḥ parivāraḥ ca udyuktaḥ bhūt kumārasya antaḥpuram pratimaṇḍayitum
translated: And the four divisions of the army were arrayed and ready to accompany the prince in order to adorn his retinue.

original: atha śuddhāvāsakāyikā devā nidhyāpayanti sma bodhisattvamāharitum /
analyzed: atha śuddhāvāsa kāyikāḥ devāḥ nidhyāpayanti sma bodhisattvam āharitum
translated: Then the gods of the Pure Abodes contemplated in order to attract the Bodhisattva.

original: tatra bodhisattvasya pūrveṇa nagaradvāreṇodyānabhūmimabhiniṣkrāmato mahatā vyūhena
analyzed: tatra bodhisattvasya pūrveṇa nagara dvāreṇa udyāna bhūmim abhiniṣkrāmataḥ mahatā vyūhena
translated: There, as the Bodhisattva was departing for the park grounds through the eastern city gate with a great display,

original: atha bodhisattvasyānubhāvena śuddhavāsakāyikairdevaputraistasmin mārge puruṣo jīrṇo🔽vṛddho mahallako dhamanīsaṃtatagātraḥ khaṇḍadanto valīnicitakāyaḥ palitakeśaḥ kubjo
analyzed: atha bodhisattvasya anubhāvena śuddha vāsa kāyikaiḥ devaputraiḥ tasmin mārge puruṣaḥ jīrṇaḥ  vṛddhaḥ mahallakaḥ dhamanī saṃtata gātraḥ khaṇḍa dantaḥ valī nicita kāyaḥ palita keśaḥ
translated: Then, through the power of the Bodhisattva, the gods of the Pure Abodes manifested an old man on that road,🔽who was decrepit,

original: gopānasīvakro vibhagno daṇḍaparāyaṇa āturo gatayauvanaḥ kharakharāvasaktakaṇṭhaḥ
analyzed: gopānasī vakraḥ vibhagnaḥ daṇḍa parāyaṇaḥ āturaḥ gata yauvanaḥ khara khara avasakta kaṇṭhaḥ
translated: bent like a cow's ear, broken, leaning on a staff, afflicted, past his youth, with a throat choked by old age,

original: prāgbhāreṇa kāyena daṇḍamavaṣṭabhya pravepayamānaḥ sarvāṅgapratyaṅgaiḥ purato mārgasyopadarśito 'bhūt //
analyzed: prāgbhāreṇa kāyena daṇḍam avaṣṭabhya pravepayamānaḥ sarva aṅga pratyaṅgaiḥ puratas mārgasya upadarśitaḥ bhūt
translated: and with his body bent forward, trembling in all his limbs and joints, as if showing the way ahead.

original: atha bodhisattvo jānanneva sārathimidamavocat 🔽kiṃ sārathe puruṣa durbala alpasthāmo ucchuṣkamāṃsarudhiratvacasnāyunaddhaḥ /
analyzed: atha bodhisattvaḥ jānan eva sārathim idam avocat  kim sārathe ucchuṣka māṃsa rudhira tvaca snāyu naddhaḥ
translated: Then, although knowing, the Bodhisattva said this to the charioteer:🔽Charioteer, what is this man, weak and feeble, bound by skin, flesh, blood, and sinews,

original: śvetaṃśiro viraladanta kṛśāṅgarūpo ālambya daṇḍa vrajate asukhaṃ skhalantaḥ // / //
analyzed: ālambya vrajate asukham
translated: with white hair, sparse teeth, and a thin body, who walks unhappily, stumbling, leaning on a staff?

analyzed: sārathiḥ āha
translated: The charioteer said:

original: eṣo hi deva puruṣo jarayābhibhūtaḥ kṣīṇendriyaḥ sudukhito balavīryahīnaḥ /
analyzed: eṣaḥ hi deva puruṣaḥ jarayā abhibhūtaḥ kṣīṇa indriyaḥ su dukhitaḥ bala vīrya hīnaḥ
translated: Deva, this is a man overcome by old age, with decaying senses, very unhappy, lacking strength and vigor,

original: bandhūjanena paribhūta anāthabhūtaḥ kāryāsamartha apaviddhu vaneva dāru // / //
analyzed: bandhū janena paribhūta anātha bhūtaḥ kārya asamartha apaviddhu vana iva dāru
translated: Abandoned by relatives, friendless, unable to act, cast away like a log in the forest.

analyzed: bodhisattvaḥ āha
translated: The Bodhisattva said:

original: kuladharma eṣa ayamasya hitaṃ bhaṇāhi athavāpi sarvajagato 'sya iyaṃ hyavasthā /
analyzed: kula dharmaḥ eṣa ayam asya hitam bhaṇāhi athavā api sarva jagataḥ iyam hi avasthā
translated: This is the family custom? Speak what is beneficial for him. Or is this the state of the whole world?

original: śīghraṃ bhaṇāhi vacanaṃ yathabhūtametat śrutvā tathārthamiha yoniśa cintayiṣye // / //
analyzed: śīghram bhaṇāhi vacanam śrutvā tathā artham iha cintayiṣye
translated: Speak quickly the truth of this matter. Having heard it, I will properly consider it here.

analyzed: sārathiḥ āha
translated: The charioteer said:

original: naitasya deva kuladharma na rāṣṭradharmaḥ sarve jagasya jara yauvanu dharṣayāti /
analyzed: na etasya deva kula dharma na rāṣṭra dharmaḥ sarve dharṣayāti
translated: This is not the family custom, nor the custom of the country. Old age overpowers the youthfulness of the whole world.

original: tubhyaṃ pi mātṛpitṛbāndhavajñātisaṃgho jarayā amukta na hi anya gatirjanasya // / //
analyzed: tubhyam mātṛ pitṛ bāndhava jñāti saṃghaḥ jarayā amukta na hi gatiḥ janasya
translated: Your assembly of mothers, fathers, relatives, and kinsmen is not exempt from old age. There is no other way for people.

analyzed: vaidya
translated: The physician

analyzed: bodhisattvaḥ āha
translated: The Bodhisattva said:

original: dhiksārathe abudha bālajanasya buddhiḥ yadyauvanena madamatta jarāṃ na paśyet /
analyzed: dhik sārathe abudha bāla janasya buddhiḥ yad yauvanena mada matta jarām na paśyet
translated: Shame on the ignorant mind of the childish people! If they, intoxicated by youthfulness and arrogance, do not see old age,

original: āvartayāśu mi rathaṃ punarahaṃ pravekṣye kiṃ mahya krīḍaratibhirjarayāśritasya // / //
analyzed: āvartaya āśu ratham punar aham pravekṣye kim krīḍa ratibhiḥ jarayā āśritasya
translated: Turn back the excellent chariot quickly! I will enter again. What is the use of play and enjoyment for me, who is overtaken by old age?

original: atha bodhisattvaḥ pratinirvatya rathavaraṃ punarapi puraṃ prāviśat //
analyzed: atha bodhisattvaḥ pratinirvatya ratha varam punar api puram prāviśat
translated: Then the Bodhisattva turned back the excellent chariot and entered the city again.

original: iti hi bhikṣavo bodhisattvo 'pareṇa kālasamayena dakṣiṇena nagaradvāreṇodyānabhūmimabhiniṣkraman
analyzed: iti hi bhikṣavaḥ bodhisattvaḥ pareṇa kāla samayena dakṣiṇena nagara dvāreṇa udyāna bhūmim abhiniṣkraman
translated: Thus, monks, at another time, the Bodhisattva, going out to the pleasure grove through the southern city gate with a great array,

original: mahatā vyūhena so 'drākṣīnmārge puruṣaṃ vyādhispṛṣṭaṃ dagdhodarābhibhūtaṃ durbalakāyaṃ
analyzed: mahatā vyūhena saḥ drākṣīt mārge puruṣam vyādhi spṛṣṭam dagdhodara abhibhūtam durbala kāyam
translated: saw on the road a man afflicted with illness, his belly swollen, his body weak,

analyzed: svake mūtra purīṣe nimagnam atrāṇam a pratiśaraṇam kṛcchreṇa ucchvasantam praśvasantam
translated: sinking in his own urine and excrement, without protection, without refuge, breathing with difficulty.

original: dṛṣṭvā ca punarbodhisattvo jānanneva sārathimidamavocat 🔽kiṃ sārathe puruṣa ruṣyavivarṇagātraḥ sarvendriyebhi vikalo guru praśvasantaḥ /
analyzed: dṛṣṭvā ca punar bodhisattvaḥ jānan eva sārathim idam avocat  kim sārathe
translated: And seeing him, the Bodhisattva, although knowing, said this to the charioteer:🔽Charioteer, why is this man's body rough and discolored, his faculties impaired, breathing heavily,

original: sarvāṅgaśuṣka udarākula kṛcchraprāpto mūtre purīṣi svaki tiṣṭhati kutsanīye // / //
analyzed: sarva aṅga śuṣkaḥ udara ākula kṛcchra prāptaḥ mūtre purīṣi tiṣṭhati kutsanīye
translated: his whole body dry, his belly swollen, fallen into misfortune, lying in his own contemptible urine and excrement?

analyzed: sārathiḥ āha
translated: The charioteer said:

original: eṣo hi deva puruṣo paramaṃ gilāno vyādhībhayaṃ upagato maraṇāntaprāptaḥ /
analyzed: eṣaḥ hi deva puruṣaḥ paramam gilānaḥ vyādhī bhayam upagataḥ maraṇa anta prāptaḥ
translated: Deva, this man is extremely ill, fallen into the fear of illness, come to the brink of death.

analyzed: ārogya teja rahitaḥ bala viprahīnaḥ atrāṇa dvīpa śaraṇaḥ hi aparāyaṇaḥ ca
translated: Deprived of health and vigor, bereft of strength, without protection, island, refuge, or ally.

analyzed: bodhisattvaḥ āha
translated: The Bodhisattva said:🔽Charioteer, I too am subject to illness, I am not exempt from illness.

original: ārogyatā ca bhavate yatha svapnakrīḍā vyādhībhayaṃ ca imamīdṛśu ghorarūpam /
analyzed: ārogya tā ca bhavate svapna krīḍā vyādhi bhayam ca ghora rūpam
translated: And he had perfect health, like in a dream or play, and no fear of illness, such as this terrible form of disease.

original: ko nāma vijñapuruṣo ima dṛṣṭvavasthāṃ krīḍāratiṃ ca janayecchubhasaṃjñatāṃ vā // / //
analyzed: kaḥ nāma dṛṣṭvā avasthām krīḍā ratim ca janayet śubha saṃjña tām vā
translated: What wise person, seeing this state, would generate play, pleasure, or the perception of beauty?

original: atha khalu bhikṣavo bodhisattvaḥ pratinivartya rathavaraṃ punarapi puravaraṃ prāvikṣat //
analyzed: atha khalu bhikṣavaḥ bodhisattvaḥ pratinivartya ratha varam punar api pura varam prāvikṣat
translated: Then, monks, the Bodhisattva turned back the excellent chariot and again entered the excellent city.

original: iti hi bhikṣavo bodhisattvo 'pareṇa kālasamayena paścimena nagaradvāreṇodyānabhūmimabhiniṣkraman
analyzed: iti hi bhikṣavaḥ bodhisattvaḥ pareṇa kāla samayena paścimena nagara dvāreṇa udyāna bhūmim abhiniṣkraman
translated: Thus, monks, at another time, the Bodhisattva, going out to the pleasure grove through the western city gate,

original: mahatā vyūhena so 'drākṣīt puruṣaṃ mṛtaṃ kālagataṃ mañce samāropitaṃ cailavitānīkṛtaṃ
analyzed: mahatā vyūhena saḥ drākṣīt puruṣam mṛtam kālagatam mañce samāropitam caila vitānīkṛtam
translated: saw a man who had died, placed on a couch, covered with a cloth,

original: jñātisaṃghaparivṛtaṃ sarvai rudadbhiḥ krandadbhiḥ paridevamānaiḥ prakīrṇakeśaiḥ pāṃśvavakīrṇaśirobhirurāṃsi
analyzed: jñāti saṃgha parivṛtam sarvaiḥ rudadbhiḥ krandadbhiḥ paridevamānaiḥ prakīrṇa keśaiḥ pāṃśu avakīrṇa śirobhiḥ urāṃsi
translated: surrounded by a group of relatives, all crying, wailing, lamenting, with disheveled hair, their heads covered in dust,

original: tāḍayadbhirutkrośadbhiḥ pṛṣṭhato 'nugacchadbhiḥ /🔽dṛṣṭvā ca punarbodhisattvo jānanneva sārathimidamavocat
analyzed: tāḍayadbhiḥ utkrośadbhiḥ pṛṣṭhatas nugacchadbhiḥ  dṛṣṭvā ca punar bodhisattvaḥ jānan eva sārathim idam avocat
translated: beating their breasts, screaming, following behind.

analyzed: vaidya
translated: And having seen it, the Bodhisattva, although knowing, said this to the charioteer:

original: kiṃ sārathe puruṣa mañcapari gṛhīto uddhūtakeśanakha pāṃśu śire kṣipanti /
analyzed: kim sārathe uddhūta keśa nakha śire kṣipanti
translated: What, charioteer, is this man who is held on the bier, and who has his hair and nails grown long, and is covered with dust,

analyzed: paricārayitvā viharanti uraḥ tāḍayantaḥ nānā vilāpa vacanāni udīrayantaḥ
translated: and whom they carry around, striking their breasts and uttering various lamentations?

analyzed: sārathiḥ āha
translated: The charioteer said:

original: eṣo hi deva puruṣo mṛtu jambudvīpe nahi bhūyu mātṛpitṛ drakṣyati putradārāṃ /
analyzed: eṣaḥ hi deva puruṣaḥ jambudvīpe nahi bhūyu mātṛ pitṛ drakṣyati putra dārān
translated: O Lord, this man is dead in Jambudvipa. He will never again see his mother, father, son, or wife,

analyzed: apahāya bhogagṛha mātṛ pitṛ
translated: having left behind his wealth, home, mother, father,
