analyzed: vaidya
translated: physician

original: yatte dṛṣṭā bhūṣaṇā uhyamānā cūḍā vastrā mahya mañce 'dṛśāsi /
analyzed: yat te dṛṣṭā bhūṣaṇā uhyamānā cūḍā vastrā mahya mañce
translated: What you saw, the ornaments floating, the hair and clothes on my bed,

original: kṣipraṃ gope lakṣaṇairbhūṣitāṅgaṃ māṃ saṃpaśyī sarvalokaiḥ stuvantam // / //
analyzed: kṣipram gope lakṣaṇaiḥ bhūṣita aṅgam mām saṃpaśyī sarva lokaiḥ stuvantam
translated: Quickly, O Gopā, may I be seen by all the world, my body adorned with the marks, and being praised.

original: yatte dṛṣṭā dīpakoṭīśatāni nagarānniṣkrāntā tatpuraṃ cāndhakāram /
analyzed: yat te dṛṣṭā dīpa koṭī śatāni nagarāt niṣkrāntā tat puram ca andhakāram
translated: If you have seen hundreds of millions of lamps, leaving the city and that city in darkness,

original: kṣipraṃ gope mohavidyāndhakāre prajñāloke kurvamī sarvalokam // / //
analyzed: kṣipram gope moha vidyā andhakāre prajñā loke sarva lokam
translated: Quickly, O Gopā, having cut through the darkness of delusion and ignorance, may I make the light of wisdom shine in the whole world.

original: yatte dṛṣṭaṃ muktahāraṃ prabhagnaṃ chinnaṃ caiva svarṇasūtraṃ vicitram /
analyzed: yat te dṛṣṭam mukta hāram prabhagnam chinnam ca eva svarṇa sūtram vicitram
translated: If you have seen a broken and shattered pearl necklace, and a beautiful golden thread cut,

original: kṣipraṃ gope kleśajālaṃ chinitvā saṃjñā sūtraṃ uddharī saṃskṛtātaḥ // / //
analyzed: kṣipram gope kleśa jālam chinitvā saṃjñā sūtram saṃskṛtā atas
translated: Quickly, O Gopā, having cut through the net of afflictions, may I pull out the thread of perception from conditioned existence.

original: yatte gope cittikāraṃ karoṣī nityaṃ pūjāṃ gauraveṇottamena /
analyzed: yat te gope cittikāram karoṣi nityam pūjām gauraveṇa uttamena
translated: If you have made an offering to me, O Gopā, always with the highest respect and honor,

original: nāstī tubhyaṃ durgatī naiva śokaḥ kṣipraṃ bhohī prītiprāmodyalabdhā // / //
analyzed: tubhyam durgatī nā eva śokaḥ kṣipram prīti prāmodya labdhā
translated: You will have no bad rebirths or sorrow, and will quickly attain joy and delight.

original: pūrve mahyaṃ dānu dattaṃ praṇītaṃ śīlaṃ cīrṇaṃ bhāvitā nityakṣānti /
analyzed: pūrve mahyam dānu dattam praṇītam śīlam cīrṇam bhāvitā nitya kṣānti
translated: In the past, I gave excellent gifts, practiced morality, and always cultivated patience.

original: tasmānmahyaṃ ye prasādaṃ labhante sarve bhontī prītiprāmodyalābhāḥ // / //
analyzed: tasmāt mahyam ye prasādam labhante sarve prīti prāmodya lābhāḥ
translated: Therefore, those who attain faith in me, all attain joy and delight.

original: kalpā koṭī saṃskṛtā me anantā bodhīmārgo śodhito me praṇītaḥ /
analyzed: kalpā koṭī saṃskṛtā me anantā bodhī mārgaḥ śodhitaḥ me praṇītaḥ
translated: For countless millions of eons, I have purified the excellent path to enlightenment.

original: tasmānmahyaṃ ye prasādaṃ karonti sarve chinnā teṣu trīṇyapyapāyāḥ // / //
analyzed: tasmāt mahyam ye prasādam karonti sarve chinnā teṣu trīṇi api apāyāḥ
translated: Therefore, those who have faith in me, for them all three lower realms are cut off.

original: harṣaṃ vindā mā ca khedaṃ janehi tuṣṭiṃ vindā saṃjanehī ca prītim /🔽kṣipraṃ bheṣye prītiprāmodyalābhī sehī gope bhadrakā te nimittā // / //
analyzed: harṣam vinda mā ca khedam janehi tuṣṭim vinda saṃjanehi ca prītim  kṣipram bheṣye prīti prāmodya lābhī sehī gope bhadrakā te nimittā
translated: Find joy and do not give rise to sorrow, find contentment and generate love.🔽You will soon attain joy and delight, keep these auspicious signs, O protector.

original: so puṇyatejabharito siritejagarbho pūrve nimittasupine imi adṛśāsi /
analyzed: saḥ puṇya teja bharitaḥ siriteja garbho pūrve nimitta supine
translated: He, filled with the splendor of merit, the womb of glorious splendor, in the past saw these signs in a dream:

analyzed: vaidya
translated: Physician

analyzed: ye bhonti pūrva śubha karma samuccayānām naiṣkramya kāla samaye nara puṃgavānām
translated: For those who are the foremost of men, who have accumulated good karma in the past, at the time of their renunciation...

original: so adṛśāsi ca karāccaraṇāddhatānā mahasāgarebhi catubhirjala lolayantā /
analyzed: sā adṛśāsi ca karāt caraṇāt hatānā maha sāgarebhi catubhiḥ jala lolayantā
translated: He saw his hands and feet cut off, and the four great oceans churning with water,

original: sarvāmimāṃ vasumatīṃ śayanaṃ vicitraṃ meruṃ ca parvatavaraṃ śirasopadhānam // / //🔽ābhā pramukta supine tada adṛśāsi loke vilokitu mahātamasāndhakāram /
analyzed: sarvām imām vasumatīm śayanam vicitram merum ca parvata varam śirasā upadhānam  ābhā pramukta supine loke mahā tamasā andhakāram
translated: This entire earth as a variegated bed, and Mount Meru, the best of mountains, as a pillow for his head...🔽In the dream he saw light emitted, illuminating the world with great darkness and obscurity.

original: chatrodgataṃ dharaṇiye spharate trilokaṃ ābhāya spṛṣṭa vinipātadukhā praśāntā // / //
analyzed: chatra udgatam spharate trilokam
translated: A parasol arose and spread throughout the three worlds, those touched by its light had their suffering from falling calamities pacified...

original: kṛṣṇā śubhā caturi prāṇaka pāda lekhī catuvarṇa etva śakunādbhuta ekavarṇāḥ /
analyzed: kṛṣṇā śubhā prāṇaka pāda lekhī catuvarṇa etva śakunādbhuta ekavarṇāḥ
translated: A black and auspicious four-legged creature with four claws, with four colors, a wondrous one-colored bird came.

original: mīḍhaṃgirī paramahīna jugupsanīyā abhibhūya caṃkramati tatra ca nopalipto // / //
analyzed: mīḍhaṃgirī parama hīna jugupsanīyāḥ abhibhūya caṃkramati tatra ca
translated: A very low, contemptible, and disgusting mountain was overcome, and he walked there without being defiled.

original: bhūyo 'dṛśī supini nadya jalaprapūrṇā bahusattvakoṭinayutāni ca uhyamānā /
analyzed: bhūyas jala prapūrṇā bahu sattva koṭi nayutāni ca uhyamānā
translated: Again, in a dream he saw a river full of water, and many millions and billions of beings being carried away.

original: so nāva kṛtva prataritva parāṃ pratārya sthāpeti so sthalavare abhaye aśoke // / //
analyzed: saḥ nāva kṛtva prataritva parām pratārya sthāpaya iti saḥ sthalavare abhaye aśoke
translated: Having made a boat, he crossed over and ferried others across, and established them on a safe and secure shore free from sorrow.

original: bhūyo 'dṛśāti bahu ātura rogaspṛṣṭāṃ ārogyatejarahitāṃ balaviprahīnāṃ /
analyzed: bhūyas bahu ātura roga spṛṣṭām ārogya teja rahitām bala viprahīnām
translated: Again, he saw many sick and afflicted beings, devoid of health and vigor, and lacking strength.

original: so vaidya bhūtva bahu oṣadha saṃprayacchā moceti sattvanayutāṃ bahurogaspṛṣṭāṃ // / //🔽siṃhāsane va hi niṣaṇṇa sumerupṛṣṭhe śiṣyāṃ kṛtāñjalipuṭānamarānnamantāṃ /
analyzed: saḥ vaidya bhūtvā bahu oṣadha saṃprayaccha ā moca iti sattva na yutām bahu roga spṛṣṭām  siṃhāsane hi sumeru pṛṣṭhe śiṣyām kṛtāñjali puṭān amarān namantām
translated: Having become a doctor, he gave them many medicines, and freed many millions of beings afflicted with various illnesses.🔽Seated on a lion throne on the back of Mount Sumeru, with his disciples, the gods with palms joined in reverence,

original: saṃgrāmamadhyi jayu adṛśi ātmanaśca ānandaśabdamamarāṃ gagane bruvantaḥ // / //
analyzed: ātmanaḥ ca ānanda śabdam amarām gagane bruvantaḥ
translated: And in the midst of a battle, he saw himself victorious, and the gods in the sky proclaiming cries of joy.

original: evaṃvidhā supini adṛśi bodhisattvo maṅgalya śobhanavratasya ca pāripūrim /
analyzed: evaṃvidhā bodhisattvaḥ maṅgalya śobhana vratasya ca pāripūrim
translated: Such were the dreams the Bodhisattva saw, of the fulfillment of his auspicious and beautiful vow.

original: yāṃ śrutva devamanujā abhavanprahṛṣṭā na cirādbhaviṣyati ayaṃ naradevadevaḥ // / //
analyzed: yām śrutva deva manujāḥ abhavan prahṛṣṭāḥ na cirāt bhaviṣyati ayam naradeva devaḥ
translated: Hearing which, the gods and humans were delighted, thinking, 'Before long, this god of gods, the king of men, will appear.'

analyzed: iti
translated: Thus it is.

analyzed: iti śrī lalitavistare svapnaparivartaḥ nāma caturdaśaḥ dhyāyaḥ
translated: Thus ends the fourteenth chapter, on the dream, in the Mahāvastu-Avadāna.

original: START Parivarta🔽Vaidya 🔽abhiniṣkramaṇaparivartaḥ pañcadaśaḥ /🔽atha khalu bhikṣavo bodhisattvasyaitadabhūt ayuktametanmama syādakṛtajñatā ca yadahamaprativedya mahārājñaḥ śuddhodanasya ananujñātaśca pitrā
analyzed: start parivarta  vaidya  abhiniṣkramaṇa parivartaḥ pañcadaśaḥ  atha khalu bhikṣavaḥ bodhisattvasya etat abhūt ayuktam etat mama syāt akṛtajña tā ca yat aham a prativedya mahā rājñaḥ śuddhodanasya ananujñātaḥ ca pitrā  /
translated: Chapter 15: The Great Departure

analyzed: niṣkrameyam
translated: Then, monks, the Bodhisattva thought, It would not be right for me, it would not be becoming, it would not be of me, it would be ungrateful, if I were to go forth without informing the great king Śuddhodana and without taking leave of him.

original: sa rātrau praśāntāyāṃ svakādupasthānaprāsādādavatīrya rājñaḥ śuddhodanasya prāsādatale pratiṣṭhito 'bhūt /
analyzed: sa rātrau praśāntāyām svakāt upasthāna prāsādāt avatīrya rājñaḥ śuddhodanasya prāsāda tale pratiṣṭhitaḥ bhūt
translated: He descended from his own reception palace and stood on the palace floor of King Śuddhodana.

original: pratiṣṭhitamātrasya ca punarbodhisattvasya sarvo 'sau prāsāda ābhayā sphuṭo 'bhūt /
analyzed: pratiṣṭhita mātrasya ca punar bodhisattvasya sarvaḥ sau prāsādaḥ ābhayā sphuṭaḥ bhūt
translated: And as soon as the Bodhisattva had stood there, the whole palace was filled with light.

analyzed: tatra rājā prativibuddhaḥ tām prabhām adrākṣīt
translated: There the king awoke and saw the light.

original: dṛṣṭvā ca punastvaritaṃ tvaritaṃ kāñcukiyamāmantrayāmāsa kiṃ bhoḥ kāñcukīya sūryo 'bhyudgato yeneyaṃ prabhā virājate /
analyzed: dṛṣṭvā ca punar tvaritam tvaritam kāñcukiyam āmantrayāmāsa kim bhoḥ kāñcukīya sūryaḥ bhyudgataḥ yena iyam prabhā virājate
translated: And seeing this, he quickly called to the chamberlain, What is it, good chamberlain? Has the sun risen, that this radiance shines forth?

original: kāñcukīya āha adyāpi tāvadeva rajanyā upārdhaṃ nātikrāntam / api ca deva
analyzed: kāñcukīyaḥ āha adya api tāvat eva rajanyāḥ upārdham na atikrāntam api ca deva
translated: The chamberlain said, It is still only midnight, not yet past. Moreover, Your Majesty,

original: sūryaprabhāya bhavate drumakuḍyachāyā saṃtāpayāti ca tanuṃ prakaroti dharmam /
analyzed: sūrya prabhāya bhavate druma kuḍya chāyā saṃtāpayāti ca tanum prakaroti dharmam
translated: The sun's rays, O King, cast shadows of trees and walls, and heat the body, producing the Dharma.

analyzed: haṃsāḥ mayūra śuka kokila cakravākāḥ pratyūṣa kāla samaye sva rutām ravanti
translated: Geese, peacocks, parrots, cuckoos, and ruddy geese sing at dawn.

original: ābhā iyaṃ tu naradeva sukhā manojñā prahlādanī śubhakarī na karoti dāham /
analyzed: ābhā iyam tu naradeva sukhā manojñā prahlādanī śubha karī na karoti dāham
translated: But this light, O King, is pleasant and delightful, refreshing and auspicious, and does not burn.

original: kuḍyā ca vṛkṣa abhibhūya na cāsti chāyā niḥsaṃśayaṃ guṇadharo iha adya prāptaḥ // / //
analyzed: ca vṛkṣa na ca asti chāyā niḥsaṃśayam guṇa dharaḥ iha adya prāptaḥ
translated: It overpowers the walls and trees, and there is no shadow. Without a doubt, one possessing virtues has arrived here.

original: so prekṣate daśadiśo nṛpatī viṣaṇṇo dṛṣṭaśca so kamalalocana śuddhasattvaḥ /
analyzed: saḥ prekṣate daśa diśaḥ nṛpatī viṣaṇṇaḥ dṛṣṭaḥ ca saḥ kamala locana śuddha sattvaḥ
translated: The king, despondent, looks in the ten directions, and sees that lotus-eyed one of pure being.

original: so 'bhyutthituṃ śayani icchati na prabhoti pitṛgauravaṃ janayate varaśuddhabuddhiḥ // / //
analyzed: saḥ bhyutthitum śayani icchati na pitṛ gauravam janayate vara śuddha buddhiḥ
translated: He wishes to rise from his bed, but is unable. The one of excellent pure mind generates reverence for his father.

original: so ca sthihitva purato nṛpatiṃ avocat mā bhūyu vighna prakarohi ma caiva khedam /
analyzed: saḥ ca sthihitva puratas nṛpatim avocat mā vighna prakarohi ca eva khedam
translated: Standing in front of the king, he said, Do not create obstacles for me again, and do not be distressed.

original: naiṣkramyakālasamayo mama deva yukto hanta kṣamasva nṛpate sajanaḥ sarāṣṭraḥ // / //
analyzed: naiṣkramya kāla samayaḥ mama deva yuktaḥ hanta kṣamasva nṛpate sa janaḥ sa rāṣṭraḥ
translated: O king, the time has come for me to leave home. Please grant me permission, O king, along with your people and the kingdom.

original: taṃ aśrupūrṇanayano nṛpatī babhāṣe kiṃcitprayojanu bhavedvinivartane te /
analyzed: tam aśru pūrṇa nayanaḥ nṛpatī babhāṣe kiṃcid bhavet vinivartane te
translated: The king, with tears in his eyes, said to him, If there is some reason for you to return,

original: kiṃ yācase mama varaṃ vada sarva dāsye anugṛhṇa rājakulu māṃ ca idaṃ ca rāṣṭram // / //
analyzed: kim yācase mama varam vada sarva dāsye anugṛhṇa mām ca idam ca rāṣṭram
translated: what do you want? Tell me, I will give you everything. Please favor the royal family, me, and this kingdom.

analyzed: vaidya
translated: Vidy

original: tada bodhisattva avacī madhurapralāpī icchāmi deva caturo vara tān mi dehi /
analyzed: madhura pralāpī icchāmi deva caturaḥ vara tān dehi
translated: Then the Bodhisattva, speaking sweetly, said, O king, if you are able to give me these four boons, I wish to return.

original: yadi śakyase daditu mahya vase ti tatra tad drakṣyase sada gṛhe na ca niṣkramiṣye // / //
analyzed: yadi śakyase ti tatra tat drakṣyase sada gṛhe na ca niṣkramiṣye
translated: If you are able to give them to me, I will stay here. Otherwise, I will not leave home.

original: icchāmi deva jara mahya na ākrameyyā
analyzed: icchāmi deva jara naḥ ākrameyyā
translated: O king, I wish that old age does not overtake me.

analyzed: śubha varṇa yauvana sthitaḥ nityakālam
translated: I wish to always remain in youthful beauty.

original: ārogyaprāptu bhavi no ca bhaveta vyādhiḥ
analyzed: ārogya prāptu no ca bhaveta vyādhiḥ
translated: I wish to attain good health and not have any illness.

original: amitāyuṣaśca bhavi no ca bhaveta mṛtyuḥ saṃpattitaśca vipulā nu bhavedvipattiḥ // / //
analyzed: amita āyuṣaḥ ca bhavi no ca bhaveta mṛtyuḥ saṃpattitaḥ ca vipulā nu bhavet vipattiḥ
translated: I wish to have an immeasurable lifespan and not die. I wish for vast prosperity and no adversity.

original: rājā śruṇitva vacanaṃ paramaṃ dukhārto asthānu yācasi kumāra na me 'tra śaktiḥ /
analyzed: rājā vacanam paramam dukha ārtaḥ yācasi kumāra na me śaktiḥ
translated: The king, hearing these words, was extremely distressed. He said, Prince, what you ask for is impossible. I have no power over this.

original: jaravyādhimṛtyubhayataśca vipattitaśca kalpasthitīya ṛṣayo 'pi na jātu muktāḥ // / //
analyzed: jarā vyādhi mṛtyu bhayataḥ ca vipattitaḥ ca kalpasthitīye ṛṣayaḥ na jātu muktāḥ
translated: Even the sages who remain for an eon are never free from the dangers of old age, sickness, death, and misfortune.

original: yadidāni deva caturo vara no dadāsi jaravyādhimṛtyubhayataśca vipattitaśca /
analyzed: yat idāni deva caturaḥ vara naḥ dadāsi jara vyādhi mṛtyu bhayataḥ ca vipattitaḥ ca
translated: If now, O King, you grant me these four boons: old age, sickness, death, and misfortune,

original: hanta śṛṇuṣva nṛpate aparaṃ varaikaṃ asmāccyutasya pratisaṃdhi na me bhaveyā // / //
analyzed: hanta śṛṇuṣva nṛpate aparam vara ekam asmāt cyutasya pratisaṃdhi na me bhaveyā
translated: then listen, O King, to another boon: may I not be reborn after passing from here.

original: śrutvaiva cema vacanaṃ narapuṃgavasya tṛṣṇā tanuṃ ca kari chindati putrasneham /
analyzed: śrutvā eva ca ima vacanam nara puṃgavasya tṛṣṇā tanum ca kari chindati putra sneham
translated: Having heard these words of the best of men, craving and attachment to his son were diminished and cut off.

original: anumodamī hitakarā jagati pramokṣaṃ abhiprāyu tubhya paripūryatu yanmataṃ te // / //
analyzed: hita karāḥ jagati pramokṣam paripūryatu yat matam te
translated: I rejoice in the liberation of the world, O Benefactor. May your intention, what you have in mind, be fulfilled.

original: atha khalu bhikṣavo bodhisattvaḥ pratikramya svake prāsāde 'bhiruhya śayane niṣasāda /
analyzed: atha khalu bhikṣavaḥ bodhisattvaḥ pratikramya svake prāsāde bhiruhya śayane niṣasāda
translated: Then, monks, the Bodhisattva descended and ascended his own palace, and sat down on the bed.

original: na cāsya kaścidgamanaṃ vā āgamanaṃ vā saṃjānīte sma //
analyzed: na ca asya kaścid gamanam vā āgamanam vā saṃjānīte sma
translated: And no one noticed his coming or going.

original: iti hi bhikṣavo rājā śuddhodanastasyā rātryā atyayena sarvaṃ śākyagaṇaṃ saṃnipātyaināṃ prakṛtimārocayati sma abhiniṣkramiṣyati kumāraḥ /
analyzed: iti hi bhikṣavaḥ rājā śuddhodanaḥ tasyāḥ rātryāḥ atyayena sarvam śākya gaṇam saṃnipātya enām prakṛtim ārocayati sma abhiniṣkramiṣyati kumāraḥ
translated: Monks, in this way, after the night had passed, King Śuddhodana assembled the entire Śākya clan and announced this situation: “The prince will go forth.

analyzed: tat kim kariṣyāmaḥ
translated: What should we do?”

analyzed: śākyāḥ āhuḥ rakṣām deva kariṣyāmaḥ
translated: The Śākyas said, “Your Majesty, we will provide protection.”

original: tatkasmāt / ayaṃ ca mahāñśākyagaṇaḥ / sa caikākī /
analyzed: tat kasmāt ayam ca mahān śākya gaṇaḥ sa ca ekākī
translated: Why is that? This great Śākya clan and he is alone.

analyzed: tat kā tasya śaktiḥ asti balāt abhiniṣkramitum
translated: What power does he have to go forth by force?”

original: tatra taiḥ śākyai rājñā śuddhodanena ca pañca śākyakumāraśatāni kṛtāstrāṇi kṛtayogyāni
analyzed: tatra taiḥ śākyaiḥ rājñā śuddhodanena ca pañca śākya kumāra śatāni kṛtāstrāṇi kṛta yogyāni
translated: Thereupon, the Śākyas and King Śuddhodana stationed five hundred Śākya youths, skilled in arms and battle,

original: iṣvastraśikṣitāni mahānagnabalopetāni pūrve nagaradvāre sthāpitānyabhūvan bodhisattvasya rakṣaṇārtham /🔽ekaikaśca śākyakumāraḥ pañcarathaśataparivāraḥ /
analyzed: iṣu astra śikṣitāni mahā nagna bala upetāni pūrve nagara dvāre sthāpitāni abhūvan bodhisattvasya rakṣaṇa artham  ekaikaḥ ca śākya kumāraḥ pañca ratha śata parivāraḥ
translated: trained in archery, and endowed with great physical strength, at the eastern gate of the city for the protection of the Bodhisattva.🔽Each Śākya youth had a retinue of five hundred chariots,

original: ekaikaṃ ca rathaṃ pañcapattiśataparivāraṃ sthāpitamabhūt Vaidya
analyzed: ekaikam ca ratham pañca patti śata parivāram sthāpitam abhūt vaidya
translated: and each chariot had a retinue of five hundred infantry.

analyzed: bodhisattvasya rakṣaṇa artham
translated: For the protection of the Bodhisattva,🔽they were stationed there.

original: evaṃ dakṣiṇe paścime uttare nagaradvāre pañca pañca śākyakumāraśatāni kṛtāstrāṇi kṛtayogyāni iṣvastraśikṣitāni mahānagnabalopetāni /
analyzed: evam dakṣiṇe paścime uttare nagara dvāre pañca pañca śākya kumāra śatāni kṛtāstrāṇi kṛta yogyāni iṣu astra śikṣitāni mahā nagna bala upetāni
translated: In the same way, at the southern, western, and northern city gates, there were five hundred Śākya youths each, skilled in weapons, trained in archery, and endowed with great strength.

analyzed: ekaikaḥ ca śākya kumāraḥ pañca ratha śata parivāraḥ
translated: Each Śākya youth had a retinue of five hundred chariots,

original: ekaikaṃ ca rathaṃ pañcapattiśataparivāraṃ sthāpitamabhūta bodhisattvasya rakṣārtham /
analyzed: ekaikam ca ratham pañca patti śata parivāram sthāpitam abhūta bodhisattvasya rakṣā artham
translated: and each chariot had a retinue of five hundred infantry, stationed for the protection of the Bodhisattva.

analyzed: mahallaka mahallikāḥ ca śākyāḥ sarva catvara śṛṅgāṭaka pūga rathyā svārakṣā artham sthitāḥ abhavan
translated: The elder Śākyas were stationed at all the crossroads, intersections, and streets for the sake of protection.

original: rājā ca śuddhodanaḥ pañcabhiḥ śākyakumāraśataiḥ sārdhaṃ parivṛtaḥ puraskṛtaḥ svake gṛhadvāre hayeṣu ca gajeṣu ca samabhiruhya jāgarti sma /
analyzed: rājā ca śuddhodanaḥ pañcabhiḥ śākya kumāra śataiḥ sārdham parivṛtaḥ puraskṛtaḥ svake gṛha dvāre hayeṣu ca gajeṣu ca samabhiruhya jāgarti sma
translated: King Śuddhodana, surrounded and honored by five hundred Śākya youths, mounted his horse and elephant and kept watch at the door of his own house.

original: mahāprajāpatī ca gotamī ceṭīvargamāmantrayate sma 🔽jvāletha dīpa vimalāṃ dhvajāgri maṇiratna sarvi sthāpethā /
analyzed: mahāprajāpatī ca gotamī ceṭī vargam āmantrayate sma  jvāletha dīpa vimalām dhvaja agri maṇi ratna sarvi sthāpethāḥ
translated: Mahāprajāpatī Gautamī addressed the group of maidservants:🔽Light the pure lamps, place jewels and gems at the top of the banners,

original: olambayātha hārāṃ prabhāṃ kuruta sarvi gehesmin // / //
analyzed: olambaya atha hārām prabhām kuruta sarvi gehe ismin
translated: hang garlands, and make all the lights shine in this house.

original: saṃgīti yojayethā jāgaratha atandritā imāṃ rajanīm /
analyzed: saṃgīti yojayethāḥ jāgaratha atandritāḥ imām rajanīm
translated: You should engage in music and be alert and diligent throughout this night.

original: pratirakṣathā kumāraṃ yathā avidito na gaccheyā // / //
analyzed: pratirakṣatha kumāram yathā a viditaḥ na gaccheyā
translated: You should protect the prince so that he does not leave unnoticed.

analyzed: varmita kalāpa hastāḥ asi dhanu śara śakti tomara gṛhītāḥ
translated: With your hands adorned with armlets and bracelets, holding swords, bows, arrows, spears, lances, and javelins,

analyzed: priya tanaya rakṣaṇa artham karotha sarve mahā yatnam
translated: all of you should make great effort for the protection of the beloved prince.

original: dvārāṃ pithetha sarvāṃ suyantritāṃ nirgaḍāṃ dṛḍhakapāṭāṃ /
analyzed: sarvām su yantritām nirgaḍām dṛḍha kapāṭām
translated: You should close all the doors securely, with bolts and strong locks,

original: muñcatha mā ca akāle mā agrasattva itu na vrajeyā // / //🔽maṇihāramuktahārāṃ mukhapuṣpake ardhacandra saśṛṅkhalāḥ /
analyzed: muñcatha mā ca akāle mā agra sattve itu na vrajeyā  maṇi hāra mukta hārām mukhapuṣpake ardhacandra sa śṛṅkhalāḥ
translated: and do not open them at the wrong time, so that the supreme being does not leave from here.🔽You should wear necklaces of pearls and gems, flower garlands, half-moons, chains,

analyzed: mekhala karṇika mudrika su nibaddhām nūpurām kuruta
translated: waistbands, earrings, signet rings, well-fastened anklets, and bracelets.

analyzed: yadi sahasa niṣkrameyāḥ matta vāraṇa vicārī
translated: If he suddenly leaves, like a mad elephant in rut, wandering among humans and gods,

original: tatha tatha parākramathā yathā vighātaṃ na vindeyā // / //
analyzed: tatha tatha parākramathāḥ yathā vighātam na vindeyā
translated: you should act in such a way that he does not find any obstacles.

original: yā nāri śaktidhārī śayanaṃ parivārayantu vimalasya /
analyzed: yā nāri śakti dhārī śayanam parivārayantu vimalasya
translated: Those women who are strong, let them surround the bed of the pure one,

original: ma ca bhavatha middhavihatāḥ pataṃga iva rakṣathā netraiḥ // / //
analyzed: ca bhavatha middha vihatāḥ pataṃgaḥ iva rakṣatha netraiḥ
translated: and do not be overcome by sleep. Protect him with your eyes, like moths [protect a flame].

original: chādetha ratanajālai idaṃ gṛhaṃ pārthivasya rakṣārtham /
analyzed: chādetha idam gṛham pārthivasya rakṣā artham
translated: Cover this palace of the king with nets of jewels for protection.

original: veṇūravāṃśca ravathā imāṃ rajani rakṣathā virajām // / //
analyzed: veṇūravān ca ravatha imām rajani rakṣatha virajām
translated: And make the sound of flutes, and protect this dust-free night.

original: anyonya bodhayethā ma vasayathā rakṣathā imāṃ rajanīm /
analyzed: anyonya bodhayethāḥ mā vasayathāḥ rakṣathāḥ imām rajanīm
translated: You should awaken each other, and stay here, and protect this night.

original: mā hu abhiniṣkramethā vijahya rāṣṭraṃ ca rājyaṃ ca // / //🔽etasya nirgatasyā rājakulaṃ sarvimaṃ nirabhiramyam /
analyzed: mā hu abhiniṣkramethāḥ vijahya rāṣṭram ca rājyam ca  etasya nirgatasyāḥ rājakulam sarva imam nirabhiramyam
translated: Do not go out, abandoning the kingdom and the royal family.🔽When he leaves, this entire royal palace will become joyless.

analyzed: ucchinnaḥ ca bhaveyā pārthiva vaṃśaḥ ciranubaddhaḥ
translated: And the long-established royal lineage will be cut off.

analyzed: atha khalu bhikṣavaḥ ṣṭāviṃśati mahā yakṣa senāpatayaḥ pāñcikayajña senāpati pūrvaṃgamāni
translated: Then, monks, the twenty-eight great yaksha generals, headed by Panchika the yaksha general,

original: ca pañcahāritīputraśatānyekasmin saṃnipātyaivaṃ mataṃ vicārayanti sma adya mārṣā
analyzed: ca pañca hāritīputra śatāni ekasmin saṃnipātya evam matam vicārayanti sma adya mārṣā
translated: and the five hundred sons of Harita,

analyzed: bodhisattvaḥ bhiniṣkramiṣyati
translated: said, Friends, today the Bodhisattva will go forth.

analyzed: tasya yuṣmābhiḥ pūjā karmaṇe autsukyam āpattavyam
translated: You should eagerly perform acts of worship for him.

analyzed: vaidya
translated: Vaidya

original: catvāraśca mahārājāno alakavatīṃ rājadhānīṃ praviśya tāṃ mahatīṃ yakṣaparṣadamāmantrayate sma adya mārṣā bodhisattvo 'bhiniṣkramiṣyati /
analyzed: catvāraḥ ca mahā rājānaḥ alakavatīm rājadhānīm praviśya tām mahatīm yakṣa parṣadam āmantrayate sma adya mārṣāḥ bodhisattvaḥ bhiniṣkramiṣyati
translated: The Four Great Kings entered the royal capital of Alakavatī and addressed the great assembly of yakṣas: 'Today, friends, the Bodhisattva will go forth.

analyzed: sa yuṣmābhiḥ ha yavara caraṇa parigṛhītaḥ niṣkrāmayitavyaḥ
translated: You should receive him with offerings and escort him as he leaves.'

analyzed: sā ca yakṣa parṣad āha
translated: And that assembly of yakṣas said:

original: vajradṛḍha abhedya nārāyaṇo ātmabhāvo guru vīryabalaupetu so 'kampito sarvasattvottamaḥ /
analyzed: vajra dṛḍha abhedya nārāyaṇaḥ ātma bhāvaḥ guru saḥ kampitaḥ sarva sattva uttamaḥ
translated: 'Indestructible, unbreakable, with the body of Nārāyaṇa, heavy, endowed with the strength of perseverance, unshakable, supreme over all beings,

original: girivara mahameru utpāṭya śakyaṃ nabhe dhārituṃ kenacit na tu jinaguṇameru śailairguruḥ puṇyajñānāśritaḥ śakya netuṃ kvacit // / //
analyzed: giri vara utpāṭya śakyam nabhe dhāritum kenacid na tu śailaiḥ guruḥ puṇya jñāna āśritaḥ netum kvacid
translated: The best of mountains, Mount Meru, can be uprooted and held in the sky by someone, but the mountain of the Victor's qualities, heavy with the support of merit and knowledge, cannot be taken anywhere.'

analyzed: vaiśravaṇaḥ āha
translated: Vaiśravaṇa said:

original: ye mānagarvita narā guru teṣu śāstā ye premagauravasthitā laghu te vijāni /
analyzed: ye narāḥ guru teṣu śāstā ye prema gaurava sthitāḥ laghu te
translated: Those people who are proud and arrogant, for whom the teacher is heavy, those who abide in love and respect, they should be known as light.

original: adhyāśayena abhiyujyatha gauraveṇa laghu taṃ hi vetsyatha khagā iva tūlapeśim // / //
analyzed: adhyāśayena abhiyujyatha gauraveṇa laghu tam hi vetsyatha khagāḥ iva tūla peśim
translated: Apply yourself with superior intention and respect, and you will quickly know him, like birds know a tuft of cotton.'

original: ahaṃ ca purato yāsye yūyaṃ ca vahathā hayam /
analyzed: aham ca puratas yāsye yūyam ca vahathā hayam
translated: I will go in front, and you will carry the horse.

analyzed: naiṣkramye bodhisattvasya puṇyam ārjayāmaḥ bahum
translated: We will accumulate much merit for the Bodhisattva's renunciation.

original: atha khalu bhikṣavaḥ śakro devānāmindro devāṃstrāyatriṃśānāmantrayate sma adya mārṣā bodhisattvo 'bhiniṣkramiṣyati /
analyzed: atha khalu bhikṣavaḥ śakraḥ devānām indraḥ devān trāyatriṃśān āmantrayate sma adya mārṣāḥ bodhisattvaḥ bhiniṣkramiṣyati
translated: Then, monks, Śakra, lord of the gods, addressed the gods of the Thirty-Three: Today, friends, the Bodhisattva will go forth.

original: tatra yuṣmābhiḥ sarvaiḥ pūjākarmaṇe autsukyena bhavitavyam //
analyzed: tatra yuṣmābhiḥ sarvaiḥ pūjā karmaṇe autsukyena bhavitavyam
translated: There, all of you should be eager to perform acts of worship.

original: tatra śāntamatirnāma devaputraḥ sa evamāha ahaṃ tāvatkapilavastuni mahānagare sarvastrīpuruṣadārakadārikāṇāṃ prasvāpanaṃ kariṣyāmi /
analyzed: tatra śāntamatiḥ nāma deva putraḥ saḥ evam āha aham tāvat kapilavastuni mahā nagare sarva strī puruṣa dāraka dārikāṇām prasvāpanam kariṣyāmi
translated: There, a god named Śāntamati said this: I will put everyone in the great city of Kapilavastu, all the women, men, boys, and girls, to sleep.

original: lalitavyūho nāma devaputraḥ sa evamāha ahamapi sarvahayagajakharoṣṭragomahiṣastrīpuruṣadārakadārikāṇāṃ śabdamantardhāpayiṣyāmi /
analyzed: lalitavyūhaḥ nāma deva putraḥ saḥ evam āha aham api sarva haya gaja khara uṣṭra go mahiṣa strī puruṣa dāraka dārikāṇām śabdam antardhāpayiṣyāmi
translated: A god named Lalitavyūha said this: I will also make the sounds of all the horses, elephants, donkeys, camels, cows, buffaloes, women, men, boys, and girls disappear.

original: vyūhamatirnāma devaputraḥ sa evamāha ahaṃ gaganatale saptarathavistārapramāṇaṃ
analyzed: vyūhamatiḥ nāma deva putraḥ saḥ evam āha aham gagana tale sapta ratha vistāra pramāṇam
translated: A god named Vyūhamati said this: I will create in the sky a canopy with a width of seven chariot lengths,

analyzed: ratna vedikā parivṛtam sūryakānta maṇi ratna prabhā ujjvalitam uchrita chatra dhvaja patākam
translated: surrounded by jeweled altars, shining with the light of sun-crystal jewels, with raised parasols, banners, and flags,

analyzed: nānā puṣpa abhikīrṇam nānā gandha ghaṭikā nidhūpitam mārga vyūham kariṣyāmi
translated: I will arrange a path strewn with various flowers and perfumed with various incense burners.

analyzed: yena mārgeṇa bodhisattvaḥ bhiniṣkramiṣyati
translated: By that path the Bodhisattva will go forth.

original: airāvaṇo nāma nāgarājā sa evamāha ahamapi ca svasyāṃ śuṇḍāyāṃ dvātriṃśadyojanapramāṇaṃ kūṭāgāraṃ māpayiṣyāmi /
analyzed: airāvaṇaḥ nāma nāga rājā saḥ evam āha aham api ca svasyām śuṇḍāyām dvātriṃśat yojana pramāṇam kūṭāgāram māpayiṣyāmi
translated: The king of nāgas named Airāvaṇa said this: I will also create a kūṭāgāra thirty-two yojanas in size on my trunk,

original: yatrāpsaraso 'bhiruhya tūryasaṃgītisaṃprabhaṇitena mahatā gītavāditena bodhisattvasyopasthānaparicaryāṃ kurvantyo gamiṣyanti /
analyzed: yatra apsarasaḥ bhiḥ uhya tūrya saṃgīti saṃprabhaṇitena mahatā gīta vāditena bodhisattvasya upasthāna paricaryām kurvantyaḥ gamiṣyanti
translated: where the celestial nymphs will ascend and go, making offerings and service to the Bodhisattva with a great song and music performance.

original: svayaṃ ca śakro devānāmindra evamāha ahaṃ dvārāṇi vivariṣyāmi /
analyzed: svayam ca śakraḥ devānām indraḥ evam āha aham dvārāṇi vivariṣyāmi
translated: Śakra, lord of the gods, himself said this: I will open the doors,

analyzed: mārgam ca saṃdarśayāmi
translated: and I will show the path.

analyzed: dharmacārī devaputraḥ āha aham vikṛtam antaḥpuram upadarśayiṣyāmi
translated: The god Dharmacarin said: I will show the distorted inner palace.

original: saṃcodako devaputra āha ahaṃ bodhisattvaṃ śayanādutthāpayiṣyāmi /
analyzed: saṃcodakaḥ deva putraḥ āha aham bodhisattvam śayanāt utthāpayiṣyāmi
translated: The god Saṃcodaka said: I will arouse the Bodhisattva from his bed.

analyzed: vaidya
translated: physician

original: tatra varuṇaśca nāma nāgarājo manasvī ca nāgarājaḥ sāgaraśca nāgarājo 'navataptaśca
analyzed: tatra varuṇaḥ ca nāma nāga rājaḥ manasvī ca nāga rājaḥ sāgaraḥ ca nāga rājaḥ navataptaḥ ca
translated: There, the nāga kings named Varuṇa, Manasvin, Sāgara, and Anavatapta,

original: nāgarājo nandopanandau nāgarājāvevamāhuḥ vayamapi bodhisattvasya pūjākarmaṇe kālānusārimeghamabhinirmāya
analyzed: nāga rājaḥ nanda upanandau nāga rājau evam āhuḥ vayam api bodhisattvasya pūjā karmaṇe kālānusāri megham abhinirmāya
translated: The nāga kings Nanda and Upananda said this: We will also, in order to worship the Bodhisattva, create a cloud that follows the seasons

analyzed: uragasāra candana cūrṇa varṣam abhivarṣayiṣyāmaḥ
translated: and rain down a shower of uragasāra sandalwood powder.

original: iti hi bhikṣavo devanāgayakṣagandharvaiścāyamevaṃrūpo niścayābhiprāyaścintito 'bhūd vyavasitaśca /
analyzed: iti hi bhikṣavaḥ deva nāga yakṣa gandharvaiḥ ca ayam evaṃrūpaḥ niścaya abhiprāyaḥ cintitaḥ bhūt vyavasitaḥ ca
translated: Thus, monks, this kind of resolution and intention was thought and decided upon by the devas, nāgas, yakṣas, and gandharvas.

analyzed: bodhisattvasya evam dharma cintā anupraviṣṭasya saṃgīti prāsādeṣu sukha śayana gatasya antaḥpura madhya gatasya
translated: While the Bodhisattva was thus engaged in contemplating the Dharma, lying on a comfortable bed in the music hall, in the midst of the harem,

analyzed: pūrva buddha carita vicintayataḥ sarva sattva hitam anucintayataḥ catvāri pūrva praṇidhāna padāni āmukhībhavanti sma
translated: contemplating the conduct of the past buddhas, and thinking of the welfare of all beings, the four former vows came to mind.

analyzed: katamāni catvāri
translated: What were the four?

original: pūrvaṃ mayā svayaṃbhuvāmādhipateyatāmabhilaṣatā sarvajñatāṃ prārthayamānenaivaṃ saṃnāhaḥ
analyzed: pūrvam mayā svayaṃbhuvām ādhipateya tām abhilaṣatā sarvajña tām prārthayamānena evam saṃnāhaḥ
translated: Formerly, when I was aspiring to the lordship of the self-existent ones and seeking omniscience, I put on this armor:🔽Having seen suffering beings, I thought, 'Alas! I will liberate from the great prison of saṃsāra

original: saṃnaddho 'bhūt sattvān duḥkhitān dṛṣṭā aho batāhaṃ saṃsāramahācārakabandhanaprakṣiptasya
analyzed: saṃnaddhaḥ bhūt sattvān duḥkhitān dṛṣṭā aho bata aham saṃsāra mahā ācāraka bandhana prakṣiptasya
translated: those who are thrown into it,

original: lokasaṃniveśasya saṃsāracārakaṃ bhittvā bandhanapramokṣaśabdaṃ codīrayeyaṃ tṛṣṇayā
analyzed: loka saṃniveśasya saṃsāra cārakam bhittvā bandhana pramokṣa śabdam ca udīrayeyam tṛṣṇayā
translated: I would break through the prison of cyclic existence of the world's inhabitants and proclaim the liberation from bondage.

analyzed: sa nigaḍa gāḍha bandhana baddhān ca sattvān pramocayeyam
translated: I would liberate beings bound by thick fetters and chains.

original: idaṃ prathamaṃ pūrvapraṇidhānapadamāmukhībhavati sma //🔽aho batāhaṃ saṃsāramahāvidyāndhakāragahanaprakṣiptasya lokasyājñānapaṭalatimirāvṛtanayanasya prajñācakṣurvirahitasyāvidyāmohāndhakārasya mahāntaṃ
analyzed: idam prathamam pūrva praṇidhāna padam āmukhībhavati sma  aho bata aham saṃsāra mahāvidyā andhakāra gahana prakṣiptasya lokasya ajñāna paṭala timira āvṛta nayanasya prajñā cakṣuḥ virahitasya avidyā moha andhakārasya mahāntam
translated: This is the first former vow that appeared before him.

analyzed: dharma ālokam kuryām
translated: Alas, I would create a great light of the Dharma for the world thrown into the dense darkness of the great ignorance of cyclic existence, whose eyes are covered by the cataract of ignorance, who are devoid of the eye of wisdom, and who are blinded by the darkness of ignorance and delusion.

analyzed: jñāna pradīpam ca upasaṃhareyam
translated: I would bring the lamp of wisdom.

analyzed: tri vimokṣa sukha jñānavatā oṣadhi saṃprayogeṇa ca upāya prajñā jñāna saṃprayuktena sarva avidyā andhakāra tamaḥ hatam mahat timira paṭala kāluṣyam apanīya prajñā cakṣuḥ viśodhayeyam
translated: By the application of the medicine of the knowledge of the bliss of the three liberations, and by the union of wisdom and means, I would remove the great darkness of ignorance, the great blindness, the great cataract of defilements, and purify the eye of wisdom.

analyzed: idam dvitīyam pūrva praṇidhāna padam āmukhībhavati sma
translated: This is the second former vow that appeared before him.

analyzed: aho bata aham māna dhvaja ucchritasya lokasya ahaṃkāra mamakāra abhiniviṣṭasya ātmanīya grāha anuga mānasasya
translated: Alas, for the world that has raised the banner of pride, that is attached to the notion of 'I' and 'mine,' whose mind follows the grasping of 'I' and 'mine,'

analyzed: saṃjñā citta dṛṣṭi viparyāsa viparyastasya asaṃgraha gṛhītasya ārya mārga upadeśena asmimāna dhvaja prapātanam kuryām
translated: I will cause the destruction of the banner of conceit for those who are confused by the perversions of perception, mind, and view, who are not included in the assembly, and who are seized by the afflictions, through teaching the noble path.'

analyzed: iti idam tṛtīyam pūrva praṇidhāna padam āmukhībhavati sma
translated: Thus, the third former vow appeared before him.

analyzed: aho bata aham vyupaśāntasya lokasya tandrā kula jātasya guṇa avaguṇṭhita bhūtasya a javaṃjava samāpannasya asmāt lokāt
translated: 'Alas, I will teach the Dharma that brings peace to the world, which is drowsy and agitated, enveloped in the dust of qualities, engaged in running back and forth, transmigrating from this world

original: paraṃ lokaṃ paralokādimaṃ lokaṃ saṃghāvataḥ saṃsarataḥ saṃsārādabhinivṛttasyālātacakrasamārūḍhasyopaśamikaṃ
analyzed: param lokam para lokāt imam lokam saṃghāvataḥ saṃsarataḥ saṃsārāt abhinivṛttasya alāta cakra samārūḍhasya upaśamikam
translated: to the next world and from the next world to this world, wandering in samsara, emerging from samsara, mounted on the wheel of a whirling firebrand,

analyzed: prajñā tṛpti karam dharmam saṃprakāśayeyam
translated: and brings satisfaction through wisdom.'

analyzed: iti idam caturtham pūrva praṇidhāna padam āmukhībhavati sma
translated: Thus, the fourth former vow appeared before him.

analyzed: imāni catvāri pūrva praṇidhāna padāni āmukhībhavanti sma
translated: These four former vows appeared before him.

original: tasmiṃśca kṣaṇe dharmacāriṇā devaputreṇa śuddhāvāsakāyikaiśca devaputrairvikṛtavigalitamantaḥ puramupadarśitamabhūt /
analyzed: tasmin ca kṣaṇe dharmacāriṇā devaputreṇa śuddhāvāsa kāyikaiḥ ca devaputraiḥ vikṛta vigalitam antar puram upadarśitam abhūt
translated: And at that moment, the god Dharmacarin and the gods of the Pure Abodes revealed to him the inner palace, which was disfigured and in disarray.

original: visaṃsthitaṃ bībhatsarūpamupadarśya ca gaganatalasthāste bodhisattvaṃ gāthābhiradhyabhāṣanta
analyzed: visaṃsthitam bībhatsa rūpam upadarśya ca gagana tala sthāḥ te bodhisattvam gāthābhiḥ adhyabhāṣanta
translated: And having shown him the repulsive form of the dismembered body, they, standing in the sky, spoke to the Bodhisattva in verses:

analyzed: athā abruvan deva sutāḥ mahā ṛddhayaḥ vibuddha padma āyata locanam tam
translated: Then the gods of great power said to him, whose eyes were wide like blooming lotuses:

analyzed: katham tava asmin upajāyate ratiḥ śmaśāna madhye samavasthitasya
translated: How can you find delight in this, dwelling in the midst of a charnel ground?

original: saṃcoditaḥ so 'tha sureśvarebhiḥ nirīkṣate 'ntaḥpura taṃ muhūrtam /
analyzed: saṃcoditaḥ saḥ tha sureśvarebhiḥ nirīkṣate ntaḥpura tam muhūrtam
translated: Thus exhorted by the lords of the gods, he looked at the harem for a moment.

analyzed: vaidya
translated: Vaidya

original: saṃpreṣate paśyati tāṃ bibhatsāṃ śmaśānamadhye vasito 'smi bhūtam // / //
analyzed: saṃpreṣate paśyati tām bibhatsām śmaśāna madhye vasitaḥ smi bhūtam
translated: He sends them away and sees that repulsive thing, dwelling in the midst of a charnel ground.

analyzed: adrākṣīt khalu api bodhisattvaḥ sarvāvantam nārī gaṇam
translated: The Bodhisattva, indeed, saw the entire assembly of women.

original: vyavalokayan paśyati /🔽tatra kāścidvayapakṛṣṭavastrāḥ kāścidvidhūtakeśyaḥ kāścidvikīrṇābharaṇāḥ kāścidvibhraṣṭamukuṭāḥ
analyzed: vyavalokayan paśyati  tatra kāścid vayapakṛṣṭa vastrāḥ kāścid vidhūta keśyaḥ kāścid vikīrṇa ābharaṇāḥ kāścid vibhraṣṭa mukuṭāḥ
translated: Looking around, he saw🔽that some had disheveled clothes, some had disheveled hair, some had scattered ornaments, some had fallen crowns,

analyzed: kāścid vihataiḥ aṃsaiḥ kāścid vigopita gātryaḥ kāścid visaṃsthita mukhāḥ kāścid viparivartita nayanāḥ
translated: some had disarranged shoulders, some had concealed their bodies, some had disfigured faces, some had rolled back eyes,

original: kāścitprasravantī lālābhiḥ kāścicchvasantyaḥ kāścitprahasantyaḥ kāścitkāśantyaḥ kāścitpralapantyaḥ
analyzed: kāścid prasravantī lālābhiḥ kāścid śvasantyaḥ kāścid prahasantyaḥ kāścid kāśantyaḥ kāścid pralapantyaḥ
translated: Some were drooling, some were sighing, some were laughing, some were coughing, some were babbling,

original: kāściddantān kaṭakaṭāyantyaḥ kāścidvivarṇavadanāḥ kāścidvisaṃsthitarūpāḥ kāścitpralambitabāhavaḥ🔽kāścidvikṣiptacaraṇāḥ kāściduddhāṭitaśīrṣāḥ kāścidavaguṇṭhitaśīrṣāḥ kāścidviparivartitamukhamaṇḍalāḥ🔽kāścitpradhvastaśarīrāḥ kāścidvibhugnagātryaḥ kāścinnikubjāḥ khurakhurāyamāṇāḥ kāścinmṛdaṅgamupaguhya
analyzed: kāścid dantān kaṭakaṭāyantyaḥ kāścid vivarṇa vadanāḥ kāścid visaṃsthita rūpāḥ kāścid pralambita bāhavaḥ  kāścid vikṣipta caraṇāḥ kāścid uddhāṭita śīrṣāḥ kāścid avaguṇṭhita śīrṣāḥ kāścid viparivartita mukha maṇḍalāḥ  kāścid pradhvasta śarīrāḥ kāścid vibhugna gātryaḥ kāścid nikubjāḥ khurakhurāyamāṇāḥ kāścid mṛdaṅgam upaguhya
translated: some were gnashing their teeth, some had pale faces, some had distorted forms, some had hanging arms,🔽some had scattered feet, some had disheveled hair, some had covered heads, some had contorted faces,🔽some had fallen bodies, some had twisted limbs, some were hunchbacked and wheezing, some were embracing drums,

analyzed: parivartita śīrṣa śarīrāḥ kāścid vīṇā vallakī ādi a paribaddha pāṇayaḥ kāścid veṇum dantaiḥ
translated: some had contorted heads and bodies, some had hands bound with lutes, flutes, and other instruments, some were playing flutes with their teeth,

analyzed: kaṭakaṭāyantyaḥ kāścid kimpala nakula saṃpatāḍa apakarṣita vādya bhāṇḍāḥ kāścid nimeṣa unmeṣa parivṛtta nayanāḥ kāścid vivṛta āsyāḥ
translated: some were beating musical instruments with kimpalas, nakulas, and sampatas, some had eyes that blinked and opened, some had gaping mouths.

original: evaṃ tadvikṛtaṃ dharaṇītalagatamantaḥpuraṃ nirīkṣamāṇo bodhisattvaḥ śmaśānasaṃjñāmutpādayati sma //
analyzed: evam tat vikṛtam dharaṇī tala gatam antaḥpuram nirīkṣamāṇaḥ bodhisattvaḥ śmaśāna saṃjñām utpādayati sma
translated: Seeing that harem so distorted and fallen on the ground, the Bodhisattva gave rise to the perception of a charnel ground.

analyzed: tatra idam ucyate
translated: Regarding this, the following is said:

original: tāṃ dṛṣṭva udvigna sa lokanāthaḥ karuṇaṃ viniśvasya idaṃ jagāda /
analyzed: tām dṛṣṭvā udvigna sa lokanāthaḥ karuṇam viniśvasya idam jagāda
translated: Seeing that, the Lord of the World became anxious. Sighing compassionately, he said this:

original: aho batā kṛcchragatā vrajeyaṃ kathaṃ ratiṃ vindati rākṣasīgaṇe // / //
analyzed: aho batā kṛcchra gatā vrajeyam katham ratim vindati rākṣasī gaṇe
translated: Alas! These women are in distress. How can they find pleasure in a group of demonesses?

analyzed: durmati kāma guṇaiḥ niguṇaiḥ guṇa saṃjñinaḥ
translated: Those with extremely deluded minds, obscured by the darkness of ignorance, regard the qualities of sensual pleasures, which are actually without qualities, as having qualities.

original: vihaga pañjaramadhyagatā yathā na hi labhanti kadāci viniḥsṛtim // / //
analyzed: vihaga pañjara madhya gatāḥ yathā na hi labhanti kadācid viniḥsṛtim
translated: Just like birds trapped in a cage, they never obtain liberation.

original: atha bodhasattvo 'nena punarapi dharmālokamukhenāntaḥpuraṃ pratyavekṣamāṇo mahākaruṇāparidevitena sattvān paridevate sma iha te bālā hanyante
analyzed: atha bodha sattvaḥ nena punar api dharma āloka mukhena antaḥpuram pratyavekṣamāṇaḥ mahā karuṇā paridevitena sattvān paridevate sma iha te bālāḥ hanyante  /
translated: Then the Bodhisattva, again contemplating the inner palace with this gateway to the light of the Dharma, lamented the beings with a great compassionate lamentation: Here, those fools are killed,

analyzed: āghātanaḥ iva vadhyāḥ
translated: like those to be executed in a prison.

original: iha te bālā rajyante citraghaṭeṣvivāmedhyaparipūrṇeṣvavidvāṃsaḥ /🔽iha te bālā majjanti gajā iva vārimadhye /
analyzed: iha te bālāḥ rajyante citra ghaṭeṣu iva amedhya paripūrṇeṣu avidvāṃsaḥ  iha te bālāḥ majjanti gajāḥ iva vāri madhye
translated: Here, those fools are attached, like the ignorant to colorful pots filled with filth.🔽Here, those fools sink, like elephants in the middle of water.

original: iha te bālā rudhyante caurā iva cārakamadhye /🔽iha te bālā abhiratā varāhā ivāśucimadhye /
analyzed: iha te bālāḥ rudhyante caurāḥ iva cāraka madhye  iha te bālāḥ abhiratāḥ varāhāḥ iva aśuci madhye
translated: Here, those fools are obstructed, like thieves in the middle of a prison.🔽Here, those fools delight, like pigs in the middle of filth.

original: iha te bālā adhyavasitāḥ kukkurā ivāsthikaraṅkamadhye /
analyzed: iha te bālāḥ adhyavasitāḥ kukkurāḥ iva asthi karaṅka madhye
translated: Here, those fools are attached, like dogs in the middle of a skeleton.

original: iha te bālāḥ prapatitā dīpaśikhāsviva pataṃgāḥ /🔽iha te bālā badhyante kapaya iva lepena /
analyzed: iha te bālāḥ prapatitāḥ dīpa śikhāsu iva pataṃgāḥ  iha te bālāḥ badhyante kapayaḥ iva lepena
translated: Here, those fools fall like moths into the flame of a lamp.🔽Here, those fools are bound like monkeys with glue.

original: iha te bālāḥ paridahyante jālotkṣiptā iva jalajāḥ /🔽iha te bālāḥ parikrūḍyante sūnākāṣṭheṣvivorabhrāḥ /🔽iha te bālā avasajjante kilbiṣakāriṇa iva śūlāgre /
analyzed: iha te bālāḥ paridahyante jāla utkṣiptāḥ iva jalajāḥ  iha te bālāḥ parikrūḍyante sūnā kāṣṭheṣu iva urabhrāḥ  iha te bālāḥ avasajjante kilbiṣa kāriṇaḥ iva śūla agre
translated: Here, those fools are burned like fish thrown onto a grill.🔽Here, those fools are slaughtered like goats on a butcher's block.🔽Here, those fools are impaled like criminals on a stake.

original: iha te bālāḥ saṃsīdanti jīrṇagajā iva paṅke /🔽iha te bālā vipadyante bhinnayānapātra iva mahāsamudre /
analyzed: iha te bālāḥ saṃsīdanti jīrṇa gajāḥ iva paṅke  iha te bālāḥ vipadyante bhinna yānapātre iva mahā samudre
translated: Here, those fools sink like old elephants in mud.🔽Here, those fools perish like a shipwrecked person in the great ocean.

original: iha te bālāḥ prapatante mahāprapāta iva jātyandhāḥ /
analyzed: iha te bālāḥ prapatante mahā prapāte iva jāti andhāḥ
translated: Here, those fools fall like a blind person over a great cliff.

original: iha te bālāḥ paryādānaṃ gacchanti pātālasaṃdhigatamiva vāri /
analyzed: iha te bālāḥ paryādānam gacchanti pātāla saṃdhi gatam iva vāri
translated: Here, those fools are destroyed like water reaching the boundary of the underworld.

original: iha te bālā dhūmāyante kalpasaṃkṣaya iva mahāpṛthivī /🔽ābhirbālā bhrāmyante kumbhakārakacakramivāviddham /
analyzed: iha te bālāḥ dhūmāyante kalpa saṃkṣaye iva mahā pṛthivī  ābhiḥ bālāḥ bhrāmyante kumbhakāraka cakram iva āviddham
translated: Here, those fools are shrouded like the great earth at the end of an eon.🔽By these, fools are deluded like an unfixed potter's wheel.

original: iha te bālāḥ paribhramanti śailāntargatā Vaidya 🔽iva jātyandhāḥ /
analyzed: iha te bālāḥ paribhramanti śaila antargatāḥ vaidya  iva jāti andhāḥ
translated: Here, those fools wander like a blind person in the mountains.

original: iha te bālā viparivartante kurkurā iva śardūlabaddhāḥ /
analyzed: iha te bālāḥ viparivartante kurkurāḥ iva śardūla baddhāḥ
translated: Here, those fools revolve like a dog tied to a chain.

original: iha te bālā mlāyante grīṣmakāla iva tṛṇavanaspatayaḥ /
analyzed: iha te bālāḥ mlāyante grīṣma kāle iva tṛṇa vanaspatayaḥ
translated: Here, fools wither like grass and trees in the summer season.

original: iha te bālāḥ parihīyante śaśīva kṛṣṇapakṣe /
analyzed: iha te bālāḥ parihīyante śaśī iva kṛṣṇapakṣe
translated: Here, fools decline like the moon in the dark fortnight.

analyzed: ābhiḥ bālāḥ bhakṣyante garuḍena iva pannagāḥ
translated: By these, fools are devoured like snakes by Garuda.

original: ābhirbālā grasyante mahāmakareṇeva potaḥ /🔽ābhirbālā lupyante corasaṃgheneva sārthaḥ /
analyzed: ābhiḥ bālāḥ grasyante mahā makareṇa iva potaḥ  ābhiḥ bālāḥ lupyante cora saṃghena iva sārthaḥ
translated: By these, fools are swallowed like a ship by a great makaras.🔽By these, fools are robbed like a caravan by a band of thieves.

analyzed: ābhiḥ bālāḥ bhidyante mārutena iva śālāḥ
translated: By these, fools are split like a house by the wind.

original: ābhirbālā hanyante dṛṣṭīviṣairiva jantavaḥ /🔽āsvādasaṃjñino bālāḥ kṣaṇyante madhudigdhābhiriva kṣuradhārābhirbālajātīyāḥ /🔽ābhirbālā uhyante dāruskandhā iva jalaughaiḥ /
analyzed: ābhiḥ bālāḥ hanyante dṛṣṭīviṣaiḥ iva jantavaḥ  āsvāda saṃjñinaḥ bālāḥ kṣaṇyante madhu digdhābhiḥ iva kṣura dhārābhiḥ bāla jātīyāḥ  ābhiḥ bālāḥ uhyante dāru skandhāḥ iva jala oghaiḥ
translated: By these, fools are killed like creatures by poisonous snakes.🔽Fools who perceive taste are pierced like those of childish nature by razor edges smeared with honey.🔽By these, fools are carried away like logs of wood by the currents of water.

original: ābhirbālāḥ krīḍanti dārakā iva svamūtrapurīṣaiḥ /🔽ābhirbālā āvartyante 'ṅkuśeneva gajāḥ /
analyzed: ābhiḥ bālāḥ krīḍanti dārakāḥ iva sva mūtra purīṣaiḥ  ābhiḥ bālāḥ āvartyante ṅkuśena iva gajāḥ
translated: By these, fools play like children with their own urine and excrement.🔽By these, fools are turned around like elephants by a goad.

analyzed: ābhiḥ bālāḥ badhyante dhūrtakaiḥ iva bāla jātīyāḥ
translated: By these, fools are bound like those of childish nature by rogues.

original: iha te bālāḥ kuśalamūlāni kṣapayanti dyatābhiratā iva dhanam /
analyzed: iha te bālāḥ kuśala mūlāni kṣapayanti dyata abhiratāḥ iva dhanam
translated: Here, fools exhaust their roots of virtue like gamblers their wealth.

analyzed: ābhiḥ bālāḥ bhakṣyante rākṣasībhiḥ iva vaṇijāḥ
translated: By these, fools are devoured like merchants by demonesses.

original: ityebhirdvātriṃśatākārairbodhisattvo 'ntaḥpuraṃ paritulayitvā kāye 'śubhasaṃjñāṃ🔽vicārayan pratikūlasaṃjñāmupasaṃharan jugupsasaṃjñāmutpādayan svakāyaṃ prativibhāvayan
analyzed: iti ebhiḥ dvātriṃśat ākāraiḥ bodhisattvaḥ ntaḥpuram paritulayitvā kāye śubha saṃjñām  vicārayan pratikūla saṃjñām upasaṃharan jugupsā saṃjñām utpādayan sva kāyam prativibhāvayan
translated: In this way, the Bodhisattva, having examined the harem with these thirty-two aspects, contemplated the perception of impurity in the body,🔽contemplated the perception of unattractiveness, generated the perception of disgust, contemplated his own body,

original: kāyasyādīnavaṃ saṃpaśyan kāyātkāyābhiniveśamuccārayan śubhasaṃjñāṃ vibhāvayan aśubhasaṃjñāmavakrāmayan
analyzed: kāyasya ādīnavam saṃpaśyan kāyāt kāya abhiniveśam uccārayan śubha saṃjñām vibhāvayan aśubha saṃjñām avakrāmayan
translated: saw the faults of the body, removed attachment to the body, contemplated the perception of beauty, and advanced the perception of impurity.

original: adhaḥ pādatalābhyāṃ yāvadūrdhvaṃ mastakaparyantaṃ paśyati sma aśucisamutthitamaśucisaṃbhavamaśucisravaṃ nityam /
analyzed: adhas pāda talābhyām yāvat ūrdhvam mastaka paryantam paśyati sma aśuci samutthitam aśuci saṃbhavam aśuci sravam nityam
translated: From the soles of his feet below up to the top of his head, he saw it as always arising from impurity, originating from impurity, and flowing with impurity.

analyzed: tasyām ca velāyām imām gāthām abhāṣata
translated: And at that time, he spoke this verse:

analyzed: karma kṣetraruham tṛṣā salila jam satkāya saṃjñīkṛtam
translated: The sprout of karma, born from the water of craving, made into the notion of a real body,

analyzed: aśru sveda kapha ārdra mūtra vikṛtam śoṇīta bindu ākulam
translated: Wet with tears, sweat, and phlegm, distorted by urine, agitated by drops of blood,

analyzed: bastī pūya vasā samastaka rasaiḥ pūrṇam tathā kilbiṣaiḥ
translated: Filled with feces, pus, fat, and all bodily fluids, and likewise with sins,

analyzed: nitya prasravitam hi amedhya sakalam durgandha nānāvidham
translated: Always flowing with impurities, foul-smelling in various ways...

analyzed: asthī danta sa keśa roma vikṛtam carma āvṛtam lomaśam
translated: Distorted by bones, teeth, hair, and nails, covered with skin, hairy,

analyzed: antar plīha yakṛt vapā uṣṇa rasanaiḥ ebhiḥ citam durbalaiḥ
translated: The intestines, liver, and lungs are its hot juices. It is filled with these weak things.

analyzed: majjā snāyu nibaddha yantra sadṛśam māṃsena śobhīkṛtam
translated: It is like a machine bound together with marrow and sinews, adorned with flesh.

analyzed: nānā vyādhi prakīrṇa śoka kalilam kṣudh tarṣa saṃpīḍitam
translated: It is scattered with various diseases and filled with sorrow, afflicted by hunger and thirst.

original: jantūnāṃ nilayaṃ anekasuṣiraṃ mṛtyuṃ jarāṃ cāśritaṃ
analyzed: jantūnām nilayam aneka suṣiram mṛtyum jarām ca āśritam
translated: Seeing this abode of beings, full of many holes, subject to death and old age,

original: dṛṣṭvā ko hi vicakṣaṇo ripunibhaṃ manye śarīraṃ svakam // / //
analyzed: dṛṣṭvā kaḥ hi vicakṣaṇaḥ ripu nibham manye śarīram svakam
translated: what wise person would consider their own body to be like an enemy?

original: evaṃ ca bodhisattvaḥ kāye kāyānugatayā smṛtyā viharati sma //
analyzed: evam ca bodhisattvaḥ kāye kāya anugatayā smṛtyā viharati sma
translated: Thus, the Bodhisattva dwelt with mindfulness that follows the body in the body.

original: gaganatalagatāśca devaputrā dharmacāriṇaṃ devaputramevamāhuḥ kimidaṃ mārṣāḥ /
analyzed: gagana tala gatāḥ ca devaputrāḥ dharmacāriṇam devaputram evam āhuḥ kim idam mārṣāḥ
translated: And the gods in the sky said to the god Dharma-cārin: What is this, friend?

analyzed: siddhārthaḥ vilambate ntaḥpuram ca avalokayati sma
translated: Siddhattha is delaying and is looking at the harem.

analyzed: tam ca udaparśayati cittam ca udvejayati
translated: He is shaking it and agitating his mind.

analyzed: bhūyaḥ cakṣuḥ niveśayati
translated: He is casting his eyes around.

analyzed: athavā java jalanidhi gambhīraḥ yam
translated: Or is he as deep as the ocean?

analyzed: na śakyam asya pramāṇam grahītum
translated: It is not possible to fathom his measure.

original: athavā asaṅgasya mā khalu viṣaye sajjate manaḥ /
analyzed: athavā asaṅgasya mā khalu viṣaye sajjate manaḥ
translated: Or may his mind not be attached to objects, being unattached?

analyzed: mā khalu amaraiḥ a saṃcoditaḥ vismarati pūrva pratijñām iti
translated: May he not forget his former vow, unprompted by the immortals.

analyzed: vaidya
translated: Vidy

analyzed: dharmacārī āha kim evam kathayata
translated: Dharmacāri said, Why do you speak like this?

original: nanu yūyamasya pratyakṣapūvemava bodhāya caratastathāvidhā niḥsaṅgatābhūt /
analyzed: nanu yūyam asya bodhāya carataḥ tathāvidhā
translated: Didn't you see with your own eyes how he was free from attachment when he was practicing for enlightenment in that way?

original: naiṣkramyatyāge ca kimaṅga punaretarhi caramabhavāvasthitasya saṅgo bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: naiṣkramya tyāge ca kim aṅga punar etarhi carama bhava avasthitasya saṅgaḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: How much less so now, when he is in his final existence, will he be attached to leaving home?

original: atha khalu bhikṣavo bodhisattvaḥ kṛtaniścayaḥ saṃvejitamānaso vyavasitabuddhiḥ salīlamavilambitaṃ
analyzed: atha khalu bhikṣavaḥ bodhisattvaḥ kṛta niścayaḥ saṃvejita mānasaḥ vyavasita buddhiḥ sa līlam avilambitam
translated: Then, monks, the Bodhisattva, having made up his mind, his mind stirred, his resolve firm, gracefully and without delay,

original: paryaṅkādavatīrya saṅgītiprāsāde pūrvābhimukhaḥ sthitvā dakṣiṇena pāṇinā ratnajālikāmavanāmya
analyzed: paryaṅkāt avatīrya saṅgīti prāsāde pūrva abhimukhaḥ sthitvā dakṣiṇena pāṇinā ratna jālikām avanāmya
translated: having descended from his couch, stood on the music terrace facing east, and with his right hand raised the jeweled canopy,

original: prāsādakoṭīgato daśanakhakṛtakarapuṭo bhūtvā sarvabuddhān samanvāhṛtya sarvabuddhebhyaśca
analyzed: prāsāda koṭī gataḥ daśa nakha kṛta kara puṭaḥ bhūtvā sarva buddhān samanvāhṛtya sarva buddhebhyaḥ ca
translated: and having gone to the edge of the terrace, with his ten fingers folded in añjali, he remembered all the Buddhas and

translated: Regarding this, it is said:

original: bhaumāntarīkṣāśca tathaiva pālāḥ śakraśca devādhipatiḥ sayakṣaḥ /
analyzed: bhauma āntarīkṣāḥ ca tathā eva pālāḥ śakraḥ ca devādhipatiḥ sa yakṣaḥ
translated: The guardians of the earth and sky, and likewise Shakra, the lord of the gods, together with the yakshas,

original: yāmāśca devāstuṣitāśca nirmitāḥ paranirmitodyukta tathaiva devāḥ // / //
analyzed: yāmāḥ ca devāḥ tuṣitāḥ ca nirmitāḥ tathā eva devāḥ
translated: The gods of the Heaven of the Thirty-three, the Heaven of Joy, the Heaven of Delighting in Emanations, and the Heaven of Making Use of Others' Emanations,

original: varuṇo manasvī api nāgarājā anāvataptaśca tathaiva māgaraḥ
analyzed: varuṇaḥ manasvī api nāga rājā anāvataptaḥ ca tathā eva māgaraḥ
translated: Varuna, Manasvi, the king of the nagas, and likewise Anavatapta, the naga,

analyzed: te ca api abhipūjana artham naiṣkramya kāle nara puṃgavasya
translated: are devoted to worship at the time of the departure of the bull among men.

original: ye cāpi rūpāvacareṣu devāḥ praśāntacārī saha dhyānagocarāḥ /
analyzed: ye ca api rūpāvacareṣu devāḥ praśānta cārī saha dhyāna gocarāḥ
translated: And the gods who dwell in the realm of form, who practice tranquility and have the sphere of meditation,

analyzed: te ca api abhipūjana artham trailokya pūjyasya narottamasya
translated: are devoted to worship of the supreme human, who is worshipped in the three worlds.

analyzed: daśa ādiśaḥ bhyāgata śuddha sattvāḥ sahāyakāḥ pūrva carim carantaḥ
translated: The pure beings who have come from the ten directions, the companions, while practicing the previous conduct,

original: drakṣyāmahe niṣkramaṇaṃ jinasya pūjāṃ kariṣyāmi tathānurūpām // / //
analyzed: drakṣyāmahe niṣkramaṇam jinasya pūjām kariṣyāmi tathā anurūpām
translated: We will see the Victor's departure and make suitable offerings.

original: sa cāpi guhyādhipatirmahātmā pradīptavajro nabhasi pratisthitaḥ /
analyzed: sa ca api guhya adhipatiḥ mahātmā pradīpta vajraḥ nabhasi pratisthitaḥ
translated: And that great lord of secrets, with the blazing vajra standing in the sky,

original: saṃnaddhagātro balavīryavikramaḥ kareṇa guhya jvalamānu vajram // / //
analyzed: saṃnaddha gātraḥ bala vīrya vikramaḥ kareṇa guhya jvalamānu vajram
translated: With his body armored, with strength, vigor, and valor, holding the blazing vajra in his hand,

original: candraśca sūryo ubhi devaputrau pradakṣiṇaṃ vāmaku supratisthitau /
analyzed: candraḥ ca sūryaḥ deva putrau pradakṣiṇam su pratisthitau
translated: And the two gods, the moon and the sun, standing to the left, well-positioned,

analyzed: daśa aṅgulī añjalibhiḥ gṛhītvā naiṣkramya śabdaḥ
translated: Holding their ten fingers in añjali, they consider the word 'departure.'

original: puṣyaśca nakṣatra sapāriṣadyo audārikaṃ nirmiṇi ātmabhāvam /
analyzed: puṣyaḥ ca nakṣatra sa pāriṣadyaḥ audārikam ātma bhāvam
translated: The Puṣya constellation and its retinue, manifesting a coarse body,

analyzed: sthitvā agratas tasya nara uttamasya manojña ghoṣa abhirutam pramuñcat
translated: Standing in front of that best of men, emits a delightful voice.

original: sarve 'dya siddhāḥ śubha tubhya maṅgalāḥ puṣyaśca yuktaḥ samayaśca gantum /
analyzed: sarve siddhāḥ śubha tubhya maṅgalāḥ puṣyaḥ ca yuktaḥ samayaḥ ca gantum
translated: All today are accomplished, auspicious and good for you, and Puṣya is joined, the time to go.

analyzed: vaidya
translated: Vaidya

analyzed: aham yāsyāmi tvayā eva sārdham
translated: I too will go with you.

analyzed: bhava rāga sūdanaḥ
translated: May you become the unsurpassed destroyer of passion.

analyzed: saṃcodakaḥ codayi devaputraḥ uttiṣṭha śīghram bala vīrya audgataḥ
translated: The inspiring god said, Rise quickly, O you who have arisen through strength and vigor,

analyzed: duḥkhaiḥ hatān tāraya sarva sattvān naiṣkramya kālaḥ samupasthitaḥ te
translated: And deliver all beings who are afflicted by suffering. The time has come for you to leave home.

analyzed: samāgatāḥ deva sahasra koṭyaḥ pravarṣamāṇā kusumān manojñān
translated: Billions of gods have assembled, showering beautiful flowers,

original: sa cāpi paryaṅkavare niṣaṇṇo devairvṛto bhrājati dīptatejaḥ // / //
analyzed: sa ca api paryaṅka vare niṣaṇṇaḥ devaiḥ vṛtaḥ bhrājati dīpta tejaḥ
translated: And he, seated on an excellent throne, shines surrounded by gods, with blazing splendor.

original: nagare istrika dārakāśca puruṣā yāścābhavan dārikāḥ
analyzed: nagare istrika dārakāḥ ca puruṣāḥ yāḥ ca abhavan dārikāḥ
translated: In the city, the men, women, and children,

analyzed: sarve te kila anta manasaḥ īryāpathebhyaḥ cyutāḥ
translated: All of them were sleeping, their minds weary, fallen from their postures.

analyzed: hasti aśva gavāḥ ca sārika śukāḥ kroñcāḥ mayūrāḥ tathā
translated: Elephants, horses, cows, mynas, parrots, cranes, and peacocks,

original: sarve te śayitā kilāntamanasaḥ paśyanti rūpaṃ na te // / //
analyzed: sarve te śayitā kila anta manasaḥ paśyanti rūpam na te
translated: All of them were sleeping, their minds weary, they did not see the form.

original: ye cā te dṛḍhavajratomaradharā śākyaiḥ sutāḥ sthāpitāḥ
analyzed: ye ca te dṛḍha vajra tomara dharā śākyaiḥ sutāḥ sthāpitāḥ
translated: Those sons of the Shakyas who were stationed by the Shakyas, holding firm vajra spears,

analyzed: hasti aśva ratheṣu toraṇa vare te ca api avasvāpitāḥ
translated: They too were asleep at the excellent gate of the elephants, horses, and chariots.

original: rājā rājakumāra pārthivajanaḥ sarve prasuptā bhavan
analyzed: rājā rāja kumāra pārthiva janaḥ sarve prasuptāḥ bhavan
translated: The king, the princes, and the people of the land, all were sleeping,

original: api cā nārigaṇā vinagnavasanā suptā na te buddhiṣū // / //
analyzed: api cā nārī gaṇāḥ vinagna vasanā suptāḥ na te buddhiṣu
translated: And moreover, the groups of women, their clothes disheveled, were sleeping, they had no awareness.

analyzed: saḥ ca brahma rutaḥ manojña vasanaḥ kalaviṅka ghoṣa svaraḥ
translated: He, with the voice of Brahma, wearing delightful garments, with the voice of a kalaviṅka bird,

original: rātrau nirgata ardharātrasamaye taṃ chandakaṃ abravīt /
analyzed: rātrau nirgataḥ ardharātra samaye tam chandakam abravīt
translated: Having gone out at night, at midnight, spoke to Chanda:

original: sādhū chandaka dehi kaṇṭhaku mama svālaṃkṛtaṃ śobhanaṃ
analyzed: sādhu chandaka dehi mama su alaṃkṛtam śobhanam
translated: Chanda, give me the Kaṇṭhaka, well-adorned and beautiful,

original: mā vighnaṃ kuru me dadāhi capalaṃ yadi me priyaṃ manyase // / //
analyzed: mā vighnam kuru me dadāhi capalam yadi me priyam manyase
translated: Do not create an obstacle for me, quickly give it to me, if you think of me with affection.

original: kva tvaṃ yāsyasi sattvasārathivarā kiṃ aśvakāryaṃ ca te
analyzed: kva tvam yāsyasi sattva sārathi varā kim aśva kāryam ca te
translated: Where will you go, O best of charioteers of beings, what is the purpose of the horse for you?

original: kālajñaḥ samayajña dharmacaraṇo kālo na gantu kvacit /
analyzed: kāla jñaḥ samaya jña dharma caraṇaḥ kālaḥ na gantu kvacid
translated: Knowing the time, knowing the occasion, practicing the Dharma, it is not the time to go anywhere.

original: dvārāste pithitā dṛḍhārgalakṛtā ko dāsyate tāṃ tava /
analyzed: dvārāḥ te pithitāḥ dṛḍha argala kṛtā kaḥ dāsyate tām tava
translated: The doors are closed by you, fastened with strong bolts, who will open them for you?

original: śakreṇā manasātha cetanavaśātte dvāra muktā kṛtāḥ
analyzed: śakreṇa manasā atha cetana vaśāt te kṛtāḥ
translated: By the power of the mind of Śakra, the doors were opened by him.

original: dṛṣṭvā chandaka harṣito puna dukhī aśrūṇi so 'vartayī /
analyzed: dṛṣṭvā chandaka harṣitaḥ puna aśrūṇi
translated: Seeing this, Chanda was delighted, but then became sorrowful, and shed tears.

original: hā dhikko mi sahāyu kiṃ tu kurumī dhāvāmi kāṃ vā diśaṃ
analyzed: hā dhikkaḥ mi sahāyu kim tu kurumī dhāvāmi kām vā diśam
translated: Alas, what shall I do with my companion? Where shall I run, or to what direction?

original: ugraṃtejadhareṇa vākyu bhaṇitaṃ śakyaṃ na saṃdhāritum // / //
analyzed: bhaṇitam śakyam na saṃdhāritum
translated: The words spoken by the one who holds fierce splendor cannot be borne.

analyzed: vaidya
translated: Vidy

original: sā senā caturaṅginī balavatī kiṃ bhū karotīha hā
analyzed: sā senā caturaṅginī balavatī kim karoti iha hā
translated: What will that powerful four-division army do here, alas!

original: rājā rājakumāra pārthiva jano nemaṃ hi budhyanti te /
analyzed: rājā rāja kumāra pārthiva janaḥ na imam hi budhyanti te
translated: The king, prince, and people of the land do not understand this.

analyzed: strī saṃghaḥ śayitaḥ tathā yaśavatī osvāpitā devataiḥ
translated: The assembly of women and Yashovati are also asleep, put to sleep by the gods.

analyzed: hā dhik gacchati sidhyate sya praṇidhiḥ yaḥ cintitaḥ pūrvaśas
translated: Alas! He is going, his aspiration made in the past is being fulfilled.

analyzed: devāḥ koṭi sahasra hṛṣṭa manasaḥ tam chandakam abruvan
translated: The gods, with joyful minds, spoke to Chanda,

original: sādhu chandaka dehi kaṇṭhakavaraṃ mā khedayī nāyakam /
analyzed: sādhu chandaka dehi kaṇṭhaka varam mā nāyakam
translated: Good, Chanda, give the excellent Kanthaka, do not tire the leader.

analyzed: bherī śaṅkha mṛdaṅga tūrya nayutā deva asuraiḥ vāditā
translated: The many thousands of koṭis of devas and asuras playing drums, conches, and musical instruments,

analyzed: na eva idam pratibudhyate puravaram osvāpitam devataiḥ
translated: Do not awaken this best of cities, it is put to sleep by the gods.

original: paśya chandaka antarīkṣa vimalaṃ divyā prabhā śobhate
analyzed: paśya chandaka antarīkṣa vimalam divyā prabhā śobhate
translated: Chanda, look at the clear sky, the divine light shines beautifully.

analyzed: paśya tvam bahu bodhisattva nayutām ye pūjanāya āgatāḥ
translated: Look at the many thousands of bodhisattvas who have come to make offerings.

original: śakraṃ paśya śacīpatiṃ balavṛtaṃ dvārasthitaṃ bhrājate
analyzed: śakram paśya śacīpatim bala vṛtam dvāra sthitam bhrājate
translated: Look at Shakra, the lord of Shachi, surrounded by an army, shining as he stands at the gate.

analyzed: devān ca api asurān ca kinnara gaṇām ye pūjana artha āgatāḥ
translated: And the devas, asuras, and hosts of kinnaras who have come to make offerings.

original: śrutvā chandaka devatāna vacanaṃ taṃ kaṇṭhakaṃ ālapī
analyzed: śrutvā chandaka devatāna vacanam tam kaṇṭhakam ālapī
translated: Having heard the words of the devas, Chanda spoke to Kanthaka,🔽 saying, Kanthaka, the Bodhisattva has made up his mind to go forth.

analyzed: eṣu āgacchati sattva sārathi varaḥ tvam tāva heṣiṣyase
translated: The supreme charioteer of beings has come here, and you are neighing.

original: so taṃ varṣikuvarṇa kāñcanakhuraṃ svālaṃkṛtaṃ kṛtvanā
analyzed: saḥ tam varṣi kuvarṇa kāñcana khuram su ālaṃkṛtam
translated: Having adorned him with a golden coat of mail,

analyzed: upanetī guṇa sāgarasya vahanam rodantakaḥ durmanāḥ
translated: He leads the ship of the ocean of qualities, and Rodanta is sad and distressed.

original: eṣā te varalakṣaṇā hitakarā aśvaḥ sujātaḥ śubho
analyzed: eṣā te vara lakṣaṇā hita karā aśvaḥ su jātaḥ śubho
translated: This horse, well-born and auspicious, is your excellent mark, O Benefactor.

original: gaccha sidhyatu tubhya eva praṇidhiryaścintitaḥ pūrvaśaḥ /
analyzed: gaccha sidhyatu tubhyaḥ eva praṇidhiḥ yaḥ cintitaḥ pūrvaśas
translated: Go, may your aspiration be fulfilled, just as you have thought it from before.

original: ye te vighnakarā vrajantu praśamaṃ āsāṃ vrataṃ sidhyatāṃ
analyzed: ye te vighna karāḥ vrajantu praśamam āsām vratam sidhyatām
translated: May those who create obstacles for you be pacified, and may your vow be accomplished.

analyzed: bhava hī sarva jagasya saukhya dadanaḥ svargasya śāntyāḥ tathā
translated: Become the giver of happiness to all beings, to heaven and peace, and so on.

original: sarvā kampita ṣaḍvikāra dharaṇī śayanādyadā sotthitaḥ
analyzed: sarvā kampita ṣaṣ vikāra dharaṇī śayanāt yadā saḥ utthitaḥ
translated: When he arose from his bed, the entire earth trembled in six ways.

analyzed: ārūḍhaḥ śaśi pūrṇa maṇḍala nibham tam aśva rāja uttamam
translated: He mounted that excellent horse king, resembling the full orb of the moon.

analyzed: pāṇi viśuddha padma vimalā aśva uttame
translated: The guardians placed their pure and stainless hands on that excellent horse.

original: śakro brahma ubhau ca tasya purato darśyanti mārgo hyayam // / //
analyzed: śakraḥ brahma ubhau ca tasya puratas darśyanti mārgaḥ hi ayam
translated: Shakra and Brahma both appeared before him, showing him this path.

original: ābhā tena pramukta acchavimalā obhāsitā medinī
analyzed: ābhā tena pramukta accha vimalā obhāsitā medinī
translated: Light of pure radiance was emitted by him, illuminating the earth.

original: sarve śānta apāya sattva sukhitā kleśairna bādhyī tadā /
analyzed: sarve śānta apāya sattva sukhitā kleśaiḥ na bādhyī tadā
translated: All the lower realms were pacified, beings were happy, and afflictions did not torment them.

analyzed: deva asurāḥ tuṣṭuvuḥ
translated: Flowers rained down, millions of musical instruments played, and devas and asuras praised.

original: sarve kṛtva pradakṣiṇaṃ puravaraṃ gacchanti harṣānvitāḥ // / //
analyzed: sarve pradakṣiṇam puravaram gacchanti harṣa anvitāḥ
translated: All of them circumambulated the excellent city and departed with joy.

analyzed: vaidya
translated: Vidy

original: puravarottami devata dīnamanā upagamya gacchati mahāpuruṣe /
analyzed: puravara uttami devata dīna manāḥ upagamya gacchati mahāpuruṣe
translated: The excellent city, the gods, with humble minds, approached and went to the great being.

original: purataḥ sthitā karuṇadīnamanā girayā samālapati padmamukham // / //
analyzed: puratas sthitā karuṇa dīna manāḥ girayā samālapati padma mukham
translated: Standing in front, with a compassionate and humble mind, he spoke with a voice to the lotus-faced one.

original: tamasākulaṃ bhuvimu sarvapuraṃ nagaraṃ na śobhati tvaya rahitam /
analyzed: tamasā ākulam sarva puram nagaram na śobhati rahitam
translated: The entire city on earth is confused and obscured, the city is not beautiful without you.

original: na mamātra kāci rati prītikarī tyaktaṃ tvayā ca yadidaṃ bhavanam // / //
analyzed: na mama atra kāci rati prīti karī tyaktam tvayā ca yat idam bhavanam
translated: I have no joy or delight here, this palace that you have abandoned.

original: na punaḥ śruṇiṣyi rutu pakṣigaṇe antaḥpure madhuraveṇuravam /
analyzed: na punar rutu pakṣi gaṇe antaḥpure madhura veṇu ravam
translated: I will not hear the sounds of flocks of birds again, the sweet sounds of flutes in the inner quarters.

original: maṅgalyaśabda tatha gītaravaṃ pratibodhanaṃ tava anantayaśaḥ // / //🔽darśe na bhūyu surasiddhagaṇāṃ kurvantu pūja tava rātridivam /
analyzed: gīta ravam pratibodhanam tava ananta yaśaḥ  darśe na kurvantu pūja tava rātri divam
translated: The auspicious sounds and the sounds of singing, the awakening of you of infinite fame.🔽I will not see the hosts of devas and siddhas again, making offerings to you day and night.

original: ghrāyiṣyi gandha na ca divya punaḥ tvayi nirgate nihatakleśagaṇe // / //
analyzed: ghrāyiṣyi gandha na ca divya punar tvayi nirgate nihata kleśa gaṇe
translated: I will not smell the divine fragrances again, when you have departed, the hordes of afflictions destroyed.

original: nirbhuktamālyamiva paryuṣitaṃ tyaktaṃ tvayādya bhavanaṃ hi tathā /
analyzed: nirbhukta mālyam iva paryuṣitam tyaktam tvayā adya bhavanam hi tathā
translated: Just as a garland worn out and discarded is left behind, so too this palace has been abandoned by you today.

original: naṭaraṅgakalpa pratibhāyati me tvayi nirgate na bhuyu tejaśiri // / //
analyzed: naṭa raṅga kalpa pratibhāyati me tvayi nirgate na
translated: When you have departed, O Lord of Splendor and Glory, this palace appears to me like a stage for actors.

original: ojo balaṃ harasi sarvapure na ca śobhate aṭavitulyamidam /
analyzed: ojaḥ balam harasi sarva pure na ca śobhate aṭavi tulyam idam
translated: You take away the strength and vigor from the entire city, and it does not shine, it is like a wilderness.

original: vitathaṃ ṛṣīṇa vacanādya bhutaṃ yehī viyākṛtu bhuvi cakrabalo // / //
analyzed: vitatham vacanā adya bhutam bhuvi cakra balaḥ
translated: The words of the sages have come true today, by whom it was proclaimed on earth that the power of the wheel will be destroyed.

original: abalaṃ balaṃ bhuvimu śākyabalaṃ ucchinna vaṃśa iha rājakule /
analyzed: abalam balam bhuvimu śākya balam ucchinna vaṃśaḥ iha rāja kule
translated: The power of the Śākyas on earth is powerless, the royal lineage is cut off here,

original: āśā pranaṣṭa iha śākyagaṇe tvayi nirgate mahati puṇyadrume // / //
analyzed: āśā pranaṣṭe iha śākya gaṇe tvayi nirgate mahati puṇya drume
translated: The hope of the Śākya clan is lost here, when you, a great tree of merit, have departed.

original: ahameva tubhya gati gacchayamī yatha tvaṃ prayāsi amalā vimalā /
analyzed: aham eva tubhya gati tvam prayāsi amalā vimalā
translated: But I will go to your destination, just as you have gone, pure and stainless.

analyzed: vaidya
translated: Vidyā

original: api cā kṛpā karuṇa saṃjaniya vyavalokayasva bhavanaṃ tvamidam // / //
analyzed: api kṛpā karuṇa vyavalokayasva bhavanam tvam idam
translated: Moreover, having generated compassion and pity, look at this palace of yours.

original: vyavalokya caiva bhavanaṃ matimān madhurasvaro giramudīritavān /
analyzed: vyavalokya ca eva bhavanam matimān madhura svaraḥ giram udīritavān
translated: Having looked at the palace, the wise one uttered these words in a sweet voice:

original: nāhaṃ pravekṣi kapilasya puraṃ aprāpya jātimaraṇāntakaram // / //
analyzed: na aham pravekṣi kapilasya puram a prāpya jāti maraṇa anta karam
translated: I will not enter the city of Kapila until I attain the end of birth and death.

analyzed: sthāna āsanam śayana caṃkramaṇam na kariṣi aham kapilavastu mukham
translated: I will not go to Kapilavastu to stand, sit, lie down, or walk,

original: yāvanna labdha varabodhi mayā ajarāmaraṃ padavaraṃ hyamṛtam // / //
analyzed: yāvat na vara bodhi mayā ajara amaram pada varam hi amṛtam
translated: Until I have attained the supreme enlightenment, the state of immortality and deathlessness.

original: yadasau jagatpradhāno niṣkrāntu bodhisattvo tasyā nabhe vrajanto stavayiṃsu apsarāṇām /
analyzed: yat asau jagat pradhānaḥ tasyāḥ nabhe vrajantaḥ stavayiṃsu apsarāṇām
translated: When the Bodhisattva set out, the foremost of the world, the celestial nymphs praised him in the sky as he went along:

original: eṣa maha dakṣiṇīyo eṣa maha puṇyakṣetraṃ puṇyarthikāna kṣetraṃ amṛtāphalasya dātā // / //
analyzed: eṣa eṣa puṇya kṣetram kṣetram amṛtā phalasya dātā
translated: He is the great object of offerings, the great field of merit, the field for those seeking merit, the giver of the fruit of immortality.

original: ena bahukalpakoṭī dānadamasaṃyamenā samudānitāsya bodhiḥ sattvakaruṇāyamānā /
analyzed: ena bahu kalpa koṭī dāna dama saṃyamena samudānitā asya bodhiḥ sattva karuṇāyamānā
translated: For many millions of eons, he has cultivated this enlightenment through generosity, self-control, and restraint, out of compassion for beings.

original: eṣa pariśuddhaśīlo suvrata akhaṇḍacārī na ca kāma naiva bhogāṃ prārthentu śīlarakṣī // / //
analyzed: eṣa akhaṇḍa cārī na ca na eva śīla rakṣī
translated: He is the one with pure morality, of good vows, faultless in conduct, who does not seek sensual pleasures or enjoyments, but guards morality.

original: eṣa sada kṣāntivādī chidyanti aṅgamaṅge na ca krodhu naiva roṣaḥ sattvaparitrāyaṇārtham /
analyzed: eṣa kṣānti vādī aṅgam aṅge na ca krodhu na eva roṣaḥ sattva paritrāyaṇa artham
translated: He is always the one who speaks of patience, even when his limbs are being cut off, he has no anger or rage, but saves beings.

original: eṣa sada vīryavanto avikhinna kalpakoṭyaḥ samudānitāsya bodhiryaṣṭā ca yakṣakoṭīḥ // / //
analyzed: vīryavantaḥ avikhinna kalpa koṭyaḥ samudānitā asya bodhiḥ yaṣṭā ca yakṣa koṭīḥ
translated: He is always the one with vigor, tireless for millions of eons, he has cultivated this enlightenment, and served millions of yakshas.

original: eṣa sada dhyānadhyāyī śāntapraśāntacitto dhyāyitva sarvakleśāṃ moceṣyi sattvakoṭīḥ /
analyzed: eṣa dhyāna dhyāyī śānta praśānta cittaḥ sarva kleśām
translated: He who always meditates in meditation, with a peaceful and tranquil mind, having meditated on all afflictions, will liberate millions of beings.

original: eṣo asaṅga prājñaḥ kalpairvikalpamukto kalpairvimuktacitto jinu bheṣyate svayaṃbhūḥ // / //
analyzed: eṣaḥ u asaṅga prājñaḥ kalpaiḥ vikalpa muktaḥ kalpaiḥ vimukta cittaḥ jinu svayaṃbhūḥ
translated: He who is unattached and wise, free from conceptualization for eons, with a mind liberated for eons, will become a victorious one, a self-existent one.

original: eṣa sada maitracitto karuṇāya pāraprāpto mudito upekṣadhyāyī brāhme pathi vidhijñaḥ /
analyzed: eṣa karuṇāya pāra prāptaḥ muditaḥ upekṣa dhyāyī brāhme pathi vidhi jñaḥ
translated: He who always has a mind of loving-kindness, has attained the other shore of compassion, is joyful, and meditates on equanimity, knows the rules on the path of Brahmā.

analyzed: eṣaḥ tidevadevaḥ śubha vimala śuddha cittaḥ guṇa niyuta pāra prāptaḥ
translated: He who is the god of gods, to be worshipped by the gods, with a pure and stainless mind, who has attained the other shore of many myriads of virtues, will become a victorious one, a self-existent one.

analyzed: vaidya
translated: Vidy

original: śaraṇaṃ bhayārditānāṃ dīpo acakṣuṣāṇāṃ layano upadrutānāṃ vaidyaścirāturāṇām /
analyzed: śaraṇam bhaya arditānām dīpaḥ acakṣuṣāṇām layanaḥ upadrutānām vaidyaḥ cira āturāṇām
translated: A refuge for those afflicted by fear, a light for the blind, a shelter for the oppressed, a doctor for the chronically ill.

original: rājeva dharmarājo indraḥ sahasranetro brahmasvayaṃbhubhūtaḥ kāyapraśabdhacitto // / //🔽dhīraḥ prabhūtaprajño vīro viviktacittaḥ śūraḥ kileśaghātī ajitaṃjayo jitāriḥ /
analyzed: rājā iva dharmarājaḥ indraḥ sahasranetraḥ brahma svayaṃbhu bhūtaḥ kāya praśabdha cittaḥ  dhīraḥ prabhūta prajñaḥ vīraḥ vivikta cittaḥ śūraḥ kileśa ghātī ajitaṃjayaḥ jita ariḥ
translated: Like a king, a Dharma king, Indra with a thousand eyes, a self-existent Brahmā, with a mind purified by the body, will become a victorious one, a self-existent one.🔽Courageous, with abundant wisdom, heroic, with a detached mind, a hero who destroys afflictions, undefeated, victorious over enemies,

original: siṃho bhayaprahīṇo nāgaḥ sudāntacitto ṛṣabho gaṇapradhānaḥ kṣāntaḥ prahīṇakopaḥ // / //
analyzed: siṃhaḥ bhaya prahīṇaḥ nāgaḥ su dānta cittaḥ ṛṣabhaḥ gaṇa pradhānaḥ kṣāntaḥ prahīṇa kopaḥ
