translated: There is another path to awakening that leads to the extinction of future birth, old age, death, and the mass of suffering.”

original: tasya me bhikṣava etadabhavat yadahaṃ piturudyāne jambucchāyāyāṃ niṣaṇṇo viviktaṃ🔽kāmairviviktaṃ pāpakairakuśalairdharmaiḥ savitarkaṃ savicāraṃ vivekajaṃ prītisukhaṃ
analyzed: tasya me bhikṣavaḥ etat abhavat yat aham pituḥ udyāne jambu chāyāyām niṣaṇṇaḥ viviktam  kāmaiḥ viviktam pāpakaiḥ akuśalaiḥ dharmaiḥ sa vitarkam sa vicāram viveka jam prīti sukham
translated: Monks, I thought, “When I was sitting in my father’s garden in the shade of the rose apple tree, I attained the first concentration, which is detached from sense pleasures, detached from nonvirtuous activities, and endowed with applied and sustained thought and with joy and bliss born of detachment.🔽I remained in that state for a long time. I then attained the second concentration, which is free from applied and sustained thought and is born of single-pointed focus and endowed with joy and bliss.🔽I remained in that state for a long time. I then attained the third concentration, which is free from joy and is endowed with equanimity and mindfulness, and is accompanied by feelings of bliss.

analyzed: prathamam dhyānam upasaṃpadya vyāhārṣam yāvat caturtha dhyānam upasaṃpadya vyāhārṣam
translated: I remained in that state for a long time. I then attained the fourth concentration, which is free from feelings of bliss and suffering and is endowed with neither-unpleasant-nor-pleasant feelings and with equanimity and mindfulness.

analyzed: syāt sa mārgaḥ bodheḥ jāti jarā maraṇa duḥkha samudāyānām asaṃbhavāya astaṃgamāya iti
translated: I remained in that state for a long time. I thought, ‘There is a path to awakening that leads to the extinction of future birth, old age, death, and the mass of suffering.’

analyzed: tad anusāri ca me vijñānam abhūt
translated: I followed that path and my mind became clear.

analyzed: sa mārgaḥ bodheḥ iti
translated: That is the path to awakening.”

original: tasya mamaitadabhūt nāsau mārgaḥ śakyaḥ evaṃ daurbalyaprāptenābhisaṃboddhum /
analyzed: tasya mama etat abhūt na asau mārgaḥ śakyaḥ evam daurbalya prāptena abhisaṃboddhum
translated: I thought, “That path is not possible for one who has become so weak.

analyzed: saced punar aham abhijñā jñāna balena eva lūham durbala kāye eva bodhimaṇḍam upasaṃkrameyam
translated: If I were to go to the seat of awakening with my weak and frail body, using only the power of my supernormal knowledge and wisdom,

original: na me paścimā janatā anukampitā syāt /
analyzed: na me paścimā janatā anukampitā syāt
translated: I would not be showing compassion to future generations.

analyzed: na ca eṣa mārgaḥ bodheḥ
translated: This is not the path to awakening.”

analyzed: yat nu aham audārikam āhāram āhṛtya kāya bala sthāmam saṃjanayya paścāt bodhimaṇḍam upasaṃkrameyam
translated: I should now eat coarse food, generate physical strength and energy, and then go to the seat of awakening.”

original: tatra bhikṣavo ye te lūhādhimuktā devaputrāste mama cetasaścetasaiva parivitarkamājñāya yenāhaṃ tenopasaṃkramya māmevamāhuḥ mā sma tvaṃ satpuruṣa
analyzed: tatra bhikṣavaḥ ye te lūha adhimuktāḥ deva putrāḥ te mama cetasaḥ cetasā eva parivitarkam ājñāya yena aham tena upasaṃkramya mām evam āhuḥ mā sma tvam sat puruṣa
translated: There, monks, those sons of gods who were inclined towards coarseness, having understood with their own minds the thought in my mind, approached me and said, “Good man,

analyzed: audārikam āhāram āhareḥ
translated: do not eat coarse food.

analyzed: vayam te romakūpaiḥ ojaḥ prakṣepsyāmaḥ iti
translated: We will inject vital energy into your pores.”

original: tasya me bhikṣava etadabhūt ahaṃ khalvanaśana ityātmānaṃ pratijāne /
analyzed: tasya me bhikṣavaḥ etat abhūt aham khalu anaśane iti ātmānam pratijāne
translated: Monks, I thought, “I have declared myself to be fasting.

original: sāmantāśca me gocaragrāmavāsino janā evaṃ saṃjānante sma yathānaśanaḥ śramaṇo gautamaḥ /
analyzed: sāmantāḥ ca me gocara grāma vāsinaḥ janāḥ evam saṃjānante sma yathā anaśanaḥ śramaṇaḥ gautamaḥ
translated: And the people living in the villages of my domain know me as a renunciant Gautama who does not eat.

original: itīva me khalu lūhādhimuktā devaputrā romakūpairojaḥ prakṣipanti /
analyzed: iti iva me khalu lūha adhimuktāḥ devaputrāḥ romakūpaiḥ ojaḥ prakṣipanti
translated: Thus, it seems, the sons of gods who are inclined towards coarseness are injecting vital energy into my pores.

analyzed: sa mama paramaḥ mṛṣāvādaḥ syāt
translated: That would be the highest falsehood for me.”

original: tato bodhisattvo mṛṣāvādaparihārārthaṃ tān devaputrān pratikṣipyaudārikamāhāramāhartu cittaṃ nāmayati sma //
analyzed: tatas bodhisattvaḥ mṛṣāvāda parihāra artham tān deva putrān pratikṣipya audārikam āhāram āhartu cittam nāmayati sma
translated: Then, in order to avoid falsehood, the Bodhisattva rejected those sons of gods, and turned his mind towards eating coarse food.

original: iti hi bhikṣavaḥ ṣaḍvarṣavratatapaḥsamuttīrṇo bodhisattvo 'smādāsanādutthāyaudārikamāhāramāhariṣyāmīti vācaṃ niścārayati sma /
analyzed: iti hi bhikṣavaḥ ṣaṣ varṣa vrata tapaḥ samuttīrṇaḥ bodhisattvaḥ smāt āsanāt utthāya audārikam āhāram āhariṣyāmi iti vācam niścārayati sma
translated: Monks, in this way, after six years of austerities, the Bodhisattva rose from his seat and said, “I will now eat coarse food.”

original: tadyathā phāṇīkṛtaṃ mudgayūṣaṃ hareṇukayūṣaṃ mathyodanakulmāṣamiti //🔽atha khalu bhikṣavaḥ pañcānāṃ bhadravargīyānāmetadabhūt tayāpi tāvaccaryayā tayāpi
analyzed: tat yathā phāṇīkṛtam mudga yūṣam hareṇuka yūṣam mathi odana kulmāṣam iti  atha khalu bhikṣavaḥ pañcānām bhadravargīyānām etat abhūt tayā api tāvat caryayā tayā api
translated: Thus, monks, the Bodhisattva, having completed the practice of austerities for six years, rose from his seat and uttered this statement: “I will now take coarse food, such as porridge made from split mung beans, porridge made from barley, rice, and kidney beans.”

original: tāvatpratipadā śramaṇena gautamena na śakitaṃ kiṃciduttarimanuṣyadharmādalamāryajñānadarśanaviśeṣaṃ sākṣātkartum /
analyzed: tāvat pratipadā śramaṇena gautamena na śakitam kiṃcid uttari manuṣya dharmāt alam ārya jñāna darśana viśeṣam sākṣātkartum
translated: Then, monks, the five companions thought this: “Even with that practice, that conduct, that austerity, that difficulty, that difficult conduct, the ascetic Gautama was not able to attain any higher knowledge or see any higher vision beyond human experience.

analyzed: kim punar etarhi audārikam āhāram āharan sukhallikā anuyogam anuyuktaḥ viharan
translated: What then, now that he has taken coarse food and is living devoted to comfort?”

analyzed: avyaktaḥ bālaḥ yam iti ca manyamānāḥ bodhisattvasya antikāt prakrāman
translated: Considering him to be unclear and foolish, they left the Bodhisattva and went to Vārāṇasī.

original: te vārāṇasīṃ gatvā ṛṣipatane mṛgadāve vyāhārṣuḥ //
analyzed: te vārāṇasīm gatvā ṛṣipatane mṛgadāve vyāhārṣuḥ
translated: Having arrived at Vārāṇasī, they stayed in the Deer Park at Ṛṣipatana.

original: tatra bodhisattvamādita eva duṣkaracaryāṃ carantaṃ daśa grāmikaduhitaraḥ kumārya upagacchan darśanāya vandanāya paryupāsanāya ca /
analyzed: tatra bodhisattvam āditas eva duṣkara caryām carantam daśa grāmika duhitaraḥ kumāryaḥ upagacchan darśanāya vandanāya paryupāsanāya ca
translated: There, while the Bodhisattva was first practicing austerities, ten village girls, daughters of village chiefs, approached him as young women to see him, to pay homage to him, and to attend on him.

analyzed: taiḥ api pañcakaiḥ bhadravargīyaiḥ upasthitaḥ bhūt  eka kola tila taṇḍula pradānena vaidya
translated: He was also attended by those five companions of good family.🔽He was given a measure of sesame seeds and rice by a doctor

analyzed: ca pratipāditaḥ bhūt
translated: and was given a measure of sesame seeds and rice by a doctor.

original: balā ca nāma dārikā balaguptā ca supriyā ca vijayasenā ca atimuktakamalā ca sundarī ca kumbhakārī ca uluvillikā ca jaṭilikā ca sujātā ca nāma 🔽grāmikaduhitāḥ /🔽ābhiḥ kumārikābhirbodhisattvāya sarvāstā yūṣavidhāḥ kṛtvopanāmitā abhūvan /
analyzed: balā ca nāma dārikā balaguptā ca supriyā ca vijayasenā ca atimuktakamalā ca sundarī ca kumbhakārī ca uluvillikā ca jaṭilikā ca sujātā ca nāma  grāmika duhitāḥ  ābhiḥ kumārikābhiḥ bodhisattvāya sarvāḥ tāḥ yūṣa vidhāḥ kṛtvā upanāmitāḥ abhūvan
translated: And there were ten village girls, daughters of village chiefs, named Bala, Balagupta, Supriya, Vijayasena, Atimuktaka, Kamala, Sundari, Kumbhakari, Uluvillika, and Jatilika.🔽These young women prepared all those medicinal concoctions for the Bodhisattva and offered them to him.

original: tāścābhyavahṛtya bodhisattvaḥ krameṇa gocaragrāme piṇḍāya caran varṇarūpabalavānabhūt /
analyzed: tāḥ ca abhyavahṛtya bodhisattvaḥ krameṇa gocara grāme piṇḍāya caran varṇa rūpa balavān abhūt
translated: Having consumed them, the Bodhisattva gradually went to the village for alms and became strong and beautiful.

original: tadagreṇa bodhisattvaḥ sundaraḥ śramaṇo mahāśramaṇa ityācakṣate //
analyzed: tad agreṇa bodhisattvaḥ sundaraḥ śramaṇaḥ mahāśramaṇaḥ iti ācakṣate
translated: From that time on, the Bodhisattva was called Sundara, the ascetic, the great ascetic.

original: tatra ca bhikṣavaḥ sujātā grāmikaduhitā bodhisattvasya duṣkaracaryāṃ carataḥ ādita🔽eva bodhisattvasya vratatapaḥsamuttāraṇārthaṃ śarīrasyāpyāyanahetośca pratidivasamaṣṭaśataṃ
analyzed: tatra ca bhikṣavaḥ sujātā grāmika duhitā bodhisattvasya duṣkara caryām carataḥ ādita  eva bodhisattvasya vrata tapaḥ samuttāraṇa artham śarīrasya āpyāyana hetoḥ ca pratidivasam aṣṭaśatam
translated: And there, monks, Sujata, the village overseer's daughter, while the Bodhisattva was practicing austerities,🔽from the very beginning, in order to test the Bodhisattva's austerities

analyzed: brāhmaṇānām bhojayati sma
translated: and for the sake of nourishing his body, fed one hundred and eight Brahmins every day.

original: evaṃ ca praṇidadhāti sma mama bhojanaṃ bhuktvā bodhisattvo 'nuttarāṃ samyaksaṃbodhimabhisaṃbudhyeteti //
analyzed: evam ca praṇidadhāti sma mama bhojanam bhuktvā bodhisattvaḥ nuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbudhyeta iti
translated: And she made this vow: May the Bodhisattva, having eaten my food, attain supreme perfect enlightenment.

original: tasya me bhikṣavaḥ ṣaḍvarṣavyativṛttasya kāṣāyāṇi vastrāṇi parijīrṇānyabhūvan /
analyzed: tasya me bhikṣavaḥ ṣaṣ varṣa vyativṛttasya kāṣāyāṇi vastrāṇi parijīrṇāni abhūvan
translated: Monks, six years after that, my ochre robes became worn out.

original: tasya me bhikṣava etadabhūt sacedahaṃ kaupīnapracchādanaṃ labheyam /
analyzed: tasya me bhikṣavaḥ etat abhūt saced aham kaupīna pracchādanam labheyam
translated: Monks, this occurred to me: If I could get a loincloth to cover myself,

analyzed: śobhanam syāt
translated: that would be good.

original: tena khalu punarbhikṣavaḥ samayena sujātāyā grāmikaduhiturdāsī rādhā nāma kālagatābhūt /
analyzed: tena khalu punar bhikṣavaḥ samayena sujātāyāḥ grāmika duhituḥ dāsī rādhā nāma kālagatā abhūt
translated: Monks, at that time, Sujata, the village overseer's daughter, had a slave named Radha who had died.

analyzed: sā śāṇakaiḥ pariveṣṭya śmaśānam apakṛṣya parityaktā abhut
translated: She was wrapped in hemp cloth, carried to the charnel ground, and abandoned.

analyzed: tat aham eva adrākṣīt pāṃśu kūlam
translated: I saw that rag-robe right then.

original: tato 'haṃ tatpāṃśukūlaṃ vāmena pādenākramya dakṣiṇaṃ hastaṃ prasāryāvanato 'bhūttadrahītum /
analyzed: tatas ham tat pāṃśu kūlam vāmena pādena ākramya dakṣiṇam hastam prasārya avanataḥ bhūt tat rahītum
translated: Then I stepped on that rag robe with my left foot, extended my right hand, and bent down to take it off.

original: atha bhaumā devā antarīkṣāṇāṃ devānāṃ ghoṣamanuśrāvayanti sma āścaryaṃ mārṣā adbhutamidaṃ mārṣāḥ /
analyzed: atha bhaumāḥ devāḥ antarīkṣāṇām devānām ghoṣam anuśrāvayanti smaḥ āścaryam mārṣāḥ adbhutam idam mārṣāḥ
translated: Then the earth gods proclaimed to the gods in the space realm, Marvellous, friends! Wonderful, friends!

original: yatra hi nāmaivaṃ mahārājakulaprasūtasya cakravartirājyaparityāginaḥ pāṃśukūle cittaṃ natamiti /🔽antarīkṣā devā bhaumānāṃ devānāṃ śabdaṃ śratvā cāturmahārājikānāṃ devānāṃ ghoṣamudīrayanti sma /🔽cāturmahārājikā devāstrāyatriṃśataḥ /
analyzed: yatra hi nāma evam mahā rāja kula prasūtasya cakravarti rājya parityāginaḥ pāṃśu kūle cittam natam iti  antarīkṣāḥ devāḥ bhaumānām devānām śabdam śratvā cāturmahārājikānām devānām ghoṣam udīrayanti sma  cāturmahārājikāḥ devāḥ trāya triṃśataḥ
translated: Here, the mind of one born into such a great royal family, who has renounced the kingdom of a wheel-turning king, is bent on a rag robe.🔽The space gods, having heard the words of the earth gods, proclaimed to the gods of the four great kings.🔽The gods of the four great kings to the gods of the Thirty-Three.

analyzed: trāyatriṃśāḥ yāmānām
translated: The gods of the Thirty-Three to the Yāma gods.

analyzed: yāmāḥ tuṣitānām
translated: The Yāma gods to the Tuṣita gods.

analyzed: tuṣitāḥ nirmāṇa ratīnām
translated: The Tuṣita gods to the Nirmāṇarati gods.

analyzed: nirmāṇa ratayaḥ para nirmita vaśavartinām
translated: The Nirmāṇarati gods to the Paranirmitavaśavartin gods.

analyzed: paranirmitavaśavartinaḥ yāvat brahmakāyikānām
translated: The Paranirmitavaśavartin gods up to the Brahmakāyika gods.

original: iti hi bhikṣavastatkṣaṇaṃ tallavaṃ tanmuhūrtaṃ yāvadakaniṣṭhabhuvanādekaghoṣa ekasaṃnirnādo 'bhyudgato 'bhūt āścaryamidaṃ mārṣā adbhutamidam
analyzed: iti hi bhikṣavaḥ tad kṣaṇam tad lavam tad muhūrtam yāvat akaniṣṭha bhuvanāt eka ghoṣaḥ eka saṃnirnādaḥ bhyudgataḥ bhūt āścaryam idam mārṣāḥ adbhutam idam
translated: Monks, at that moment, at that instant, at that very second, a single loud cry arose from the Akaniṣṭha realm all the way up to the Avīci hell: “It is a wonder, friends, it is marvelous!

original: yatra hi nāmaivaṃ mahārājakulaprasūtasya cakravartirājyaparityāginaḥ pāṃśukūle cittaṃ natamiti //
analyzed: yatra hi nāma evam mahā rāja kula prasūtasya cakravarti rājya parityāginaḥ pāṃśu kūle cittam natam iti
translated: How is it that the mind of one born into such a great royal family, who has renounced the kingdom of a wheel-turning king, is bent on rags?”

original: atha bodhisattvasya punarapyetadabhavat labdhaṃ mayā pāṃśukūlam /
analyzed: atha bodhisattvasya punar api etat abhavat labdham mayā pāṃśu kūlam
translated: Then the Bodhisattva thought again, “I have obtained the rags.

analyzed: saced udakam labheyam
translated: If I could find water,

analyzed: śobhanam syāt iti
translated: that would be good.”

original: tatastatraiva devatā pāṇinā mahīṃ parāhanti sma /
analyzed: tatas tatra eva devatā pāṇinā mahīm parāhanti sma
translated: Then a deity there struck the ground with her hand.

analyzed: tatra puṣkariṇī prādurabhūt
translated: A lotus pond appeared there.

analyzed: adya api sā pāṇi hatā iti puṣkariṇī saṃjñāyate
translated: Even today it is known as the Hand-Struck Lotus Pond.

original: punarapi bodhisattvasyaitadabhavat labdhaṃ mayā pānīyam /🔽sacecchilāṃ labheyam /
analyzed: punar api bodhisattvasya etat abhavat labdham mayā pānīyam  saced śilām labheyam
translated: Again the Bodhisattva thought, “I have found water.🔽If I could find a stone

analyzed: yatra idam pāṃśu kūlam prakṣālayeyam
translated: where I could wash these rags,

analyzed: śobhanam syāt
translated: that would be good.”

analyzed: atha tatra eva śakreṇa śilā tad kṣaṇam eva upanikṣiptā abhūt
translated: Then Śakra immediately placed a stone there.

analyzed: tatas bodhisattvaḥ tat pāṃśu kūlam prakṣālayati sma
translated: Then the Bodhisattva washed the rags.

original: atha śakro devarājo bodhisattvamevamāha dadasvedaṃ satpuruṣa mahyam /
analyzed: atha śakraḥ devarājaḥ bodhisattvam evam āha dadasva idam sat puruṣa mahyam
translated: Then Śakra, lord of the gods, said to the Bodhisattva, Give this to me, good man.

analyzed: aham prakṣālayiṣyāmi iti
translated: I will wash it.

original: tato bodhisattvaḥ svayaṃkāritāṃ pravrajyāyāḥ saṃdarśayituṃ tatpāṃśukūlaṃ śakrasyādatvā svayameva prakṣālayati sma /
analyzed: tatas bodhisattvaḥ svayaṃkāri tām pravrajyāyāḥ saṃdarśayitum tat pāṃśu kūlam śakrasya a datvā svayam eva prakṣālayati sma
translated: Then the Bodhisattva, in order to show that the going forth is to be done by oneself, did not give the piece of cloth to Śakra, but washed it himself.

analyzed: sa śrāntaḥ klānta kāyaḥ vatīrya puṣkariṇīm uttariṣyāmi iti
translated: He, tired and weary in body, thought, I will descend and emerge from the pond.

original: māreṇa ca pāpīyasā Vaidya 🔽īrṣyādharmaparītena puṣkariṇyā atyucchritāni taṭāni nirmitānyabhūvan /
analyzed: māreṇa ca pāpīyasā vaidya  īrṣyā dharma parītena puṣkariṇyāḥ ati ucchritāni taṭāni nirmitāni abhūvan
translated: But Māra, the evil one, overcome by the Dharma of envy,🔽created very high banks around the pond.

analyzed: tasyāḥ ca puṣkariṇyāḥ tīre mahān kukubha pādapaḥ
translated: And on the bank of that pond there was a large kiku tree.

original: tatra devatāṃ bodhisattvo lokānuvṛttyā devatānugrahārthaṃ cābravīt āhara devate vṛkṣaśākhāmiti /
analyzed: tatra devatām bodhisattvaḥ loka anuvṛttyā devatā anugraha artham ca abravīt āhara devate vṛkṣa śākhām iti
translated: There the Bodhisattva, in conformity with the world and in order to favor the gods, said, Bring down a branch of the tree, O goddess.

analyzed: tayā vṛkṣa śākhā avanāmitā abhūt
translated: She bent down a branch of the tree.

analyzed: tām bodhisattvaḥ balambya uttarati sma
translated: The Bodhisattva took hold of it and emerged.

original: uttīrya ca tasya kakubhapādapasyādhastāttatpāṃśukūlaṃ saṃghāṭīkṛtya āsīvyati sma /
analyzed: uttīrya ca tasya kakubha pādapasya adhastāt tat pāṃśu kūlam saṃghāṭīkṛtya āsīvyati sma
translated: And after emerging, under that kiku tree he gathered the piece of cloth into a bundle and sewed it together.

original: adyāpi tat pāṃśukūlaṃ sīvanamityevaṃ saṃjñāyate sma //
analyzed: adya api tat pāṃśu kūlam sīvanam iti evam saṃjñāyate sma
translated: Even today, that piece of cloth is known as the 'sewn one.'

analyzed: atha vimalaprabhaḥ nāma śuddhāvāsa kāyikaḥ deva putraḥ
translated: Then, a god named Vimalaprabha from the Pure Abodes,

original: sa divyāni cīvarāṇi kāṣāyaraṅgaraktāni kalpikāni śramaṇasārūpyāṇi bodhisattvāyopanāmayati sma /
analyzed: sa divyāni cīvarāṇi kāṣāya raṅga raktāni kalpikāni śramaṇa sārūpyāṇi bodhisattvāya upanāmayati sma
translated: offered divine robes dyed in ochre, suitable, and befitting an ascetic, to the Bodhisattva.

original: bodhisattvaśca tāni gṛhītvā pūrvāhṇe nivāsya saṃghāṭīprāvṛtya gocaragrāmābhimukho 'bhut //
analyzed: bodhisattvaḥ ca tāni gṛhītvā pūrvāhṇe nivāsya saṃghāṭī prāvṛtya gocara grāma abhimukhaḥ
translated: The Bodhisattva accepted them, put them on in the morning, and with his upper robe wrapped around him, faced the village where he would go for alms.

original: tatra devatābhirurubilvāsenāpatigrāmake nandikagrāmikaduhituḥ sujātāyā ārocitamabhūdardharātrasamaye yadarthaṃ tvaṃ mahāyajñaṃ yajase tasmādvratāduttīrṇaḥ 🔽saḥ /
analyzed: tatra devatābhiḥ urubilvā senāpati grāmake nandika grāmika duhituḥ sujātāyāḥ ārocitam abhūt ardharātra samaye yad artham tvam mahāyajñam yajase tasmāt vratāt uttīrṇaḥ  / saḥ
translated: There, at midnight, a deity informed the daughter of the village headman of Nandika in the village of Uruvilvā-Seṇā, Sujātā by name, for whose sake she was performing a great sacrifice: The one for whose sake you are performing this great sacrifice, he has completed his austerities,

analyzed: subhagam audārikam āhāram āhariṣyati
translated: and he will eat delicious and substantial food.

original: tvayā ca pūrve praṇidhānaṃ kṛtam mama bhojanaṃ bhuktvā bodhisattvo 'nuttarāṃ samyaksaṃbodhimabhisaṃbudhyeta iti /
analyzed: tvayā ca pūrve praṇidhānam kṛtam mama bhojanam bhuktvā bodhisattvaḥ nuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbudhyeta iti
translated: And you made a vow in the past: 'May the Bodhisattva eat my food and attain supreme perfect enlightenment.'

analyzed: yat te karaṇīyam tat kuruṣva iti
translated: So do what you have to do.

original: atha khalu bhikṣavaḥ sujātā nandikagrāmaduhitā teṣāṃ devatānāṃ tadvacanaṃ śrutvā śīghraṃ gosahasrasya kṣīrātsaptakṛtsāroddhṛtādagryamojomaṇḍaṃ
analyzed: atha khalu bhikṣavaḥ sujātā nandikagrāma duhitā teṣām devatānām tat vacanam śrutvā śīghram go sahasrasya kṣīrāt sapta kṛt sāra uddhṛtāt agryam ojaḥ maṇḍam
translated: Monks, when Sujātā, the daughter of the village headman of Nandika, heard those words of the gods, she quickly took the milk of a thousand cows, which had been boiled seven times, and the best essence of the milk,

analyzed: gṛhṇīte sma  gṛhītvā ca sā tat kṣīram abhinavam
translated: and took it.🔽Having taken that milk, she put it in a new pot,

original: bhinavaistaṇḍulairabhinavāyāṃ sthālyāmabhinavāṃ cullīmupalipya tadbhojanaṃ sādhayati sma /
analyzed: bhinavaiḥ taṇḍulaiḥ abhinavāyām sthālyām abhinavām cullīm upalipya tat bhojanam sādhayati sma
translated: and on a new stove, she prepared that food, having cleaned the place.

original: tasmiṃśca sādhyamāne imāni pūrvanimittāni saṃdṛśyante sma tasmin khalvapi kṣīre śrīvatsasvastikanandyāvartapadmavardhamānādīni maṅgalyāni
analyzed: tasmin ca sādhyamāne imāni pūrva nimittāni saṃdṛśyante sma tasmin khalu api kṣīre śrīvatsa svastika nandyāvarta padma vardhamāna ādīni maṅgalyāni  /
translated: And while it was being prepared, these were the auspicious signs that were seen: in that milk, the auspicious signs of the srivatsa, swastika, nandyāvarta, lotus, and vardhamāna were seen.

analyzed: saṃdṛśyante sma
translated: And those were seen.

analyzed: tatas tasyāḥ etat abhūt yādṛśāni imāni pūrva nimittāni saṃdṛśyante
translated: Then this occurred to her: Since these auspicious signs are seen,

original: niḥsaṃśayamidaṃ bhojanaṃ bhuktvā bodhisattvo 'nuttarāṃ samyaksaṃbodhiṃ prāpsyati /
analyzed: niḥsaṃśayam idam bhojanam bhuktvā bodhisattvaḥ nuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim prāpsyati
translated: there is no doubt that the Bodhisattva, having eaten this food, will attain supreme perfect enlightenment.

analyzed: sāmudra jñāna vidhi jñaḥ ca naimittikaḥ tam pradeśam prāptaḥ bhūt
translated: And a diviner who knew the rules of ocean knowledge had arrived in that place.

analyzed: saḥ pi tathā eva amṛta adhigamanam eva vyākṛtavān
translated: He also predicted the attainment of immortality in the same way.

original: tataḥ sujātā taṃ pāyasaṃ pakvaṃ sthaṇḍilamupalipya puṣpairavakīrya gandhodakenābhyukṣya āsanaṃ prajñāpya satkṛtyottarāṃ nāma ceṭīmāmantrayate
analyzed: tatas sujātā tam pāyasam pakvam sthaṇḍilam upalipya puṣpaiḥ avakīrya gandha udakena abhyukṣya āsanam prajñāpya satkṛtya uttarām nāma ceṭīm āmantrayate  /
translated: Then Sujata, having cooked that rice pudding, anointed a platform, scattered flowers, sprinkled it with perfumed water, prepared a seat, honored it, and addressed her maid named Uttara,

analyzed: sma gaccha uttare brāhmaṇam ānaya
translated: saying, Go, Uttara, and bring a brahmin.

analyzed: aham idam madhu pāyasam avalokayāmi
translated: I will offer this honey-rice pudding.

original: sādhvārya iti pratiśrutya uttarā pūrvāṃ diśamagamat /
analyzed: sādhu ārya iti pratiśrutya uttarā pūrvām diśam agamat
translated: She replied, Excellent, noble lady, and went to the east.

analyzed: sā tatra bodhisattvam paśyati sma
translated: There she saw the Bodhisattva.

analyzed: tathā eva dakṣiṇām
translated: In the same way, she went to the south,

analyzed: bodhisattvam eva paśyati sma
translated: and saw only the Bodhisattva.

analyzed: evam paścimām uttarām eva diśam gacchati sma
translated: Thus she went to the west and north.

analyzed: tatra tatra bodhisattvam eva adrākṣīt
translated: Everywhere she saw only the Bodhisattva.

original: tena khalu punaḥ samayena śuddhāvāsakāyikairdevaputraiḥ sarve 'nyatīrthikā nigṛhītā abhūvan /
analyzed: tena khalu punar samayena śuddhāvāsa kāyikaiḥ devaputraiḥ sarve nyatīrthikāḥ nigṛhītāḥ abhūvan
translated: At that time, the gods of the Pure Abodes had restrained all the non-Buddhist ascetics,

analyzed: na kaścid saṃdṛśyate sma
translated: so that no one was seen.

original: tataḥ sā āgatvā svāminīmevamāha na khalvārye anyaḥ kaścid dṛśyate śramaṇo vā brāhmaṇo vā /
analyzed: tatas sā āgatvā svāminīm evam āha na khalu ārye anyaḥ kaścid dṛśyate śramaṇaḥ vā brāhmaṇaḥ vā
translated: Then she returned and said to her mistress, Noble lady, I do not see any other ascetic or brahmin,

analyzed: anyatra yatas yatas eva gacchāmi
translated: except that wherever I go,

analyzed: tatra tatra śramaṇam eva sundaram paśyāmi
translated: I see that in all those places, the ascetic is the most beautiful.

original: sujātā āha gacchottare sa eva brāhmaṇaḥ /
analyzed: sujātā āha gaccha uttare saḥ eva brāhmaṇaḥ
translated: Sujātā said, Go north, that very brahmin,

analyzed: saḥ eva śramaṇaḥ
translated: that very ascetic,

analyzed: tasya eva arthe yama ārambhaḥ
translated: for his sake this undertaking has begun.

analyzed: tam eva anaya iti
translated: Bring him alone.

original: sādhvārye ityuttarā gatvā bodhisattvasya caraṇayoḥ praṇipatya sujātāyā Vaidya
analyzed: sādhu ārye iti uttarā gatvā bodhisattvasya caraṇayoḥ praṇipatya sujātāyāḥ vaidya
translated: Excellent, noble lady! Having said this, Uttara went and bowed at the feet of the Bodhisattva, and invited Sujātā,

analyzed: nāmnā upanimantrayate sma
translated: the village headman's daughter, to be the doctor.

original: tato bhikṣavo bodhisattvaḥ sujātāyā grāmikaduhiturniveśanaṃ gatvā prajñapta evāsane nyaṣīdat /
analyzed: tatas bhikṣavaḥ bodhisattvaḥ sujātāyāḥ grāmika duhituḥ niveśanam gatvā prajñapte eva āsane nyaṣīdat
translated: Then, monks, the Bodhisattva, having gone to the dwelling of Sujātā, the village headman's daughter, sat down on the prepared seat.

original: atha khalu bhikṣavaḥ sujātā grāmikaduhitā suvarṇamayīṃ pātrīṃ madhupāyasapūrṇāṃ bodhisattvasyopanāmayati sma //
analyzed: atha khalu bhikṣavaḥ sujātā grāmika duhitā suvarṇa mayīm pātrīm madhu pāyasa pūrṇām bodhisattvasya upanāmayati sma
translated: Then, monks, Sujātā, the village headman's daughter, offered to the Bodhisattva a golden bowl filled with milk-rice and honey.

analyzed: atha bodhisattvasya etat abhavat yādṛśam idam sujātayā bhojanam upanāmitam
translated: Then, monks, this occurred to the Bodhisattva: Such is the food that has been offered by Sujātā.

analyzed: niḥsaṃśayam aham adya enam bhojanam bhuktvā anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbhotsyate
translated: Without a doubt, having eaten this food today, I will fully awaken to unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.

original: atha bodhisattvastadbhojanaṃ pratigṛhya sujātāṃ grāmikaduhitarametadavocat iyaṃ bhagini suvarṇapātrī /
analyzed: atha bodhisattvaḥ tat bhojanam pratigṛhya sujātām grāmika duhitaram etat avocat iyam bhagini suvarṇa pātrī
translated: Then the Bodhisattva accepted the food and said to Sujātā, the daughter of the village headman, “Sister, this golden bowl—

analyzed: kim kriyatām
translated: what should be done with it?”

analyzed: sā āha tava eva bhavatu iti
translated: She said, “It should be yours.”

original: bodhisattva āha na mamedṛśena bhājanena prayojanam /
analyzed: bodhisattvaḥ āha na mama īdṛśena bhājanena prayojanam
translated: The Bodhisattva said, “I have no use for such a vessel.”

analyzed: sujātā āha yatheṣṭam kriyatām
translated: Sujātā said, “Do with it as you wish.”

analyzed: na aham vinā bhājanena kasyacid bhojanam prayacchāmi
translated: “I do not give food to anyone without a vessel.”

original: atha bodhisattvastaṃ piṇḍapātramādāyorubilvāyā niṣkramya nāganadīṃ pūrvāhṇakālasamaye
analyzed: atha bodhisattvaḥ tam piṇḍa pātram ādāya urubilvāyāḥ niṣkramya nāga nadīm pūrvāhṇa kāla samaye
translated: Then the Bodhisattva took the alms bowl and left Uruvilvā. In the morning,

original: nadīṃ nairañjanāmupasaṃkramya taṃ piṇḍapātraṃ cīvarāṇi caikānte nikṣipya nadīṃ nairañjanāmavatarati
analyzed: nadīm nairañjanām upasaṃkramya tam piṇḍapātram cīvarāṇi ca ekānte nikṣipya nadīm nairañjanām avatarati
translated: he went to the Nairañjanā River. He placed the alms bowl and robes on the bank and entered the river.

analyzed: sma gātrāṇi śītalīkartum
translated: He went into the water to cool his limbs.

original: bodhisattvasya khalu punarbhikṣavaḥ snāyato 'nekāni devaputraśatasahasrāṇi divyāgurucandanacūrṇavilepanairnadīmāloḍayanti sma /
analyzed: bodhisattvasya khalu punar bhikṣavaḥ snāyataḥ nekāni devaputra śata sahasrāṇi divya aguru candana cūrṇa vilepanaiḥ nadīm āloḍayanti sma
translated: Bhikṣus, while the Bodhisattva was bathing, many hundreds of thousands of devas churned the river with divine sandalwood powder and ointments.

original: divyāni ca nānāvarṇāni kusumāni jale kṣipanti sma yaduta bodhisattvasya pūjākarmaṇe //
analyzed: divyāni ca nānā varṇāni kusumāni jale kṣipanti sma yat uta bodhisattvasya pūjā karmaṇe
translated: They also threw divine flowers of various colors into the water in order to make offerings to the Bodhisattva.

original: tena khalu punaḥ samayena nairañjanā nadī divyairgandhaiḥ puṣpaiśca samākulā vahati sma /
analyzed: tena khalu punar samayena nairañjanā nadī divyaiḥ gandhaiḥ puṣpaiḥ ca samākulā vahati sma
translated: At that time, the Nairañjanā River flowed filled with divine fragrances and flowers.

analyzed: yena ca gandha udakena bodhisattvaḥ snātaḥ bhūt
translated: The divine water with which the Bodhisattva bathed

original: taṃ devaputrakoṭīniyutaśatasahasrāṇyabhyutkṣipya svakasvakāni bhavanāni nayanti sma caityārthaṃ pūjārthaṃ ca //
analyzed: tam devaputra koṭī niyuta śata sahasrāṇi abhyutkṣipya svaka svakāni bhavanāni nayanti sma caitya artham pūjā artham ca
translated: was taken up by many hundreds of thousands of millions of billions of gods and carried to their own abodes for the sake of worship and veneration.

analyzed: yāni ca bodhisattvasya keśa śmaśrūṇi abhūvan
translated: All the hair and beard of the Bodhisattva

original: tāni sarvāṇi sujātā grāmikaduhitā maṅgalyānīti kṛtvā caityārthaṃ pūjārthaṃ ca parigṛhṇīte sma //
analyzed: tāni sarvāṇi sujātā grāmika duhitā maṅgalyāni iti kṛtvā caitya artham pūjā artham ca parigṛhṇīte sma
translated: were taken by Sujātā, the village overseer's daughter, as auspicious and for the sake of worship and veneration.

original: nadyuttīrṇaśca bodhisattvaḥ pulinaṃ nirīkṣate sma upaveṣṭukāmaḥ /
analyzed: nadī uttīrṇaḥ ca bodhisattvaḥ pulinam nirīkṣate smaḥ upaveṣṭu kāmaḥ
translated: After crossing the river, the Bodhisattva looked at the sandbank, wishing to sit down.

original: atha yā nairañjanāyāṃ nadyāṃ nāgakanyā sā dharaṇitalādabhyudgabhya maṇimayaṃ manoramaṃ
analyzed: atha yā nairañjanāyām nadyām nāga kanyā sā dharaṇi talāt abhyudgabhya maṇi mayam manoramam
translated: Then the nāga maiden of the Nairañjanā River rose up from the ground and offered a beautiful jeweled seat

analyzed: bhadrāsanam bodhisattvāya upanāmayati sma
translated: to the Bodhisattva.

original: tatra bodhisattvo niṣadya yāvadarthaṃ taṃ madhupāyasaṃ paribhuṅkte sma sujātāyā grāmikaduhituranukampāmupādāya /
analyzed: tatra bodhisattvaḥ niṣadya yāvadartham tam madhu pāyasam paribhuṅkte sma sujātāyāḥ grāmika duhituḥ anukampām upādāya
translated: There the Bodhisattva sat down and ate the honeyed milk-rice to his satisfaction, out of compassion for Sujata, the village overseer's daughter.

original: paribhujya ca tāṃ suvarṇapātrīmanapekṣo vāriṇi prākṣipati sma /
analyzed: paribhujya ca tām suvarṇa pātrīm anapekṣaḥ vāriṇi prākṣipati sma
translated: Having eaten, he threw the golden bowl into the water without hesitation.

original: kṣiptamātrāṃ ca tāṃ sāgaro nāgarājaścittikārabahumānajāto gṛhītvā svabhavanābhimukhaḥ prasthito 'bhut pūjārheti kṛtvā /
analyzed: kṣipta mātrām ca tām sāgaraḥ nāga rājaḥ cittikāra bahu māna jātaḥ gṛhītvā sva bhavana abhimukhaḥ prasthitaḥ bhuj pūjā arhā iti kṛtvā
translated: As soon as it was thrown in, Sagara, the king of the nagas, out of respect and great esteem, took it and set out in the direction of his own palace, thinking it was worthy of worship.

original: atha daśaśatanayanaḥ puraṃdaro garuḍarūpamabhinirmāya vajratuṇḍo bhūtvā sāgarasya nāgarājasyāntikāttāṃ suvarṇapātrīṃ hartumārabdhaḥ /
analyzed: atha daśa śata nayanaḥ puraṃdaraḥ garuḍa rūpam abhinirmāya vajratuṇḍaḥ bhūtvā sāgarasya nāga rājasya antikāt tām suvarṇa pātrīm hartum ārabdhaḥ
translated: Then Purandara, the one with a thousand eyes, transformed himself into the form of Garuda, became a vajra-beaked [bird], and tried to take the golden bowl from Sagara, the king of the nagas.

analyzed: yadā na śaknoti sma
translated: But when he was unable to [take it],

original: tadā svarūpeṇādareṇa yācitvā trāyatriṃśadbhavanaṃ nītavān pūjārthaṃ caityārthaṃ ca /
analyzed: tadā sva rūpeṇa ādareṇa yācitvā trāyatriṃśat bhavanam nītavān pūjā artham caitya artham ca
translated: he respectfully asked for it in his own form and took it to the heaven of the Thirty-Three for worship and as a shrine.

analyzed: nītvā pātrīyātrām nāma parvaṇi pravartitavān
translated: Having taken it, he instituted the festival called the Bowl Procession.

original: adyāpi ca trāyatriṃśeṣu deveṣu pratisaṃvatsaraṃ pātrīmaho vartate /
analyzed: adya api ca trāyatriṃśeṣu deveṣu pratisaṃvatsaram pātrī mahaḥ vartate
translated: Even now, among the Thirty-Three gods, the festival of the bowl takes place every year.

original: tacca bhadrāsanaṃ tayaiva nāgakanyayā parigṛhītaṃ caityārthaṃ pūjārthaṃ ca //
analyzed: tat ca bhadrāsanam tayā eva nāga kanyayā parigṛhītam caitya artham pūjā artham ca
translated: And that auspicious seat was taken by that very nāga maiden for the purpose of worship and veneration.

analyzed: vaidya
translated: Vidy

analyzed: samanta paribhuktaḥ ca bhikṣavaḥ bodhisattvena audārikaḥ āhāraḥ
translated: Monks, the Bodhisattva then consumed coarse food.

original: atha tatkṣaṇameva bodhisattvasya puṇyabalena prajñābalena pūrvikā kāye śubhavarṇapuṣkaratā prādurabhūt /
analyzed: atha tad kṣaṇam eva bodhisattvasya puṇya balena prajñā balena pūrvikā kāye śubha varṇa puṣkara tā prādurabhūt
translated: Then, at that very moment, by the power of the Bodhisattva's merit and the power of his wisdom, the previous beauty and excellence of his body reappeared.

analyzed: dvātriṃśat ca mahāpuruṣa lakṣaṇāni aśītiḥ ca anuvyañjanāni vyāma prabha tā ca
translated: And the thirty-two marks of a great man and the eighty minor marks appeared, as well as the radiance of a fathom.

analyzed: tatra idam ucyate
translated: Regarding this, it is said:

original: ṣaḍvarṣa vrata uttaritva bhagavān evaṃ matiṃ cintayan so 'haṃ dhyānaabhijñajñānabalavānevaṃ kṛśāṅgo 'pi san /🔽gaccheyaṃ drumarājamūlaviṭapaṃ sarvajñatāṃ buddhituṃ no me syādanukampitā hi janatā evaṃ bhavet paścimā // / //
analyzed: bhagavān evam matim cintayan saḥ ham dhyāna abhijña jñāna balavān evam san  gaccheyam drumarāja mūla viṭapam sarvajña tām buddhitum no me syāt anukampitā hi janatā evam bhavet paścimā
translated: The Blessed One, having completed the six-year vow, thought thus: Although I am emaciated, I have the power of meditation, supernormal knowledge, and wisdom.🔽I shall go to the foot of the king of trees to attain omniscience. Otherwise, the people would not be so compassionate.

original: yattvaudārika bhuktva bhojanavaraṃ kāye balaṃ kṛtvanā gaccheyaṃ drumarājamūlaviṭapaṃ sarvajñatāṃ budhyitum /
analyzed: yat tu audārika bhuktvā bhojana varam kāye balam gaccheyam drumarāja mūla viṭapam sarvajña tām budhyitum
translated: Having eaten excellent food and gained strength in the body, I shall go to the foot of the king of trees to attain omniscience.

original: mā haivetvarapuṇya devamanujā lūhena jñānekṣiṇo no śaktā siya budhyanāya amṛtaṃ kāyena te durbalāḥ // / //
analyzed: mā ha eva itvara puṇya deva manujāḥ lūhena jñāna īkṣiṇaḥ no śaktā siya budhyanāya amṛtam kāyena te durbalāḥ
translated: May the gods and humans with little merit not be able to attain enlightenment with their weak bodies, seeking knowledge through inferior means, unable to attain immortality.

original: sā ca grāmikadhīta pūrvacaritā nāmnā sujātā iti
analyzed: sā ca grāmikadhīta pūrvacaritā nāmnā sujātā iti
translated: And that village girl, who had practiced in the past, was named Sujata.

original: yajñā nityu yajāti evamanasā siddhe vrataṃ nāyake /
analyzed: evamanasā siddhe vratam nāyake
translated: She always made offerings at sacrifices, thinking, May the leader of the vow be successful.

original: sā devāna niśāmya codana tadā gṛhyā madhūpāyasaṃ
analyzed: sā tadā gṛhyā madhūpāyasam
translated: Having heard the gods' exhortation, she then took honeyed rice gruel

analyzed: upagamyā naditi iri hṛṣṭa manasā nairañjanāyāḥ sthitā
translated: and went to the bank of the Nairañjanā River, standing there with a joyful mind.

analyzed: saḥ ca a kalpa sahasra cīrṇa caritaḥ śānta praśānta indriyaḥ
translated: He, who had practiced for a thousand eons, with peaceful and calm faculties,

analyzed: devaiḥ nāga gaṇaiḥ ṛṣī parivṛtaḥ āgatya nairañjanām
translated: surrounded by gods, nāgas, and hosts of sages, came to the Nairañjanā River.

original: tīrṇastāraku pārasattva matimāṃ snāne matiṃ cintayan
analyzed: tīrṇaḥ tāraku pārasattva matimān snāne matim cintayan
translated: Having crossed, the wise one, the savior of beings, thinking of bathing,

original: oruhyā nadi snāpi śuddhavimalo lokānukampī muniḥ // / //
analyzed: oruhyāḥ nadi snāpi śuddha vimalaḥ loka anukampī muniḥ
translated: descended into the river, the pure and stainless sage, compassionate towards the world.

original: devā koṭisahasra hṛṣṭamanasā gandhāmbu cūrṇāni ca
analyzed: gandha ambu cūrṇāni ca
translated: Tens of thousands of delighted gods, with fragrant water and powders,

original: oruhyā nadi loḍayanti salilaṃ snānārtha sattvottame /
analyzed: oruhyā nadi loḍayanti salilam snāna artha sattva uttame
translated: having descended into the river, churned the water for the supreme being to bathe in.

original: snānā snātvana bodhisattva vimalastīre sthitaḥ sūrataḥ
analyzed: bodhisattva vimalaḥ tīre sthitaḥ sūrataḥ

original: yasyā tejatu puṇyataśca śiriye brāhmaḥ patho jñāyate maitrī vā karuṇā upekṣa muditā dhyānānyabhijñāstathā /
analyzed: puṇyataḥ ca śiriye brāhmaḥ pathaḥ jñāyate maitrī vā karuṇā muditā dhyānāni abhijñāḥ tathā
translated: Whose path of Brahmā is known by its splendor and merit, by loving-kindness, compassion, equanimity, and joy, and by the meditative absorptions and higher knowledges,

analyzed: vaidya
translated: Vidy

analyzed: saḥ yam kalpa sahasra cīrṇa caritaḥ bodhi drumam prasthitaḥ
translated: He who has practiced for a thousand eons and has set out for the Bodhi tree,

original: pūjāṃ sādhu karotha tasya munino āśivrate sādhanām // / //
analyzed: pūjām sādhu karotha tasya muninaḥ āśi vrate sādhanām
translated: Do well to make offerings to that Sage, who has accomplished the conduct of auspicious vows.

original: yaṃ gatvā śaraṇaṃ na durgatibhayaṃ prāpnoti naivākṣaṇaṃ
analyzed: yam gatvā śaraṇam na durgati bhayam prāpnoti na eva akṣaṇam
translated: Having gone for refuge to whom, one does not attain the fear of bad destinies or inauspicious times,

original: deveṣviṣṭasukhaṃ ca prāpya vipulaṃ brahmālayaṃ gacchati /
analyzed: deveṣu iṣṭa sukham ca prāpya vipulam brahmālayam gacchati
translated: And having attained the vast and most desirable happiness of the gods, one goes to the abode of Brahmā.

analyzed: ṣaḍ vaṣāṇi duṣkara carim yāti eṣa bodhi drumam
translated: Having practiced the difficult practice for six years, he goes to the Bodhi tree,

analyzed: sādhu sarvi udagra hṛṣṭa manasaḥ pūjā asya kurvāmahe
translated: All of you, being well-disposed, with joyful minds, let us make offerings to him.

analyzed: rājā asau tri sahasri īśvara varaḥ dharma īśvaraḥ pārthivaḥ
translated: That king is the supreme lord of the trichiliocosm, the lord of the Dharma, the earthly one,

original: śakrābrahmapure ca candrasuriye nāstyasya kaścit samaḥ /
analyzed: śakrābrahmapure ca candrasuriye na asti asya kaścid samaḥ
translated: In the city of Shakra, Brahma, the moon, and the sun, there is no one equal to him.

analyzed: yasyāḥ kṣetra koṭi nayutā saṃkampitā ṣaḍvidhā
translated: In whose birth, millions of buddha-fields trembled in six ways,

original: saiṣo 'dya vrajate mahādrumavaraṃ mārasya jetuṃ camūn // / //
analyzed: sa eṣaḥ dya vrajate mahā druma varam mārasya jetum camūn
translated: He now goes to the best of great trees to conquer Mara's army.

original: mūrdhnaṃ yasya na śakyamīkṣitumiha brahmālaye 'pi sthitaiḥ
analyzed: yasya na śakyam īkṣitum iha brahmālaye sthitaiḥ
translated: Whose head cannot be seen even by those dwelling in Brahma's realm,

analyzed: kāyaḥ yasya vara agra lakṣaṇa dharaḥ dvātriṃśat alaṃkṛtaḥ
translated: Whose body bears the supreme marks, adorned with thirty-two,

analyzed: vāgyasyā iha manojña valgu madhurā brahma svarā su svarā
translated: Whose speech here is delightful, sweet, and soft, with the voice of Brahma, well-sounding,

original: cittaṃ yasya praśānta doṣarahitaṃ gacchāma tatpūjane // / //
analyzed: cittam yasya praśānta doṣa rahitam gacchāma tad pūjane
translated: Whose mind is peaceful, free from faults, we shall go to worship him.

original: yeṣāṃ vā mati brahmaśakrabhavane nityaṃ sukha kṣepituṃ
analyzed: yeṣām vā mati brahma śakra bhavane nityam kṣepitum
translated: For those whose mind is set on always enjoying bliss in the abode of Brahma and Shakra,

original: athavā sarvakileśabandhanalatāṃ chettuṃ hi tāṃ jālinīm /
analyzed: athavā sarva kileśa bandhana latām chettum hi tām jālinīm
translated: Or to cut through the net of all the bonds and vines of afflictions,

analyzed: a śrutvā paratas spṛśeyam amṛtam pratyeka bodhim śivām
translated: Without hearing from another, to touch the nectar of the auspicious individual enlightenment,

original: buddhatvaṃ yadi vepsitaṃ tribhuvane pūjetvasau nāyakam // / //
analyzed: buddha tvam yadi vā īpsitam tribhuvane pūjetu asau nāyakam
translated: If Buddhahood is desired in the three worlds, one should worship that Guide.

analyzed: tyaktā yena sa sāgarā vasumatī ratnāni anantāni atho
translated: By whom the earth with its oceans was given away, as well as countless jewels,

analyzed: prāsādāḥ ca gavākṣa harmya kalikāḥ yugyāni yānāni ca
translated: Palaces with windows and turrets, and pairs of vehicles,

analyzed: udyāna kūpa āsarāḥ
translated: The earth adorned with garlands of flowers, beautiful parks and ponds,

analyzed: pāda śira uttama aṅga nayanā saḥ bodhimaṇḍa unmukhaḥ
translated: With hands, feet, head, eyes, he is turned towards the seat of awakening.

original: iti hi bhikṣavastrisāhasramahāsāhasriko mahābrahmā imaṃ trisāhasramahāsāhasraṃ lokadhātuṃ tatkṣaṇaṃ samamadhyatiṣṭhat /
analyzed: iti hi bhikṣavaḥ trisāhasramahāsāhasrikaḥ mahābrahmā imam tri sāhasra mahā sāhasram lokadhātum tad kṣaṇam samam adhyatiṣṭhat
translated: Thus, monks, the Great Brahma of the Great Trichiliocosm at that moment made the Great Trichiliocosm even.

analyzed: pāṇi tala jātam apagata śarkara kaṭhallam utsada maṇi mukti vaidūrya śaṅkha śilā pravāla rajata jātarūpyam
translated: It became like the palm of a hand, free from gravel and pebbles, with abundant jewels, pearls, lapis lazuli, conch shells, crystals, corals, silver,

analyzed: nīla mṛdu kuṇḍala jāta pradakṣiṇa nandyāvarta kācilindika sukha saṃsparśaiḥ ca tṛṇaiḥ imam
translated: and with soft, blue, curly grass growing to the right, like the nandyāvarta grass, pleasant to the touch. It covered

analyzed: tri sāhasra mahā sāhasram lokadhātum saṃchāditam adhyatiṣṭhat
translated: this Great Trichiliocosm.

original: sarve ca tadā mahāsamudrā dharaṇītalasaṃsthitā abhūvan /
analyzed: sarve ca tadā mahā samudrāḥ dharaṇī tala saṃsthitāḥ abhūvan
translated: And at that time all the great oceans were on the surface of the earth.

analyzed: na ca jalacarāṇām sattvānām kācid viheṭhā abhūt
translated: And there was no harm to any water-dwelling beings.

original: imaṃ caiva lokadhātumalaṃkṛtaṃ dṛṣṭvā ca daśasu dikṣu śakrabrahmalokapālairbodhisattvasya pūjākarmaṇe buddhakṣetraśatasahasrāṇi samalaṃkṛtānyabhūvan
analyzed: imam ca eva lokadhātum alaṃkṛtam dṛṣṭvā ca daśasu dikṣu śakra brahma lokapālaiḥ bodhisattvasya pūjā karmaṇe buddhakṣetra śata sahasrāṇi samalaṃkṛtāni abhūvan
translated: And having seen this adorned world realm, in the ten directions the Śakras, Brahmās, and Lokapālas, in order to make offerings to the Bodhisattva, adorned a hundred thousand buddha-fields.

original: bodhisattvaiśca divyamānuṣyakātikrāntaiḥ pūjāvyūhairdaśasu dikṣvaprameyāṇi buddhakṣetrāṇi pratimaṇḍitānyabhūvan Vaidya
analyzed: bodhisattvaiḥ ca divya mānuṣyaka atikrāntaiḥ pūjā vyūhaiḥ daśasu dikṣu aprameyāṇi buddhakṣetrāṇi pratimaṇḍitāni abhūvan vaidya
translated: And the bodhisattvas, with offerings surpassing those of gods and humans, adorned immeasurable buddha-fields in the ten directions.

analyzed: bodhisattvasya pūjā karmaṇe
translated: In order to make offerings to the Bodhisattva.

original: sarvāṇi ca tāni buddhakṣetrāṇyekamiva buddhakṣetraṃ saṃdṛśyante sma /
analyzed: sarvāṇi ca tāni buddhakṣetrāṇi ekam iva buddhakṣetram saṃdṛśyante sma
translated: And all those buddha-fields were seen as if they were one buddha-field.

analyzed: nānā vyūha alaṃkāra alaṃkṛtāni ca
translated: Adorned with various arrays and ornaments.

original: na ca bhūyo lokāntarikā na ca kālaparvatā na ca cakravālamahācakravālāḥ prajñāyante sma /
analyzed: na ca bhūyas loka āntarikāḥ na ca kālaparvatāḥ na ca cakravāla mahā cakravālāḥ prajñāyante sma
translated: And the intermundane spaces, the Kālaparvata mountains, and the Cakravāla and Mahācakravāla mountain ranges were no longer perceived.

original: sarvāṇi ca tāni buddhakṣetrāṇi bodhisattvasyābhayā sphuṭāni saṃdṛśyante sma /
analyzed: sarvāṇi ca tāni buddhakṣetrāṇi bodhisattvasya ābhayā sphuṭāni saṃdṛśyante sma
translated: And all those buddha-fields were seen to be filled with the light of the Bodhisattva.

analyzed: ṣoḍaśa ca bodhimaṇḍa paripālikāḥ deva putrāḥ
translated: And the sixteen gods who guard the Bodhi tree,

original: tadyathā utkhalī ca nāma devaputraḥ sūtkhalī ca nāma prajāpatiśca śūrabalaśca keyūrabalaśca
analyzed: tat yathā utkhalī ca nāma deva putraḥ sūtkhalī ca nāma prajāpatiḥ ca śūrabalaḥ ca keyūrabalaḥ ca
translated: namely the gods Utkhalī, Sutkhalī, Prajāpati, Śūrabala, Keyūrabala,

original: supratisthitaśca mahiṃdharaśca avabhāsakaraśca vimalaśca dharmeśvaraśca dharmaketuśca
analyzed: supratisthitaḥ ca mahiṃdharaḥ ca avabhāsakaraḥ ca vimalaḥ ca dharmeśvaraḥ ca dharmaketuḥ ca
translated: Supratiṣṭhita, Mahindhara, Avabhāsakara, Vimalā, Dharmeśvara, Dharmaketu,

analyzed: siddhapātraḥ ca apratihatanetraḥ ca mahāvyūhaḥ ca śīlaviśuddhanetraḥ ca padmaprabhaḥ ca
translated: Siddhapātra, Apratihata-netra, Mahāvyūha, Śīla-viśuddha-netra, Padma-prabha.

original: itīme ṣoḍaśa bodhimaṇḍapratipālakā devaputrāḥ sarve 'vaivartyakṣāntipratilabdhāste bodhisattvasya pūjārthaṃ bodhimaṇḍaṃ maṇḍayanti sma /🔽samantādaśītiyojanāni saptabhī ratnavedikābhiḥ parivṛtaṃ saptabhistālapaṅktibhiḥ saptabhī ratnakiṅkiṇījālaiḥ saptabhī ratnasūtraiḥ parivṛtam /
analyzed: iti ime ṣoḍaśa bodhimaṇḍa pratipālakāḥ deva putrāḥ sarve vaivartya kṣānti pratilabdhāḥ te bodhisattvasya pūjā artham bodhimaṇḍam maṇḍayanti sma  samantāt aśīti yojanāni saptabhiḥ ratna vedikābhiḥ parivṛtam saptabhiḥ tāla paṅktibhiḥ saptabhiḥ ratna kiṅkiṇī jālaiḥ saptabhiḥ ratna sūtraiḥ parivṛtam
translated: These sixteen gods who guard the seat of awakening, all of whom have attained irreversible acceptance, adorned the seat of awakening for the sake of worshipping the Bodhisattva.🔽All around, for eighty leagues, it was surrounded by seven jeweled terraces, seven rows of palm trees, seven nets of jeweled bells, and seven jeweled threads.

analyzed: sapta ratna pratyuptaiḥ ca jāmbūnada suvarṇa paṭaiḥ suvarṇa sūtraiḥ jāmbūnada suvarṇa padmaiḥ ca avakīrṇam sāra vara gandha nirdhūpitam ratna jāla saṃchannam
translated: It was covered with cloths of Jāmbūnada gold studded with the seven jewels, with golden threads, and with Jāmbūnada gold lotuses. It was perfumed with the finest fragrant incense and covered with jeweled nets.

original: ye ca daśasu dikṣu nānālokadhātuṣu vividhā vṛkṣāḥ santyabhijātā abhipūjitā divyamānuṣyakāste 'pi sarve tatra bodhimaṇḍe saṃdṛśyante sma /🔽yāśca daśasu dikṣu nānāprakārā jalasthalajāḥ puṣpajātayastā api sarvāstatra bodhimaṇḍe saṃdṛśyante sma /
analyzed: ye ca daśasu dikṣu nānā lokadhātuṣu vividhāḥ vṛkṣāḥ santi abhijātāḥ abhipūjitāḥ divya mānuṣyakāḥ te pi sarve tatra bodhimaṇḍe saṃdṛśyante sma  yāḥ ca daśasu dikṣu nānā prakārāḥ jala sthala jāḥ puṣpa jātayaḥ tāḥ api sarvāḥ tatra bodhimaṇḍe saṃdṛśyante sma
translated: And the various trees in the various world systems in the ten directions, which are renowned and worshipped by gods and humans, all appeared there in the Bodhimaṇḍa.🔽And all the various kinds of water and land flowers in the ten directions appeared there in the Bodhimaṇḍa.

original: ye 'pi ca daśasu dikṣu nānālokadhātuṣu bodhisattvā bodhimaṇḍālaṃkurvantyapramāṇapuṇyajñānasaṃbhāravyūhaiste 'pi tatra bodhimaṇḍe saṃdṛśyante 🔽sma //
analyzed: ye pi ca daśasu dikṣu nānā lokadhātuṣu bodhisattvāḥ bodhimaṇḍa alaṃkurvanti apramāṇa puṇya jñāna saṃbhāra vyūhaiḥ te pi tatra bodhimaṇḍe saṃdṛśyante  / sma
translated: And the bodhisattvas in the various world systems in the ten directions who were adorning the Bodhimaṇḍa with the displays of the immeasurable accumulations of merit and wisdom also appeared there in the Bodhimaṇḍa.

original: iti hi bhikṣavo bodhimaṇḍaparipālakairdevaputraistādṛśā vyūhā bodhimaṇḍe abhinirmitā abhūvan /
analyzed: iti hi bhikṣavaḥ bodhimaṇḍa paripālakaiḥ deva putraiḥ tādṛśāḥ vyūhāḥ bodhimaṇḍe abhinirmitāḥ abhūvan
translated: Thus, monks, the divine princes who guarded the Bodhimaṇḍa created such displays in the Bodhimaṇḍa.

analyzed: yān dṛṣṭvā deva nāga yakṣa gandharva asurāḥ sva bhavanāni śmaśāna saṃjñām utpādayāmāsuḥ
translated: Seeing them, the gods, nāgas, yakṣas, gandharvas, and asuras regarded their own abodes as charnel grounds.

analyzed: tān ca vyūhān dṛṣṭvā atyartham citrīkāram utpādayāmāsuḥ
translated: Seeing those displays, they were filled with wonder.

analyzed: evam udānam ca udānayāmāsuḥ sādhu aho cintyaḥ puṇya vipāka nisyandaḥ iti
translated: And they exclaimed, “How wonderful! The outpouring of the ripening of merit is inconceivable!”

analyzed: catvāraḥ ca bodhivṛkṣa devatāḥ
translated: And the four tree deities of the Bodhi tree.

analyzed: tat yathā veṇuḥ ca valguḥ ca sumanaḥ ca ojāpatiḥ ca
translated: Namely, Veṇu, Valgu, Suman, and Ojāpati.

original: ete catvāro bodhivṛkṣadevatā bodhisattvasya pūjārthaṃ bodhivṛkṣaṃ māpayanti sma mūlasaṃpannaṃ
analyzed: ete catvāraḥ bodhivṛkṣa devatāḥ bodhisattvasya pūjā artham bodhivṛkṣam māpayanti sma mūla saṃpannam
translated: These four tree deities, for the sake of worshipping the Bodhisattva, created a Bodhi tree with excellent roots,

original: skandhasaṃpannaṃ śākhāpatrapuṣpaphalasaṃpannaṃ ārohapariṇāhasaṃpannaṃ prāsādikaṃ🔽darśanīyaṃ vistīrṇamaśītistālānuccaistvena tadanurūpeṇa pariṇāhena citraṃ darśanīyaṃ🔽manoramaṃ saptabhī ratnavedikābhiḥ parivṛtaṃ saptabhī ratnatālapaṅktibhiḥ saptabhī
analyzed: skandha saṃpannam śākhā patra puṣpa phala saṃpannam āroha pariṇāha saṃpannam prāsādikam  darśanīyam vistīrṇam aśītiḥ tāla anuccaistvena tad anurūpeṇa pariṇāhena citram darśanīyam  manoramam saptabhiḥ ratna vedikābhiḥ parivṛtam saptabhiḥ ratna tāla paṅktibhiḥ saptabhī
translated: excellent trunk, excellent branches, leaves, flowers, and fruits, excellent height and girth, beautiful,🔽pleasing to the eye, vast, eighty palm trees high, with a corresponding girth, colorful, pleasing to the eye,

analyzed: ratna kiṅkiṇī jālaiḥ saptabhiḥ ratna sūtraiḥ samantāt anuparivṛtaiḥ anuparikṣiptam pārijātaka kovidāra prakāśam atṛpta cakṣuḥ darśanam
translated: delightful, surrounded by seven jeweled platforms, with seven rows of jeweled palm trees, with seven nets of jeweled bells, with seven jeweled threads all around, with seven jeweled railings, shining like the pārijātaka tree, with an insatiable sight.

original: sa ca pṛthivīpradeśastrisāhasramahāsāhasralokadhātuvajreṇābhidṛḍhaḥ sāro 'bhedyavajramayaḥ saṃsthito 'bhūt yatra bodhisattvo niṣaṇṇo 'bhūdbodhimabhisaṃboddhukāmaḥ
analyzed: sa ca pṛthivī pradeśaḥ tri sāhasra mahā sāhasra lokadhātu vajreṇa abhidṛḍhaḥ sāraḥ bhedya vajra mayaḥ saṃsthitaḥ bhūt yatra bodhisattvaḥ niṣaṇṇaḥ bhūt bodhim abhisaṃboddhu kāmaḥ
translated: And that place on the earth became as firm as the adamantine core of the great trichiliocosm, solid, indestructible, and made of diamond, where the Bodhisattva sat, wishing to attain full and complete awakening.

original: iti hi bhikṣavo bodhisattvena bodhimaṇḍamupasaṃkramatā tathārūpā kāyātprabhā muktābhūt /
analyzed: iti hi bhikṣavaḥ bodhisattvena bodhimaṇḍam upasaṃkramatā tathārūpā kāyāt prabhā muktā abhūt
translated: Thus, monks, as the Bodhisattva was going to the seat of awakening, he emitted from his body a light

original: yayā prabhayā sarve 'pāyāḥ śāntā abhūvan /🔽sarvāṇyakṣaṇāni pithitānyabhūvan /
analyzed: yayā prabhayā sarve pāyāḥ śāntāḥ abhūvan  sarvāṇi akṣaṇāni pithitāni abhūvan
translated: by which all the lower realms became pacified.🔽All the inauspicious moments were closed off.

analyzed: sarva durgati vedanāḥ ca upaśoṣitāḥ anubhavan
translated: And all the feelings of suffering in the lower realms were alleviated.

analyzed: ye ca sattvāḥ vikala indriyāḥ abhūvan
translated: Those beings who had incomplete faculties

original: te sarve paripūrṇendriyatāmanuprāpnuvan /🔽vyādhitāśca vyādhibhyo vyamucyanta /🔽bhayārditāścāśvāsaprāptā abhūvan /
analyzed: te sarve paripūrṇa indriya tām anuprāpnuvan  vyādhitāḥ ca vyādhibhyaḥ vyamucyanta  bhaya arditāḥ ca āśvāsa prāptāḥ abhūvan
translated: all attained complete faculties.🔽The sick were freed from their illnesses.🔽Those afflicted with fear obtained relief.

analyzed: bandhana baddhāḥ ca bandhanebhyaḥ vyamucyanta
translated: Those bound in prison were freed from their bonds.

analyzed: daridrāḥ ca sattvāḥ bhogavantaḥ bhūvan
translated: Poor beings became wealthy.

analyzed: kleśa saṃtaptāḥ ca niṣparidāhāḥ abhūvan
translated: Those tormented by afflictions became free from distress.

analyzed: vaidya bubhukṣitāḥ ca sattvāḥ pūrṇa udarāḥ abhūvan
translated: Hungry beings seeking food became filled with food.

analyzed: pipāsitāḥ ca tṛṣā apagatāḥ abhūvan
translated: Those who were thirsty became free from thirst.

analyzed: gurviṇyaḥ ca sukhena prasūyante sma
translated: Pregnant women gave birth easily.

analyzed: jīrṇa durbalāḥ ca bala saṃpannāḥ abhūvan
translated: The old and weak became endowed with strength.

original: na ca kasyacitsattvasya tasmin samaye rāgo bādhate dveṣo va moho vā krodho vā lobho vā khilo vā vyāpādo vā īrṣyā vā mātsaryo vā /
analyzed: na ca kasyacid sattvasya tasmin samaye rāgaḥ bādhate dveṣaḥ mohaḥ vā krodhaḥ vā lobhaḥ vā khilaḥ vā vyāpādaḥ vā īrṣyā vā mātsaryaḥ vā
translated: At that time, no being was afflicted by desire, hatred, delusion, anger, greed, resentment, malice, envy, or stinginess.

original: na kaścitsattvastasmin samaye mriyate sma /🔽na cyavate sma /
analyzed: na kaścid sattvaḥ tasmin samaye mriyate sma  na cyavate sma
translated: At that time, no being died.🔽No one fell away.

analyzed: na upapadyate sma
translated: No one was reborn.

original: sarvasattvāśca tasmin samaye maitracittā hitacittāḥ parasparaṃ mātāpitṛsaṃjñino 'bhūvan //
analyzed: sarva sattvāḥ ca tasmin samaye maitra cittāḥ hita cittāḥ parasparam mātā pitṛ saṃjñinaḥ bhūvan
translated: At that time, all beings had loving minds, helpful minds, and the perception of each other as mother and father.

analyzed: tatra idam ucyate
translated: Regarding this, it is said:

analyzed: yāvat ca avīci paryantam narakāḥ ghora darśanāḥ
translated: As far as the Avīci hell, the terrifying realms,

original: duḥkhaṃ praśāntaṃ sattvānāṃ sukhaṃ vindanti vedanām // / //
analyzed: duḥkham praśāntam sattvānām sukham vindanti vedanām
translated: The suffering of beings is pacified, they experience blissful feelings.

analyzed: tiryagyoniṣu yāvantaḥ sattvāḥ anyonya ghātakāḥ
translated: As many beings as there are in the animal realm, who harm each other,

analyzed: maitra cittāḥ hite jātāḥ spṛṣṭāḥ bhābhiḥ mahā mune
translated: Having loving minds, intent on benefit, touched by the light of the Great Sage.

analyzed: preta lokeṣu yāvantaḥ pretāḥ kṣudh tarṣa pīḍitāḥ
translated: As many hungry ghosts as there are in the realm of hungry ghosts, afflicted by hunger and thirst,

analyzed: prāpnuvanti anna pānāni bodhisattvasya tejasā
translated: And obtain food and drink through the power of the Bodhisattva.

analyzed: akṣaṇāḥ pithitāḥ sarve durgatiḥ ca upaśoṣitā

analyzed: ye vyūhāḥ bodhimaṇḍasya devataiḥ abhisaṃskṛtāḥ  iti hi bhikṣavaḥ tayā bodhisattvasya kāya pramuktayā prabhayā kālikasya nāga rājasya

original: bhiṣaṅkā viśalyā vineyā vineṣī suvaidyā jagasyā dukhebhyaḥ pramocī /
analyzed: bhiṣaṅkāḥ viśalyāḥ vineyāḥ vineṣī su vaidyāḥ jagasyāḥ dukhebhyaḥ pramocī
translated: A physician, without wounds, having trained disciples, a good doctor for the world, having freed from sufferings,

original: alenā atrāṇā ahīnā viditvā bhavā lenu trāṇo trilokesmi jātaḥ // / //
analyzed: a lenāḥ a trāṇāḥ a hīnāḥ viditvā bhava trāṇo tri loka ismi jātaḥ
translated: Knowing that beings are without a protector, without refuge, and without a savior, you have become a protector, a refuge, and a savior in the three worlds.

original: prasannā prahṛṣṭā yathā devasaṃghāḥ pravarṣī nabhasthā mahatpuṣpavarṣam /
analyzed: prasannā prahṛṣṭāḥ yathā deva saṃghāḥ pravarṣī nabhasthāḥ mahat puṣpa varṣam
translated: Just as the hosts of gods are delighted and joyful, they rain down a great shower of flowers from the sky.

original: mahācailakṣepaṃ karontī yatheme jino bheṣyase 'dyā kuruṣva praharṣam // / //
analyzed: mahā caila kṣepam karontī yathā ime jinaḥ kuruṣva praharṣam
translated: They toss great garments, just as they did for the Victor. Today you will become the Victor. Make haste and rejoice.

original: upehi drumendraṃ niṣīdā achambhī jinā mārasenāṃ dhuna kleśajālam /
analyzed: upehi druma indram niṣīda a chambhī jinā māra senām dhuna kleśa jālam
translated: Go to the lord of trees and sit down fearlessly. O Victor, shake off Māra's army and the net of afflictions.

original: vibuddhya praśāntāṃ varāmagrabodhiṃ yathā paurvakaistairvibuddhā jinendraiḥ // / //
analyzed: vibuddhya praśāntām varām agra bodhim yathā paurvakaiḥ taiḥ vibuddhāḥ jinendraiḥ
translated: Awaken to the supreme, peaceful, and excellent supreme enlightenment, just as it was awakened to by the former Victorious Lords.

original: tvayā yasya arthe bahūkalpakoṭyaḥ kṛtā duṣkarāṇī jaganmocanārtham /
analyzed: tvayā yasya arthe bahu kalpa koṭyaḥ kṛtāḥ duṣkarāṇī jagat mocana artham
translated: For whose sake you have performed many difficult deeds for many millions of eons, in order to liberate the world,

original: prapūrṇā ti āśā ayaṃ prāptu kālo upehi drumendraṃ spṛśasvāgrabodhim // / //
analyzed: prapūrṇā te āśā ayam prāptu kālaḥ upehi druma indram spṛśasva agra bodhim
translated: your hopes are now fulfilled. It is time to attain. Go to the lord of trees and touch the supreme enlightenment.

analyzed: iti
translated: Thus it is.

original: atha khalu bhikṣavo bodhisattvasyaitadabhavat kutra niṣaṇṇaistaiḥ pūrvakaistathāgatairanuttarā samyaksaṃbodhirabhisaṃbuddhā iti /
analyzed: atha khalu bhikṣavaḥ bodhisattvasya etat abhavat kutra niṣaṇṇaiḥ taiḥ pūrvakaiḥ tathāgataiḥ anuttarā samyaksaṃbodhiḥ abhisaṃbuddhā iti
translated: Then, monks, the Bodhisattva thought, Where were those former Tathāgatas seated when they fully awakened to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment?

analyzed: tatas sya etat abhūt tṛṇa saṃstare niṣaṇṇaiḥ iti
translated: Then he thought, They were seated on a bed of grass.

original: atha khalvantarīkṣagatāni śuddhāvāsakāyikadevaśatasahasrāṇi bodhisattvasya cetobhireva cetaḥparivitarkamājñāyaivaṃ vāco bhāṣante sma evametat
analyzed: atha khalu antarīkṣa gatāni śuddhāvāsa kāyika deva śata sahasrāṇi bodhisattvasya cetobhiḥ eva cetaḥ parivitarkam ājñāya evam vācaḥ bhāṣante sma evam etat  /
translated: Then hundreds of thousands of pure-realm gods in the sky, knowing the thought of the Bodhisattva, spoke these words: It is so,

analyzed: sat puruṣaḥ evam etat
translated: good man. It is so.

original: tṛṇasaṃstare satpuruṣa niṣadya taiḥ pūrvakaistathāgatairanuttarā samyaksaṃbodhirabhisaṃbuddhā iti //
analyzed: tṛṇa saṃstare sat puruṣa niṣadya taiḥ pūrvakaiḥ tathāgataiḥ anuttarā samyaksaṃbodhiḥ abhisaṃbuddhā iti
translated: Sitting on a bed of grass, good man, those past Tathagatas attained supreme perfect enlightenment.

original: adrākṣītkhalvapi bhikṣavo bodhisattvo mārgasya dakṣiṇe pārśve svastikaṃ yāvasikam tṛṇāni lūnāti sma nīlāni mṛdukāni sukumārāṇi ramaṇīyāni kuṇḍalajātāni
analyzed: adrākṣīt khalu api bhikṣavaḥ bodhisattvaḥ mārgasya dakṣiṇe pārśve svastikam yāvasikam tṛṇāni lūnāti sma nīlāni mṛdukāni su kumārāṇi ramaṇīyāni kuṇḍala jātāni
translated: Monks, the Bodhisattva saw on the right side of the road a certain Svastika the grass-seller, cutting grass, green, soft, tender, lovely, curly,

analyzed: pradakṣiṇa āvartāni
translated: turning to the right.

analyzed: mayūra grīva saṃnibhāni kācilindika sukha saṃsparśāni sugandhīni varṇavanti manoramāṇi
translated: Like the neck of a peacock, pleasant to the touch like kācilindika cloth, fragrant, colorful, delightful.

analyzed: dṛṣṭvā ca vaidya
translated: Seeing him, the Bodhisattva

analyzed: punar bodhisattvaḥ mārgāt apakramya yena svastikaḥ yāvasikaḥ tena upasaṃkrāmat
translated: again left the road and approached Svastika the grass-seller.

original: upasaṃkramya svastikaṃ yāvasikaṃ madhurayā vācā samālapati sma /
analyzed: upasaṃkramya svastikam yāvasikam madhurayā vācā samālapati sma
translated: Having approached, he spoke to Svastika the grass-seller with sweet words:🔽Svastika, give me some grass.

original: yāsau vāgājñāpanī vijñāpanī vispaṣṭā anekalokaikavarṇasukhā valguḥ śravaṇīyā snigdhā
analyzed: yā asau vāc ājñāpanī vijñāpanī vispaṣṭā aneka loka eka varṇa sukhā valguḥ śravaṇīyā snigdhā
translated: That speech which is commanding, informing, clear, delightful to many people, melodious, pleasant to hear, smooth,

original: smaraṇīyā codanī toṣaṇī premaṇī akarkaśā agadgadā aparuṣā acapalā ślakṣṇā madhurā
analyzed: smaraṇīyā codanī toṣaṇī premaṇī akarkaśā agadgadā aparuṣā acapalā ślakṣṇā madhurā
translated: memorable, encouraging, satisfying, endearing, not harsh, not stammering, not rough, not fickle, smooth, sweet,
pleasing to the ears, gladdening body and mind, dispelling passion, hatred, delusion, and afflictions, with the voice of a cuckoo,

analyzed: kuṇāla jīvaṃjīvaka abhinadita ghoṣā dundubhi saṃgīti ruta ravita nirghoṣavatī an apahatā satyā
translated: with the sound of the kuṇāla and jīvañjīva birds, with the sound of the resounding of drums and music, with an unvanquished true

analyzed: acchā bhūtā brahma sva ruta ravita nirghoṣā samudra svara vega nibhā śaila saṃghaṭṭanavatī
translated: voice, pure, with the sound of Brahmā's voice, with the force of the ocean's voice, with the sound of mountains colliding,

analyzed: deva indra asura indra abhiṣṭutā gambhīrā duravagāhā namuci bala abala karaṇī para pravāda mathanī
translated: praised by the lords of the gods and demons, deep, hard to fathom, weakening the power of Namuci, subduing the arguments of others,

analyzed: siṃha svara vegā haya gaja garjita ghoṣā nāga nirnādanī megha stanita abhigarjita svarā daśa diś sarva buddhakṣetra spharaṇī
translated: with the force of a lion's roar, with the sound of the neighing of horses and elephants, with the rumbling of elephants, with the sound of thunderclouds roaring, pervading all the buddha-fields in the ten directions,

original: vineyasattvasaṃcodanī adrutā anupahatā avilambitā sahitā yuktā kālavādinī samayānatikramaṇī
analyzed: vineya sattva saṃcodanī adrutā anupahatā avilambitā sahitā yuktā kāla vādinī samaya anatikramaṇī
translated: It was not hurried, not interrupted, not delayed, but appropriate, timely, and not transgressing the occasion.

original: dharmaśatasahasrasugrathitā saumyā asaktā adhiṣṭhitapratibhānā ekarutā sarvarutaracanī
analyzed: dharma śata sahasra su grathitā saumyā asaktā adhiṣṭhita pratibhānā eka rutā sarva ruta racanī
translated: It was well-woven with hundreds of thousands of dharmas, gentle, unattached, with authoritative eloquence, and with a single sound it produced all sounds.

analyzed: sarva abhiprāya jñāpanī sarva sukha saṃjananī mokṣa patha saṃdarśikā mārga saṃbhāra vādinī
translated: It conveyed all intentions, generated all happiness, showed the path to liberation, and spoke of the requisites of the path.

analyzed: parṣad anatikramaṇī sarva parṣad saṃtoṣaṇī sarva buddha bhāṣita anukūlā
translated: It did not transgress the assembly, satisfied all assemblies, and was in accord with the teachings of all Buddhas.

original: īdṛśyā vācā bodhisattvaḥ svastikaṃ yāvasikaṃ gāthābhirabhyabhāṣata
analyzed: īdṛśyā vācā bodhisattvaḥ svastikam yāvasikam gāthābhiḥ abhyabhāṣata
translated: With such speech, the Bodhisattva addressed Svastika the cowherd with these verses:

original: tṛṇu dehi mi svastika śīghraṃ adya mamārthu tṛṇaiḥ sumahāntaḥ /
analyzed: tṛṇu dehi svastika śīghram adya tṛṇaiḥ su mahāntaḥ
translated: Give me grass, Svastika, quickly! Today my great purpose is with the grass.

original: sabalaṃ namuciṃ nihanitvā bodhimanuttaraśānti spṛśiṣye // / //🔽yasya kṛte mayi kalpasahasrā dānu damo 'pi ca saṃyama tyāgo /
analyzed: sa balam namucim nihanitvā bodhim anuttara śānti spṛśiṣye  yasya kṛte mayi kalpa sahasrāḥ ca saṃyama tyāgaḥ
translated: Having slain Namuci and his army, I shall touch the unsurpassed peace of enlightenment.🔽For whose sake I have practiced giving, morality, self-control, renunciation,

original: śīlavrataṃ ca tapaśca sucīrṇā tasya mi niṣpadi bheṣyati adya // / //
analyzed: śīla vratam ca tapaḥ ca su cīrṇā tasya mi niṣpadi adya
translated: And have well observed discipline, vows, and austerities for thousands of eons, For him, my purpose will be fulfilled today.🔽For whose sake I have practiced giving, morality, self-control, renunciation,🔽And have well observed discipline, vows, and austerities for thousands of eons, For him, my purpose will be fulfilled today.

original: kṣāntibalaṃ tatha vīryabalaṃ ca dhyānabalaṃ tatha jñānabalaṃ ca /
analyzed: kṣānti balam tatha vīrya balam ca dhyāna balam tatha jñāna balam ca
translated: The power of patience, the power of diligence, the power of concentration, and the power of wisdom,

original: puṇyaabhijñavimokṣabalaṃ ca tasya mi niṣpadi bheṣyati adya // / //
analyzed: puṇya abhijña vimokṣa balam ca tasya niṣpadi adya
translated: The power of merit, higher knowledge, and liberation - may I accomplish them today.

original: prajñabalaṃ ca upāyabalaṃ ca ṛddhima saṃgatamaitrabalaṃ ca /
analyzed: prajña balam ca upāya balam ca ṛddhim saṃgata maitra balam ca
translated: The power of wisdom, the power of skillful means, the power of concentration, the power of loving-kindness,

original: pratisaṃvidaparisatyabalaṃ ca teṣa mi niṣpadi bheṣyati adya // / //
analyzed: pratisaṃvid aparisatya balam ca teṣa niṣpadi adya
translated: The power of the analytical knowledges and the power of the truths - may I accomplish them today.

analyzed: vaidya
translated: physician

original: puṇyabalaṃ ca tavāpi anantaṃ yanmama dāsyasi adya tṛṇāni /
analyzed: puṇya balam ca tava api anantam yat mama dāsyasi adya tṛṇāni
translated: Your power of merit is also infinite, as you will give me grass today.

original: na hyaparaṃ tava etu nimittaṃ tvaṃ pi anuttaru bheṣyasi śāstā // / //
analyzed: na hi aparam tava etu nimittam tvam śāstā
translated: Let this not be a sign for you, for you too will become an unsurpassed teacher.

analyzed: śrutvā vāca nāyake su rucira madhurām
translated: Having heard the words of Svastika, the guide, so beautiful and sweet,

analyzed: tuṣṭaḥ ātta manāḥ ca harṣitaḥ pramudita manasaḥ
translated: Delighted, uplifted, joyful, with a delighted mind,

analyzed: gṛhṇītvā tṛṇa muṣṭi sparśanavatī mṛdu taruṇa śubhām
translated: Taking a handful of grass, soft, tender, and beautiful to the touch,

analyzed: puratas vācaḥ bhāṣate pramudita hṛdayaḥ
translated: Standing in front, he spoke with a delighted heart:

analyzed: yadi labhyate
translated: If I can attain the supreme state of immortality

analyzed: bodhī uttama śānta durdṛśā
translated: The supreme peace of enlightenment, difficult to see, the path of the former victors,

analyzed: tiṣṭhatu tāva mahā guṇa udadhe aparimita yaśāḥ
translated: Let alone the ocean of great qualities, of immeasurable fame,

analyzed: aham eva prathame nu budhyami pada vara mṛtam
translated: I alone will first attain the supreme, excellent nectar of enlightenment.

analyzed: na eṣā svastika bodhi labhyate tṛṇa vara śayanaiḥ
translated: O Svastika, this enlightenment is not attained by lying on the excellent grass bed,

analyzed: a caritvā
translated: Without practicing the many difficult austerities and austerities for many eons,

analyzed: matimān
translated: When the wise one has risen above wisdom, merit, and skillful means,

original: tada paścājjina vyākaronti munayo bhaviṣyasi virajaḥ // / //
analyzed: vyākaronti munayaḥ bhaviṣyasi virajaḥ
translated: Then the victorious sages prophesy, You will become stainless.

original: yadi bodhi iya śakyu svastikā parajani dadituṃ
analyzed: yadi bodhi iya śakyu svastikā parajani daditum
translated: If this enlightenment, O Svastika, could be given to another by birth,

original: piṇḍīkṛtya dadeya prāṇināṃ ma bhavatu vimatiḥ /
analyzed: piṇḍīkṛtya dadeya prāṇinām ma bhavatu vimatiḥ
translated: I would gather it together and give it to beings. Let there be no doubt.

original: yada bodhī maya prāpta jānasī vibhajami amṛtaṃ
analyzed: yada bodhī maya prāpta jānasī vibhajami amṛtam
translated: When I have attained enlightenment, you will know I have divided the nectar.

original: āgatvā śṛṇu dharmayukta tvaṃ bhaviṣyasi virajaḥ // / //
analyzed: āgatvā śṛṇu dharma yukta tvam bhaviṣyasi virajaḥ
translated: Come and listen to the Dharma. You will become stainless.

analyzed: gṛhṇītvā tṛṇa muṣṭi nāyakaḥ parama su mṛdukām
translated: Taking a handful of grass, the supreme leader, of the most tender kind,

analyzed: siṃhāhaṃsa gatiḥ ca prasthitaḥ dharaṇī
translated: He set out with the gait of a lion and swan, causing the earth to tremble.

analyzed: devāḥ nāga gaṇāḥ kṛtāñjalī pramudita manasaḥ
translated: The hosts of gods and nagas, with palms joined, with joyful minds,

analyzed: adyā māra balam nihatya ayam spṛśiṣyati amṛtam
translated: Today he will destroy Mara's army and touch immortality.

analyzed: iti hi bhikṣavaḥ bodhisattvasya bodhivṛkṣam upasaṃkrāmataḥ śīti bodhivṛkṣa sahasrāṇi
translated: Thus, monks, as the Bodhisattva was approaching the Bodhi tree, eighty thousand Bodhi trees

original: devaputraiśca bodhisattvaiśca maṇḍitānyabhūvan iha niṣadya bodhisattvo bodhiṃ prāpsyatyabhisaṃbhotsyata iti /🔽santi tatra kecidbodhivṛkṣāḥ puṣpamayā yojanaśatasahasrodviddhāḥ /
analyzed: deva putraiḥ ca bodhisattvaiḥ ca maṇḍitāni abhūvan iha niṣadya bodhisattvaḥ bodhim prāpsyati abhisaṃbhotsyate iti  santi tatra kecid bodhivṛkṣāḥ puṣpa mayāḥ yojana śata sahasra udviddhāḥ
translated: were adorned by gods and Bodhisattvas, thinking, Here, sitting, the Bodhisattva will attain enlightenment and realize it.

analyzed: kecid bodhi vṛkṣāḥ vaidya  gandha mayāḥ dvi yojana śata sahasra udviddhāḥ
translated: Among them, some Bodhi trees were made of flowers, rising up one hundred thousand yojanas.

analyzed: kecid bodhivṛkṣāḥ candana mayāḥ tri yojana śata sahasra udviddhāḥ
translated: Some Bodhi trees were made of sandalwood, rising up three hundred thousand yojanas.

original: kecidbodhivṛkṣā vastramayāḥ pañcayojanaśatasahasrāṇyuccaistvena /🔽kecidbodhivṛkṣā ratnamayā daśayojanaśatasahasrāṇyuccaistvena /🔽kecidbodhivṛkṣāḥ sarvaratnamayā daśayojanakoṭinayutaśatasahasrāṇyuccaistvena /
analyzed: kecid bodhivṛkṣāḥ vastra mayāḥ pañca yojana śata sahasrāṇi uccaistvena  kecid bodhivṛkṣāḥ ratna mayāḥ daśa yojana śata sahasrāṇi uccaistvena  kecid bodhivṛkṣāḥ sarva ratna mayāḥ daśa yojana koṭi nayuta śata sahasrāṇi uccaistvena
translated: Some Bodhi trees were made of cloth, five hundred thousand yojanas high.🔽Some Bodhi trees were made of jewels, ten hundred thousand yojanas high.🔽Some Bodhi trees were made of all jewels, rising up ten trillion yojanas.

analyzed: kecid bodhivṛkṣāḥ ratna mayāḥ koṭi nayuta śata sahasram udviddhāḥ
translated: Some Bodhi trees were made of jewels, rising up a trillion yojanas.

original: sarveṣu teṣu bodhivṛkṣamūleṣu yathānurūpāṇi siṃhāsanāni prajñaptānyabhūvan nānādivyadūṣyasaṃstṛtāni /
analyzed: sarveṣu teṣu bodhivṛkṣa mūleṣu yathā anurūpāṇi siṃhāsanāni prajñaptāni abhūvan nānā divya dūṣya saṃstṛtāni
translated: At the foot of each of those Bodhi trees, a lion throne was arranged in a fitting manner, covered with divine, precious fabrics.

analyzed: kvacid bodhivṛkṣe padmāsanam prajñaptam abhūt  kvacid gandha āsanam
translated: At one Bodhi tree, a lotus throne was arranged.🔽At another, a fragrant throne.

original: kvacinnānāvidharatnāsanam /🔽bodhisattvaśca lalitavyūhaṃ nāma samādhiṃ samāpadyate sma /
analyzed: kvacid nānāvidha ratna āsanam  bodhisattvaḥ ca lalitavyūham nāma samādhim samāpadyate sma
translated: At another, a throne made of various kinds of jewels.🔽The Bodhisattva entered the samadhi called Array of Grace.

original: samanantarasamāpannasya ca bodhisattvasyemaṃ lalitavyūhaṃ nāma bodhisattvasamādhim /
analyzed: samanantara samāpannasya ca bodhisattvasya imam lalitavyūham nāma bodhisattva samādhim
translated: As soon as the Bodhisattva entered this samadhi of the Bodhisattvas called Array of Grace,

original: atha tatkṣaṇameva bodhisattvaḥ sarveṣu ca teṣu bodhivṛkṣamūleṣu siṃhāsane saṃniṣaṇṇaḥ saṃdṛśyate sma lakṣaṇānuvyañjanasamalaṃkṛtena kāyena
analyzed: atha tad kṣaṇam eva bodhisattvaḥ sarveṣu ca teṣu bodhivṛkṣa mūleṣu siṃhāsane saṃniṣaṇṇaḥ saṃdṛśyate sma lakṣaṇa anuvyañjana samalaṃkṛtena kāyena
translated: at that very moment, the Bodhisattva was seen seated on a lion throne at the foot of all those Bodhi trees, his body adorned with the major and minor marks of a Buddha.

original: ekaikaśca bodhisattvo devaputraiścaivaṃ saṃjānīte sma mamaiva siṃhāsane bodhisattvo niṣaṇṇo nānyeṣāmiti /
analyzed: ekaikaḥ ca bodhisattvaḥ deva putraiḥ ca evam saṃjānīte sma mama eva siṃhāsane bodhisattvaḥ niṣaṇṇaḥ na anyeṣām iti
translated: And each Bodhisattva and son of the gods thought thus: The Bodhisattva is seated on my lion throne, not on that of others.

original: yathā ca te saṃjānate sma tathāsyaiva lalitavyūhasya bodhisattvasamādheranubhāvena
analyzed: yathā ca te saṃjānate sma tathā asya eva lalita vyūhasya bodhisattva samādheḥ anubhāvena
translated: And it was so, by the power of this very samadhi of the Bodhisattvas called Array of Grace.

original: sarvanirayatiryagyoniyamalokikāḥ sarve devamanuṣyāśca sarve gatyupapannāḥ sarvasattvā
analyzed: sarva niraya tiryagyoni yama lokikāḥ sarve deva manuṣyāḥ ca sarve gati upapannāḥ sarva sattvāḥ
translated: All the beings in the hells, animal realms, and the world of Yama, all the gods and humans, all the beings in the various destinies

original: bodhisattvaṃ paśyanti sma bodhivṛkṣamūle siṃhāsane niṣaṇṇam //
analyzed: bodhisattvam paśyanti sma bodhivṛkṣa mūle siṃhāsane niṣaṇṇam
translated: saw the Bodhisattva seated on the lion throne at the foot of the Bodhi tree.

original: atha ca punarhīnādhimuktikānāṃ sattvānāṃ matiparitoṣaṇārthaṃ bodhisattvastṛṇamuṣṭimādāya yena bodhivṛkṣastenopasaṃkrāmat /
analyzed: atha ca punar hīna adhimuktikānām sattvānām mati paritoṣaṇa artham bodhisattvaḥ tṛṇa muṣṭim ādāya yena bodhivṛkṣaḥ tena upasaṃkrāmat
translated: However, in order to satisfy the minds of beings with inferior aspirations, the Bodhisattva took a handful of grass and approached the Bodhi tree.

original: upasaṃkramya bodhivṛkṣaṃ saptakṛtvaḥ pradakṣiṇīkṛtya svayamevābhyantarāgraṃ bahirmūlaṃ
