original: gauravu tuṣṭa prema janiyā staviṣu hitakaram // / //🔽nirmalapadmagarbhasadṛśā śaradiśaśimukhā
analyzed: gauravu tuṣṭa prema janiyā staviṣu hita karam  nirmala padmagarbha sadṛśā śaradi śaśi mukhā
translated: And, giving rise to respect, joy, and love, they praised the Benefactor.🔽With a face like the center of a stainless lotus, the autumn moon,

analyzed: sarpi huta arci teja sadṛśā kanaka giri nibhā
translated: Like the splendor of fire offered with ghee, like a golden mountain,

analyzed: sidhyatu bhava śata caritā
translated: May the aspiration be fulfilled, practiced for hundreds of existences,

analyzed: svām upatīrya tāraya jagat vyasana parigatam
translated: Having crossed over, may you liberate the world that is overcome by calamity.

analyzed: tā karṇikāra campaka nibham bahuvidham
translated: Having praised in many ways the one who is like a karnikara or champak flower,

analyzed: pradakṣiṇam atiśayam giriḥ iva acalam
translated: Having circumambulated to the right, like an immovable mountain,

analyzed: gatva pituḥ nipatya śirasā idam avaci giram
translated: Having gone to his father and fallen at his feet with his head, he spoke these words:

original: sādhvasa naṃ hi tāta pratighaṃ amaranaraguroḥ // / //
analyzed: sādhvasa nam hi tāta pratigham amara nara guroḥ
translated: Father, do not give rise to hostility towards the teacher of gods and humans.

analyzed: paśyati padma patra nayanaḥ prahasita vadanaḥ
translated: The one with eyes like lotus petals, with a smiling face,

original: nāpi saraktu prekṣati janaṃ na pi ca sabhṛkuṭiḥ /
analyzed: na api sa raktu prekṣati janam na ca sa bhṛkuṭiḥ
translated: Does not look with anger at people, nor with a frowning face.

original: meru caleya śuṣya udadhiḥ śaśiravi prapate
analyzed: meru caleya śuṣya udadhiḥ śaśi ravi prapate
translated: Mount Meru may move, the ocean may dry up, the moon and sun may fall,

original: naiva sa doṣadarśi tribhave pramadavaśa gamiyā // / //
analyzed: na eva sa doṣa darśi tri bhave
translated: But he, who sees faults in the three existences, will not come under the sway of women.

original: atha khalu māraḥ pāpīyānidaṃ vacanaṃ śrutvā bhūyasyā mātrayā duḥkhito durmanā anāttamanāḥ
analyzed: atha khalu māraḥ pāpīyān idam vacanam śrutvā bhūyasyā mātrayā duḥkhitaḥ durmanāḥ an ātta manāḥ
translated: Then Mara, the evil one, having heard these words, became even more miserable, unhappy, and dejected.

original: praduṣṭamanāstāṃ svaduhitṝnāmantrayate sma kathaṃ bho na śakyate sa bodhimaṇḍādutthāpayitum /
analyzed: praduṣṭa manāḥ tām sva duhitṝn āmantrayate sma katham bho na śakyate sa bodhimaṇḍāt utthāpayitum
translated: With a disturbed mind, he addressed his daughters, saying, How is it that he cannot be made to rise from the seat of awakening?

original: mā khalu mūḍhaḥ ajño 'tha yuṣmākaṃ rūpākṛtiṃ na paśyati /
analyzed: mā khalu mūḍhaḥ yuṣmākam rūpa ākṛtim na paśyati
translated: Alas, the fool does not see your form and beauty.

original: atha khalu tā māraduhitaraḥ svapitaraṃ gāthābhiḥ pratyabhāṣanta
analyzed: atha khalu tāḥ māra duhitaraḥ sva pitaram gāthābhiḥ pratyabhāṣanta
translated: Then the daughters of Mara replied to their father in verse:

original: ślakṣṇā madhuraṃ ca bhāṣate na ca rakto guru guhyaṃ ca nirīkṣate na ca duṣṭaḥ /🔽Vaidya
analyzed: ślakṣṇāḥ madhuram ca bhāṣate na ca raktaḥ guru guhyam ca nirīkṣate na ca duṣṭaḥ  vaidya
translated: He speaks gently and sweetly, yet is not attached. He looks upon the profound secrets, yet is not hostile.

original: īryāṃ caryāṃ ca prekṣate na ca mūḍhaḥ kāyā sarva paneti āśayo sugabhīraḥ // / //
analyzed: īryām caryām ca prekṣate na ca mūḍhaḥ sugabhīraḥ
translated: He observes conduct and behavior, yet is not deluded. He penetrates all bodies, his intention is very deep.

original: niḥsaṃśayena viditāḥ pṛthu istridoṣāḥ kāmairviraktamanaso na ca rāgaraktaḥ /
analyzed: niḥsaṃśayena viditāḥ kāmaiḥ virakta manasaḥ na ca rāga raktaḥ
translated: Without doubt, he knows well the many faults of women. His mind is detached from desires, yet he is not free from passion.

original: naivāstyasau divi bhuvīha naraḥ suro vā yastasya cittacaritaṃ parijānayeyā // / //
analyzed: na evā asti asau divi bhuvi iha naraḥ suraḥ vā yaḥ tasya citta caritam parijānayeyā
translated: There is no man or god in heaven or on earth who can fully understand his mind and conduct.

original: yā istrimāya upadarśita tatra tāta pravilīyu tasya hṛdayaṃ bhaviyaḥ sarāgaḥ /
analyzed: tatra tāta sa rāgaḥ
translated: Father, whatever feminine wiles were displayed there, the heart of one who is passionate would have melted.

original: taṃ dṛṣṭa ekamapi kampitu nāsya cittaṃ śailendrarāja iva tiṣṭhati so 'prakampyaḥ // / //
analyzed: tam dṛṣṭe ekam api na asya cittam śaila indra rājaḥ iva tiṣṭhati saḥ u prakampyaḥ
translated: Even seeing him, his mind does not waver, he stands unshakable like the king of mountains.

original: śatapuṇyatejabharito guṇatejapūrṇaḥ śīle tapasmi carito bahukalpakoṭyaḥ /
analyzed: śata puṇya teja bharitaḥ guṇa teja pūrṇaḥ śīle caritaḥ bahu kalpa koṭyaḥ
translated: Filled with the splendor of a hundred merits, full of the splendor of virtues, practicing morality and austerities for many millions of eons,

original: brahmā ca deva śubhateja viśuddhasattvā mūrdhnā nipatya caraṇeṣu namanti tasmai // / //
analyzed: brahmā ca deva śubha teja viśuddha sattvāḥ mūrdhnā nipatya caraṇeṣu namanti tasmai
translated: Brahma, the gods, the splendorous and pure beings, bowing their heads at his feet, pay homage to him.

original: niḥsaṃśayena vinihatya sa mārasenāṃ pūrve jinānumata prāpsyati agrabodhim /
analyzed: niḥsaṃśayena vinihatya sa māra senām pūrve jina anumata prāpsyati agra bodhim
translated: Without a doubt, having defeated Mara's army, he will attain supreme enlightenment, approved by the victorious ones of the past.

original: tātā na rocati hi no va raṇe vivāde balavatsu vigrahu sukṛcchra ayaṃ prayogaḥ // / //
analyzed: tātā na rocati hi naḥ vaḥ raṇe vivāde balavatsu su kṛcchra ayam prayogaḥ
translated: Father, we do not delight in battle or dispute, it is difficult to engage in conflict with the powerful.

original: prekṣasva tāta gagane maṇiratnacūḍā saṃbodhisattvanayutāḥ sthita gauraveṇa /
analyzed: prekṣasva tāta gagane maṇi ratna cūḍā saṃ bodhisattva nayutāḥ sthita gauraveṇa
translated: Father, look in the sky, millions of bodhisattvas, adorned with jeweled crowns, stand there with reverence.

analyzed: ratna ākarā kusuma dāma vicitrita aṅgā saṃprekṣitā daśa balaiḥ iha pujana artham
translated: The sources of jewels, their bodies adorned with flower garlands, are being looked at by the ten powers here for the sake of worship.

original: ye cetanā api ca ye ca acetanā ca vṛkṣāśca śaila garūḍendrasurendrayakṣāḥ /
analyzed: ye cetanāḥ api ca ye ca acetanā ca vṛkṣāḥ ca śaila garūḍa indra sura indra yakṣāḥ
translated: Those that are sentient and those that are not, the trees, mountains, lords of the garudas and the lords of the gods and yakshas,

original: abhyonatā abhimukhā guṇaparvatasya śreyo bhave pratinivartitumadya tāta // / //
analyzed: abhyonatāḥ abhimukhāḥ guṇa parvatasya śreyaḥ bhave pratinivartitum adya tāta
translated: It would be better to turn back today, dear son, and not go to the mountain of qualities.”

analyzed: api ca
translated: Moreover:

original: na taṃ taredyasya na pāramuttare na taṃ khanedyasya na mūlamuddharet /
analyzed: na tam taret yasya na pāram uttare na tam khanet yasya na mūlam uddharet
translated: One should not cross over one whose shore one has not reached, nor should one dig one whose root one has not uprooted.

analyzed: vaidya
translated: Physician

original: na kopayettaṃ kṣamayetpunopi taṃ kuryānna taṃ yena bhavecca durmanāḥ // / //
analyzed: na kopayet tam kṣamayet punar api tam kuryāt na tam yena bhavet ca durmanāḥ
translated: One should not anger him, but rather appease him again. One should not do that by which one would become displeased.

analyzed: atha khalu bhikṣavaḥ tasmin samaye ṣṭau bodhivṛkṣa devatāḥ
translated: Then, monks, at that time there were eight Bodhi tree deities.

original: tadyathā śrīḥ vṛddhiḥ tapā śreyasī viduḥ ojobalā satyavādinī samaṅginī ca /
analyzed: tat yathā śrīḥ vṛddhiḥ tapā śreyasī viduḥ ojobalā satyavādinī samaṅginī ca
translated: Namely, Śrī, Vṛddhi, Tapā, Śreyasī, Vidu, Ojobalā, Satyavādinī, and Samaṅgiṇī.

original: tā etā bodhisattvaṃ saṃpūjya ṣoḍaśabhirākārairbodhisattvaṃ śriyā vardhayanti sma /
analyzed: tāḥ etāḥ bodhisattvam saṃpūjya ṣoḍaśabhiḥ ākāraiḥ bodhisattvam śriyā vardhayanti sma
translated: Having worshipped the Bodhisattva, they extolled the Bodhisattva with sixteen aspects of glory:

original: abhiṣṭuvanti sma 🔽upaśobhase tvaṃ viśuddhasattva candra iva śuklapakṣe /🔽abhivirocase tvaṃ viśuddhabuddha sūrya iva prodayamānaḥ // / //
analyzed: abhiṣṭuvanti sma  upaśobhase tvam viśuddha sattva candraḥ iva śukla pakṣe  abhivirocase tvam viśuddha buddha sūryaḥ iva prodayamānaḥ
translated: They praised him:🔽You shine, O pure being, like the moon in the bright fortnight.🔽You shine forth, O pure-minded one, like the rising sun.

analyzed: praphullitaḥ tvam viśuddha sattva padmam iva vāri madhye
translated: You are in full bloom, O pure being, like a lotus in the water.

analyzed: nadasi ttvam viśuddha sattva kesarī iva vana rājau anucārī
translated: You roar, O pure-hearted one, like a lion in the forest.

original: vibhrājase tvaṃ agrasattva parvatarāja iva sāgaramadhye /🔽abhyudgatastvaṃ viśuddhasattva cakravāla iva parvataḥ // / //
analyzed: vibhrājase tvam agra sattva parvata rājaḥ iva sāgara madhye  abhyudgataḥ tvam viśuddha sattva cakravālaḥ iva parvataḥ
translated: You shine, O supreme being, like a king of mountains in the ocean.🔽You rise up, O pure-hearted one, like the Cakravāla mountain.

analyzed: duravagāhaḥ tvam agrasattva jaladharaḥ ratna saṃpūrṇaḥ
translated: You are unfathomable, O supreme being, like a cloud filled with jewels.

analyzed: vistīrṇa buddhiḥ asi lokanātha gaganam iva aparyantam
translated: You have vast intelligence, O Lord of the World, like the endless sky.

original: susthitabuddhirasi viśuddhasattva dharaṇitalavatsarvasattvopajīvyaḥ /🔽akaluṣabuddhirasi agrasattva anavatapta iva saraḥ sadā prasannaḥ // / //
analyzed: susthita buddhiḥ asi viśuddha sattva dharaṇi tala vat sarva sattva upajīvyaḥ  akaluṣa buddhiḥ asi agrasattva anavataptaḥ iva saraḥ sadā prasannaḥ
translated: You have a well-established mind, O pure-hearted one, like the surface of the earth, the support of all beings.🔽You have an untroubled mind, O supreme being, like the Anavatapta lake, always clear.

original: aniketabuddhistvaṃ agrasattva māruta iva sarvaloke sadāprasaktaḥ /🔽durāsadasttvaṃ agrasattva tejorāja iva sarvamanyunā prahīnaḥ // / //
analyzed: aniketa buddhiḥ tvam agrasattva mārutaḥ iva sarva loke sadā prasaktaḥ  durāsadaḥ tvam agra sattva tejaḥ rājaḥ iva sarva manyunā prahīnaḥ
translated: You have a mind without abode, O supreme being, like the wind, always moving in all worlds.🔽You are unapproachable, O supreme being, like the king of light, having abandoned all anger.

original: balavānasi tvaṃ agrasattva nārāyaṇa iva durdharṣaḥ /
analyzed: balavān asi tvam agrasattva nārāyaṇaḥ iva durdharṣaḥ
translated: You are powerful, O supreme being, like Nārāyaṇa, invincible.

analyzed: dṛḍha samādānaḥ tvam lokanātha anutthātā bodhimaṇḍā
translated: You have a firm commitment, O Lord of the World, not rising from the seat of enlightenment.

analyzed: anivartyaḥ tvam agrasattvaḥ indra kara utsṛṣṭaḥ iva vajraḥ
translated: You are unassailable, O Foremost Being, like a thunderbolt released from Indra's hand.

analyzed: su labdha lābhaḥ tvam agra sattva cirāt bhaviṣyasi
translated: You have gained a good gain, O Foremost Being, you will soon be endowed with the ten powers.

analyzed: iti
translated: Thus it is, monks.

original: evaṃ khalu bhikṣavo bodhivṛkṣadevatāḥ ṣoḍaśākāraṃ bodhisattvaṃ śriyā vardhayanti sma //
analyzed: evam khalu bhikṣavaḥ bodhivṛkṣa devatāḥ ṣoḍaśa ākāram bodhisattvam śriyā vardhayanti sma
translated: Thus, monks, the tree deities of the Bodhi tree extolled the Bodhisattva with sixteen aspects of glory.

original: tatra bhikṣavaḥ śuddhāvāsakāyikā devaputrāḥ ṣoḍaśabhirākārairmāraṃ pāpīyāṃsaṃ durbalaṃ kurvanti sma /
analyzed: tatra bhikṣavaḥ śuddhāvāsa kāyikāḥ deva putrāḥ ṣoḍaśabhiḥ ākāraiḥ māram pāpīyāṃsam durbalam kurvanti sma
translated: There, monks, the gods of the Pure Abodes made Mara the Evil One weak in sixteen ways.

original: katamaiḥ ṣoḍaśabhiḥ / tadyathā 🔽dhvastastvaṃ pāpīyaṃ jīrṇakroñca iva dhyāyase /
analyzed: katamaiḥ ṣoḍaśabhiḥ tat yathā  dhvastaḥ tvam pāpīyam jīrṇa kroñcaḥ iva dhyāyase
translated: In what sixteen ways? Namely:🔽You are ruined, O Evil One, you brood like an old crane.

original: durbalastvaṃ pāpīyaṃ jīrṇagaja iva paṅkamagraḥ // / //🔽ekākyasi tvaṃ pāpīyaṃ nirjita iva śūrapratijñaḥ /
analyzed: durbalaḥ tvam pāpī iyam jīrṇa gajaḥ iva paṅkam agraḥ  ekākī asi tvam pāpīyam nirjitaḥ iva śūra pratijñaḥ
translated: You are weak, O Evil One, like an old elephant sinking in mud.🔽You are alone, O Evil One, like one defeated, vowing to be a hero.

original: advitīyastvaṃ pāpīyaṃ aṭavyāṃ tyakta iva rogārtaḥ // / //🔽abalastvaṃ pāpīyaṃ bhārakliṣṭa iva balīvardaḥ /
analyzed: advitīyaḥ tvam pāpīyam aṭavyām tyaktaḥ iva roga ārtaḥ  abalaḥ tvam pāpīyam bhāra kliṣṭaḥ iva balīvardaḥ
translated: You are without a second, O Evil One, like one abandoned in the wilderness, afflicted with disease.🔽You are powerless, O Evil One, like an ox exhausted by a load.

analyzed: apaviddhaḥ tvam pāpīyam vāta kṣiptaḥ iva taruḥ
translated: You are cast down, O Evil One, like a tree tossed by the wind.

analyzed: vaidya
translated: physician

original: kupathasthitasvaṃ pāpīyaṃ mārgabhraṣṭa iva sārthikaḥ /🔽dīnahīnastvaṃ pāpīyaṃ matsariṇa iva daridrapuruṣaḥ // / //
analyzed: kupatha sthita svam pāpīyam mārga bhraṣṭaḥ iva sārthikaḥ  dīna hīnaḥ tvam pāpīyam matsariṇaḥ iva daridra puruṣaḥ
translated: You are like a sinful man on a wrong path, like a merchant who has lost his way.🔽You are miserable and inferior, O sinful one, like a poor man who is stingy.

analyzed: mukharaḥ tvam pāpīyam vāyasaḥ iva pragalbhaḥ
translated: You are garrulous, O sinful one, like a crow that is bold.

original: mānābhibhūtastvaṃ pāpīyaṃ akṛtajña iva ḍhurvinītaḥ // / //🔽palāyiṣyase tvamadya pāpīyaṃ koṣṭuka iva siṃhanādena /
analyzed: māna abhibhūtaḥ tvam pāpīyam akṛtajñaḥ iva ḍhuḥ vinītaḥ  palāyiṣyase tvam adya pāpī iyam koṣṭukaḥ iva siṃhanādena
translated: You are overcome by pride, O sinful one, like an ungrateful person who is ill-mannered.🔽You will flee today, O sinful one, like a mouse at the sound of a lion's roar.

original: vidhuneṣyase tvamadya pāpīyaṃ vairambhavāyuvikṣipta iva pakṣī // / //
analyzed: vidhunā iṣyase tvam adya pāpīyam vairambha vāyu vikṣiptaḥ iva pakṣī
translated: You will be scattered today, O sinful one, like a bird tossed about by a storm wind.

analyzed: akāla jñaḥ tvam pāpīyam puṇya parikṣīṇaḥ iva bhaikṣukaḥ
translated: You are untimely, O sinful one, like a beggar whose merit has been exhausted.

analyzed: vivarjiṣyase tvam adya pāpīyam pāṃśu pratipūrṇam
translated: You will be abandoned today, O sinful one, like a broken vessel filled with dust.

analyzed: nigṛhīṣyase tvam adya pāpī iyam bodhisattvena mantreṇa iva uragāḥ
translated: You will be subdued today, O sinful one, by the Bodhisattva, like serpents by a spell.

analyzed: sarva bala prahīṇaḥ si pāpīyam chinna kara caraṇaḥ iva uruṇḍaḥ
translated: You are devoid of all strength, O sinful one, like a eunuch whose hands and feet have been cut off.

original: evaṃ khalu bhikṣavaḥ śuddhāvāsakāyikā devaputrāḥ ṣoḍaśabhirākārairmāraṃ pāpīyāṃsaṃ durbalamakārṣuḥ //
analyzed: evam khalu bhikṣavaḥ śuddhāvāsa kāyikāḥ deva putrāḥ ṣoḍaśabhiḥ ākāraiḥ māram pāpīyāṃsam durbalam akārṣuḥ
translated: Thus, monks, the gods of the Pure Abodes weakened the sinful Māra in sixteen ways.

original: tatra bhikṣavo bodhiparicārikā devaputrāḥ ṣoḍaśabhirākārairmāraṃ pāpīyāṃsaṃ vichacdayanti sma /
analyzed: tatra bhikṣavaḥ bodhiparicārikāḥ devaputrāḥ ṣoḍaśabhiḥ ākāraiḥ māram pāpīyāṃsam vichacdayanti sma
translated: There, monks, the gods who attend on the Bodhisattva with sixteen aspects made Māra the evil one flee.

analyzed: katamaiḥ ṣoḍaśabhiḥ tat yathā
translated: With what sixteen? They are as follows:

original: adya tvaṃ pāpīyaṃ nirjeṣyase bodhisattvena parasainya iva śūreṇa /
analyzed: adya tvam pāpīyam nirjeṣyase bodhisattvena para sainye iva śūreṇa
translated: Today, evil one, you will be defeated by the Bodhisattva, like a weak army by a hero.

original: nigṛhīṣyase tvamadya pāpīyaṃ bodhisattvena durbalamalla iva mahāmallena // / //
analyzed: nigṛhīṣyase tvam adya pāpī iyam bodhisattvena durbala mallaḥ iva mahā mallena
translated: Today, evil one, you will be subdued by the Bodhisattva, like a weak wrestler by a great wrestler.

original: abhibhaviṣyase tvamadya pāpīyaṃ bodhisattvena khadyotakamiva sūryamaṇḍalena /
analyzed: abhibhaviṣyase tvam adya pāpīyam bodhisattvena khadyotakam iva sūrya maṇḍalena
translated: Today, evil one, you will be overwhelmed by the Bodhisattva, like a firefly by the orb of the sun.

original: vidhvaṃsayiṣyase tvamadya pāpīyaṃ bodhisattvena muñjamuṣṭimiva mahāmārutena // / //🔽vitrāsiṣyase tvamadya pāpīyaṃ bodhisattvena kesariṇeva śṛgālaḥ /
analyzed: vidhvaṃsayiṣyase tvam adya pāpīyam bodhisattvena muñja muṣṭim iva mahā mārutena  vitrāsiṣyase tvam adya pāpī iyam bodhisattvena kesariṇā iva śṛgālaḥ
translated: Today, evil one, you will be destroyed by the Bodhisattva, like a bundle of reeds by a great wind.🔽Today, evil one, you will be terrified by the Bodhisattva, like a jackal by a lion.

original: prapātiṣyase tvamadya pāpīyaṃ bodhisattvena mahāsāla iva mūlachinnam // / //
analyzed: prapātiṣyase tvam adya pāpī iyam bodhisattvena mahā sālaḥ iva mūla chinnam
translated: Today, evil one, you will fall by the Bodhisattva, like a great sāla tree cut at the root.

analyzed: vilopsyase tvam adya pāpī iyam bodhisattvena amitra nagaram iva mahā rājena
translated: Today, evil one, you will be annihilated by the Bodhisattva, like a city of enemies by a great king.

original: viśoṣiṣyase tvamadya pāpīyaṃ bodhisattvena goṣpadavārīva mahātapena // / //🔽palāyiṣyase tvamadya pāpīyaṃ bodhisattvena vadhyavimukta iva dhūrtapuruṣaḥ /
analyzed: viśoṣiṣyase tvam adya pāpī iyam bodhisattvena goṣpada vārī iva mahā tapena  palāyiṣyase tvam adya pāpī iyam bodhisattvena vadhya vimuktaḥ iva dhūrta puruṣaḥ
translated: You will be dried up today by the Bodhisattva, like a puddle in a cow's hoofprint by the great heat.🔽You will flee today, O wicked one, by the Bodhisattva, like a criminal released from execution by a clever man.

original: udbhrāmiṣyase tvamadya pāpīyaṃ bodhisattvena agnidāheneva madhukaravṛndam // / //
analyzed: udbhrāmiṣyase tvam adya pāpī iyam bodhisattvena agni dāhena iva madhukara vṛndam
translated: You will be whirled around today, O wicked one, by the Bodhisattva, like a swarm of bees by a forest fire.

original: roṣiṣyase tvamadya pāpīyaṃ bodhisattvena rāṣṭrabhraṣṭa iva dharmarājaḥ /🔽dhyāyiṣyase tvamadya pāpīyaṃ bodhisattvena jīrṇakroñca iva lūnapakṣaḥ // / //🔽vibhartsyase tvamadya pāpīyaṃ bodhisattvena kṣīṇapathyādana ivāṭavīkāntāre /
analyzed: roṣiṣyase tvam adya pāpī iyam bodhisattvena rāṣṭra bhraṣṭaḥ iva dharmarājaḥ  dhyāyiṣyase tvam adya pāpī iyam bodhisattvena jīrṇa kroñcaḥ iva lūna pakṣaḥ  vibhartsyase tvam adya pāpī iyam bodhisattvena kṣīṇa pathya adane iva aṭavī kāntāre
translated: You will be angry today, O wicked one, by the Bodhisattva, like a righteous king fallen from his kingdom.🔽You will meditate today, O wicked one, by the Bodhisattva, like an old crane with clipped wings.🔽You will be frightened today, O wicked one, by the Bodhisattva, like a traveler in a desert with exhausted provisions.

original: vilapiṣyase tvamadya pāpīyaṃ bodhisattvena bhinnayānapātra iva mahārṇave // / //
analyzed: vilapiṣyase tvam adya pāpī iyam bodhisattvena bhinna yānapātre iva mahā arṇave
translated: You will lament today, O wicked one, by the Bodhisattva, like one in a great ocean with a broken ship.

original: āmlāyiṣyase tvamadya pāpīyaṃ bodhisattvena kalpadāha iva tṛṇavanaspatayaḥ /
analyzed: āmlāyiṣyase tvam adya pāpī iyam bodhisattvena kalpa dāhaḥ iva tṛṇa vanaspatayaḥ
translated: You will be withered today, O wicked one, by the Bodhisattva, like grass and trees by the conflagration at the end of an eon.

original: vikiriṣyase tvamadya pāpīyaṃ bodhisattvena mahāvajreṇeva girikūṭam // / //
analyzed: vikiriṣyase tvam adya pāpī iyam bodhisattvena mahā vajreṇa iva giri kūṭam
translated: You will be scattered today, O wicked one, by the Bodhisattva, like the peak of a mountain by a great thunderbolt.

analyzed: vaidya
translated: Vaidya

original: evaṃ khalu bhikṣavo bodhiparicārikā devaputrāḥ ṣoḍaśākārairmāraṃ vicchandayanti sma /
analyzed: evam khalu bhikṣavaḥ bodhi paricārikāḥ deva putrāḥ ṣoḍaśa ākāraiḥ māram vicchandayanti sma
translated: Thus, monks, the Bodhi tree deities tried to dissuade Māra with sixteen aspects.

original: na ca māraḥ pāpīyān vinivartate sma //
analyzed: na ca māraḥ pāpīyān vinivartate sma
translated: But the evil Māra did not turn back.

analyzed: tatra idam ucyate
translated: Regarding this, it is said:

original: bhūtāṃ codana śrutva devatagaṇā na nivartate so 'ntako
analyzed: devata gaṇāḥ na nivartate
translated: Having heard the true admonition of the assembly of gods, that destroyer does not turn back.

original: ucchethā hanathā vilumpatha imāṃ mā dāsyathā jīvitam /
analyzed: ucchethāḥ hanathāḥ vilumpathaḥ imām mā dāsyathāḥ jīvitam
translated: Cut them down, kill them, plunder them, do not give them life!

original: eṣottīrṇa svayaṃ mamāpi viṣayāṃ tāriṣyate cāparāṃ
analyzed: eṣā uttīrṇa svayam mama api viṣayām tāriṣyate ca aparām
translated: He himself has crossed over my domain and will deliver others.

original: nānyaṃ mokṣa vademi kiṃci śramaṇe utthāpayetprakramet // / //
analyzed: na anyam mokṣa vademi kiṃci śramaṇe utthāpayet prakramet
translated: I say there is no other liberation. A monk should rise up and depart.

analyzed: bodhisattvaḥ āha
translated: The Bodhisattva said:

original: meruḥ parvatarāja sthānatu cale sarvaṃ jaganno bhavet
analyzed: sarvam jagat naḥ bhavet
translated: Let Mount Meru, the king of mountains, move, and let the whole world be destroyed,

analyzed: sarve tāraka saṃgha bhūmi prapate sa jyotiṣā induḥ nabhāt
translated: Let all the hosts of stars fall to the ground, and the sun and moon fall from the sky,

analyzed: ekamatayaḥ śuṣyet mahā sāgaraḥ
translated: Let all beings have the same mind, and the great ocean dry up,

analyzed: na tu eva drumarāja mūla upagataḥ cālyet asmadvidhaḥ
translated: But one like me, who has gone to the foot of the king of trees, will not be shaken.

analyzed: māraḥ āha
translated: Māra said:

original: kāmeśvaro 'smi vasitā iha sarvaloke devā sadānavagaṇā manujāśca tiryā /
analyzed: smi vasitā iha sarva loke
translated: I am the lord of desire, the sovereign here over all the worlds, the hosts of gods, the assemblies of demons, and the humans and animals.

original: vyāptā mayā mama vaśena ca yānti sarve uttiṣṭha mahya viṣayastha vacaṃ kuruṣva // / //
analyzed: vyāptāḥ mayā mama vaśena ca yānti sarve uttiṣṭha viṣayastha vacam kuruṣva
translated: I pervade everything and all are under my control. Arise, remain within my domain and do as I say.

analyzed: bodhisattvaḥ āha
translated: The Bodhisattva said:

original: kāmeśvaro 'si yadi vyaktamanīśvaro 'si dharmeśvaro 'hamapi paśyasi tattvato mām /
analyzed: kāma īśvaraḥ si yadi vyaktam anīśvaraḥ si dharma īśvaraḥ ham api paśyasi tattvataḥ mām
translated: If you are truly the lord of desire, you are not the lord at all. I am the lord of Dharma, and you should see me as such.

original: kāmeśvaro 'si yadi durgati na prayāsi prāpsyāmi bodhimavaśasya tu paśyataste // / //
analyzed: kāmeśvaraḥ si yadi durgati na prayāsi prāpsyāmi bodhim avaśasya tu paśyataḥ te
translated: If you are truly the lord of desire, you will not go to the lower realms. But I will attain enlightenment, while you, powerless, look on.

analyzed: māraḥ āha
translated: Mara said:

original: ekātmakaḥ śramaṇa kiṃ prakaroṣi raṇye yaṃ prārthayasyasulabhaḥ khalu saṃprayogaḥ /
analyzed: eka ātmakaḥ śramaṇa kim prakaroṣi raṇye yam prārthayasi a sulabhaḥ khalu saṃprayogaḥ
translated: Ascetic, what are you doing alone in the forest? The attainment you seek is indeed easily obtained.

original: bhṛgvaṅgiraprabhṛtibhistapaso prayatnā prāptaṃ na tatpadavaraṃ manujaḥ kutastvam // / //
analyzed: bhṛgu aṅgira prabhṛtibhiḥ tapasaḥ prayatnā prāptam na tat pada varam manujaḥ kutas tvam
translated: By Bhrigu, Angiras and others, through striving in austerities, that supreme state was not attained. How much less can you, a mere man?

analyzed: bodhisattvaḥ āha
translated: The Bodhisattva said:

analyzed: ṛṣibhiḥ krodha abhibhūta matibhiḥ diva loka kāmaiḥ
translated: In the past, the sages practiced austerities out of ignorance, their minds overcome by anger, desiring to go to the heavenly world.

analyzed: vaidya
translated: Vidy

original: nityaṃ na nityamiti cātmani saṃśrayadbhiḥ mokṣaṃ ca deśagamanasthitamāśrayadbhiḥ // / //
analyzed: nityam na nityam iti ca ātmani saṃśrayadbhiḥ mokṣam ca deśa gamana sthitam āśrayadbhiḥ
translated: Always doubting whether the self is permanent or impermanent, and relying on liberation as being located in a particular place.

original: te tatvato 'rtharahitāḥ puruṣaṃ vadanti vyāpiṃ pradeśagata śāśvatamāhureke /
analyzed: te tatvataḥ ṛtha rahitāḥ puruṣam vadanti vyāpim pradeśa gata śāśvatam āhuḥ eke
translated: They say that the true nature is devoid of meaning, and some say that the all-pervading person is localized and eternal.

original: mūrtaṃ na mūrtamaguṇaṃ guṇināṃ tathaiva kartā na karta iti cāpyapare bruvanti // / //
analyzed: mūrtam na mūrtam aguṇam guṇinām tathā eva kartā na kartā iti ca api apare bruvanti
translated: Others say it is embodied and disembodied, devoid of qualities and yet the possessor of qualities, and also that it is both the creator and not the creator.

original: prāpyādya bodhi virajāmiha cāsanasthaḥ tvāṃ jitva māra vihataṃ sabalaṃ sasainyam /
analyzed: prāpya adya bodhi virajām iha ca āsana sthaḥ tvām jitva māra vihatam sa balam sa sainyam
translated: Having attained the first immaculate enlightenment, sitting here on this seat, having defeated you, Māra, along with your army and forces,

original: varteṣyi asya jagataḥ prabhavodbhavaṃ ca nirvāṇa duḥkhaśamanaṃ tatha śītibhāvam // / //
analyzed: asya jagataḥ prabhava udbhavam ca nirvāṇa duḥkha śamanam
translated: I will turn the wheel of existence for this world, revealing the origin and cessation, as well as the cooling of suffering and the state of peace.

original: māraḥ kruddho duṣṭo ruṣṭaḥ paruṣagira puna tu bhaṇate gṛhāṇa sugautamaṃ🔽eṣo hyeko 'raṇye nyasto grahiya mama puratu vrajathā laghuṃ vaśu kurvathā /
analyzed: māraḥ kruddhaḥ duṣṭaḥ ruṣṭaḥ paruṣa gira puna tu bhaṇate gṛhāṇa sugautamam  eṣaḥ hi ekaḥ raṇye nyastaḥ mama vrajatha laghum vaśu kurvathā
translated: Māra, angry, wicked, enraged, spoke harsh words again: Take this Sugata!🔽He is alone in the wilderness, abandoned. Seize him and bring him before me. Quickly go and subjugate him.

original: śīghraṃ gatvā mahyaṃ gehe haḍinigaḍayugalavikṛtaṃ karotha duvārikaṃ
analyzed: śīghram gatvā mahyam gehe haḍi nigaḍa yugala vikṛtam karotha duvārikam
translated: Quickly go and make a doorkeeper for me in my house, deformed with a pair of iron fetters.

original: svā maṃ drakṣye duḥkhenārtaṃ bahuvividhajavitaravitaṃ marūṇa va ceṭakam // / //
analyzed: mam drakṣye duḥkhena ārtam bahu vividha javita ravitam ceṭakam
translated: I will see you, afflicted with suffering, crying out with many different cries, like a slave of the gods.

analyzed: bodhisattvaḥ āha
translated: The Bodhisattva said:🔽You are not my doorkeeper, nor am I your slave. I am the doorkeeper of the world, and the world is my slave.

original: śakyākāśe lekhyaṃ citraṃ bahuvividhavikṛta padaśaḥ prakartu pṛthakpṛthak
analyzed: śakya ākāśe lekhyam citram padaśas prakartu pṛthak pṛthak
translated: It is possible to draw a picture in the sky, with many different forms and colors, by writing it out word by word, separately,

original: śakyo vāyuḥ pāśairbaddhuṃ diśavidiśagamanajavito nareṇa suyatnataḥ /
analyzed: śakyaḥ vāyuḥ pāśaiḥ baddhum diśa vidiśa gamana javitaḥ nareṇa su yatnataḥ
translated: It is possible for a man to bind the wind with ropes, which moves swiftly in all directions, with great effort,

original: śakyā kartuṃ candrādityau tamatimiravitimirakarau nabho 'dya mahītalaṃ
analyzed: śakyā kartum candra ādityau nabhaḥ mahī talam
translated: It is possible to make the moon and sun, which remove darkness, and the sky, into the surface of the earth today,

analyzed: śakyaḥ nā aham tvad sādṛśyaiḥ bahubhiḥ api gaṇana virutaiḥ drumāt praticālitum
translated: I am not able to be shaken from this tree, even by many groups of people equal to you, who are skilled in counting and making sounds.

analyzed: abhyutthitā balavatī namuceḥ camū sā hākāra śaṅkha rava bheri mṛdaṅga śabdaiḥ
translated: The powerful army of Namuci has arisen, with the sounds of battle cries, conches, drums, and kettledrums.

original: ha putra vatsa dayitā kimasi pranaṣṭo dṛṣṭvā imāṃ namucisenamatīva bhīmām // / //
analyzed: ha putra vatsa dayitā kim asi pranaṣṭaḥ dṛṣṭvā imām namucisenam atīva bhīmām
translated: O son, dear one, why are you lost, seeing this extremely terrifying army of Namuci?

analyzed: su kumāra deva nara saṃstuta pūjanīya
translated: Pale like the heart of a golden campaka flower, tender, praised and worshipped by gods and humans,

original: adya prayāsyasi vināśu mahāraṇesmiṃ mārasya eṣyasi vaśaṃ asurasya venduḥ // / //
analyzed: adya prayāsyasi vināśu mahā raṇesmin mārasya eṣyasi vaśam asurasya vā induḥ
translated: Today you will go without a doubt into this great battle, and will fall under the power of Mara or Asura, O Moon.

original: brahmasvareṇa karaviṅkarutasvareṇā tān yakṣarākṣasagaṇāṃ sugato babhāṣe /🔽Vaidya
analyzed: brahma svareṇa karaviṅka ruta svareṇa tān yakṣa rākṣasa gaṇām sugataḥ babhāṣe 🔽vaidya
translated: With a voice like Brahma's, with a voice like the cuckoo's, the Well-Gone One spoke to the groups of Yakshas and Rakshasas:🔽O Yakshas and Rakshasas, listen to my words, which are beneficial and pleasant, and which bring peace and happiness to all beings.

original: ākāśu trāsayitumicchati yo hyavidvān so 'smadvidhaṃ drumavarād grahaṇāya icchet // / //
analyzed: ākāśu trāsayitum icchati yaḥ hi a vidvān saḥ smadvidham druma varāt grahaṇāya icchet
translated: If an ignorant one wishes to frighten space, he would wish to seize me, who am like that, from the best of trees.

original: bhittvā ca yo raju gaṇeya mahāsahasra lomnā ca sāgarajalaṃ ca samuddharedyaḥ /
analyzed: bhittvā ca yaḥ lomnā ca sāgara jalam ca samuddharet yaḥ
translated: And if one were to pierce a rope and count a great thousand, and if one were to draw out the water of the ocean with a hair,

original: vajrāmayāṃ girivarāṃ vikiretkṣaṇācca so cāpi māṃ tarugataṃ na viheṭhayeta // / //
analyzed: vajra āmayām giri varām vikiret kṣaṇāt ca ca api mām taru gatam na viheṭhayeta
translated: And if one were to scatter in an instant the best of diamond mountains, he still would not be able to harm me who is in the tree.

original: yugamantarasmi sthita māru praduṣṭacitto niṣkoṣa pāṇinamasiṃ pragṛhītva tīkṣṇam /
analyzed: sthita praduṣṭa cittaḥ niṣkoṣa tīkṣṇam
translated: Standing between the two wheels, Māra with an evil mind, holding a sharp sword unsheathed in his hand,

original: uttiṣṭha śīghra śramaṇāsmamatena gaccha mā veṇuyaṣṭi haritāṃ va chinadmi te 'dya // / //
analyzed: uttiṣṭha śīghra śramaṇa asmamatena gaccha mā veṇu yaṣṭi haritām chinadmi te
translated: Arise quickly, O monk, go by my order, lest I cut you down today like a green bamboo.

analyzed: bodhisattvaḥ āha
translated: The Bodhisattva said:

original: sarveyaṃ trisahasra medini yadi māraiḥ prapūrṇā bhavet
analyzed: sarvā iyam tri sahasra medini yadi māraiḥ prapūrṇā bhavet
translated: If this entire trichiliocosm were filled with Māras,

original: sarveṣāṃ yatha meru parvatavaraḥ pāṇīṣu khaṅgo bhavet /
analyzed: sarveṣām parvata varaḥ pāṇīṣu khaṅgaḥ bhavet
translated: and if in the hands of all of them there were a sword like the best of mountains, Meru,

original: te mahyaṃ na samartha loma calituṃ prāgeva māṃ ghātituṃ
analyzed: te mahyam na samartha loma calitum prāk eva mām ghātitum
translated: they would not be able to move a hair of mine, much less kill me.

original: mā dūṣī nativela saṃpranadahe smāremi te 'nadṛḍham // / //
analyzed: mā saṃpranadahe smāremi te
translated: Do not speak harshly, O Māra, I remember your words as being weak.

original: vidhyanti śailaśikharāṃ jvalitāgnivarṇāṃ vṛkṣāṃ samūlaka kṣipī tatha tāmraloham /
analyzed: vidhyanti śaila śikharām jvalita agni varṇām tāmra loham
translated: They shoot at the peaks of mountains, blazing with the color of fire, and at trees, and throw in molten copper and iron.

original: uṣṭrāśca gogajamukhāstatha bhairavākṣā āśīviṣā bhujaga dṛṣṭiviṣāśca ghorāḥ // / //
analyzed: uṣṭrāḥ ca bhairava akṣāḥ āśīviṣāḥ bhujaga dṛṣṭiviṣāḥ ca ghorāḥ
translated: There are camels, cows, and elephants, and also terrifying beings with fearful eyes, poisonous snakes, and terrible ones with poisonous eyes.

original: megheva utthita caturdiśa garjamānā vajrāśanī tatha ayoguḍa varṣamāṇāḥ /
analyzed: caturdiśa garjamānā vajrāśanī ayoguḍa varṣamāṇāḥ
translated: Like clouds rising in the four directions, thundering, and raining down lightning bolts and iron balls,

original: asiśaktitīṣṇaparaśuṃ saviṣāṃśca bāṇāṃ bhindanti medinitalaṃ pramathanti vṛkṣāṃ // / //
analyzed: sa viṣān ca bāṇām bhindanti medini talam pramathanti
translated: They split the earth with sharp swords, spears, and axes, and crush the trees.

original: bāhūśataiḥ śaraśatāni kṣipanti keci āśīviṣāṃ hutavahāṃśca mukhā sṛjanti /
analyzed: bāhū śataiḥ śara śatāni kṣipanti āśīviṣām hutavahān ca mukhā sṛjanti
translated: Some shoot hundreds of arrows with hundreds of arms, and release poisonous snakes and fire from their mouths.

original: makarādikāṃśca jalajānudadhergṛhītvā vidhyanti keci bhujagāṃ garuḍāśca bhūtvā // / //
analyzed: makara ādikān ca jala jānu dadheḥ gṛhītvā vidhyanti bhujagām garuḍāḥ ca bhūtvā
translated: Some, becoming serpents and garuḍas, seize crocodiles and other water creatures from the ocean and pierce them.

analyzed: kecid sumeru sadṛśān ayasā guḍāni tapta agni varṇa śikharāḥ nikṣipanti ruṣṭāḥ
translated: Some, in anger, throw molten iron balls the size of Mount Sumeru, with peaks the color of burning fire,

original: āsādya medinitalaṃ kṣubhayanti corvīṃ heṣṭhā paskandha salilasya viloḍayanti // / //🔽Vaidya
analyzed: āsādya medini talam kṣubhayanti ca urvīm heṣṭhā salilasya viloḍayanti 🔽vaidya
translated: They reach the earth and shake it, and below, they churn the waters of the ocean.

original: kecitpatanti puratastatha pṛṣṭhato 'sya vāme ca dakṣiṇa patanti aho ti vatsa /
analyzed: kecid patanti puratas vāme ca dakṣiṇa patanti
translated: Some fall in front of him, and likewise behind him, on his left and right, exclaiming, Alas, my child!

original: viparītahastacaraṇā jvalitottamāṅgā netrebhi niścarati vidyudiva pradīptā // / //
analyzed: viparīta hasta caraṇā jvalita uttamāṅgā netrebhiḥ niścarati vidyut iva pradīptā
translated: With their hands and feet in the opposite position, their heads ablaze, lightning flashes from their eyes, blazing...

original: dṛṣṭvā vikāravikṛtā namucestu senā māyākṛtaṃ ca yatha prekṣati śuddhasattvaḥ /
analyzed: dṛṣṭvā vikāra vikṛtā namuceḥ tu senā māyā kṛtam ca prekṣati śuddha sattvaḥ
translated: Seeing the distorted forms of Namuci's army, the Pure Being sees them as created by illusion.

original: naivātra māru na balaṃ na jaganna cātmā udacandrarūpasadṛśo bhramati trilokaḥ // / //
analyzed: na eva atra na balam na jagat na ca ātmā uda candra rūpa sadṛśaḥ bhramati trilokaḥ
translated: Here there is no Mara, no power, no world, and no self. The three worlds revolve like a water-moon image...

original: cakṣurna istri puruṣo napi cātmanīyaṃ srotaṃ ca ghrāṇa tathā jihva tathaiva kāyaḥ /
analyzed: cakṣuḥ puruṣaḥ ca ātmanīyam ca ghrāṇa tathā jihva tathā eva kāyaḥ
translated: The eye is neither male nor female, nor is it a self. The ear, nose, tongue, body, and mind are likewise.

original: adhyātmaśūnya bahiśūnya pratītya jātā dharmā ime karakavedakavītivṛttāḥ // / //
analyzed: adhyātma śūnya bahi śūnya pratītya jātāḥ dharmāḥ ime karaka vedaka vīti vṛttāḥ
translated: These phenomena, arisen dependently, are internally and externally empty, devoid of an agent and a feeler.

original: so satyavākyamakarotsada satyavādī yeneha satyavacanenima śūnya dharmāḥ /
analyzed: saḥ satya vākyam akarot sada satya vādī yena iha satya vacana inima śūnya dharmāḥ
translated: He, the true speaker, the good truth-speaker, by whom these phenomena are empty due to true speech,

original: ye keci saumya vinaye anukūlapakṣāḥ te śastra pāṇiṣu nirīkṣiṣu puṣpadāmāṃ // / //
analyzed: ye keci saumya vinaye anukūlapakṣāḥ te śastra pāṇiṣu nirīkṣiṣu
translated: Whatever favorable factors there are, gentle one, for the training, those who hold weapons and look for them see flower garlands...

original: so dakṣiṇe karatale racitāgrajāle tāmrairnakhaiḥ suruciraiḥ sahasrāracakre /
analyzed: saḥ dakṣiṇe kara tale racita agra jāle tāmraiḥ nakhaiḥ su ruciraiḥ sahasra ara cakre
translated: With his right hand, he gracefully touches his feet, which are adorned with webbed fingers and copper-colored, very beautiful, thousand-spoked wheels,

original: jāmbūnadārcisadṛśaiḥ śubhapuṇyajuṣṭe mūrdhnātu yāva spṛśate caraṇāṃ salīlam // / //
analyzed: jāmbūnada arci sadṛśaiḥ śubha puṇya juṣṭe mūrdhnātu sa līlam
translated: Which are endowed with auspicious merit, resembling the radiance of gold from the Jambū River.

original: bāhuṃ prasārya yatha vidyudivā nabhasthā ābhāṣate vasumatīniya mahya sākṣī /
analyzed: bāhum prasārya ābhāṣate sākṣī
translated: Stretching out his arm, like lightning in the sky, he declares, The earth is my witness.

original: citrā mi yajña nayutānapi yaṣṭa pūrve na mi jātu yācanaka bandhakṛtā nu dāsye // / //
analyzed: citrā mi yajña nayutānapi yaṣṭa pūrve na mi jātu yācanaka bandha kṛtā nu dāsye
translated: I have performed many tens of thousands of sacrifices in the past, but I have never before given to a beggar. I will give now.

original: āpo mi sākṣi tatha teja tathaiva vāyu brahmā prajāpati sajotiṣa candrasūryāḥ /
analyzed: āpaḥ tathā teja tathā eva vāyu brahmā prajāpati sajotiṣa candra sūryāḥ
translated: The waters are my witness, and likewise fire and wind, Brahmā, Prajāpati, the luminous moon and sun,

original: buddhā mi sākṣi daśasu sthita ye diśāsu yatha mahya śīlavrataudgata bodhiaṅgāḥ // / //
analyzed: buddhāḥ mi sākṣi daśasu sthita ye diśāsu śīla vrata audgata bodhi aṅgāḥ
translated: The buddhas who abide in the ten directions are my witness, just as the factors of enlightenment that have arisen from my morality and discipline.

original: dānaṃ mi sākṣi tatha śīlu tathaiva kṣāntiḥ vīryāpi sākṣi tatha dhyāna tathaiva prajñā /🔽Vaidya
analyzed: dānam sākṣi tathā śīlu tathā eva kṣāntiḥ  vaidya
translated: Giving is my witness, and likewise morality and patience, diligence is my witness, and likewise concentration and wisdom,

original: catura pramāṇa mama sākṣi tathā abhijñā anupūrvabodhicari sarva mameha sākṣī // / //
analyzed: sarva mama iha
translated: The four valid means of knowledge are my witness, and likewise the superknowledges, the entire sequence of enlightenment is my witness here.

original: yāvanti sattva nikhilā daśasu diśāsu yatteṣu puṇya bala śīlu tathaiva jñānam /
analyzed: yāvanti sattva nikhilā daśasu diśāsu yatteṣu puṇya bala śīlu tathā eva jñānam
translated: All the merit, strength, morality, and wisdom of all beings in the ten directions,

original: yajñā nirargaḍa ya yaṣṭa śaṭhaḥ kalībhiḥ te mahya roma śatimāṃ kala nopayanti // / //
analyzed: yajñā nirargaḍa ya yaṣṭa śaṭhaḥ kalībhiḥ te mahya roma śatimām kala nopayanti
translated: And the sacrifices performed by the deceitful and quarrelsome with great wealth, do not amount to a hundredth part of mine.

original: so pāṇinā dharaṇi āhanate salīlaṃ raṇate iyaṃ vasumatī yatha kaṃsapātrī /
analyzed: saḥ u pāṇinā dharaṇi āhanate sa līlam iyam vasumatī kaṃsapātrī
translated: He playfully strikes the earth with his hand, and it resounds like a bronze vessel.

original: māro niśamya ravu mediniye nirastaḥ śṛṇute vacaṃ hanata gṛhṇatu kṛṣṇabandhum // / //
analyzed: māraḥ niśamya ravu nirastaḥ śṛṇute vacam hanata gṛhṇatu kṛṣṇa bandhum
translated: Hearing this sound on the earth, Mara is defeated. He hears the words: Kill him! Seize Krishna's friend!

original: prasvinnagātru hatateju vivarṇavaktro māro jarābhihatu ātmanu saṃprapaśyī /
analyzed: prasvinna gātru hata teju vivarṇa vaktraḥ māraḥ ātmanu saṃprapaśyī
translated: With trembling body, lost splendor, and pale face, Mara sees himself struck by old age.

original: uratāḍa krandatu bhayārtu anāthabhūto bhrāntaṃ mano namucito gatu citta moham // / //🔽hastyaśvayānaratha bhūmitale nirastāḥ dhāvanti rākṣasa kubhāṇḍa piśāca bhītāḥ /
analyzed: krandatu anātha bhūtaḥ bhrāntam manaḥ namucitaḥ gatu moham  hasti aśva yāna ratha bhūmi tale nirastāḥ dhāvanti rākṣasa kubhāṇḍa piśāca bhītāḥ
translated: Beating his chest, he cries out in fear, becoming helpless. His mind is confused and his thoughts are deluded.🔽Elephants, horses, vehicles, chariots, and the earth are all destroyed. The rakshasas, kumbhandas, and pisachas run away in fear.

original: saṃmūḍha mārga na labhanti alenatrāṇāḥ pakṣī davāgnipataneva nirīkṣya krāntāḥ // / //
analyzed: saṃmūḍha mārga na labhanti alenatrāṇāḥ pakṣī dava agni patana iva nirīkṣya krāntāḥ
translated: Confused, they find no path, no shelter, no protection. Like birds in a forest fire, they look up and cry out.

original: mātā svasā pitara putra tathaiva bhrātā pṛcchanti tatra kahi dṛṣṭa kahiṃ gatā vā /
analyzed: mātā svasā pitara putra tathā eva bhrātā pṛcchanti tatra kahi dṛṣṭa kahiṃ gatā vā
translated: Mother, sister, father, and son, and likewise brother, they ask there, Where have we been seen? Where have we gone?

original: anyonya vigraha karonti tathaiva heṭhāḥ prāptā vayaṃ vyasana jīvita nāvakāśaḥ // / //
analyzed: anyonya vigraha karonti tathā eva heṭhāḥ prāptāḥ vayam vyasana jīvita na avakāśaḥ
translated: They quarrel with each other and likewise harm each other, We have fallen into misfortune, there is no opportunity for life.

original: sā mārasena vipulā mahatī akṣobhyā vibhraṣṭa sarva viralīkṛta naiva saṃdhiḥ /
analyzed: sā mārasena vipulā mahatī akṣobhyā vibhraṣṭa sarva viralīkṛta na eva saṃdhiḥ
translated: That great and immeasurable army of Māra, all scattered and dispersed, is not united.

original: divasāni sapta abhijāni paraspareṇa ābhāsi dṛṣṭa yadi jīvasi taṃ khu prītāḥ // / //
analyzed: divasāni sapta abhijāni paraspareṇa ābhāsi dṛṣṭa yadi jīvasi tam khu prītāḥ
translated: For seven days they recognize each other, If you are seen alive, we will be delighted.

original: sā vṛkṣadevata tadā karuṇāṃ hi kṛtvā vārīghāṭaṃ grahiya siñcati kṛṣṇabandhum /
analyzed: sā vṛkṣadevata tadā karuṇām hi kṛtvā siñcati kṛṣṇa bandhum
translated: Then the tree deity, having taken pity, took a water pot and sprinkled the dark-colored one.

original: uttiṣṭha śīghra vraja he ma puno vilamba evaṃ hi teṣa bhavate guruuddharāṇām // / //
analyzed: uttiṣṭha śīghra vraja he ma punar vilamba evam hi bhavate guru uddharāṇām
translated: Rise up quickly and go, do not delay again, for this is how it becomes for those who are rescued by their elders.

analyzed: vaidya
translated: Vidy

analyzed: māraḥ āha
translated: Māra said:

original: duḥkhaṃ bhayaṃ vyasana śoka vināśanaṃ ca dhikkāraśabdamavamānagataṃ ca dainyam /
analyzed: duḥkham bhayam vyasana śoka vināśanam ca dhikkāra śabdam avamāna gatam ca dainyam
translated: Misery, fear, misfortune, sorrow, and destruction, the sound of blame, contempt, and dejection,

original: prāpto 'smi adya aparādhya suśuddhasatve aśrutva vākya madhuraṃ hitamātmajānām // / //
analyzed: prāptaḥ smi adya aparādhya su śuddha satve a śrutvā vākya madhuram hitam ātmajānām
translated: I have attained today, O pure-hearted one, without hearing the sweet and beneficial words of my children.

analyzed: devatāḥ āha
translated: The deity said:

original: bhayaṃ ca duḥkhaṃ vyasanaṃ ca dainyaṃ dhikkāraśabdaṃ vadhabandhanaṃ ca /
analyzed: bhayam ca duḥkham vyasanam ca dainyam dhikkāra śabdam vadha bandhanam ca
translated: Fear, suffering, misfortune, and misery, the sound of reproach, and killing and binding,

original: doṣānanekāṃ labhate hyavidvān nirāparādheṣvapi rādhyate yaḥ // / //
analyzed: doṣān anekām labhate hi avidvān nirāparādheṣu api rādhyate yaḥ
translated: The ignorant one obtains many faults, and is condemned even for those who are innocent.

original: devāsurā garuḍa rākṣasa kinnarendrā brahmātha śakra paranirmita sākaniṣṭhāḥ /
analyzed: deva asurāḥ garuḍa rākṣasa kinnara indrāḥ brahma atha śakra paranirmita sākaniṣṭhāḥ
translated: The gods, asuras, garuḍas, rākṣasas, and kinnara kings, Brahmā, Śakra, Paranirmita, and Akaniṣṭha,

original: bhāṣanti tasya vijayaṃ jaya lokavīra yatredṛśī namucisena tvayā nirastā // / //
analyzed: bhāṣanti tasya vijayam jaya loka vīra yatrā īdṛśī namuci sena tvayā nirastā
translated: They proclaim your victory, O Victorious One, O Hero of the World, where such an army of Namuci was repelled by you.

original: hārārdhacandra dhvaja chatrapatāka dentī puṣpāgarū tagaracandanacūrṇavarṣāṃ /
analyzed: dentī puṣpa agarū tagara candana cūrṇa varṣām
translated: Offering necklaces, half-moons, flags, parasols, and banners, a rain of flowers, agarwood, tagara, and sandalwood powder,

original: tūryā parāhaniya vākyamudīrayante acchā drume tuva ca śūra jitārisiṃhā // / //
analyzed: vākyam udīrayante acchā drume ca śūra jita ari siṃhā
translated: And playing musical instruments, they utter these words: O Tree, O Hero, O Lion who has conquered the enemy,

original: atraiva cāsanavare labhase 'dya bodhiṃ āveṇikāṃ daśabalāṃ pratisaṃvidaṃ ca /
analyzed: atrā eva ca āsana vare labhase dya bodhim āveṇikām daśa balām pratisaṃvidam ca
translated: Here on this excellent seat you will attain enlightenment today, the unequaled, the ten powers, and the discernments.

original: sarvaṃ ca buddhaviṣayaṃ labhase 'dya śūra maitrā vijitya vipulāṃ śaṭhamārapakṣāṃ // / //
analyzed: sarvam ca buddha viṣayam labhase śūra maitrā vijitya vipulām śaṭha māra pakṣām
translated: And you will attain the entire domain of the Buddha today, O Hero, having conquered the vast army of Māra and the deceitful.

original: iha māradharṣaṇakṛte ca raṇe pravṛtte saṃbodhisattvabalavikrama yebhi dṛṣṭam /
analyzed: iha māra dharṣaṇa kṛte ca raṇe pravṛtte dṛṣṭam
translated: In this battle waged for the sake of conquering Māra, by whom was the power and valor of the Bodhisattva seen?

original: ṣaṭtriṃśakoṭinayutā cature ca viṃśā yebhirmanaḥ praṇihitaṃ varabuddhabodhau // / //
analyzed: ṣaṭtriṃśa koṭi nayutā cature ca viṃśāḥ yebhiḥ manaḥ praṇihitam vara buddha bodhau
translated: And thirty-six koṭis of nayutas of beings, four times twenty, by whom the mind was directed to the supreme enlightenment of the Buddha.

analyzed: iti
translated: Thus.

analyzed: iti śrī lalitavistare māradharṣaṇaparivartaḥ nāma ekaviṃśatitamaḥ dhyāyaḥ
translated: Thus ends the twenty-first chapter, the chapter on Mara's harassment, in the Sutra of the Auspicious Eon.

analyzed: start parivarta  vaidya  abhisaṃbodhana parivartaḥ dvāviṃśaḥ
translated: Chapter 22: Attainment of Buddhahood

original: iti hi bhikṣavo bodhisattvo nihatamārapratyarthiko marditakaṇṭako raṇaśirasi vijitavijayaḥ
analyzed: iti hi bhikṣavaḥ bodhisattvaḥ nihata māra pratyarthikaḥ mardita kaṇṭakaḥ raṇa śirasi vijita vijayaḥ
translated: Thus have I heard. At one time, the Blessed One was dwelling in the Deer Park at Vārāṇasī, in the Ṛṣipatana, the Deer Grove, together with a great assembly of monks, with 1,250 monks.🔽At that time, the Blessed One addressed the monks: Monks, this is the noble truth of suffering. Birth is suffering, old age is suffering, disease is suffering, death is suffering, association with what is disliked is suffering, separation from what is loved is suffering, not getting what one wants is suffering. In brief, the five aggregates subject to clinging are suffering.🔽This, monks, is called the noble truth of suffering.

original: uchritachatradhvajapatāko viviktaṃ kāmairviviktaṃ pāpakairakuśalairdhamaiḥ savitarkaṃ🔽savicāraṃ vivekajaṃ prītisukhaṃ prathamaṃ dhyānamupasaṃpadya viharati sma /
analyzed: uchrita chatra dhvaja patākaḥ viviktam kāmaiḥ viviktam pāpakaiḥ akuśalaiḥ dhamaiḥ sa vitarkam  sa vicāram viveka jam prīti sukham prathamam dhyānam upasaṃpadya viharati sma
translated: Monks, this is the noble truth of the arising of suffering. It is that craving which leads to continuation in existence, which is accompanied by delight and passion, greatly enjoying this and that, as follows: craving for sensual pleasures, craving for continuation, and craving for discontinuation.🔽This, monks, is called the noble truth of the arising of suffering.🔽Monks, this is the noble truth of the cessation of suffering. It is the complete fading away and cessation without remainder of that craving - liberation, letting go, releasing, not clinging.🔽This, monks, is called the noble truth of the cessation of suffering.

original: savitarkasavicārāṇāṃ vyupaśamādadhyātmasaṃprasādāccetasa ekotibhāvādavitarkamavicāraṃ samādhijaṃ prītisukhaṃ dvitīyaṃ dhyānamupasaṃpadya viharati
analyzed: sa vitarka sa vicārāṇām vyupaśamāt adhyātma saṃprasādāt cetasaḥ eka ūti bhāvāt a vitarkam a vicāram samādhi jam prīti sukham dvitīyam dhyānam upasaṃpadya viharati
translated: Monks, this is the noble truth of the path leading to the cessation of suffering. It is this noble eightfold path, as follows: right view, right thought, right speech, right action, right livelihood, right effort, right mindfulness, right concentration.

analyzed: sma
translated: This, monks, is called the noble truth of the path leading to the cessation of suffering.🔽Monks, this is the noble truth of suffering. It should be fully known by direct spiritual experience, and it has been fully known by direct spiritual experience.🔽Monks, this is the noble truth of the arising of suffering. It should be given up, and it has been given up.🔽Monks, this is the noble truth of the cessation of suffering. It should be realized, and it has been

original: sa prītervirāgādupekṣako viharati sma smṛtimān saṃprajānan sukhaṃ kāyena pratisaṃvedayate sma yattadāryā ācakṣate sma upekṣakaḥ smṛtimān
analyzed: sa prīteḥ virāgāt upekṣakaḥ viharati sma smṛtimān saṃprajānan sukham kāyena pratisaṃvedayate sma yat tat āryāḥ ācakṣate smaḥ upekṣakaḥ smṛtimān
translated: He abided in equanimity, mindful and clearly knowing, experiencing that happiness of which the noble ones say, 'Equanimous and mindful one abides happily.'

analyzed: niṣprītikam tṛtīyam dhyānam upasaṃpadya viharati sma
translated: He attained and abided in the third dhyāna, which is without joy.

original: sa sukhasya ca prahāṇādduḥkhasya ca prahāṇātpūrvameva ca saumanasyadaurmanasyayorastaṃgamādaduḥkhāsukhamupekṣāsmṛtipariśuddhaṃ caturthaṃ dhyānamupasaṃpadya
analyzed: sa sukhasya ca prahāṇāt duḥkhasya ca prahāṇāt pūrvam eva ca saumanasya daurmanasyayoḥ astaṃgamāt aduḥkha asukham upekṣā smṛti pariśuddham caturtham dhyānam upasaṃpadya
translated: He abandoned pleasure, abandoned pain, and having previously abandoned mental well-being and sorrow, attained and abided in the fourth dhyāna, which is neither painful nor pleasant and is purified in terms of equanimity and mindfulness.

original: viharati sma //🔽atha bodhisattvasyathā samāhite citte pariśuddhe paryavadāte prabhāsvare 'naṅgane
analyzed: viharati sma  atha samāhite citte pariśuddhe paryavadāte prabhāsvare naṅgane
translated: He abided in that.

original: vigatopakleśe mṛduni karmaṇyupasthite ānijjyaprāpte rātryāṃ prathame yāme divyasya
analyzed: vigata upakleśe mṛduni karmaṇi upasthite ānijjya prāpte rātryām prathame yāme divyasya
translated: Then, when the Bodhisattva's mind was thus concentrated, purified, bright, unblemished, free from defilement, supple, workable, steady, and imperturbable, he directed it to the knowledge of recollecting his former abodes.🔽He recollected his various former abodes, with their aspects and details.

analyzed: cakṣuṣaḥ jñāna darśana vidyā sākṣātkriyāyai cittam abhinirharati sma 🔽abhinirnāmayati sma
translated: This was the first knowledge he attained in the first watch of the night.

original: atha bodhisattvo divyena cakṣuṣā pariśuddhenātikrāntamānuṣyakeṇa sattvān paśyati sma cyavamānānupapadyamānān suvarṇān durvarṇān sugatān durgatān 🔽hīnān praṇītān /
analyzed: atha bodhisattvaḥ divyena cakṣuṣā pariśuddhena atikrānta mānuṣyakeṇa sattvān paśyati sma cyavamāna an upapadyamānān suvarṇān durvarṇān sugatān durgatān  / hīnān praṇītān
translated: Then the Bodhisattva, with his divine eye, which is purified and surpasses that of (normal) men, saw beings passing away and being reborn, base and noble, fair and ugly, in happy and unhappy states, according to their deeds.

original: yathākarmopagān sattvān prajānāti sma ime bata bhoḥ sattvāḥ kāyaduścaritena samanvāgatāḥ /🔽vāṅbhanoduścaritena samānvāgatāḥ /
analyzed: yathā karma upagān sattvān prajānāti smaḥ ime bata bhoḥ sattvāḥ kāya duścaritena samanvāgatāḥ  samā anvāgatāḥ
translated: He knew how beings pass on according to their actions: 'These worthy beings who are endowed with bodily misconduct,🔽who are endowed with verbal and mental misconduct,

analyzed: āryāṇām apavādakāḥ mithyā dṛṣṭayaḥ
translated: who revile noble ones, have wrong views,

original: te mithyādṛṣṭikarmadharmasamādānahetoḥ kāyasya bhedātparaṃ maraṇādapāyadurgativinipātaṃ narakeṣūpapadyante /
analyzed: te mithyādṛṣṭi karma dharma samādāna hetoḥ kāyasya bhedāt param maraṇāt apāya durgati vinipātam narakeṣu upapadyante
translated: and who have undertaken actions and conduct based on wrong views, because of that, at the breaking up of the body after death, are reborn in a bad realm of existence, in an unhappy state, in the hells.

analyzed: ime punar bhavantaḥ sattvāḥ kāya su caritena samanvāgatāḥ
translated: But these worthy beings who are endowed with good bodily conduct,

analyzed: samanvāgatāḥ
translated: who are endowed with good verbal and mental conduct,

analyzed: āryāṇām anapavādakāḥ samyak dṛṣṭayaḥ
translated: who do not revile noble ones, have right views,

analyzed: te samyak dṛṣṭi karma dharma samādāna hetoḥ kāyasya bhedāt sugatau svarga lokeṣu upapadyante
translated: and who have undertaken actions and conduct based on right views, because of that, at the breaking up of the body after death, are reborn in a good realm of existence, in a heavenly world.'

original: iti hi divyena cakṣuṣā viśuddhenātikrāntamānuṣyakeṇa sattvānāpaśyati sma cyavamānānupapadyamānān suvarṇān durvarṇān sugatān durgatān hīnān
analyzed: iti hi divyena cakṣuṣā viśuddhena atikrānta mānuṣyakeṇa sattvān āpaśyati sma cyavamāna an upapadyamānān suvarṇān durvarṇān sugatān durgatān hīnān  /
translated: Thus, with his divine eye, which is purified and surpasses that of (normal) men, he saw beings passing away and being reborn, base and excellent, fair and ugly, in good and bad destinies, according to their deeds.

analyzed: praṇītān yathā karma upagān
translated: He understood how beings go to a good destiny or a bad destiny according to their deeds.

original: evaṃ khalu bhikṣavo bodhisattvo rātryāṃ prathame yāme vidyāṃ sākṣātkaroti sma /
analyzed: evam khalu bhikṣavaḥ bodhisattvaḥ rātryām prathame yāme vidyām sākṣātkaroti sma
translated: Thus, monks, in the first watch of the night, the Bodhisattva realized knowledge.

analyzed: tamaḥ nihanti sma
translated: He destroyed darkness.

analyzed: ālokam utpādayati sma
translated: He produced light.

original: atha bodhisattvastathā samāhite citte pariśuddhe paryavadāte prabhāsvare niraṅgane🔽vigatopakleśe mṛduni karmaṇyupasthite āniñjyaprāpte rātryāṃ madhyame yāme pūrvanivāsānusmṛtijñānadarśanavidyāsākṣātkriyāyai
analyzed: atha bodhisattvaḥ tathā samāhite citte pariśuddhe paryavadāte prabhāsvare niraṅgane  vigata upakleśe mṛduni karmaṇi upasthite āniñjya prāpte rātryām madhyame yāme pūrva nivāsa anusmṛti jñāna darśana vidyā sākṣātkriyāyai
translated: Then, monks, the Bodhisattva, with his mind thus concentrated, purified, bright, unblemished, free from defilement, supple, malleable, steady, and attained to imperturbability, in the middle watch of the night,

analyzed: cittam abhinirharati sma  abhinirnāmayati sma
translated: directed his mind to the knowledge of the recollection of past lives.🔽He remembered various abodes in the past,

analyzed: ātmanaḥ para sattvānām ca anekavidham pūrva nivāsān anusmarati sma
translated: various kinds of former abodes.🔽He thought: This is my former abode, my former name, my former family, my former caste, my former food, my former happiness and suffering, my former life span.🔽Then, having passed away from there, I was reborn elsewhere. There also was my name, my family, my caste, my food, my happiness and suffering, my life span. Having passed away from there, I was reborn here. Thus he remembered various abodes in the past, various kinds of former abodes.

original: tadyathā ekāmapi jātiṃ dve tisraścatasraḥ pañca daśa viṃśati triṃśaccatvāriṃśatpañcāśajjātiśataṃ Vaidya 🔽jātisahasraṃ jātiśatasahasram anekānyapi jātiśatasahasrāṇyapi jātikoṭīmapi jātikoṭīśatamapi jātikoṭīsahasramapi jātikoṭīnayutamapi /🔽anekānyapi jātikoṭīsahasrāṇyapi anekānyapi jātikoṭīśatasahasrāṇyapi anekānyapi jātikoṭīnayutaśatasahasrāṇi
analyzed: tat yathā ekām api jātim dve tisraḥ catasraḥ pañca daśa viṃśati triṃśat catvāriṃśat pañcāśat jāti śatam vaidya  jāti sahasram jāti śata sahasram anekāni api jāti śata sahasrāṇi api jāti koṭīm api jāti koṭī śatam api jāti koṭī sahasram api jāti koṭī nayutam api  anekāni api jāti koṭī sahasrāṇi api anekāni api jāti koṭī śata sahasrāṇi api anekāni api jāti koṭī nayuta śata sahasrāṇi
translated: For example, one birth, two, three, four, five, ten, twenty, thirty, forty, fifty, a hundred births,🔽a thousand births, a hundred thousand births, many hundreds of births, many thousands of births, many hundreds of thousands of births, many koṭis of births, many hundreds of koṭis of births, many thousands of koṭis of births, many hundreds of thousands of koṭis of births,🔽many koṭis of niyutas of hundreds of thousands of births,

original: yāvatsaṃvartakalpamapi vivartakalpamapi saṃvartavivartakalpamapi anekānyapi saṃvartavivartakalpānyanusmarati🔽sma amutrāhamāsannevaṃnāmā evaṃgotra evaṃjātya evaṃvarṇa evamāhāra evamāyuṣpramāṇamevaṃ cirasthitikaḥ /
analyzed: yāvat saṃvarta kalpam api vivarta kalpam api saṃvarta vivarta kalpam api anekāni api saṃvarta vivarta kalpāni anusmarati  sma amutra aham āsan evaṃnāmā evaṃgotraḥ evaṃjātyaḥ evaṃvarṇaḥ evam āhāraḥ evam āyuṣpramāṇam evam cirasthitikaḥ
translated: many eons of dissolution, many eons of evolution, many eons of dissolution and evolution, many hundreds of eons of dissolution and evolution, many thousands of eons of dissolution and evolution, many hundreds of thousands of eons of dissolution and evolution,🔽many eons of dissolution and evolution as numerous as the sands of the Ganges River,🔽I was named so-and-so, of such-and-such a family, of such-and-such a lineage, of such-and-such a caste, eating such-and-such food, having such-and-such an experience of pleasure and pain,

analyzed: evam sukha duḥkha prativedī
translated: living so long, remaining for such-and-such a time,

analyzed: saḥ ham tatas cyutaḥ san amutra upapannaḥ
translated: and from there I passed away and was reborn there.

original: tataścyutvehopapanna iti sākāraṃ soddeśamanekavidhamātmanaḥ sarvasattvānāṃ ca pūrvanivāsamanusmarati sma //
analyzed: tatas cyutvā iha upapannaḥ iti sa ākāram sa uddeśam anekavidham ātmanaḥ sarva sattvānām ca pūrva nivāsam anusmarati sma
translated: Having passed away from there, he was reborn here. In this way, he remembered his own and all sentient beings' various past lives, with their aspects and locations.

original: atha bodhisattvastathā samāhitena cittena pariśuddhena paryavadātena prabhāsvareṇa🔽anaṅganena vigatopakleśena mṛdunā karmaṇye sthitenāniñcyaprāptena rātryāṃ paścime
analyzed: atha bodhisattvaḥ tathā samāhitena cittena pariśuddhena paryavadātena prabhāsvareṇa  anaṅganena vigata upakleśena mṛdunā karmaṇye sthitena aniñcya prāptena rātryām paścime
translated: Then, the Bodhisattva, with a mind thus concentrated, purified, bright, unblemished, free from defilement, supple, workable, steady, and imperturbable,

analyzed: yāme aruṇoddhāṭana kāla samaye nandī mukhyām rātrau
translated: in the last watch of the night, at dawn, when the night was passing away,🔽in the last extreme of the night, in the last extreme of the day, in the last extreme of the eon, in the last extreme of birth, old age, death, sorrow, lamentation, pain, dejection, and anguish,🔽he directed his mind to the knowledge of recollecting past lives.

analyzed: duḥkha samudaya astaṃgatāyāḥ āśrava kṣaya jñāna darśana vidyā sākṣātkriyāyai cittam abhinirharati sma  abhinirnāmayati sma
translated: He directed his mind to the knowledge of recollecting past lives.

original: tasyaitadabhavat kṛcchraṃ batāyaṃ loka āpanno yaduta jāyate jīryate mriyate cyavate upapadyate /
analyzed: tasya etat abhavat kṛcchram bata ayam lokaḥ āpannaḥ yat uta jāyate jīryate mriyate cyavate upapadyate
translated: He thought, Alas, this world has fallen into great suffering, for it is born, ages, dies, falls away, and is reborn.

original: atha ca punarasya kevalasya mahato duḥkhaskandhasya niḥsaraṇaṃ na saṃprajānāti jarāvyādhimaraṇādikasya /
analyzed: atha ca punar asya kevalasya mahataḥ duḥkha skandhasya niḥsaraṇam na saṃprajānāti jarā vyādhi maraṇa ādikasya
translated: Yet it does not know the escape from this great mass of suffering, from old age, sickness, death, and so on.

original: aho batāsya kevalasya mahato duḥkhaskandhasyāntaḥkriyā na prajñāyate sarvasya jarāvyādhimaraṇādikasya //
analyzed: aho bata asya kevalasya mahataḥ duḥkha skandhasya antaḥkriyā na prajñāyate sarvasya jarā vyādhi maraṇa ādikasya
translated: Alas, the end of this great mass of nothing but suffering, of all suffering such as old age, sickness, and death, is not seen.

original: tato bodhisattvasyaitadabhūt kasmin sati jarāmaraṇaṃ bhavati /
analyzed: tatas bodhisattvasya etat abhūt kasmin sati jarā maraṇam bhavati
translated: Then this occurred to the Bodhisattva: When what exists does old age and death occur?

analyzed: kiṃpratyayam ca punar jarā maraṇam
translated: And with what as condition is old age and death?

analyzed: tasya etat abhūt jātyām satyām jarā maraṇam bhavati
translated: This occurred to him: When birth exists, old age and death occur.

analyzed: jāti pratyayam jarā maraṇam
translated: With birth as condition is old age and death.

original: atha bodhisattvasya punaretadabhavat kasmin sati jātirbhavati /
analyzed: atha bodhisattvasya punar etat abhavat kasmin sati jātiḥ bhavati
translated: Then this occurred to the Bodhisattva: When what exists does birth occur?

analyzed: kiṃpratyayā ca punar jātiḥ
translated: And with what as condition is birth?

original: tasyaitadabhavat bhave sati jātirbhavati bhavapratyayā ca punarjātiḥ //
analyzed: tasya etat abhavat bhave sati jātiḥ bhavati bhava pratyayā ca punar jātiḥ
translated: This occurred to him: When existence exists, birth occurs. And with existence as condition is birth.

original: atha bodhisattvasyaitabhavat kasmin sati bhavo bhavati /
analyzed: atha kasmin sati bhavaḥ bhavati
translated: Then this occurred to the Bodhisattva: When what exists does existence occur?

analyzed: kiṃpratyayaḥ ca punarbhavaḥ
translated: And with what as condition is existence?

analyzed: tasya etat abhavat upādāne sati bhavaḥ bhavati
translated: This occurred to him: When clinging exists, existence occurs.

analyzed: upādāna pratyayaḥ hi bhavaḥ
translated: For existence is conditioned by clinging.

analyzed: atha bodhisattvasya etat abhavat kasmin sati upādānam bhavati
translated: Then this occurred to the Bodhisattva: When what exists does clinging occur?

analyzed: kiṃpratyayam ca punar upādānam
translated: And with what as condition is clinging?

analyzed: tasya etat abhavat tṛṣṇāyām satyām upādānam bhavati
translated: He thought: “When there is craving, appropriation occurs.

analyzed: tṛṣṇā pratyayam hi upādānam
translated: For appropriation is conditioned by craving.”

original: atha bodhisattvasya punaretadabhavat kasmin sati tṛṣṇā bhavati /
analyzed: atha bodhisattvasya punar etat abhavat kasmin sati tṛṣṇā bhavati
translated: Then the Bodhisattva thought again, “When what exists does craving exist?

analyzed: kiṃpratyayā ca tṛṣṇā
translated: Conditioned by what does craving occur?”

analyzed: tasya etat abhavat vedanāyām satyām tṛṣṇā bhavati
translated: He thought: “When there is feeling, craving exists.

analyzed: vedanā pratyayā ca tṛṣṇā
translated: For craving is conditioned by feeling.”

original: atha bodhisattvasya punaretadabhūt kasmin sati vedanā bhavati /🔽kiṃpratyayā punarvedanā /
analyzed: atha bodhisattvasya punar etat abhūt kasmin sati vedanā bhavati  kiṃpratyayā punar vedanā
translated: Then the Bodhisattva thought again, “When what exists does feeling exist?🔽Conditioned by what does feeling occur?”

analyzed: tasya etat abhūt sparśe sati vedanā bhavati
translated: He thought: “When there is contact, feeling exists.

analyzed: sparśa pratyayā hi vedanā
translated: For feeling is conditioned by contact.”

original: atha bodhisattvasya punaretadabhavat kasmin sati sparśo bhavati /
analyzed: atha bodhisattvasya punar etat abhavat kasmin sati sparśaḥ bhavati
translated: Then the Bodhisattva thought again, “When what exists does contact exist?

analyzed: kiṃpratyayaḥ ca punar sparśaḥ
translated: Conditioned by what does contact occur?”

analyzed: tasya etat abhavat ṣaṣ āyatane sati sparśaḥ bhavati
translated: He thought: “When there are the six sense spheres, contact exists.

original: ṣaḍāyatanapratyayo hi sparśaḥ //🔽atha bodhisattvasya punaretadabhavat kasmin sati ṣaḍāyatanaṃ bhavati /
analyzed: ṣaṣ āyatana pratyayaḥ hi sparśaḥ  atha bodhisattvasya punar etat abhavat kasmin sati ṣaṣ āyatanam bhavati
translated: For contact is conditioned by the six sense spheres.”🔽Then the Bodhisattva thought again, “When what exists do the six sense spheres exist?

analyzed: kiṃpratyayam ca punar ṣaṣ āyatanam
translated: Conditioned by what do the six sense spheres occur?”

analyzed: tasya etat abhavat nāma rūpe sati ṣaṣ āyatanam bhavati
translated: He thought: When there is name-and-form, the six sense bases exist.

analyzed: nānā rūpa pratyayam hi ṣaṣ āyatanam
translated: For the six sense bases have various forms as their condition.

analyzed: vaidya
translated: [Name-and-form]

original: atha bodhisattvasya punaretadabhavat kasmin sati nāmarūpaṃ bhavati /
analyzed: atha bodhisattvasya punar etat abhavat kasmin sati nāma rūpam bhavati
translated: Then the Bodhisattva thought again: When what exists does name-and-form exist?

analyzed: kiṃpratyayam ca punar nāma rūpam
translated: And what is the condition for name-and-form?

analyzed: tasya etat abhavat vijñāne sati nāma rūpam bhavati
translated: He thought: When consciousness exists, name-and-form exists.

analyzed: vijñāna pratyayam hi nāma rūpam
translated: For name-and-form has consciousness as its condition.

original: atha bodhisattvasya punaretadabhavat kasmin sati vijñānaṃ bhavanti /
analyzed: atha bodhisattvasya punar etat abhavat kasmin sati vijñānam bhavanti
translated: Then the Bodhisattva thought again: When what exists does consciousness exist?

analyzed: kiṃpratyayam punar vijñānam
translated: And what is the condition for consciousness?

analyzed: tasya etat abhavat saṃskāreṣu satsu vijñānam bhavati
translated: He thought: When formations exist, consciousness exists.

analyzed: saṃskāra pratyayam ca vijñānam
translated: For consciousness has formations as its condition.

original: atha bodhisattvasya punaretadabhavat kasmin sati saṃskārā bhavanti /
analyzed: atha bodhisattvasya punar etat abhavat kasmin sati saṃskārāḥ bhavanti
translated: Then the Bodhisattva thought again: When what exists do formations exist?

original: kiṃpratyayāśca punaḥ saṃskārāḥ /🔽tasyaitadabhavat avidyāyāṃ satyāṃ saṃskārā bhavanti /
analyzed: kiṃpratyayāḥ ca punar saṃskārāḥ  tasya etat abhavat avidyāyām satyām saṃskārāḥ bhavanti
translated: And what is the condition for formations?🔽He thought: When ignorance exists, formations exist.

analyzed: avidyā pratyayāḥ hi saṃskārāḥ
translated: For formations have ignorance as their condition.🔽[The twelve links of dependent origination]

original: iti hi bhikṣavo bodhisattvasyaitadabhūt avidyāpratyayāḥ saṃskārāḥ /
analyzed: iti hi bhikṣavaḥ bodhisattvasya etat abhūt avidyā pratyayāḥ saṃskārāḥ
translated: Thus, monks, the Bodhisattva thought: “Conditioned by ignorance are volitions.

analyzed: saṃskāra pratyayam vijñānam
translated: Conditioned by volitions is consciousness.

analyzed: vijñāna pratyayam nāma rūpam
translated: Conditioned by consciousness is name-and-form.

analyzed: nāma rūpa pratyayam ṣaṣ āyatanam
translated: Conditioned by name-and-form are the six sense spheres.

analyzed: ṣaṣ āyatana pratyayam sparśaḥ  sparśa pratyayam vedanā
translated: Conditioned by the six sense spheres is contact.🔽Conditioned by contact is feeling.

analyzed: vedanā pratyayam tṛṣṇā  tṛṣṇā pratyayam upādānam
translated: Conditioned by feeling is craving.🔽Conditioned by craving is clinging.

analyzed: upādāna pratyayam bhavaḥ
translated: Conditioned by clinging is becoming.

analyzed: bhava pratyayā jātiḥ
translated: Conditioned by becoming is birth.

analyzed: jāti pratyayāḥ jarā maraṇa śoka parideva duḥkha daurmanasya upāyāsāḥ saṃbhavanti
translated: Conditioned by birth, old age, death, grief, lamentation, pain, sorrow, and despair arise.

original: evamasya kevalasya mahato duḥkhaskandhasya samudayo bhavati /
analyzed: evam asya kevalasya mahataḥ duḥkha skandhasya samudayaḥ bhavati
translated: Thus arises this whole great mass of suffering.

analyzed: samudayaḥ samudayaḥ iti
translated: Arising, arising!”

original: iti hi bhikṣavo bodhisattvasya pūrvamaśruteṣu dharmeṣu yoniśomanasikārādbahulīkārājjñānamudapādi /
analyzed: iti hi bhikṣavaḥ bodhisattvasya pūrvam aśruteṣu dharmeṣu yoni śomanasikārāt bahulīkārāt jñānam udapādi
translated: Thus, monks, as the Bodhisattva previously applied himself to the proper mental attention of phenomena that had not been heard, knowledge arose.

analyzed: cakṣuḥ udapādi
translated: The eye arose.

analyzed: vidyā udapādi  bhūriḥ udapādi  medhā udapādi
translated: Knowledge arose.🔽Wisdom arose.🔽Intelligence arose.

analyzed: prajñā udapādi
translated: Insight arose.

analyzed: ālokaḥ prādurbabhūva
translated: Light appeared.

analyzed: kasmin asati jarā maraṇam na bhavati
translated: When what does not exist does old age and death not exist?

analyzed: kasya vā nirodhāt jarā maraṇa nirodhaḥ iti
translated: Or, due to the cessation of what does old age and death cease?

analyzed: tasya etat abhūt jātyām asatyām jarā maraṇam na bhavati
translated: It occurred to him: When birth does not exist, old age and death do not occur.

analyzed: jāti nirodhāt jarā maraṇa nirodhaḥ
translated: Due to the cessation of birth, old age and death cease.

original: atha bodhisattvasya punaretadabhavat kasminnasati jātirna bhavati /
analyzed: atha bodhisattvasya punar etat abhavat kasmin asati jātiḥ na bhavati
translated: Then it occurred to the Bodhisattva again: When what does not exist do births not occur?

analyzed: kasya vā nirodhāt jāti nirodhaḥ
translated: Or, due to the cessation of what do births cease?

analyzed: tasya etat abhavat bhave sati jātiḥ na bhavati
translated: It occurred to him: When becoming does not exist, births do not occur.

analyzed: bhava nirodhāt jāti nirodhaḥ
translated: Due to the cessation of becoming, births cease.

original: atha bodhisattvasya punarapyetadabhavat kasminnasati vistareṇa yāvatsaṃskārā na bhavanti /
analyzed: atha bodhisattvasya punar api etat abhavat kasmin asati vistareṇa yāvat saṃskārāḥ na bhavanti
translated: Then it occurred to the Bodhisattva again: When what does not exist do formations not occur?

analyzed: kasya vā nirodhāt saṃskāra nirodhaḥ
translated: Or, due to the cessation of what do formations cease?

original: tasyaitadabhavat avidyāyāṃ satyāṃ saṃskārā na bhavanti /
analyzed: tasya etat abhavat avidyāyām satyām saṃskārāḥ na bhavanti
translated: It occurred to him: When ignorance exists, formations do not occur.

analyzed: avidyā nirodhāt saṃskāra nirodhaḥ
translated: Due to the cessation of ignorance, formations cease.

analyzed: saṃskāra nirodhāt vijñāna nirodhaḥ yāvat jāti nirodhāt jarā maraṇa śoka parideva duḥkha daurmanasya upāyāsāḥ nirudhyante
translated: Due to the cessation of formations, the cessation of consciousness... up to... Due to the cessation of birth, the cessation of old age, death, grief, lamentation, pain, sorrow, and despair occur.

original: evamasya kevalasya mahato duḥkhaskandhasya nirodho bhavatīti //
analyzed: evam asya kevalasya mahataḥ duḥkha skandhasya nirodhaḥ bhavati iti
translated: Thus there is the cessation of this entire great mass of suffering.

original: iti hi bhikṣavo bodhisattvasya pūrvamaśruteṣu dharmeṣu yoniśomanasikārādbahulīkārājjñānamudapādi /🔽cakṣurudapādi vidyodapadi /
analyzed: iti hi bhikṣavaḥ bodhisattvasya pūrvam aśruteṣu dharmeṣu yoni śomanasikārāt bahulīkārāt jñānam udapādi  cakṣuḥ udapādi vidyā udapadi
translated: Thus, monks, for the Bodhisattva, through proper attention, from hearing the teachings that had not been heard before, knowledge arose.🔽The eye arose, knowledge arose,

analyzed: bhūriḥ udapādi  medhā udapādi
translated: insight arose,🔽understanding arose,

analyzed: prajñā udapādi
translated: wisdom arose,

analyzed: ālokaḥ prādurbabhūva
translated: and light appeared.

original: so 'haṃ bhikṣavastasmin samaye idaṃ duḥkhamiti yathābhūtamajñāsiṣam /🔽ayamāśravasamudayo 'yamāśravanirodhaḥ iyamāśravanirodhagāminī pratipaditi yathābhūtamajñāsiṣam /
analyzed: saḥ ham bhikṣavaḥ tasmin samaye idam duḥkham iti yathābhūtam ajñāsiṣam  ayam āśrava samudayaḥ yam āśrava nirodhaḥ iyam āśrava nirodha gāminī pratipad iti yathābhūtam ajñāsiṣam
translated: Monks, at that time I knew as it really is: 'This is suffering.'🔽I knew as it really is: 'This is the arising of suffering,' 'This is the cessation of suffering,' 'This is the path leading to the cessation of suffering.'

analyzed: kāma āśravaḥ yam bhava āśravaḥ yam avidyā āśravaḥ yam dṛṣṭi āśravaḥ
translated: This is the defilement of sensual desire, this is the arising of the defilement of sensual desire, this is the cessation of the defilement of sensual desire, this is the path leading to the cessation of the defilement of sensual desire.

analyzed: iha āśravāḥ niravaśeṣataḥ nirudhyante
translated: Here, the defilements cease without remainder.

analyzed: iha āśravaḥ niravaśeṣam an ābhāsam astam gacchati iti
translated: Here, the defilements cease without remainder, without appearance.

analyzed: iyam avidyā ayam avidyā samudayaḥ yam avidyā nirodhaḥ iyam avidyā nirodha gāminī pratipad iti yathābhūtam ajñāsiṣam
translated: This is ignorance, this is the arising of ignorance, this is the cessation of ignorance, this is the path leading to the cessation of ignorance.

analyzed: iha avidyā a pariśeṣam an ābhāsam astam gacchati iti peyālam
translated: Here, ignorance ceases without remainder, without appearance.

original: amī saṃskārā ayaṃ saṃskārasamudayo 'yaṃ saṃskāranirodha iyaṃ saṃskāranirodhagāminī pratipaditi yathābhūtamajñāsiṣam /
analyzed: amī saṃskārāḥ ayam saṃskāra samudayaḥ yam saṃskāra nirodhaḥ iyam saṃskāra nirodha gāminī pratipad iti yathābhūtam ajñāsiṣam
translated: I knew as it really is: These are the formative factors, this is the origin of the formative factors, this is the cessation of the formative factors, this is the practice leading to the cessation of the formative factors.

original: idaṃ vijñānamayaṃ vijñānasamudayo 'yaṃ vijñānanirodha iyaṃ vijñānanirodhagāminī pratipaditi yathābhūtamajñāsiṣam /
analyzed: idam vijñānam ayam vijñāna samudayaḥ yam vijñāna nirodhaḥ iyam vijñāna nirodha gāminī pratipad iti yathābhūtam ajñāsiṣam
translated: I knew as it really is: This is consciousness, this is the origin of consciousness, this is the cessation of consciousness, this is the practice leading to the cessation of consciousness.

original: idaṃ nāmarūpamayaṃ nāmarūpasamudayo 'yaṃ nāmarūpanirodhaḥ iyaṃ nāmarūpanirodhagāminī Vaidya 🔽pratipaditi yathābhūtamajñāsiṣam /🔽idaṃ ṣaḍāyatanamayaṃ ṣaḍāyatanasamudayo 'yaṃ ṣaḍāyatananirodhaḥ iyaṃ ṣaḍāyatananirodhagāminīṃ pratipaditi yathābhūtamajñāsiṣam /
analyzed: idam nāma rūpam ayam nāma rūpa samudayaḥ yam nāma rūpa nirodhaḥ iyam nāma rūpa nirodha gāminī vaidya  pratipad iti yathābhūtam ajñāsiṣam  idam ṣaṣ āyatana mayam ṣaṣ āyatana samudayaḥ yam ṣaṣ āyatana nirodhaḥ iyam ṣaṣ āyatana nirodha gāminīm pratipad iti yathābhūtam ajñāsiṣam
translated: I knew as it really is: This is name-and-form, this is the origin of name-and-form, this is the cessation of name-and-form, this is the practice leading to the cessation of name-and-form.🔽I knew as it really is: This is the six sense bases, this is the origin of the six sense bases, this is the cessation of the six sense bases, this is the practice leading to the cessation of the six sense bases.

original: ayaṃ sparśo 'yaṃ spaśasamudayo 'yaṃ sparśanirodhaḥ iyaṃ sparśanirodhagāminī pratipaditi yathābhūtamajñāsiṣam /
analyzed: ayam sparśaḥ yam spaśa samudayaḥ yam sparśa nirodhaḥ iyam sparśa nirodha gāminī pratipad iti yathābhūtam ajñāsiṣam
translated: I knew as it really is: This is contact, this is the origin of contact, this is the cessation of contact, this is the practice leading to the cessation of contact.

original: iyaṃ vedanā ayaṃ vedanāsamudayo 'yaṃ vedanānirodha iyaṃ vedanānirodhagāminī pratipaditi yathābhūtamajñāsiṣam /🔽iyaṃ tṛṣṇā ayaṃ tṛṣṇāsamudayo 'yaṃ tṛṣṇānirodhaḥ iyaṃ tṛṣṇānirodhagāminī pratipaditi yathābhūtamajñāsiṣam /
analyzed: iyam vedanā ayam vedanā samudayaḥ yam vedanā nirodhaḥ iyam vedanā nirodha gāminī pratipad iti yathābhūtam ajñāsiṣam  iyam tṛṣṇā ayam tṛṣṇā samudayaḥ yam tṛṣṇā nirodhaḥ iyam tṛṣṇā nirodha gāminī pratipad iti yathābhūtam ajñāsiṣam
translated: This is feeling, this is the arising of feeling, this is the cessation of feeling, this is the practice that leads to the cessation of feeling—I knew as it really is.🔽This is craving, this is the arising of craving, this is the cessation of craving, this is the practice that leads to the cessation of craving—I knew as it really is.

original: idamupādānamayamupādānasamudayo 'yamupādānanirodhaḥ iyamupādānanirodhagāminī pratipaditi yathābhūtamajñāsiṣam /🔽ayaṃ bhavo 'yaṃ bhavasamudayo 'yaṃ bhavanirodhaḥ iyaṃ bhavanirodhagāminī pratipaditi yathābhūtamajñāsiṣam /🔽iyaṃ jātirayaṃ jātisamudayo 'yaṃ jātinirodhaḥ iyaṃ jātinirodhagāminī pratipaditi yathābhūtamajñāsiṣam /
analyzed: idam upādānam ayam upādāna samudayaḥ yam upādāna nirodhaḥ iyam upādāna nirodha gāminī pratipad iti yathābhūtam ajñāsiṣam  ayam bhavaḥ yam bhava samudayaḥ yam bhava nirodhaḥ iyam bhava nirodha gāminī pratipad iti yathābhūtam ajñāsiṣam  iyam jātiḥ ayam jāti samudayaḥ yam jāti nirodhaḥ iyam jāti nirodha gāminī pratipad iti yathābhūtam ajñāsiṣam
