translated: This is grasping, this is the arising of grasping, this is the cessation of grasping, this is the practice that leads to the cessation of grasping—I knew as it really is.🔽This is becoming, this is the arising of becoming, this is the cessation of becoming, this is the practice that leads to the cessation of becoming—I knew as it really is.🔽This is birth, this is the arising of birth, this is the cessation of birth, this is the practice that leads to the cessation of birth—I knew as it really is.

original: iyaṃ jarā ayaṃ jarāsamudayo 'yaṃ jarānirodhaḥ iyaṃ jarānirodhagāminī pratipaditi yathābhūtamajñāsiṣam /
analyzed: iyam jarā ayam jarā samudayaḥ yam jarā nirodhaḥ iyam jarā nirodha gāminī pratipad iti yathābhūtam ajñāsiṣam
translated: This is old age, this is the arising of old age, this is the cessation of old age, this is the practice that leads to the cessation of old age—I knew as it really is.

original: idaṃ maraṇamayaṃ maraṇasamudayo 'yaṃ maraṇanirodhaḥ iyaṃ maraṇanirodhagāminī pratipaditi yathābhūtamajñāsiṣam /
analyzed: idam maraṇam ayam maraṇa samudayaḥ yam maraṇa nirodhaḥ iyam maraṇa nirodha gāminī pratipad iti yathābhūtam ajñāsiṣam
translated: This is death, this is the arising of death, this is the cessation of death, this is the path leading to the cessation of death, as it really is, I understood.

analyzed: ime śoka parideva duḥkha daurmanasya upāyāsāḥ
translated: These are sorrow, lamentation, pain, grief, and despair.

original: evamasya kevalasya mahato duḥkhaskandhasya samudayo bhavati yāvannirodho bhavatīti yathābhūtamajñāsiṣam /
analyzed: evam asya kevalasya mahataḥ duḥkha skandhasya samudayaḥ bhavati yāvat nirodhaḥ bhavati iti yathābhūtam ajñāsiṣam
translated: Thus there is the arising of this whole great mass of suffering, up to the cessation of this whole great mass of suffering, as it really is, I understood.

original: idaṃ duḥkhamayaṃ duḥkhasamudayo 'yaṃ duḥkhanirodhaḥ iyaṃ duḥkhanirodhagāminī pratipaditi yathābhūtamajñāsiṣam //
analyzed: idam duḥkham ayam duḥkha samudayaḥ yam duḥkha nirodhaḥ iyam duḥkha nirodha gāminī pratipad iti yathābhūtam ajñāsiṣam
translated: This is suffering, this is the arising of suffering, this is the cessation of suffering, this is the path leading to the cessation of suffering, as it really is, I understood.🔽Thus, monks, in the last watch of the night, at the time of dawn, the Bodhisattva, having attained the five superknowledges,

analyzed: evam khalu bhikṣavaḥ bodhisattvena rātryām paścime yāme nandīmukhyām  rātryau yat kiṃcid puruṣeṇa sat puruṣeṇa ati puruṣeṇa mahā puruṣeṇa puruṣa ṛṣabheṇa puruṣa nāgena
translated: having attained the six superknowledges, having attained the seven superknowledges, having attained the eight superknowledges, having attained the nine superknowledges, having attained the ten superknowledges,

analyzed: puruṣapuṇḍarīkeṇa puruṣadhaureyeṇa anuttareṇa puruṣa damya sārathinā evaṃbhūtena āryeṇa
translated: by the best of men, the bull of a man, the unsurpassed trainer of men to be tamed, the noble one,

original: jñānena jñātavyaṃ boddhavyaṃ prāptavyaṃ draṣṭavyaṃ sākṣātkartavyam /
analyzed: jñānena jñātavyam boddhavyam prāptavyam draṣṭavyam sākṣātkartavyam
translated: what is to be known, understood, attained, seen, and realized by wisdom,

original: sarvaṃ tadekacittekṣaṇasamāyuktayā prajñayā anuttarāṃ samyaksaṃbodhimabhisaṃbudhya traividyādhigatā //
analyzed: sarvam tat eka citta īkṣaṇa samāyuktayā prajñayā anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbudhya traividyā adhigatā
translated: all that he fully awakened to through unsurpassed perfect enlightenment with the wisdom that is combined with the vision of a single mind, and attained the threefold knowledge.

original: tato bhikṣavo devā āhuḥ avakirata mārṣāḥ puṣpāṇi /
analyzed: tatas bhikṣavaḥ devāḥ āhuḥ avakirata mārṣāḥ puṣpāṇi
translated: Then, monks, the gods said, Friends, scatter flowers!

analyzed: abhisaṃbuddhaḥ bhagavān
translated: The Blessed One has attained perfect enlightenment.

original: ye tatra devaputrāḥ pūrvabuddhadarśinastasmin saṃnipatitā āsaṃste 'vocan mā sma tāvanmārṣāḥ puṣpāṇyavakirata yāvattāvadbhagavānnimittaṃ prāduḥkaroti
analyzed: ye tatra deva putrāḥ pūrva buddha darśinaḥ tasmin saṃnipatitāḥ āsan te vocan mā sma tāvat mārṣāḥ puṣpāṇi avakirata yāvat tāvat bhagavān nimittam prāduḥkaroti
translated: But the gods who had seen the previous buddhas and had assembled there said, Friends, do not scatter flowers yet, until the Blessed One manifests a sign.

analyzed: pūrvakāḥ api samyaksaṃbuddhāḥ nimittam akārṣuḥ
translated: For the previous perfect buddhas also manifested a sign.

analyzed: nirmitām abhinirmiṇvanti sma
translated: and manifested emanations.

original: atha khalu bhikṣavastathāgatastān devaputrān vimatiprāptāñjñātvā saptatālamātraṃ vihāyasamabhyudgamya tatrastha idamudānamudānayati sma
analyzed: atha khalu bhikṣavaḥ tathāgataḥ tān deva putrān vimati prāptān jñātvā sapta tāla mātram vihāyasam abhyudgamya tatrasthaḥ idam udānam udānayati sma
translated: Then, monks, the Thus-Gone One, knowing that those gods had doubts, rose up into the sky to the height of seven tālas and, standing there, uttered this exalted utterance:

original: chinnavartmopaśāntarajāḥ śuṣkā āsravā na punaḥ sravanti /
analyzed: chinna vartma upaśānta rajāḥ śuṣkāḥ āsravāḥ na punar sravanti
translated: The dried-up outflows do not flow again.

analyzed: chinne vartmani vartata duḥkhasya eṣaḥ ntaḥ ucyate
translated: When the path is cut, this is said to be the end of suffering.

analyzed: iti
translated: Thus it is.

analyzed: tatas te devaputrāḥ divyaiḥ kusumaiḥ tathāgatam abhyavakiranti sma
translated: Then those gods scattered divine flowers over the Tathagata.

analyzed: tatas jānu mātram divyānām puṣpāṇām saṃstaraḥ bhūt
translated: Then there was a covering of divine flowers up to the knees.

analyzed: iti hi bhikṣavaḥ tathāgate bhisaṃbuddhe vigatam tamaḥ ndhakāram
translated: Thus, monks, when the Tathagata had attained enlightenment, the darkness and gloom had gone.

analyzed: viśodhitā tṛṣṇā
translated: Craving was purified.

analyzed: vivartitā dṛṣṭiḥ  vikṣobhitāḥ kleśāḥ
translated: Views were reversed.🔽Afflictions were agitated.

analyzed: viśāritāḥ śalyāḥ
translated: Thorns were dispersed.

analyzed: muktaḥ granthiḥ  prapātitaḥ māna dhvajaḥ
translated: The knot was untied.🔽The banner of pride was overthrown.

analyzed: ucchrepitaḥ dharmadhvajaḥ vaidya
translated: The banner of the Dharma was raised.

analyzed: uddhāṭitāḥ anuśayāḥ
translated: Latent tendencies were opened up.

analyzed: jñātā dharma tathatā
translated: The suchness of phenomena was known.

analyzed: avabuddhā bhūtakoṭiḥ
translated: The peak of existence was realized.

analyzed: parijñātaḥ dharmadhātuḥ
translated: The dharma realm was fully known.

analyzed: vyavasthāpitaḥ sattvadhātuḥ  saṃvarṇitaḥ samyaktva niyataḥ rāśiḥ
translated: The realm of beings was established.🔽The class of those destined for complete enlightenment was praised.

analyzed: vivarṇitaḥ mithyātva niyataḥ rāśiḥ
translated: The class destined for wrongness was disparaged.

analyzed: parigṛhītaḥ niyata rāśiḥ
translated: The undetermined class was accepted.

analyzed: vyavasthāpitāni sattva indriyāṇi
translated: The faculties of beings were established.

analyzed: parijñātāḥ sattva caritāḥ
translated: The conduct of beings is fully known.

analyzed: avabuddhā sattva vyādhiḥ
translated: The disease of beings is understood.

analyzed: sattva samutthāna siddhaḥ mṛta bhaiṣaja prayogaḥ
translated: The application of the medicine of immortality is accomplished for the arising of beings.

original: utpanno vaidyarājaḥ pramocakaḥ sarvaduḥkhebhyaḥ pratiṣṭhāpako nirvāṇasukhe /
analyzed: utpannaḥ vaidya rājaḥ pramocakaḥ sarva duḥkhebhyaḥ pratiṣṭhāpakaḥ nirvāṇa sukhe
translated: The king of physicians has arisen, the liberator from all sufferings, the one who establishes in the bliss of nirvana.

analyzed: niṣaṇṇaḥ tathāgatagarbhe tathāgata mahā dharmarāja āsane
translated: He is seated in the womb of the Tathagata, on the great Dharma throne of the Tathagata, the king.

analyzed: sarvaḥ ābaddhaḥ vimukti pakṣaḥ
translated: The entire side of liberation is bound.

analyzed: praviṣṭaḥ sarvajña tā nagaram samavasṛtam sarva buddhaiḥ
translated: He has entered the city of omniscience, and has united with all Buddhas.

analyzed: a saṃbhinnaḥ dharmadhātu prasara anubodheḥ
translated: He is undivided in the realization of the spread of the dharma realm.

original: prathame saptāhe bhikṣavastathāgatastasminneva bodhimaṇḍe niṣaṇṇo 'sthāt iha mayā 'nuttarāṃ samyaksaṃbodhimabhisaṃbuddhaḥ /
analyzed: prathame saptāhe bhikṣavaḥ tathāgataḥ tasmin eva bodhimaṇḍe niṣaṇṇaḥ sthāt iha mayā nuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbuddhaḥ
translated: For the first seven days, monks, the Tathagata remained seated at the very seat of enlightenment, thinking, Here I have attained supreme perfect enlightenment.

analyzed: mayā an avara agrasya jāti jarā maraṇa duḥkhasya antaḥ kṛtaḥ iti
translated: Here I have put an end to the suffering of birth, old age, and death, which has no known beginning.

original: samanantaraprāpte khalu punarbhikṣavo bodhisattvena sarvajñatve atha tatkṣaṇameva
analyzed: samanantara prāpte khalu punar bhikṣavaḥ bodhisattvena sarvajñatve atha tad kṣaṇam eva
translated: Monks, as soon as the Bodhisattva attained omniscience, at that very moment,

original: daśasu dikṣu sarvalokadhātuṣu sarvasattvāstatkṣaṇaṃ tallavaṃ tanmuhūrtaṃ parasukhasamarpitā abhuvan /
analyzed: daśasu dikṣu sarva lokadhātuṣu sarva sattvāḥ tad kṣaṇam tad lavam tad muhūrtam para sukha samarpitāḥ abhuvan
translated: At that moment, that instant, that second, all sentient beings in all the world systems in the ten directions were filled with the highest bliss.

analyzed: sarva lokadhātavaḥ ca mahatā avabhāsena avabhāsyantaḥ
translated: And all the world systems were illuminated with a great light.

original: yā 'pi tā lokāntarikā aghā aghasphuṭā andhakārā iti pūrvavat /
analyzed: yāḥ pi tāḥ loka āntarikāḥ aghāḥ agha sphuṭāḥ andhakārāḥ iti pūrvavat
translated: Even those intermundane spaces that are dark, that are pitch black, that are without illumination, that are without light, that are without moonlight and sunlight,🔽in those places beings were able to see each other and said, Oh! There are other beings here! Oh! There are other beings here!

original: ṣaḍvikāraṃ ca daśasu dikṣu sarvalokadhātavo 'kampat prākampat saṃprākampat /
analyzed: ṣaṣ vikāram ca daśasu dikṣu sarva lokadhātavaḥ kampat prākampat saṃprākampat
translated: And the world systems in the ten directions shook in six ways, trembled, trembled strongly, and trembled intensely;

analyzed: avedhat prāvedhat saṃprāvedhat  acalat prācalat saṃprācalat
translated: they quivered, quivered strongly, and quivered intensely;🔽they quaked, quaked strongly, and quaked intensely;

analyzed: akṣubhyat prākṣubhyat saṃprākṣubhyat  araṇat prāraṇat saṃprāraṇat
translated: they shuddered, shuddered strongly, and shuddered intensely;🔽they roared, roared strongly, and roared intensely;

analyzed: agarjat prāgarjat saṃprāgarjat
translated: they crashed, crashed strongly, and crashed intensely.

analyzed: sarva buddhāḥ ca tathāgatāya abhisaṃbuddhāya sādhukāram dadanti sma
translated: And all the Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, gave their approval to the Thus-Gone One's full awakening.

analyzed: dharma ācchādān ca saṃpreṣayanti sma
translated: And they sent forth Dharma robes.

analyzed: yaiḥ dharma ācchādaiḥ ayam tri sāhasra mahā sāhasra lokadhātuḥ aneka ratna saṃchannaḥ bhūt
translated: By those Dharma robes, this great trichiliocosm became covered with many jewels.

original: tebhyaśca ratnachatrebhyaḥ evaṃrūpā raśmijālā niścaranti sma /
analyzed: tebhyaḥ ca ratna chatrebhyaḥ evaṃrūpāḥ raśmi jālāḥ niścaranti sma
translated: And from those jeweled parasols, such a net of light rays issued forth.

analyzed: yaiḥ daśasu dikṣu aprameya asaṃkhyeyāḥ lokadhātavaḥ vabhāsyante
translated: By which the immeasurable and innumerable world systems in the ten directions are illuminated.

original: daśasu dikṣu bodhisattvāśca devāputrāścanandaśabdaṃ niścārayāmāsuḥ utpannaḥ sattvapaṇḍitaḥ /
analyzed: daśasu dikṣu bodhisattvāḥ ca devāputrāḥ cananda śabdam niścārayāmāsuḥ utpannaḥ sattva paṇḍitaḥ
translated: The Bodhisattvas and sons of gods in the ten directions uttered the sound of joy, saying: The wise one among beings has appeared.

analyzed: padmaḥ jñāna sarasi saṃbhūtaḥ na upaliptaḥ loka dharmaiḥ
translated: The lotus has arisen in the lake of wisdom, unstained by worldly dharmas.

analyzed: samantataḥ mahā karuṇā megham sphuritvā dharmadhātu bhavanam varṣayiṣyati
translated: Having caused the cloud of great compassion to spread in all directions, he will rain down on the abode of the dharmadhatu.

original: dharmavarṣavinaye janabhaiṣajāṅkuraprarohaṇaṃ sarvakuśalamūlabījānāṃ vivardhanaṃ śraddhāṅkurāṇāṃ dātā vimuktiphalānām //
analyzed: dharma varṣa vinaye jana bhaiṣaja aṅkura prarohaṇam sarva kuśala mūla bījānām vivardhanam śraddhā aṅkurāṇām dātā vimukti phalānām
translated: He will give the rain of Dharma, the medicine for the people in the discipline, the sprouting and growth of all the seeds of wholesome roots, the increase of the sprouts of faith, and the fruit of liberation.

analyzed: tatra idam ucyate
translated: Regarding this, it is said:

original: māraṃ vijitya sabalaṃ sa hi puruṣasiṃho dhyānāmukhaṃ abhimukhaṃ abhito 'pi śāstā /
analyzed: māram vijitya sa balam sa hi puruṣa siṃhaḥ dhyāna āmukham abhimukham abhitas pi śāstā
translated: Having conquered Mara and his army, he is indeed a lion among men, the teacher who faces the door of meditation and the Dharma.

original: traividyatā daśabalena yadā hi prāptā saṃkampitā daśa diśo bahukṣatrakoṭyaḥ // / //
analyzed: traividya tā daśa balena yadā hi prāptā saṃkampitāḥ daśa diśaḥ bahu kṣatra koṭyaḥ
translated: When the one with the ten powers attained the state of being one with the three knowledges, many millions of worlds in the ten directions trembled.

original: ye bodhisattva puri āgata dharmakāmā caraṇau nipatya iti bhāṣiṣu māsi klānto /
analyzed: ye bodhisattva puri āgata dharma kāmā caraṇau nipatya iti bhāṣiṣu
translated: Those Bodhisattvas who in the past came with a desire for the Dharma, having fallen at his feet, said: Do not be weary.

original: pratyakṣa asmi camu yādṛśikā subhīmā sā prajñapuṇyabalavīryabalena bhagnā // / //
analyzed: asmi camu yādṛśikā su bhīmā sā prajña puṇya bala vīrya balena bhagnā
translated: The army of demons, which was so terrifying, has been destroyed by the power of your wisdom, merit, strength, and diligence.

original: buddhaiśca kṣetranayutaiḥ prahitāni chatrā sādho mahāpuruṣa dharṣita mārasenām /
analyzed: buddhaiḥ ca kṣetra nayutaiḥ prahitāni sādho mahāpuruṣa dharṣita māra senām
translated: The parasols sent by the buddhas in millions of realms, O virtuous one, O great being, have crushed the army of Mara.

analyzed: vaidya
translated: Physician

original: prāptaṃ tvayā padavaraṃ amṛtaṃ viśokaṃ saddharmavṛṣṭi tribhave abhivarṣa śīghram // / //
analyzed: prāptam tvayā pada varam amṛtam viśokam saddharma vṛṣṭi tri bhave abhivarṣa śīghram
translated: You have attained the supreme state of immortality, free from sorrow. Quickly rain down the Dharma rain upon the three realms.

original: bāhuṃ prasārya daśadikṣu ca sattvasārā ābhāṣayiṃsu kalaviṅkarutāya vācā /
analyzed: bāhum prasārya daśa dikṣu ca sattva sārāḥ ābhāṣayiṃsu kalaviṅka rutāya vācā
translated: Stretching out their arms in the ten directions, the essence of beings, they spoke with a voice like the kalaviṅka bird,

original: bodhiryathāmanugatā bhavatā viśuddhā tulyaḥ samo 'si yatha sarpiṇi sarpimaṇḍaiḥ // / //
analyzed: bodhiḥ yathām anugatā bhavatā viśuddhā tulyaḥ samaḥ si sarpiṇi
translated: As you have attained enlightenment, may we be purified. You are equal and the same as clarified butter and ghee.

original: atha khalu bhikṣavaḥ kāmāvacarā apsaraso bodhimaṇḍaniṣaṇṇaṃ tathāgataṃ prāptābhijñaṃ🔽paripūrṇasaṃkalpaṃ vijitasaṃgrāmaṃ nirjitamārapratyarthikamucchritachatradhvajapatākaṃ
analyzed: atha khalu bhikṣavaḥ kāmāvacarāḥ apsarasaḥ bodhimaṇḍa niṣaṇṇam tathāgatam prāpta abhijñam  paripūrṇa saṃkalpam vijita saṃgrāmam nirjita māra pratyarthikam ucchrita chatra dhvaja patākam
translated: Then, monks, the celestial nymphs of the desire realm, to the Thus-Gone One seated at the seat of awakening, who had attained higher knowledge,🔽whose intentions were fulfilled, who had won the battle, who had defeated Mara and his adversaries, who had raised parasols, banners, and flags,

original: śūraṃ jayodgataṃ puruṣaṃ mahāpuruṣaṃ vaidyottamaṃ mahāśalyahartāraṃ siṃhaṃ vigatabhayalomaharṣaṃ
analyzed: śūram jaya udgatam puruṣam mahā puruṣam vaidya uttamam mahā śalya hartāram siṃham vigata bhaya loma harṣam
translated: the hero, the victorious one, the man, the great man, the supreme physician, the great remover of darts, the lion, free from fear and horripilation,

original: nāgaṃ sudāntacittanirmalaṃ trimalaviprahīnaṃ vaidyakaṃ traividyatāmanuprāptaṃ pāragaṃ
analyzed: nāgam su dānta citta nirmalam tri mala viprahīnam vaidyakam traividya tām anuprāptam pāragam
translated: The serpent with a well-tamed and pure mind, free from the three defilements, the physician who has attained the three knowledges and the other shore,

analyzed: catur ogha uttīrṇam kṣatriyam eka ratna chatra dhāriṇam trailokya brāhmaṇam vāhita pāpa karmāṇam
translated: Who has crossed the four floods, the kṣatriya who holds the single jewel parasol, the brāhmaṇa of the three worlds, whose evil deeds have been destroyed,

original: bhikṣuṃ bhinnavidyāṇḍakoṣaṃ śramaṇaṃ sarvasaṅgasamatikrāntaṃ śrotriyaṃ niḥsṛtakleśaṃ
analyzed: bhikṣum bhinnavidyā aṇḍakoṣam śramaṇam sarva saṅga samatikrāntam śrotriyam niḥsṛta kleśam
translated: The bhikṣu whose egg of knowledge is broken, the śramaṇa who has transcended all attachments, the learned one whose afflictions have been eradicated,

analyzed: śūram aprapātita dhvajam balīyāṃsam daśa bala dhāriṇam ratna ākaram iva sarva dharma ratna saṃpūrṇam
translated: The hero whose banner has not been overthrown, the powerful one who bears the ten powers, who is like an ocean full of all the jewels of the Dharma,

analyzed: viditvā bodhimaṇḍa abhimukhāḥ tathāgatam ābhiḥ gāthābhiḥ abhyastāviṣuḥ
translated: Having recognized him, they faced the seat of enlightenment and praised the Tathāgata with these verses:

original: eṣa drumarājamūle abhijitya mārasainyaṃ sthitu meruvadaprakampyo nirbhīrapralāpī /🔽anekabahukalpakoṭyo dānadamasaṃyamena samudānayaṃ prabodhi teneṣa śobhate 'dya // / //
analyzed: eṣa drumarāja mūle abhijitya māra sainyam meru vat aprakampyaḥ nirbhīra pralāpī  aneka bahu kalpa koṭyaḥ dāna dama saṃyamena samudānayam prabodhi tena iṣa śobhate
translated: Here, at the foot of the king of trees, having conquered Māra's army, he stands unshakable like Mount Meru, fearless and eloquent.🔽For many millions of eons, he has accumulated [merit] through generosity, self-control, and restraint, and thus has attained enlightenment. Therefore, he shines forth today.

original: anena bahukalpakoṭyaḥ śīlavratātapobhi jihmikṛta śakra brahmā bodhivara eṣatā hi /
analyzed: anena bahu kalpa koṭyaḥ śīla vrata ā tapobhi śakra brahmā bodhi varaḥ hi
translated: For many millions of eons, he has obscured Śakra and Brahmā through his morality, austerities, and vows, seeking the supreme enlightenment.

original: anena bahukalpakoṭyaḥ kṣāntibalavarmitena adhivāsitā dukhāni tena prabha svarṇavarṇā // / //
analyzed: anena bahu kalpa koṭyaḥ kṣānti bala varmitena adhivāsitāḥ dukhāni tena prabha svarṇa varṇā
translated: By him, for many millions of eons, with the power of patience as armor, sufferings were endured, and therefore he has the radiance of golden color.

original: anena bahukalpakoṭyo vīryabalavikrameṇa parāṅmukhāṃ kṛtāsyā tena māra jita senā /
analyzed: anena bahu kalpa koṭyaḥ vīrya bala vikrameṇa parāṅmukhām kṛta āsyā tena senā
translated: By him, for many millions of eons, with the power and strength of vigor, the army of Mara was turned away, and therefore he has conquered Mara's army.

original: anena bahukalpakoṭyo dhyānā abhijñajñānaiḥ saṃpūjitā munīndrastenaiva pūjito 'dya // / //
analyzed: anena bahu kalpa koṭyaḥ dhyānāḥ abhijña jñānaiḥ saṃpūjitāḥ muni indraḥ tena eva pūjitaḥ
translated: By him, for many millions of eons, with the dhyanas, higher knowledges, and wisdom, the Lord of Sages was fully worshipped, and therefore he is worshipped even now.

original: anena bahukalpakoṭyaḥ prajñāśratasaṃcayena pragṛhīta sattvakoṭyastena laghu bodhi prāptā /
analyzed: anena bahu kalpa koṭyaḥ prajñā śrata saṃcayena sattva koṭyaḥ tena laghu bodhi prāptā
translated: By him, for many millions of eons, with the accumulation of wisdom and learning, millions of beings were taken hold of, and therefore enlightenment was quickly attained by him.

original: anena jitu skandhamārastatha mṛtyu kleśamāraḥ anena jitu devaputramārastenāsya nāsti śokaḥ // / //
analyzed: anena skandha māraḥ mṛtyu kleśa māraḥ anena devaputra māraḥ tena asya na asti śokaḥ
translated: By him, the Mara of the aggregates was conquered, and likewise the Mara of death and afflictions, by him the Mara of the sons of gods was conquered, and therefore he has no sorrow.

analyzed: eṣaḥ hi devadevaḥ devaiḥ api pūjanīyaḥ
translated: For he is the god of gods, to be worshipped even by the gods,
worthy of worship in the three worlds,

analyzed: kṣetram amṛtā phalasya dātā  vaidya
translated: a field of merit for those seeking merit, a giver of the fruit of immortality.

analyzed: eṣa vara dakṣiṇīyaḥ utpātu dakṣiṇāhi
translated: He is the supreme recipient of offerings, arisen from offerings.

original: nāstyuttarasya nāśo yā ca varabodhi labdhā // / //
analyzed: na asti uttarasya nāśaḥ yā ca vara bodhi labdhā
translated: There is no destruction of the northern [continent], and the supreme enlightenment that was attained.

original: ūrṇā virājate 'sya spharati bahukṣetrakoṭyo jihmikṛta candrasūryā andhakārālokaprāptā /
analyzed: ūrṇā virājate sya spharati bahu kṣetra koṭyaḥ candra sūryā andhakāra āloka prāptā
translated: His urna shines and spreads to many millions of buddha-fields, outshining the moon and sun, bringing light to darkness.

original: eva hi surūparūpo vararūpa sādhurūpo varalakṣaṇo hitaiṣī trailokyapūjanīyaḥ // / //
analyzed: eva hi surūpa rūpaḥ vara rūpa sādhu rūpaḥ vara lakṣaṇaḥ hita eṣī trailokya pūjanīyaḥ
translated: Thus he is of beautiful form, with excellent form, good form, with excellent marks, wishing for benefit, to be worshipped in the three worlds.

original: eṣa suviśuddhanetro bahu prekṣate svayaṃbhūḥ kṣatrā ca sattvakāyā cittāni cetanā ca /
analyzed: eṣa su viśuddha netraḥ bahu prekṣate svayaṃbhūḥ kṣatrā ca sattva kāyā cittāni cetanā ca
translated: He has very pure eyes, the self-arisen one sees much, the realms and the assemblies of beings, and their thoughts and intentions.

original: eṣa suviśuddhaśrotraḥ śṛṇute anantaśabdāṃ divyāṃśca mānuṣāṃśca jinaśabdadharmaśabdāṃ // / //
analyzed: eṣa su viśuddha śrotraḥ śṛṇute ananta śabdām divyān ca mānuṣān ca jina śabda dharma śabdām
translated: He has very pure ears, he hears infinite sounds, divine and human, the sounds of the Victorious One and the Dharma.

analyzed: eṣa prabhūta jihvaḥ kalaviṅka mañju ghoṣa
translated: He has a large tongue, with a voice as sweet as a kalaviṅka bird,

original: ḥ śroṣyāma asya dharmaṃ amṛtaṃ praśāntagāmim /
analyzed: ḥ śroṣyāma asya dharmam amṛtam praśānta gāmim
translated: we will hear his nectar-like Dharma, which leads to peace.

original: dṛṣṭvā ca mārasainyaṃ na kṣubhyate mano 'sya
analyzed: dṛṣṭvā ca māra sainyam na kṣubhyate
translated: Seeing Māra's army, his mind does not become agitated,

original: puna dṛṣṭgha devasaṃghāṃ na ca harṣate sumedhā // / //
analyzed: punar deva saṃghām na ca harṣate sumedhā
translated: and seeing the assemblies of gods, the wise one is not delighted.

analyzed: śastraiḥ na ca api bāṇaiḥ jitaḥ ena māra senā
translated: He conquered Māra's army with weapons and arrows,

original: satyavratātapobhi jitu ena duṣṭamallaḥ /🔽calito na cāsanā na ca kāyu vedhino 'sya
analyzed: ena duṣṭamallaḥ  calitaḥ na ca āsanā na ca
translated: and with the truth, vows, and austerities, he defeated the evil wrestler.🔽He did not move from his seat, nor was his body pierced,

original: na ca snehu nāpi doṣastadanantare abhūvan // / //
analyzed: na ca snehu na api doṣaḥ tad anantare abhūvan
translated: and immediately afterwards, there was neither attachment nor aversion.

original: lābhā sulabdha teṣāṃ maruṇāṃ narāṇa caiva
analyzed: teṣām maruṇām narāṇa ca eva
translated: “Those gods and humans have gained a great gain

original: ye tubhya dharma śrutvā pratipattimeṣyatī hi /🔽yatpuṇya tvāṃ stavitvā jina puṇyatejarāśe
analyzed: ye tubhya dharma śrutvā hi  yat puṇya tvām stavitvā jina puṇya teja rāśe
translated: Those gods and humans who, having heard the Dharma from you, will engage in practice, have gained a great gain.

original: sarve bhavema kṣipraṃ yatha tvaṃ manuṣyacandraḥ // / //
analyzed: sarve bhavema kṣipram tvam manuṣya candraḥ
translated: Having praised you, O Victorious One, a mass of merit and radiance, may we all quickly become like you, O Moon among Men.

original: buddhitva bodhi puruṣarṣabhanāyakena saṃkampya kṣatranayutāni vijitya māram /
analyzed: buddhi tva bodhi puruṣa ṛṣabha nāyakena saṃkampya kṣatra nayutāni vijitya māram
translated: Having attained enlightenment, O Leader, bull among men, having shaken the millions of warriors and conquered Mara,

original: brahmasvareṇa kalaviṅkarutasvareṇa prathamena gāthā imi bhāṣita nāyakena // / //
analyzed: brahma svareṇa kalaviṅka ruta svareṇa prathamena gāthāḥ bhāṣita nāyakena
translated: with the voice of Brahma, with the voice of the cuckoo, the Leader spoke these first verses.

original: puṇyavipāku sukha sarvaduḥkhāpanetī abhiprāyu sidhyati ca puṇyavato narasya /
analyzed: sidhyati ca puṇyavataḥ narasya
translated: Merit ripens as happiness, it removes all suffering, the wishes of a meritorious person are fulfilled.

analyzed: vaidya
translated: Doctor

original: kṣipraṃ ca bodhi spṛśate vinihatya māraṃ śāntāpatho gacchati ca nirvṛtiśītibhāvam // / //
analyzed: kṣipram ca bodhi spṛśate vinihatya māram śāntā pathaḥ gacchati ca nirvṛti śīti bhāvam
translated: and quickly attains enlightenment, having destroyed Mara, and goes to the peaceful path, to the state of cool nirvana.

original: tasmātka puṇyakaraṇe na bhaveta tṛptaḥ śṛṇvaṃśca dharmamamṛtaṃ bhavi ko vitṛptaḥ /
analyzed: tasmāt kaḥ puṇya karaṇe na bhaveta tṛptaḥ śṛṇvan ca dharmam amṛtam bhavi kaḥ vitṛptaḥ
translated: Therefore, who would not be satisfied in making merit? Who would not be satisfied in listening to the nectar-like Dharma?

original: vijane vane ca viharaṃ bhavi ko vitṛptaḥ kaḥ sattva arthakaraṇe na bhaveddhi tṛptaḥ // / //
analyzed: vijane vane ca kaḥ vitṛptaḥ kaḥ sattva artha karaṇe na bhavet hi tṛptaḥ
translated: Who would not be satisfied in dwelling in a solitary forest? Who would not be satisfied in working for the benefit of beings?

original: pāṇiṃ prasārya samuvāca ca bodhisattvāṃ pūjāṃ kṛtā brajata kṣetra svakasvakāni /
analyzed: pāṇim prasārya samuvāca ca bodhisattvām pūjām kṛtāḥ brajata kṣetra svaka svakāni
translated: Extending his hand, he said to the Bodhisattvas, Go and make offerings in your own buddha-fields.

original: sarve 'bhivandya caraṇau ca tathāgatasya nānāviyūha gata kṣetra svakasvakāni // / //
analyzed: sarve bhivandya caraṇau ca tathāgatasya
translated: All of them bowed at the feet of the Tathagata and went to their own buddha-fields, adorned in various ways.

original: dṛṣṭvā ca tāṃ namucināṃ mahatīmavasthāṃ vikrīḍitāṃ ca sugatasya tathā salīlam /
analyzed: dṛṣṭvā ca tām namucinām mahatīm avasthām vikrīḍitām ca sugatasya tathā sa līlam
translated: Seeing that great state of Namuci and the playful sport of the Sugata,

original: bodhāya cittamatulaṃ praṇidhāya sattvāṃ māraṃ vijitya sabalaṃ amṛtaṃ spṛśema // / //
analyzed: bodhāya cittam atulam praṇidhāya sattvām māram vijitya sa balam amṛtam spṛśema
translated: They generated the incomparable mind of enlightenment for the sake of beings, thinking, Having conquered Mara and his army, we shall attain immortality.

original: abhisaṃbuddhasya bhikṣavastathāgatasya bodhivṛkṣamūle siṃhāsanopaviṣṭasya tasmin kṣaṇe 'prameyāni buddhavikrīḍitānyabhūvan /
analyzed: abhisaṃbuddhasya bhikṣavaḥ tathāgatasya bodhivṛkṣa mūle siṃhāsana upaviṣṭasya tasmin kṣaṇe prameyāni buddha vikrīḍitāni abhūvan
translated: Monks, when the Tathagata had attained perfect enlightenment, while seated on the lion throne at the foot of the Bodhi tree, at that moment there were immeasurable displays of a Buddha's power,

analyzed: yāni na sukaram kalpena api nirdeṣṭum
translated: which are not easily described even in a kalpa.

analyzed: tatra idam ucyate  kara tala sadṛśā abhūt su sthitā medinī iyam vikasita śata patrāḥ ca udgatāḥ raśmi jālaiḥ
translated: Regarding this, it is said:🔽The earth was as level as the palm of a hand, and the Bodhi tree rose up with a net of light rays from its hundred thousand blooming petals.

original: amaraśatasahasrā onamī bodhimaṇḍaṃ imu prathama nimittaṃ siṃhanādena dṛṣṭam // / //
analyzed: amara śata sahasrāḥ nimittam siṃhanādena dṛṣṭam
translated: Hundreds of thousands of immortals bowed to the Bodhi tree. This was the first sign seen from the lion's roar.

original: drumaśatatrisahasro bodhimaṇḍe namante girivara tatha neke śailarājaśca meruḥ /
analyzed: druma śata tri sahasraḥ bodhimaṇḍe namante neke śaila rājaḥ ca meruḥ
translated: Three hundred thousand trees bow to the Bodhi tree, and many excellent mountains, including Mount Meru, the king of mountains.

original: daśabalamadhigamya brahmaśakrā namante idamapi narasiṃhe krīḍitaṃ bodhimaṇḍe // / //
analyzed: daśa balam adhigamya brahma śakrāḥ namante idam api narasiṃhe krīḍitam bodhimaṇḍe
translated: Brahma and Shakra bow to the One of Ten Powers. This is the play of the Lion among Men at the Bodhi tree.

original: raśmiśatasahasrā svośarīrātmabhāvā sphuri jinavara kṣatrā trīṇi śāntā apāyāḥ /
analyzed: raśmi śata sahasrā trīṇi śāntāḥ apāyāḥ
translated: From his own body, a hundred thousand light rays shine forth, illuminating the three realms of the victorious ones, and the lower realms become peaceful.

original: tata kṣaṇasumuhūrte śodhitā cākṣaṇāni na ca khilamadadoṣā bādhiṣū kaṃci sattvam // / //
analyzed: tata kṣaṇa su muhūrte śodhitā ca akṣaṇāni na ca khila mada doṣā sattvam
translated: In that moment, the unfortunate realms are purified, and no one is afflicted by the faults of anger, pride, or hatred.

analyzed: vaidya
translated: Vidy

original: iyamapi narasiṃhasyāsanasthasya krīḍā śaśiravimaṇivahnividyutābhā ca divyā /
analyzed: iyam api narasiṃhasya āsana sthasya krīḍā śaśi ravi maṇi vahni vidyut ābhā ca divyā
translated: This is also the play of the Lion among Men, seated on his throne, with a radiance like the moon, sun, jewels, fire, and lightning.

original: na tapati abhibhūtā bhānuvatyorṇapāśā na ca jagadiha kaścitprekṣate śāstu mūrdham // / //
analyzed: na tapati abhibhūtā bhānuvatyā ūrṇapāśā na ca jagat iha kaścid prekṣate śāstu mūrdham
translated: The radiant rays of light are outshone, and no one in the world can see the top of the Teacher's head.

analyzed: iyam api narasiṃhasya āsana sthasya krīḍā
translated: This is also the play of the Lion among Men, seated on his throne.

analyzed: kara tala spṛśanena ā kampitā ca urvi sarvā
translated: By the touch of his palm, the entire earth trembles.

analyzed: yena namuci senā kṣobhitā tūla bhūtā
translated: By whom the army of Namuci is agitated like cotton,

analyzed: namuci iṣu gṛhītvā medinī vyālikhedya
translated: Namuci, taking up his arrow, scratches the earth.

analyzed: idam api narasiṃhasya āsane krīḍitam bhūt
translated: This too was the play of the Lion among Men on his throne.

analyzed: iti
translated: Thus.

analyzed: start parivarta
translated: Chapter on the Praise

analyzed: vaidya
translated: Vidyā

analyzed: saṃstava parivartaḥ trayoviṃśaḥ
translated: Chapter Twenty-Three: Praise

original: atha khalu śuddhāvāsakāyikā devaputrā bodhimaṇḍaniṣaṇṇaṃ tathāgataṃ pradakṣiṇīkṛtya divyaiścandanacūrṇavarṣairabhyavakīrya ābhiḥ sārūpyābhirgāthābhirabhituṣṭuvuḥ
analyzed: atha khalu śuddhāvāsa kāyikāḥ devaputrāḥ bodhimaṇḍa niṣaṇṇam tathāgatam pradakṣiṇīkṛtya divyaiḥ candana cūrṇa varṣaiḥ abhyavakīrya ābhiḥ sārūpyābhiḥ gāthābhiḥ abhituṣṭuvuḥ
translated: Then the gods of the Pure Abodes, having circumambulated the Thus-Gone One seated at the seat of awakening, having scattered a rain of divine sandalwood powder, praised him with these fitting verses:
The Light of the World has arisen, the Protector of the World, the Illuminator,

analyzed: andha bhūtasya lokasya cakṣuḥ dātā raṇaṃjahaḥ
translated: The Giver of Eyes to the World, which is like a blind man, the Renouncer of Strife.

analyzed: bhavān vijita saṃgrāmaḥ puṇyaiḥ pūrṇa manorathaḥ
translated: You have conquered in battle, your merits have fulfilled your wishes,

analyzed: saṃpūrṇaḥ śukla dharmaiḥ ca jagat tvam tarpayiṣyasi
translated: And you are complete with pure qualities, you will satisfy the world.

analyzed: uttīrṇa paṅkaḥ hi anighaḥ sthale tiṣṭhati gautamaḥ
translated: Gautama has crossed the mire, is unblemished, and stands on dry land,

analyzed: anyām sattvām mahā oghena prodgataḥ tārayiṣyasi
translated: You will deliver other beings who have arisen from the great flood.

analyzed: udgataḥ tvam mahā prājñaḥ lokeṣu apratipudgalaḥ
translated: You have arisen, O greatly wise one, in the worlds there is no one like you.

analyzed: bhavya abhavya mune prajānase vinaye
translated: The Sage who knows the suitable and unsuitable, as the mind is to be disciplined,

original: vande tvāṃ trisahasri adbhutaṃ divi bhuvi mahitam // / //
analyzed: vande tvām tri sahasri adbhutam divi bhuvi mahitam
translated: I praise you, the wondrous one in the three thousand worlds, revered in heaven and on earth.

original: evaṃ khalu bhikṣavaḥ sunirmito devaputraḥ saparivārastathāgatamabhiṣṭutyaikānte 'sthāt prāñjalīkṛtastathāgataṃ namaskurvan //
analyzed: evam khalu bhikṣavaḥ sunirmitaḥ devaputraḥ sa parivāraḥ tathāgatam abhiṣṭutya ekānte sthāt prāñjalīkṛtaḥ tathāgatam namaskurvan
translated: Thus, monks, the god Sunirmāṇa, together with his retinue, having praised the Tathāgata, stood to one side with palms joined in homage to the Tathāgata.

analyzed: vaidya
translated: Vidy

original: atha khalu saṃtuṣito devaputraḥ sārdhaṃ tuṣitakāyikairdevairyena tathāgatastenopasaṃkrāmat /
analyzed: atha khalu saṃtuṣitaḥ deva putraḥ sārdham tuṣita kāyikaiḥ devaiḥ yena tathāgataḥ tena upasaṃkrāmat
translated: Then the god Santuṣita, together with the gods of the Tuṣita realm, approached the Tathāgata.

original: upasaṃkramya mahatā divyavastrajālena bodhimaṇḍaniṣaṇṇaṃ tathāgatamabhisaṃchādya saṃmukhamābhirgāthābhirabhyastauṣīt
analyzed: upasaṃkramya mahatā divya vastra jālena bodhimaṇḍa niṣaṇṇam tathāgatam abhisaṃchādya saṃmukham ābhiḥ gāthābhiḥ abhyastauṣīt
translated: Having approached, he covered the Tathāgata seated at the seat of enlightenment with a great divine net of cloth and praised him with these verses in his presence:

original: tuṣitālayi yadvasitastvaṃ tatra ti deśitu dharma udāro /
analyzed: tuṣita ālayi yat vasitaḥ tvam tatra deśitu dharmaḥ udāraḥ
translated: You who dwelt there in the Tuṣita realm, taught the vast Dharma there,

original: na ca chidyati sā anuśāsti adyapi dharmacarī suraputrā // / //
analyzed: na ca chidyati sā anuśāsti adi api dharma carī sura putrā
translated: And even now, the Dharma practitioners are instructed by it.

original: na ca darśana tṛpti labhāmo dharma śṛṇotu na vindati tṛptim /
analyzed: na ca darśana tṛpti labhāmaḥ dharma śṛṇotu na vindati tṛptim
translated: We do not attain satisfaction in seeing it, nor in hearing the Dharma do we find satisfaction.

original: guṇasāgara lokapradīpā vandima te śirasā manasā ca // / //
analyzed: guṇa sāgara loka pradīpāḥ vandima te śirasā manasā ca
translated: O ocean of qualities, illuminator of the world, we praise you with our heads and minds.

original: tuṣitālaya yaccalitastvaṃ śoṣita akṣaṇa sarvi tadā te /
analyzed: tuṣitālaya yat calitaḥ tvam śoṣita akṣaṇa sarvi tadā te
translated: When you descended from the Tusita realm, all unfavorable conditions were dried up then.

original: yada bodhivaṭe upaviṣṭaḥ sarvajagasya kileśa praśāntāḥ // / //
analyzed: bodhivaṭe upaviṣṭaḥ sarva jagasya kileśa praśāntāḥ
translated: When you sat under the Bodhi tree, the afflictions of the entire world were pacified.

original: yasya kṛtena ca bodhi udārā eṣa ti prāpti jinitvana māram /
analyzed: yasya kṛtena ca bodhi udārā eṣa ti prāpti jinitvana māram
translated: For whose sake was the supreme enlightenment attained? Having conquered Mara, you have reached this.

original: tvā praṇidhī tapasā paripūrṇā kṣipra pravartaya cakramudāram // / //
analyzed: tvā praṇidhī tapasā paripūrṇā kṣipra pravartaya cakram udāram
translated: Your aspirations and austerities are fulfilled. Quickly set in motion the supreme wheel.

original: bahu dikṣiṣu prāṇisahasrā dharmaratā kṣuṇiyāmatha dharmam /
analyzed: bahu dikṣiṣu prāṇi sahasrāḥ dharma ratā kṣuṇiyām atha dharmam
translated: In many directions, thousands of beings delight in the Dharma. We will be destroyed without the Dharma.

original: kṣipra pravartaya cakramudāraṃ mocaya prāṇisahasra bhaveṣu // / //
analyzed: kṣipra pravartaya cakram udāram mocaya prāṇi sahasra bhaveṣu
translated: Quickly set in motion the supreme wheel. Liberate thousands of beings from existence.

original: evaṃ khalu bhikṣavaḥ saṃtuṣito devaputraḥ saparivārastathāgatamabhiṣṭatyaikānte 'sthāt prāñjalīkṛtastathāgataṃ namasyamānaḥ //
analyzed: evam khalu bhikṣavaḥ saṃtuṣitaḥ devaputraḥ sa parivāraḥ tathāgatam abhiṣṭatya ekānte sthāt prāñjalīkṛtaḥ tathāgatam namasyamānaḥ
translated: Thus, monks, the god Santushita, together with his retinue, praised the Tathagata and stood to one side with palms joined in reverence to the Tathagata.

original: atha khalu suyāmadevaputrapramukhāḥ suyāmā devā yena tathāgatastenopasaṃkrāmat /
analyzed: atha khalu suyāma deva putra pramukhāḥ suyāmāḥ devāḥ yena tathāgataḥ tena upasaṃkrāmat
translated: Then the gods of the Heaven of Suyāma, headed by the god Suyāma, approached the Thus-Gone One.

analyzed: upasaṃkramya nānā puṣpa dhūpa gandha mālya vilepanaiḥ bodhimaṇḍa niṣaṇṇam tathāgatam saṃpūjya saṃmukham ābhiḥ sārūpyābhiḥ gāthābhiḥ tuṣṭavuḥ
translated: Having approached, they worshipped the Thus-Gone One seated at the seat of awakening with various flowers, incense, perfumes, garlands, and ointments, and praised him with these fitting verses:

original: sadṛśo 'sti na te kutontare śīla samādhi tathaiva prajñayā /
analyzed: sadṛśaḥ asti na te kutontare śīla samādhi tathā eva prajñayā
translated: There is none equal to you, let alone superior, in morality, concentration, and likewise in wisdom.

analyzed: adhimukti vimukti kovidā śirasā vandima te tathāgatam
translated: Skilled in devotion and liberation, we bow our heads to you, Thus-Gone One.

analyzed: vaidya
translated: Vidy

original: dṛṣṭā sa viyūha śobhanā bodhimaṇḍasmi marubhi yā kṛtā /
analyzed: dṛṣṭā sa viyūha śobhanā marubhi yā kṛtā
translated: We have seen the beautiful array made by the gods at the seat of awakening.

original: na tamarhati anya kaścanā yatha tvaṃ devamanuṣyapūjitaḥ // / //
analyzed: na tam arhati tvam deva manuṣya pūjitaḥ
translated: It does not deserve to be compared to any other, just as you are worshipped by gods and humans.

original: na mudhāya bhavān samudgato yasya arthe bahu cīrṇa duṣkarā /
analyzed: na mudhāya bhavān samudgataḥ yasya arthe bahu cīrṇa duṣkarā
translated: You did not rise up in vain, for the sake of which you practiced many austerities.

original: vijito hi śaṭhaḥ sasainyakaḥ prāptā bodhi anuttarā tvayā // / //🔽āloka kṛto daśādiśe prajñādīpena triloka jvālitaḥ /
analyzed: vijitaḥ hi śaṭhaḥ sa sainyakaḥ prāptā bodhi anuttarā tvayā  āloka kṛtaḥ daśādiśe prajñā dīpena triloka jvālitaḥ
translated: For you have conquered the deceitful one with his army and attained unsurpassed awakening.🔽You have made light in the ten directions and illuminated the three worlds with the lamp of wisdom.

analyzed: timiram apanāyayiṣyase dāsyasi cakṣuḥ anuttaram jage
translated: You will remove darkness and bestow unsurpassed vision upon the world.

original: bahukalpa stuvanti bhāṣato romarūpasya na cāntu asti te /
analyzed: bahu kalpa stuvanti bhāṣataḥ romarūpasya na asti te
translated: For many eons, they praise, but there is no end to your hair pores.

original: guṇasāgara lokaviśrutā śirasā vandima te tathāgatam // / //
analyzed: guṇa sāgara loka viśrutā śirasā vandima te tathāgatam
translated: O ocean of qualities, renowned in the world, we bow our heads to you, Tathagata.

original: evaṃ khalu te suyāmadevaputrapramukhā devāstathāgatamabhiṣṭutyaikānte tasthuḥ prāñjalastathāgataṃ namasyantaḥ //
analyzed: evam khalu te suyāma deva putra pramukhāḥ devāḥ tathāgatam abhiṣṭutya ekānte tasthuḥ prāñjalaḥ tathāgatam namasyantaḥ
translated: Thus, those gods headed by the god Suyama, having praised the Tathagata, stood to one side, with palms joined in reverence, paying homage to the Tathagata.

analyzed: atha khalu śakraḥ devānām indraḥ sārdham trāyatriṃśa kāyikaiḥ devaiḥ nānā puṣpa dhūpa dīpa gandha mālya vilepana cūrṇa cīvara chatra dhvaja patākā vyūhaiḥ tathāgatam
translated: Then Shakra, lord of the gods, together with the gods of the Heaven of the Thirty-Three, with various arrays of flowers, incense, lamps, perfumes, garlands, ointments, powders, robes, parasols, banners, and flags,

analyzed: saṃpūjya ābhiḥ gāthābhiḥ abhyastāvīt
translated: having made offerings to the Tathagata, praised him with these verses:

original: askhalitā anavadyā sadā susthitā merukalpā mune
analyzed: askhalitā anavadyā sadā susthitā meru kalpā mune
translated: O Sage, your steps are unerring, always well-placed, like Mount Meru.

analyzed: daśa diśi jñāna prabhā puṇya teja anvitā
translated: In the ten directions, your wisdom light is well-known, endowed with the radiance of merit.

analyzed: buddha śata sahasra saṃpūjitā pūrvi tubhyam mune
translated: O Sage, in the past, you made offerings to a hundred thousand Buddhas.

original: tasya viśeṣu yena bodhidrume mārasenā jitā // / //
analyzed: tasya viśeṣu yena bodhi drume māra senā jitā
translated: By that distinction, you conquered Mara's army under the Bodhi tree.

analyzed: śīla śruta samādhi prajñā karā jñāna ketu dhvajā
translated: You are the source of morality, learning, concentration, and wisdom, the banner of the knowledge-bearing flag.
You destroy old age and death, the supreme physician, the giver of eyes to the world.

analyzed: tri mala khila prahīṇa śānta indriyā śānta cittā mune
translated: You have abandoned the three defilements and all faults, O Sage, your senses are peaceful, your mind is peaceful,

analyzed: śākya ṛṣabhāḥ dharmarājā jage
translated: I go for refuge to you, O Shakyamuni, the Dharma King of the world.

analyzed: bodhi carī ananta tulyā abhūt vīrya sthāmā udgatā
translated: The infinite and immeasurable practice of enlightenment has arisen from the power of your diligence,

analyzed: prajñā bale upāya maitrābalam brāhmapuṇyam balam
translated: The power of wisdom, the power of skillful means and love, the power of Brahma merit,

analyzed: vaidya  eti balam ananta tulyā bhavam bodhi saṃprasthite
translated: The power of medicine,🔽This infinite and immeasurable power has arisen in you, O Enlightened One, who has set out for enlightenment,

analyzed: daśa bala bala dhārī adyā punar bodhimaṇḍe
translated: Today, having attained the ten powers, you are seated on the Bodhi seat.

analyzed: dṛṣṭvā surāḥ bhīta trastāḥ abhavan
translated: Seeing this, the infinite beings and gods became frightened and terrified,

original: mā khu śramaṇarāju bādhiṣyate bodhimaṇḍe sthitaḥ /
analyzed: mā bādhiṣyate bodhimaṇḍe sthitaḥ
translated: Lest the King of Ascetics, dwelling on the Bodhi seat, be harmed.

original: na ca bhavatu babhūva tebhyo bhayaṃ no ca kāyeñjanā
analyzed: na ca bhavatu babhūva tebhyaḥ bhayam na u ca kāya iñjanā
translated: But no fear arose in them, nor did their bodies tremble,

analyzed: kara hata guru bhāra saṃkampanā māra senā jitā
translated: The heavy burden of the hand-to-hand combat shook, and the army of Mara was defeated.

original: yatha ca purimakebhi siṃhāsane prāpta bodhi varā
analyzed: yatha ca purimakebhi siṃhāsane prāpta bodhi varā
translated: Just as the previous ones attained the supreme enlightenment on the lion throne,

original: tatha tvayā anubuddha tulyā samā anyathā tvaṃ na hi /
analyzed: tathā tvayā anubuddha tulyā samā anyathā tvam na hi
translated: In the same way, you have attained enlightenment, equally, not otherwise.

original: samamanasa samacitta sarvajñatā sthāma prāptaṃ tvayā
analyzed: sama manasa sama citta sarvajña tā sthāma prāptam tvayā
translated: With an equal mind, with an equal thought, you have attained the power of omniscience,

original: tena bhava svayaṃbhu lokottamo puṇyakṣetraṃ jage // / //
analyzed: tena bhava svayaṃbhu puṇya kṣetram jage
translated: Therefore, be a self-existent one, a supreme being in the world, a field of merit for the world.

original: evaṃ khalu bhikṣavaḥ śakro devānāmindraḥ sārdhaṃ devaputraistrāyatriṃśaistathāgatamabhiṣṭutyaikānte 'sthāt prāñjalīkṛtastathāgataṃ namaskurvan
analyzed: evam khalu bhikṣavaḥ śakraḥ devānām indraḥ sārdham deva putraiḥ trāyatriṃśaiḥ tathāgatam abhiṣṭutya ekānte sthāt prāñjalīkṛtaḥ tathāgatam namaskurvan
translated: Thus, monks, Śakra, lord of the gods, together with the gods of the Thirty-Three, having praised the Tathāgata, stood to one side with palms joined in respect, paying homage to the Tathāgata.

original: atha khalu catvāro mahārājānaḥ sārdhaṃ caturmahārājakāyikairdevaputrairyena tathāgatastenopasaṃkrāmat /
analyzed: atha khalu catvāraḥ mahā rājānaḥ sārdham catur mahā rājakāyikaiḥ deva putraiḥ yena tathāgataḥ tena upasaṃkrāmat
translated: Then the Four Great Kings, together with the gods of the Four Great Kings, approached the Tathāgata.

analyzed: upasaṃkramya abhimuktaka campaka sumanā vārṣika dhānuskāri mālya dāma parigṛhītā apsaraḥ śata sahasra parivṛtā
translated: Having approached, holding garlands of abhimuktaka, campaka, sumanā, vārṣika, and dhānuṣkārī flowers, surrounded by hundreds of thousands of celestial nymphs,

original: divyasaṃgītisaṃpravāditena tathāgatasya pūjāṃ kṛtvā ābhiḥ sārūpyābhirgāthābhistuṣṭuvuḥ
analyzed: divya saṃgīti saṃpravāditena tathāgatasya pūjām kṛtvā ābhiḥ sārūpyābhiḥ gāthābhiḥ tuṣṭuvuḥ
translated: having made offerings to the Tathāgata with divine music and song, they praised him with these fitting verses:

original: sumadhuravacanā manojñaghoṣā śaśi va praśāntikarā prasannacittā /
analyzed: su madhura vacanā manojña ghoṣā praśānti karā prasanna cittā
translated: Your words are very sweet and your voice is delightful, like the moon, bringing peace and clarity of mind.

analyzed: prahasita vadanā prabhūta jihvā parama su prīti karā mune namaḥ te
translated: With a smiling face and a large tongue, you bring supreme joy, Sage, we pay homage to you.

original: rutaravita ya asti sarvaloke sumadhura premaṇiyā narāmarūṇām /
analyzed: yaḥ asti sarva loke su madhura nara amarūṇām
translated: All the sounds in the world, so sweet and endearing to humans and gods,

original: bhavata svaru pramukta mañjughoṣo abhibhavate ruta sarvi bhāṣamāṇāṃ // / //
analyzed: bhavata svaru pramukta mañju ghoṣaḥ abhibhavate ruta sarvi bhāṣamāṇām
translated: You are the Svaru, released, Manjushri, the melodious sound that surpasses all sounds of speech.

original: rāgu samayi doṣamohakleśā prīti janeti amānuṣāṃ viśuddhām /
analyzed: amānuṣām viśuddhām
translated: When one sees the Dharma, one generates non-human joy and purity, free from the afflictions of desire, hatred, and delusion.

original: akaluṣahṛdayā niśāmya dharmaṃ ārya vimukti labhanti te hi sarve // / //
analyzed: akaluṣa hṛdayāḥ niśāmya dharmam ārya vimukti labhanti te hi sarve
translated: All of them attain noble liberation, with untainted hearts, having heard the Dharma.

original: na ca bhava atimanyase avidvāṃ na ca puna vidvamadena jātu mattaḥ /
analyzed: na ca bhava atimanyase a vidvān na ca puna jātu mattaḥ
translated: You do not excessively think I am ignorant, nor are you ever intoxicated by the pride of knowledge.

analyzed: vaidya
translated: You are like a doctor,

original: unnatu na ca naiva conatastvaṃ giririva susthitu sāgarasya madhye // / //
analyzed: na ca nā eva ca ūnataḥ tvam giriḥ iva sāgarasya madhye
translated: not elevated or lowered, but well-established like a mountain in the middle of the ocean.

original: lābha iha sulabdha mānuṣāṇāṃ yatra hi tādṛśu jātu sattva loke /
analyzed: lābhaḥ iha sulabdha mānuṣāṇām yatra hi tādṛśu jātu sattva loke
translated: Here, humans have obtained a good gain, where such a being exists in the world.

original: śrīriva padumo dhanasya dātrī tatha tava dāsyati dharmu sarvaloke // / //
analyzed: śrīḥ iva tava dāsyati sarva loke
translated: Just as Lakshmi, the giver of wealth, gives, so will she give Dharma to the whole world.

original: evaṃ khalu caturmahārājapramukhā mahārājakāyikā devā bodhimaṇḍaniṣaṇṇaṃ tathāgatamabhiṣṭutyaikānte tasthuḥ prāñjalayastathāgataṃ namasyantaḥ
analyzed: evam khalu catur mahārāja pramukhāḥ mahārājakāyikāḥ devāḥ bodhimaṇḍa niṣaṇṇam tathāgatam abhiṣṭutya ekānte tasthuḥ prāñjalayaḥ tathāgatam namasyantaḥ
translated: Thus, the Four Great Kings and other great kings of the desire realm, having praised the Tathagata seated at the seat of enlightenment, stood to one side with palms joined in respect, bowing to the Tathagata.

analyzed: atha khalu antarikṣāḥ devāḥ tathāgatasya antikam upasaṃkramya abhisaṃbodheḥ pūjā karmaṇe sarvam antarīkṣam
translated: Then the gods of the space realm approached the Thus-Gone One. In order to make offerings at the time of perfect enlightenment, they adorned the entire space

analyzed: ratna jālena kiṅkiṇī jālena ratna chatraiḥ ratna patākābhiḥ ratna paṭṭa dāmaiḥ ratna avataṃsakaiḥ vividha muktā hāra puṣpa dāma ardha kāyika devatā parigṛhītaiḥ ardhacandrakaiḥ ca
translated: with a network of jewels, a network of small bells, jeweled parasols, jeweled banners, jeweled silk streamers, jeweled earrings, various pearl necklaces, flower garlands, and half-body celestial beings holding crescent moons,

original: samalaṃkṛtya tathāgatāya niryātayanti sma /🔽niryātya ca saṃmukhamābhirgāthābhirabhyastāviṣuḥ
analyzed: samalaṃkṛtya tathāgatāya niryātayanti sma  niryātya ca saṃmukham ābhiḥ gāthābhiḥ abhyastāviṣuḥ
translated: and offered them to the Thus-Gone One.🔽Having offered them, they praised him with these verses:

original: asmāku vāsaṃ gagane dhruvaṃ mune paśyāma sattvā cariyā yathā jage /
analyzed: vāsam gagane dhruvam mune paśyāma sattvā cariyā yathā jage
translated: We always see your abode in the sky, Sage, and the conduct of beings in the world.

original: bhavataścariṃ prekṣiya śuddhasattva skhalitaṃ na paśyāma tavaikacitte // / //
analyzed: bhavataḥ carim śuddha sattva skhalitam na paśyāma tava ekacitte
translated: Observing your conduct, Pure Being, we do not see any error in your mind.

original: ye āgatā pūjana bodhisattvā gaganaṃ sphuṭaṃ tairnaranāyakebhiḥ /
analyzed: ye bodhisattvāḥ gaganam sphuṭam taiḥ nara nāyakebhiḥ
translated: The bodhisattvas who have come to make offerings fill the sky with their bodies.

original: hānirvimānāna na cābhavanta tathā hi te vai gaganātmabhāvāḥ // / //
analyzed: na ca abhavanta tathā hi te vai gagana ātma bhāvāḥ
translated: The palaces are not diminished, for they are of the nature of space.

original: ye antarīkṣātu pravarṣi puṣpāṃ syāccūḍabandhā hi mahāsahasrā /
analyzed: ye syāt cūḍabandhā hi mahā sahasrā
translated: Those who rain down flowers from the sky, with a thousand great chignon-knots,

original: te tubhya kāye patitā aśeṣā nadyo yathā sāgari saṃpraviṣṭāḥ // / //
analyzed: te kāye patitāḥ aśeṣāḥ nadyaḥ yathā sāgari saṃpraviṣṭāḥ
translated: They all fall upon your body, like rivers flowing into the ocean.

analyzed: paśyāma chatrāṇi avataṃsakā ca mālāguṇām campaka puṣpa dāmām
translated: We see parasols, earrings, garlands, strings of champaka flowers,

original: hārāṃśca candrāṃśca tathārdhacandrāṃ kṣipanti devā na ca saṃskaroti // / //
analyzed: hārān ca candrān ca tathā ardhacandrām kṣipanti devāḥ na ca saṃskaroti
translated: Necklaces, moons, and half-moons thrown by the gods, but you are not affected by them.

original: vālasya nābhūdavakāśamasmin devaiḥ sphuṭaṃ sarvata antarīkṣam /
analyzed: vālasya na abhūt avakāśam asmin devaiḥ sphuṭam
translated: There is no space here for a hair for the gods to fill the entire sky.

original: kurvanti pūjāṃ dvipadottamasya na ca te mado jāyati vismayo vā // / //
analyzed: kurvanti pūjām dvipada uttamasya na ca te madaḥ jāyati vismayaḥ vā
translated: They make offerings to the supreme human, but neither pride nor wonder arises in them.

analyzed: vaidya
translated: Vidy

original: evaṃ khalvantarīkṣadevā bodhimaṇḍe niṣaṇṇaṃ tathāgatamabhiṣṭutyaikānte 'vatasthivantaḥ prāñjalayastathāgataṃ namasyantaḥ //
analyzed: evam khalu antarīkṣa devāḥ bodhimaṇḍe niṣaṇṇam tathāgatam abhiṣṭutya ekānte vatasthivantaḥ prāñjalayaḥ tathāgatam namasyantaḥ
translated: Thus, the gods of the sky, having praised the Tathagata seated at the seat of enlightenment, stood to one side, their palms joined in reverence to the Tathagata.

original: atha khalu bhaumā devāstathāgatasya pūjākarmaṇe sarvāvantaṃ dharaṇītalaṃ suśodhitopaliptaṃ
analyzed: atha khalu bhaumāḥ devāḥ tathāgatasya pūjā karmaṇe sarvāvantam dharaṇī talam su śodhita upaliptam
translated: Then, the earth gods, in order to make offerings to the Tathagata, thoroughly cleaned and anointed the entire surface of the earth,

original: gandhodakapariṣiktaṃ puṣpāvakīrṇaṃ ca kṛtvā nānādūṣyavitānavitataṃ ca tathāgatāya niryātayanti sma /
analyzed: gandha udaka pariṣiktam puṣpa avakīrṇam ca kṛtvā nānā dūṣya vitāna vitatam ca tathāgatāya niryātayanti sma
translated: sprinkled it with fragrant water, scattered flowers, and spread out canopies of various fine cloths, and offered them to the Tathagata.

analyzed: ābhiḥ gāthābhiḥ abhituṣṭuvuḥ
translated: They praised him with these verses:

original: vajramiva abhedyā saṃsthitā triḥsahasrā vajramayapadenāyaṃ sthito bodhimaṇḍe /
analyzed: vajram iva abhedyā saṃsthitā triḥsahasrā vajra maya padena ayam sthitaḥ bodhimaṇḍe
translated: It is as unbreakable as a vajra, standing in the three-thousand [world system]. This Bodhi tree is established on a base of vajra.

original: iha mama tvacamāṃsaṃ śuṣyatāmasthimajjā na ca ahu aspṛśitvā bodhi uttheṣya asmāt // / //
analyzed: iha mama tvaca māṃsam śuṣyatām asthi majjā na ca ahu a spṛśitvā bodhi uttheṣya asmāt
translated: Here, let my skin and flesh dry up, and even my bones and marrow, but I will not rise from here without having attained enlightenment.

original: savibhava narasiṃhā sarviyaṃ triḥsahasrā na kariṣu adhisthānaṃ syādvidīrṇaśeṣā /
analyzed: sa vibhava nara siṃhā triḥsahasrā na kariṣu adhisthānam syāt vidīrṇa śeṣā
translated: O Lion among Men, this entire three-thousand [world system] will be destroyed and left in ruins if you do not take possession of it.

original: tādṛśa mahavegā āgatā bodhisattvā yeṣa kramatalebhiḥ kampitā kṣetrakoṭyaḥ // / //
analyzed: āgatāḥ bodhisattvāḥ krama talebhiḥ kampitāḥ kṣetra koṭyaḥ
translated: Such are the great and powerful Bodhisattvas who have come here, whose footsteps have shaken millions of Buddha-fields.

original: lābha iha sulabdhā bhūmidevairudārā yatra paramasattvaścaṃkramī medinīye /
analyzed: lābhaḥ iha su labdhā bhūmidevaiḥ udārā yatra parama sattvaḥ caṃkramī medinīye
translated: The gods of the earth have gained a great and excellent gain, where the Supreme Being has walked upon the earth.

original: yatra ku raju loke sarva obhāsitāste cetibhu trisahasraḥ kiṃ punastubhya kāyaḥ // / //🔽hesti śatasahasraṃ yāvataścāpaskandho dharaṇitalu jagasyā yāvataścopajīvyaḥ /
analyzed: yatra loke sarve tri sahasraḥ kim punar tubhya kāyaḥ  śata sahasram yāvataḥ ca apaskandhaḥ jagasyā yāvataḥ ca upajīvyaḥ
translated: Where the entire world has been illuminated by your splendor, and this three-thousand [world system] has been filled with light, what need is there to speak of your own body?🔽We will carry the entire earth, the three-thousand [world system], as far as the sphere of water, as far as the ground of the world, and as far as the means of livelihood.

original: sarva vayu dharemo medinī triḥsahasrāṃ sarva tava dadāmo bhuṅkṣvimāṃ tvaṃ yatheṣṭam // / //
analyzed: sarva dharemaḥ medinī triḥsahasrām sarva tava dadāmaḥ bhuṅkṣu imām tvam yatheṣṭam
translated: We will give it all to you. Enjoy it as you wish.

original: yatra bhava sthihedvā caṃkramedvā śayedvā ye 'pi sugataputrāḥ śrāvakā gautamasya /
analyzed: yatra bhava sthihet vā caṃkramet vā śayet vā ye sugata putrāḥ śrāvakāḥ gautamasya
translated: Wherever they stand, sit, walk, or lie down, and also the disciples of the Sugata, the followers of Gautama,

original: dharmakatha kathentī ye 'pi vā tāṃ śṛṇonti sarvakuśalamūlaṃ bodhiye nāmayāmaḥ // / //
analyzed: ye pi vā tām śṛṇonti sarva kuśala mūlam nāmayāmaḥ
translated: who teach the Dharma or listen to it, we dedicate all the roots of virtue to enlightenment.

original: evaṃ khalu bhaumā devā bodhimaṇḍaniṣaṇṇaṃ tathāgatamabhiṣṭatyaikānte tasthuḥ prāñjalayastathāgataṃ namasyantaḥ //
analyzed: evam khalu bhaumāḥ devāḥ bodhimaṇḍa niṣaṇṇam tathāgatam abhiṣṭatya ekānte tasthuḥ prāñjalayaḥ tathāgatam namasyantaḥ
translated: Thus the earth gods, having praised the Tathagata seated at the seat of enlightenment, stood to one side with palms joined in reverence to the Tathagata.

original: iti śrīlalitavistare saṃstavaparivarto nāma trayoviṃśatitamo 'dhyāyaḥ //🔽START Parivarta🔽Vaidya
analyzed: iti śrī lalitavistare saṃstavaparivartaḥ nāma trayoviṃśatitamaḥ dhyāyaḥ  start parivarta  vaidya
translated: Thus ends the twenty-third chapter, the Chapter on Praise, in the Mahāvastu-Avadāna.

original: trapuṣabhallikaparivartaścaturviṃśaḥ /🔽iti hi bhikṣavo 'bhisaṃbuddhastathāgato devairabhiṣṭūyamānaḥ paryaṅkamabhindannanimiṣanayano drumarājaṃ prekṣate sma /
analyzed: trapuṣabhallikaparivartaḥ caturviṃśaḥ  iti hi bhikṣavaḥ bhisaṃbuddhaḥ tathāgataḥ devaiḥ abhiṣṭūyamānaḥ paryaṅkam abhindān animiṣa nayanaḥ drumarājam prekṣate sma
translated: Chapter 24: The Chapter on Trapusa and Bhallika🔽Thus have I heard. At one time the Blessed One was dwelling in the Deer Park at Ṛṣivadana near Bārāṇasī.🔽There the Blessed One addressed the monks:

analyzed: dhyāna prīti āhāraḥ sukha pratisaṃvedī sapta rātram bodhivṛkṣa mūle bhināmayati sma
translated: Monks, this is the holy life's culmination, its consummation, its finality, its perfection, its unsurpassed practice, its direct path, its direct path to the deathless, its direct path to the highest peace, its direct path to enlightenment, its direct path to the knowledge and insight of a Buddha.🔽What is that? It is this noble truth of suffering, this noble truth of the arising of suffering, this noble truth of the cessation of suffering, this noble truth of the path leading to the cessation of suffering.🔽This is the holy life's culmination, its consummation, its finality, its perfection, its unsurpassed practice, its direct path, its direct path to the deathless, its direct path to the highest peace, its direct path to enlightenment, its direct path to the knowledge and insight of a Buddha.

original: atha saptāhe 'tikrānte kāmāvacarā devaputrā daśagandhodakakumbhasahasrāṇi parigṛhya yena tathāgatastenopasaṃkrāmanti sma /
analyzed: atha sapta ahe tikrānte kāmāvacarāḥ deva putrāḥ daśa gandha udaka kumbha sahasrāṇi parigṛhya yena tathāgataḥ tena upasaṃkrāmanti sma
translated: Then, after seven days had passed, the gods of the desire realm, having taken ten thousand jars of scented water, approached the Thus-Gone One.

original: rūpāvacarā api devaputrā daśagandhodakakumbhasahasrāṇi parigṛhya yena tathāgastenopasaṃkrāmanti sma /
analyzed: rūpāvacarāḥ api deva putrāḥ daśa gandha udaka kumbha sahasrāṇi parigṛhya yena tathāgaḥ tena upasaṃkrāmanti sma
translated: The gods of the form realm also, having taken ten thousand jars of scented water, approached the Thus-Gone One.

original: upasaṃkramya bodhivṛkṣaṃ tathāgataṃ ca gandhodakena snāpayanti sma /
analyzed: upasaṃkramya bodhivṛkṣam tathāgatam ca gandha udakena snāpayanti sma
translated: Having approached, they bathed the Bodhi tree and the Thus-Gone One with scented water.

analyzed: gaṇanā samatikrāntāḥ ca deva nāga yakṣa gandharva asura garuḍa kinnara mahoragāḥ tena tathāgata kāya patitena gandha udakena svaka svakān kāyān upalimpanti
translated: Gods, nāgas, yakṣas, gandharvas, asuras, garuḍas, kinnaras, and mahoragas beyond number anointed their own bodies with the scented water that had touched the body of the Thus-Gone One.

analyzed: anuttarāyām ca samyaksaṃbodhau cittāni utpādayāmāsuḥ
translated: They gave rise to the mind of unexcelled and complete awakening.

original: svabhavane praviṣṭā api ca te devaputrādayo 'virahitā abhūvaṃstena gandhodakagandhena /
analyzed: sva bhavane praviṣṭāḥ api ca te deva putra ādayaḥ virahitāḥ abhūvan tena gandha udaka gandhena
translated: Even after entering their own abodes, those gods and others were not separated from the scent of that scented water.

analyzed: na ca asmai gandhāya spṛhām utpādayāmāsuḥ
translated: They did not give rise to longing for that scent.

analyzed: tena eva ca prīti prāmodyena tathāgata gaurava manasikāra nirjātena a vaivartikāḥ abhūvan anuttarāyāḥ samyaksaṃbodheḥ
translated: And through that very joy and gladness born from the mental attention of reverence for the Tathāgata, they became irreversible from unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.

original: atha khalu bhikṣavaḥ samantakusumo nāma devaputrastasyāmeva parṣadi saṃnipatito 'bhūt /
analyzed: atha khalu bhikṣavaḥ samantakusumaḥ nāma deva putraḥ tasyām eva parṣadi saṃnipatitaḥ bhūt
translated: Then, monks, a god named Samantakusuma, who was present in that very assembly,

original: sa tathāgatasya caraṇayornipatya prāñjalistathāgatametadavocat ko nāmāyaṃ bhagavan samādhiryena samādhinā samanvāgatastathāgataḥ saptarātraṃ
analyzed: sa tathāgatasya caraṇayoḥ nipatya prāñjaliḥ tathāgatam etat avocat kaḥ nāma ayam bhagavan samādhiḥ yena samādhinā samanvāgataḥ tathāgataḥ sapta rātram
translated: fell at the feet of the Tathāgata, with palms joined addressed the Tathāgata with this: What is the name of this concentration, Blessed One, endowed with which the Tathāgata spent seven nights

original: evamukto bhikṣavastathāgatastaṃ devaputrametadavocat prītyāhāravyūho nāma devaputra ayaṃ samādhiryena samādhinā samanvāgatastathāgataḥ saptarātraṃ
analyzed: evam uktaḥ bhikṣavaḥ tathāgataḥ tam deva putram etat avocat prīti āhāra vyūhaḥ nāma deva putra ayam samādhiḥ yena samādhinā samanvāgataḥ tathāgataḥ sapta rātram
translated: in concentration? Thus addressed, monks, the Tathāgata said to that god: God, this concentration is called the Array of Nourishment through Joy, endowed with which the Tathāgata spent seven nights

analyzed: vyāhārṣīt abhinna paryaṅkaḥ
translated: in concentration, without moving from his cross-legged position.

original: atha khalu bhikṣavaḥ samantakusumo devaputrastathāgataṃ gāthābhirabhyastāvīt
analyzed: atha khalu bhikṣavaḥ samantakusumaḥ deva putraḥ tathāgatam gāthābhiḥ abhyastāvīt
translated: Then, monks, the god Samantakusuma praised the Tathāgata with these verses:

analyzed: ratha caraṇa nicita caraṇā daśa śata ara jalaja kamala dala tejā
translated: Your feet are marked with wheels, with the splendor of a thousand lotus petals.

analyzed: sura mukuṭa ghṛṣṭa caraṇā vande caraṇau śirighanasya
translated: Whose feet are rubbed by the crowns of the gods, I pay homage to the feet of Śrīghana.

analyzed: abhivandya sugata caraṇau pramudita cittaḥ tadā sa sura putraḥ
translated: Having paid homage to the feet of the Sugata, with a joyful mind, the son of the gods,

analyzed: idam avaci vimati haraṇam praśānta karaṇam nara marūṇām
translated: Spoke these words, which remove doubt and bring peace to humans and gods:

analyzed: śākya kula nandi jananāḥ anta karāḥ rāga doṣa mohānām
translated: You who bring joy to the Śākya clan, you who put an end to attachment, anger, and delusion,

analyzed: pramlāna anta karaṇā vinehi kāṅkṣām nara marūṇām
translated: With your mind completely at peace, remove the doubts of humans and gods.

analyzed: kim kāraṇam daśabalāḥ buddhvā sarvajña tām aparimāṇām
translated: For what reason, O One with Ten Powers, having attained immeasurable omniscience,

original: saptāhaṃ mahimaṇḍe jinā na bhindanti paryaṅkam // / //
analyzed: sapta aham mahi maṇḍe jināḥ na bhindanti paryaṅkam
translated: Do the Victorious Ones not break their cross-legged posture for seven days on the great platform?

original: kiṃ tu khalu paśyamānaḥ saptāhaṃ animeṣeṇa narasiṃhā /
analyzed: kim tu khalu paśyamānaḥ sapta aham animeṣeṇa nara siṃhā
translated: But what, indeed, do you see, O Lion among Men, that for seven days you gaze without blinking,

analyzed: prekṣasi viśuddha cakṣaḥ vikasita śatapatra tulya akṣaḥ  vaidya
translated: With eyes like a blossoming hundred-petaled lotus, O you of pure vision?

original: kiṃ tu bhavateṣa praṇidhī utāhu sarveṣa vādisiṃhānām /
analyzed: kim tu sarveṣa vādi siṃhānām
translated: What, indeed, is the aspiration of you, the Lion of Speakers, by which

original: yena drumarājamūle paryaṅka na bhindi saptāham // / //
analyzed: yena drumarāja mūle paryaṅka na
translated: You do not break your cross-legged posture for seven days at the foot of the king of trees?

analyzed: sādhu sama śuddha dantā sugandhagandhā mukham daśabalasya
translated: Excellent are the pure teeth, the mouth fragrant with sweet scent, of the One with Ten Powers.

original: pravada vacanaṃ avitathaṃ kuruṣva prītiṃ naramarūṇām // / //
analyzed: pravada vacanam avitatham kuruṣva prītim nara marūṇām
translated: Speak words that are true and bring joy to humans and gods.

original: tamuvāca candravacanaḥ śṛṇuṣva me bhāṣato amaraputra /
analyzed: tam uvāca candra vacanaḥ śṛṇuṣva me bhāṣataḥ amara putra
translated: He replied, Son of the gods, listen to me as I speak.

analyzed: asya praśnasya aham kiṃcid mātram pravakṣyāmi
translated: I will explain a little bit about this question.

analyzed: rājā yadvat yasmin abhiṣiktaḥ bhavati jñāti saṃghena
translated: Just as a king is consecrated by the assembly of his relatives,

original: saptāhu taṃ pradeśaṃ na jahāti hi dharmatā rājñām // / //
analyzed: tam pradeśam na jahāti hi dharmatā rājñām
translated: and by the nature of kings, he does not leave that place for seven days,

original: evameva daśabalā api abhiṣiktā bhonti yada praṇidhipūrṇāḥ /
analyzed: evam eva daśa balāḥ api abhiṣiktāḥ bhonti praṇidhi pūrṇāḥ
translated: in the same way, the one with the ten powers is consecrated when his vow is fulfilled.

original: saptāhu dharaṇimaṇḍe jinā na bhindanti paryaṅkam // / //
analyzed: dharaṇi maṇḍe jināḥ na bhindanti paryaṅkam
translated: For seven days, the victors do not part from the circle of the earth.

analyzed: śūraḥ yathā ari saṃghām nirīkṣate nirjitām niravaśeṣām
translated: Just as a hero looks at the assembly of enemies defeated without remainder,

original: buddhā pi bodhimaṇḍe kleśāṃ nihatāṃ nirīkṣante // / //
analyzed: buddhāḥ pi bodhimaṇḍe kleśām nihatām nirīkṣante
translated: the buddhas, too, at the seat of awakening, look at the afflictions destroyed.

analyzed: iha te kāma krodhāḥ moha prabhāvāḥ jagat parinikāśāḥ
translated: Here, desire, anger, and delusion, the causes of the world's appearance,

original: sāhoḍhā iva caurā vināśitā ye niravaśeṣāḥ // / //
analyzed: sā ahoḍhāḥ iva caurāḥ vināśitāḥ ye niravaśeṣāḥ
translated: like thieves who have been caught, are destroyed without remainder.

original: iha me hatāna vividhā mānavidhāmanyunā puraniketāḥ /
analyzed: iha me vividhāḥ māna vidhā manyunā pura niketāḥ
translated: Here, various kinds of pride, anger, and former abodes are destroyed by me.

analyzed: sarva āśravā prahīnā jñānam ca agram samotpannam
translated: All taints are abandoned, and supreme knowledge has arisen.

original: iha sā akāryakartrī bhavatṛṣṇā cāriṇī tathāvidyā /
analyzed: iha sā akārya kartrī bhava tṛṣṇā cāriṇī tathā avidyā
translated: Here, that thirst for existence, the doer of evil deeds, wandering thus, and ignorance,

analyzed: sa anuśaya mūla jātā paṭunā jñāna agninā dagdhā
translated: Along with their latent tendencies and roots, are burned by the sharp fire of knowledge.

original: iha sā ahaṃ mameti ca kalipāśu durānugāḍhalitamūlā /
analyzed: iha sā aham mama iti ca kali pāśu
translated: Here, those words I and mine, the stubborn, difficult-to-follow, deeply rooted defilements,

analyzed: nīvaraṇa kaṭhina granthi chinnā me jñāna śastreṇa
translated: The knots of the hard obscurations, are cut by me with the weapon of knowledge.

original: iha te ciraṃ samāyata ullāpanakā vināśaparyantāḥ /
analyzed: iha te ciram ullāpanakāḥ vināśa paryantāḥ
translated: Here, those aggregates, along with their clinging, which have been accumulated for a long time, ending in destruction,

analyzed: skandhāḥ sa upādānāḥ jñānena mayā parijñātāḥ
translated: Are fully known by me through knowledge.

analyzed: iha te dvaya saṃmohāḥ mithyā grāhāḥ mahā naraka niṣṭhāḥ
translated: Here, those two delusions, the false graspings, which lead to the great hells,

original: maya uddhṛtā aśeṣā bhūyaśca na jātu jñāsyante // / //
analyzed: mayaḥ uddhṛtāḥ aśeṣāḥ bhūyas ca na jātu jñāsyante
translated: Are extracted by me without remainder and will not be known again.

analyzed: iha nīvaraṇa vana arī dagdhā me kuśala mūla tejena
translated: Here, the forest of obscurations is burned by me with the power of the roots of virtue.

analyzed: caturaḥ ca viparyāsāḥ nirdagdha mayā niravaśeṣāḥ
translated: And the four perversions are completely burned by me.

original: iha sā vitarkamālā saṃjñāsūtreṣu granthitā nipathī //
analyzed: iha sā vitarka mālā saṃjñā sūtreṣu granthitā nipathī
translated: Here, that garland of discursive thoughts, tied in the knots of the threads of perception, on the path,

analyzed: vinivartitāḥ aśeṣāḥ bodhyaṅga vicitra mālābhiḥ
translated: Is turned back without remainder by the various garlands of the factors of enlightenment.

analyzed: vaidya
translated: physician

original: durgāni pañcaṣaṣṭi mohānī triṃśatiṃ ca malināni /
analyzed: durgāni pañcaṣaṣṭi mohānī triṃśatim ca malināni
translated: The sixty-five difficult passages, the thirty defiled delusions,

analyzed: catvāriṃśat aghāni chinnā me smin dharaṇi maṇḍe
translated: The forty sins have been cut off by me on this great earth.

analyzed: ṣoḍaśa asaṃvṛtāni aṣṭādaśa dhātavaḥ ca mahi maṇḍe
translated: The sixteen unrestrained ones and the eighteen elements have been cut off by me on this great earth.

analyzed: kṛcchrāṇi pañcaviṃśati chinnāni mayā ihasaṃsthena
translated: The twenty-five difficult ones have been cut off by me while dwelling here.

analyzed: viṃśati rajastarāṇi aṣṭāviṃśati jagasya vitrāsāḥ
translated: The twenty Rajastaras and the twenty-eight terrors of the world,

analyzed: iha me samatikrāntāḥ vīrya bala parākramam karitvā
translated: have been overcome by me here, having made effort, strength, and valor.

analyzed: buddha narditānī pañca śatā asmin mayā samanubuddhā
translated: Thus, the five hundred roars of the Buddha have been fully awakened to by me.

analyzed: paripurṇa śata sahasram mayā samanubuddham
translated: The one hundred thousand dharmas have been fully awakened to by me.

analyzed: iha me aśeṣāḥ aṣṭānavatiḥ sa mūla paryantāḥ
translated: Here, my latent tendencies, ninety-eight in number, along with their roots,

analyzed: paryutthāna kisalayāḥ nirdagdhāḥ jñāna tejena
translated: have been burned away by the flame of knowledge, like the sprouts of uprisings.

analyzed: kāṅkṣā vimati samudayā aśubha mūlā
translated: Doubt, uncertainty, and the arising of views, the dullness and sluggishness of beings, the root of impurity,

analyzed: tṛṣṇā nadī tri vegā praśoṣitā jñāna sūryeṇa
translated: the river of craving, with its three currents, has been dried up by the sun of knowledge.

analyzed: kuhana lapana prahāṇam māyā mātsarya doṣa īrṣyā ādyam
translated: The faults of hypocrisy, flattery, deceit, stinginess, envy, and so on,

original: iha te kleśāraṇyaṃ chinnaṃ vinayāgninā dagdham // / //
analyzed: iha te kleśa araṇyam chinnam vinaya agninā dagdham
translated: have been cut down here in the forest of afflictions by the fire of discipline.

analyzed: iha te vivāda mūlāḥ ākarṣaṇa durgatīṣu viṣamāsu
translated: Here are the roots of dispute, the uneven paths leading to misfortune and bad rebirths.

analyzed: ārya apavāda vacanā jñāna vara virecanaiḥ vāntā
translated: The words of slander against the noble ones are vomited out by the supreme wisdom of discernment.

analyzed: iha rudita kranditānām paryantam
translated: Here, I have reached the end of weeping, crying, grieving, and lamenting,

analyzed: prāptam mayā hi aśeṣam jñāna guṇa samādhim āgamya
translated: Having attained the qualities of wisdom and concentration without exception.

analyzed: oghāḥ a yoga granthāḥ śokāḥ śalyāḥ mada pramādāḥ ca
translated: The floods, bonds of non-restraint, sorrows, darts, pride, and negligence,

analyzed: vijitāḥ mayā iha sarve satya naya samādhim āgamya
translated: I have conquered all of these here, having attained the truth and the way of concentration.

analyzed: iha bhava vṛkṣāḥ
translated: Here, I have cut down the dense forests of afflictions, the trees of existence with their roots firmly established in conceptualization,
