original: atha khalu tāstisro māraduhitaro ratiścāratiśca tṛṣṇā ca māraṃ pāpīyāṃsaṃ gāthayādhyabhāṣanta
analyzed: atha khalu tāḥ tisraḥ māra duhitaraḥ ratiḥ ca aratiḥ ca tṛṣṇā ca māram pāpīyāṃsam gāthayā adhyabhāṣanta
translated: Then Māra’s three daughters, Rati, Arati, and Tṛṣṇā, addressed Māra the Evil One in verse:

original: durmanāsi kathaṃ tāta procyatāṃ yadyasau naraḥ /
analyzed: durmanāḥ asi katham tāta procyatām yadi asau naraḥ
translated: “Father, why are you so miserable? Tell us if it is that man.

original: rāgapāśena taṃ buddhvā kuñjaraṃ vā nayāmahe // / //
analyzed: rāga pāśena tam buddhvā kuñjaram vā nayāmahe
translated: We will bind him with the noose of passion, like an elephant.

original: ānayitvā ca taṃ śīghraṃ kariṣyāma vaśe tava /
analyzed: ānayitvā ca tam śīghram kariṣyāma vaśe tava
translated: Having brought him here quickly, we will bring him under your control.”

analyzed: māraḥ āha
translated: Māra said:

original: arahan sugato loke na rāgasya vaśaṃ vrajet /
analyzed: arahan sugataḥ loke na rāgasya vaśam vrajet
translated: “The Worthy One, the Well-Gone One in the world would not come under the sway of passion.

analyzed: viṣayam me hi atikrāntaḥ tasmāt śocāmi aham bhṛśam
translated: He has gone beyond my domain, and so I am greatly grieving.”

original: tatastāḥ strīcāpalyādaviditaprabhāvā api bodhisattvabhūtasyaiva tathāgatasya piturvacanamaśrutvaiva
analyzed: tatas tāḥ strī cāpalyāt avidita prabhāvāḥ api bodhisattva bhūtasya eva tathāgatasya pituḥ vacanam a śrutvā eva
translated: Then, due to the fickleness of women, they, although unaware of the power, without hearing the words of the father of the Tathāgata when he was a bodhisattva,

analyzed: prabhūta yauvana madhya yauvana dhāriṇyaḥ bhūtvā vicakṣuḥkarmaṇe tathāgatasya antikam upasaṃkrāntāḥ
translated: having become bearers of abundant youth and middle youth, went to the Tathāgata for the purpose of beholding him.

analyzed: strī māyāḥ ati tat sarvam akārṣuḥ
translated: They performed all that with the deceit of women.

original: tāśca tathāgato na manasi karoti sma /
analyzed: tāḥ ca tathāgataḥ na manasi karoti sma
translated: And the Tathāgata did not pay attention to them.

analyzed: bhūyas ca tāḥ jarā jarjarāḥ adhyatiṣṭhan
translated: And they remained old and decrepit.

analyzed: tatas tāḥ pituḥ antike gatvā evam āhuḥ
translated: Then they went to their father and said this:

original: satyaṃ vadasi nastāta na rāgeṇa sa nīyate /
analyzed: satyam vadasi naḥ tāta na rāgeṇa sa nīyate
translated: You speak the truth, father, he is not led by passion.

analyzed: viṣayam me hi atikrāntaḥ tasmāt śocāmi aham bhṛśam
translated: He has gone beyond my domain, therefore I grieve deeply.

analyzed: vīkṣeta yadi asau rūpam yat asmābhiḥ vinirmitam
translated: If he were to behold the form that we have created,

analyzed: gautamasya vināśa artham hṛdayam sphuṭet
translated: for the destruction of Gautama, then his heart would burst.

analyzed: tat sādhu naḥ tāta idam jarā jarjara śarīram antardhāpaya
translated: Therefore, father, it is good that you make this old and decrepit body of ours disappear.

analyzed: māraḥ āha
translated: Māra said:

original: nāhaṃ paśyāmi taṃ loke puruṣaṃ sacarācare /
analyzed: na aham paśyāmi tam loke puruṣam sacarācare
translated: I do not see that man in the world, moving or unmoving,

analyzed: buddhasya yaḥ hi adhiṣṭhānam śaknuyāt kartum anyathā
translated: who could alter what is established by the Buddha.

original: śīghraṃ gatvā nivedaya atyayaṃ svakṛtaṃ muneḥ /
analyzed: śīghram gatvā nivedaya atyayam sva kṛtam muneḥ
translated: Go quickly and confess your wrongdoing to the sage.

analyzed: sarvam paurāṇakam kāyam kariṣyati yathāmatam
translated: He will restore your entire former body, just as you wish.

original: tatastā gatvā tathāgataṃ kṣamāpayanti sma atyayaṃ no bhagavān pratigṛhṇātu /
analyzed: tatas tāḥ gatvā tathāgatam kṣamāpayanti sma atyayam naḥ bhagavān pratigṛhṇātu
translated: Then they went and asked for forgiveness from the Thus-Gone One, saying, May the Blessed One accept our wrongdoing.

original: atyayaṃ no sugato pratigṛhṇātu yathā bālānāṃ yathā mūḍhānāṃ yathā vyaktānāmakuśalānāmakṣetrajñānāṃ yā vayaṃ bhagavantamāsādayitavyaṃ manyāmahe
analyzed: atyayam no sugato pratigṛhṇātu yathā bālānām yathā mūḍhānām yathā vyaktānām akuśalānām akṣetrajñānām yāḥ vayam bhagavantam āsādayitavyam manyāmahe
translated: May the Well-Gone One accept our wrongdoing, as we were like fools, like idiots, like the unskillful, like the ignorant, in that we thought to harm the Blessed One.

analyzed: tatas tāḥ tathāgataḥ gāthayā adhyabhāṣata  girim nakhaiḥ vilikhetha loham dantaiḥ vikhādatha
translated: Then the Thus-Gone One spoke to them in verse:🔽You would scratch a mountain with your nails, chew iron with your teeth,

analyzed: śirasā vibhitsatha girim agādhe gādham eṣata
translated: and try to bore through a mountain with your head, seeking a ford in the unfordable.

analyzed: vaidya
translated: Vidy

analyzed: tasmāt yuṣmākam dārikāḥ atyayam pratigṛhṇāmi
translated: Therefore, girls, I accept your wrongdoing.

original: tatkasmāt / vṛddhireṣā ārye dharmavinaye yo 'tyayamatyayato dṛṣṭvā pratideśayatyāyatyāṃ ca saṃvaramāpadyate //
analyzed: tat kasmāt vṛddhiḥ eṣā ārye dharma vinaye yā u tyayam atyayataḥ dṛṣṭvā pratideśayati āyatyām ca saṃvaram āpadyate
translated: Why is that? In this noble Dharma and Vinaya, growth comes from seeing wrongdoing as wrongdoing, confessing it, and undertaking restraint for the future.

original: pañcame saptāhe bhikṣavastathāgato mucilindanāgarājabhavane viharati sma saptāhe mahādurdine /
analyzed: pañcame saptāhe bhikṣavaḥ tathāgataḥ mucilinda nāga rāja bhavane viharati sma saptāhe mahā durdine
translated: Monks, in the fifth week, the Thus-Gone One stayed in the abode of the nāga king Mucilinda during a great seven-day rainstorm.

original: atha khalu mucilindanāgarājaḥ svabhavanānniṣkramya tathāgatasya kāye saptakṛdbhogena pariveṣṭya phaṇaiśchādayati sma mā bhagavataḥ kāyaṃ 🔽śītavātāḥ prākṣuriti /
analyzed: atha khalu mucilinda nāga rājaḥ sva bhavanāt niṣkramya tathāgatasya kāye sapta kṛt bhogena pariveṣṭya phaṇaiḥ chādayati sma mā bhagavataḥ kāyam  śīta vātāḥ prākṣuḥ iti
translated: Then the nāga king Mucilinda emerged from his abode, wrapped his coils around the body of the Thus-Gone One seven times, and covered him with his hood, thinking, May the Thus-Gone One's body not be chilled by the cold wind.

original: pūrvasyā api diśo 'nye 'pi saṃbahulā nāgarājā āgatya tathāgatasya kāyaṃ saptakṛdbhogaiḥ pariveṣṭya phaṇaiśchādayanti sma mā bhagavataḥ kāyaṃ 🔽śītavātāḥ prākṣuriti /🔽yathā pūrvasyāṃ diśi evaṃ dakṣiṇapaścimottarābhyo digbhyo nāgarājā āgatya tathāgatasya
analyzed: pūrvasyāḥ api diśaḥ nye pi saṃbahulāḥ nāga rājāḥ āgatya tathāgatasya kāyam sapta kṛt bhogaiḥ pariveṣṭya phaṇaiḥ chādayanti sma mā bhagavataḥ kāyam  śīta vātāḥ prākṣuḥ iti  yathā pūrvasyām diśi evam dakṣiṇa paścima uttarābhyaḥ digbhyaḥ nāga rājāḥ āgatya tathāgatasya
translated: Nāga kings from the east also came and wrapped the body of the Thus-Gone One with their coils seven times and covered him with their hoods, thinking, May the Thus-Gone One's body not be chilled by the cold wind.

original: kāyaṃ saptakṛtvo bhogaiḥ pariveṣṭya phaṇaiśrchādayanti sma mā bhagavataḥ kāyaṃ🔽śītavātāḥ prākṣuriti /
analyzed: kāyam sapta kṛtvas bhogaiḥ pariveṣṭya phaṇaiḥ śrchādayanti sma mā bhagavataḥ kāyam  śīta vātāḥ prākṣuḥ iti
translated: Just as in the east, so also in the south, west, and north, nāga kings came and wrapped the body of the Thus-Gone One with their coils seven times and covered him with their hoods, thinking, May the Thus-Gone One's body not be chilled by the cold wind.

analyzed: sa ca nāga rāja bhogarāśiḥ meru parvata indra vat uccaistvena sthitaḥ bhūt
translated: That heap of nāga kings' coils stood high like Mount Meru, the king of mountains.

original: na ca tairnāgarājaistādṛśaṃ kadācitsukhaṃ prāptaṃ pūrvaṃ yādṛśaṃ teṣāṃ tāni saptarātriṃdivasāni tathāgatakāyasaṃnikarṣādāsīt /
analyzed: na ca taiḥ nāga rājaiḥ tādṛśam kadācid sukham prāptam pūrvam yādṛśam teṣām tāni sapta rātriṃdivasāni tathāgata kāya saṃnikarṣāt āsīt
translated: And those nāga kings had never before experienced such happiness as they did for those seven nights and days, being in the presence of the Tathāgata's body.

original: tataḥ saptāhasyātyayena tataste nāgarājā vyapagatadurdinaṃ viditvā tathāgatasya kāyādbhogānapanīya
analyzed: tatas saptāhasya atyayena tatas te nāga rājāḥ vyapagata durdinam viditvā tathāgatasya kāyāt bhogān apanīya
translated: Then, after seven days had passed, those nāga kings, knowing that the bad weather had cleared, withdrew their coils from the Tathāgata's body

original: tathāgatasya pādau śirasābhivandya tripradakṣiṇīkṛtya svakasvakāni bhavanānyupajagmuḥ /
analyzed: tathāgatasya pādau śirasā abhivandya tri pradakṣiṇīkṛtya svaka svakāni bhavanāni upajagmuḥ
translated: and bowed their heads at the Tathāgata's feet, circumambulated him three times, and went to their own abodes.

original: mucilindo 'pi nāgarājastathāgatasya pādau śirasābhivandya tripradakṣiṇīkṛtya svabhavanaṃ prāvikṣat //
analyzed: mucilindaḥ pi nāga rājaḥ tathāgatasya pādau śirasā abhivandya tri pradakṣiṇīkṛtya sva bhavanam prāvikṣat
translated: The nāga king Mucilinda also bowed his head at the Tathāgata's feet, circumambulated him three times, and entered his own abode.

original: ṣaṣṭhe saptāhe tathāgato mucilindabhavanādajapālasya nyagrodhamūlaṃ gacchati sma /
analyzed: ṣaṣṭhe saptāhe tathāgataḥ mucilinda bhavanāt ajapālasya nyagrodha mūlam gacchati sma
translated: In the sixth week, the Tathāgata went from Mucilinda's abode to the foot of the goatherd's nyagrodha tree.

analyzed: antare ca mucilinda bhavanasya antarāt ca ajapālasya nadyāḥ nairañjanāyāḥ tīre caraka parivrājaka vṛddha śrāvaka gautama nirgrantha ājīvika ādayaḥ tathāgatam
translated: In between Mucilinda's abode and the goatherd's nyagrodha tree, on the bank of the Nairañjanā River, the Tathāgata was seen by wandering mendicants, naked ascetics, elderly disciples, Gautama Ājīvikas, Nirgranthas, and others.

original: dṛṣṭvābhibhāṣante sma api bhagavatā gautamenedaṃ saptāhamakāladurdinaṃ samyaksukhena vyatināmitam /
analyzed: dṛṣṭvā abhibhāṣante sma api bhagavatā gautamena idam saptāham akāla durdinam samyak sukhena vyatināmitam
translated: Seeing this, they said, “We have spent this week of untimely bad weather in perfect happiness with Gautama the Blessed One.”

analyzed: atha khalu bhikṣavaḥ tathāgataḥ tasyām velāyām idam udānayati sma
translated: Monks, at that time the Thus-Gone One spoke this verse:

analyzed: sukhaḥ vivekaḥ tuṣṭasya śruta dharmasya paśyataḥ
translated: “Happy is the solitude of one who is content, who sees the Dharma he has heard.

analyzed: a vyābadhyam sukham loke prāṇi bhūteṣu saṃyataḥ
translated: Happy is the life of one who is restrained toward living beings in the world.

analyzed: sukhā virāga tā loke pāpānām samatikramaḥ
translated: Happy is the dispassion in the world, the transcendence of evil.

analyzed: asmin mānuṣya viṣaye etat vai paramam sukham
translated: This is the highest happiness in the human realm.”

original: paśyati sma bhikṣavastathāgato lokamādīptaṃ pradīptaṃ jātyā jarayā vyādhibhirmaraṇena śokaparidevaduḥkhadaurmanasyopāyāsaiḥ /
analyzed: paśyati sma bhikṣavaḥ tathāgataḥ lokam ādīptam pradīptam jātyā jarayā vyādhibhiḥ maraṇena śoka parideva duḥkha daurmanasya upāyāsaiḥ
translated: Monks, the Thus-Gone One saw the world burning with birth, old age, sickness, death, sorrow, lamentation, pain, depression, and distress.

analyzed: tatra tathāgataḥ idam iha udānam udānayati sma
translated: There, the Thus-Gone One spoke this verse:

analyzed: ayam lokaḥ saṃtāpa jātaḥ śabda sparśa rasa rūpa gandhaiḥ
translated: “This world is born from heat and is ablaze with sound, touch, taste, form, and smell.

analyzed: bhaya bhītaḥ bhayam bhūyas mārgate bhava tṛṣṇayā
translated: Frightened by fear, it seeks fear again through craving for existence.”

original: saptame saptāhe tathāgato tārāyaṇamūle viharati sma /
analyzed: saptame saptāhe tathāgataḥ tārāyaṇa mūle viharati sma
translated: In the seventh week, the Thus-Gone One stayed at the foot of the Tārāyaṇa tree.

original: tena khalu punaḥ samayenottarāpathakau dvau bhrātarau trapuṣabhallikanāmakau vaṇijau
analyzed: tena khalu punar samayena uttarāpathakau dvau bhrātarau trapuṣa bhallika nāmakau vaṇijau
translated: At that time, there were two brothers from the northern region, merchants named Trapusa and Bhallika,

original: paṇḍitau nipuṇau vividhapaṇyaṃ gṛhītvā mahālabdhalābhau dakṣiṇāpathāduttarāpathaṃ
analyzed: paṇḍitau nipuṇau vividha paṇyam gṛhītvā mahā labdha lābhau dakṣiṇāpathāt uttarāpatham
translated: who were wise and skilled. Having taken various goods, they had obtained great profit in the southern region and were returning to the northern region.

original: gacchete sma mahatā sārthena pañcabhirdhuraśataiḥ suparipūrṇaiḥ /
analyzed: gacchete sma mahatā sārthena pañcabhiḥ dhura śataiḥ su paripūrṇaiḥ
translated: They were traveling with a large caravan of five hundred fully loaded carts.

original: tayoḥ sujātaḥ kīrtiśca nāmājāneyau dvau balīvardāvāstām /
analyzed: tayoḥ sujātaḥ kīrtiḥ ca nāma ajāneyau dvau balīvardau āstām
translated: They had two excellent oxen named Sujāta and Kīrti.

original: nāsti tayorlagnabhayam /🔽yatrānye balīvardā na Vaidya 🔽vahanti sma tatra tau yujyete sma /
analyzed: na asti tayoḥ lagna bhayam  yatra anye balīvardāḥ na vaidya  vahanti sma tatra tau yujyete sma
translated: They had no fear of being yoked.🔽Where other oxen would not go, they would go.

original: yatra cāgrato bhayaṃ bhavati sma tatra /
analyzed: yatra ca agratas bhayam bhavati sma tatra
translated: Where there was danger ahead,

analyzed: tau kīla baddhau iva tiṣṭhete sma
translated: they would stand there as if tied with a peg.

original: na ca tau pratodena vāhyete sma /
analyzed: na ca tau pratodena vāhyete sma
translated: They were not driven with a whip.

original: utpalahastakena vā sumanādāmakena vā tau vāhyete sma /
analyzed: utpala hastakena vā sumanā dāmakena vā tau vāhyete sma
translated: They were driven with a lotus in the hand or with a garland of beautiful flowers.

original: teṣāṃ tārāyaṇasamīpe kṣīrikāvananivāsinīdevatādhiṣṭhānātte śakaṭāḥ sarve viṣṭhitā na vahanti sma /
analyzed: teṣām tārāyaṇa samīpe kṣīrikā vana nivāsinī devatā adhiṣṭhānāt te śakaṭāḥ sarve viṣṭhitāḥ na vahanti sma
translated: Near their Tārāyana, their carts all stopped and would not move from the shrine of the goddess who dwells in the Kṣīrika forest.

original: vastrādīni ca sarvaśakaṭāṅgāni ca chidyante sma /
analyzed: vastra ādīni ca sarva śakaṭa aṅgāni ca chidyante sma
translated: Their clothes and all the parts of the carts were torn.

analyzed: bhidyante ca
translated: They were broken.

original: śakaṭācakrāṇi ca nābhīparyantaṃ bhūmau nimagnāni sarvaprayatnairapi te śakaṭā na vahanti sma /
analyzed: śakaṭā cakrāṇi ca nābhī paryantam bhūmau nimagnāni sarva prayatnaiḥ api te śakaṭāḥ na vahanti sma
translated: The wheels of the carts sank up to their axles in the ground, and no matter how hard they tried, the carts would not move.

original: te vismitā bhītāścābhūvan kiṃ nu khalvatra kāraṇam /
analyzed: te vismitāḥ bhītāḥ ca abhūvan kim nu khalu atra kāraṇam
translated: They were amazed and frightened, wondering what the cause might be.

original: ko 'yaṃ vikāro yadime sthale śakaṭā viṣṭhitāḥ /
analyzed: kaḥ yam vikāraḥ yat ime sthale śakaṭāḥ viṣṭhitāḥ
translated: What is this strange occurrence, that these carts are stuck in the ground?

analyzed: taiḥ tau sujāta kīrti balīvardau yojitau
translated: They yoked the oxen Sujāta and Kīrti.

original: tāvapi na vahete sma sotpalahastena ca sumanādāmakena ca vāhyamānau /
analyzed: tau api na vahete sma sa utpala hastena ca sumanā dāmakena ca vāhyamānau
translated: But even they would not move, even when pulled by Somaprabha and Sumana's garland.

original: teṣāmetadabhavat asaṃśayaṃ purataḥ kiṃcidbhayaṃ yenaitāvapi na vahataḥ /🔽tairaśvadūtāḥ purataḥ preṣitāḥ /
analyzed: teṣām etat abhavat asaṃśayam puratas kiṃcid bhayam yena etau api na vahataḥ  taiḥ aśva dūtāḥ puratas preṣitāḥ
translated: They thought, There is no doubt that there is some danger ahead, since even these two will not move.🔽They sent ahead their horse messengers.

analyzed: aśva dūtāḥ pratyāgatāḥ
translated: The horse messengers returned.

analyzed: prāhuḥ na asti kiṃcid bhayam iti
translated: They said, There is no danger.

original: tayāpi devatayā svarūpaṃ saṃdarśya āśvāsitāḥ mā bhetavyamiti /
analyzed: tayā api devatayā sva rūpam saṃdarśya āśvāsitāḥ mā bhetavyam iti
translated: That deity also revealed its form and reassured them, saying, Do not be afraid.

original: tāvapi balīvadau yena tathāgatastena śakaṭā prakarṣitau yāvatte paśyanti sma tathāgataṃ
analyzed: tau api balīvadau yena tathāgataḥ tena prakarṣitau yāvat te paśyanti sma tathāgatam
translated: Those two oxen then pulled the carts to where the Thus-Gone One was. When they saw the Thus-Gone One,🔽he was shining like a blazing fire, adorned with the thirty-two marks of a great being, like the newly risen

analyzed: vaiśvānaram iva pradīptam dvātriṃśat mahāpuruṣa lakṣaṇaiḥ samalaṃkṛtam acira uditam iva
translated: sun.

analyzed: dinakaram śriyā daidīpyamānam
translated: Shining with splendor like the sun.

original: dṛṣṭvā ca te vismitā babhūvuḥ kiṃ nu khalvayaṃ brahmā ihānuprāpta utāho śakro devendra utāho vaiśravaṇa utāho sūryacandrau vā utāho kiṃcidgiridevataṃ
analyzed: dṛṣṭvā ca te vismitāḥ babhūvuḥ kim nu khalu ayam brahmā iha anuprāptaḥ uta aho śakraḥ deva indraḥ uta aho vaiśravaṇaḥ uta aho sūrya candrau vai uta aho kiṃcid giri devatam
translated: And when they saw him, they were amazed. They thought, Is this Brahmā who has come here, or is it Śakra, Lord of the Gods, or is it Vaiśravaṇa, or is it the sun or moon, or is it some mountain deity,

analyzed: vā nadī devatam vā
translated: or a river deity?

analyzed: tatas tathāgataḥ kāṣāyāṇi vastrāṇi prakaṭāyati sma
translated: Then the Tathāgata revealed his saffron robes.

original: tataste āhuḥ pravrajitaḥ khalvayaṃ kāṣāyasaṃvṛto nāsmādbhayamastīti /
analyzed: tatas te āhuḥ pravrajitaḥ khalu ayam kāṣāya saṃvṛtaḥ na asmāt bhayam asti iti
translated: Then they said, This one is a renunciant, covered in saffron robes. There is no danger from him.

original: te prasādaṃ pratilabdhā anyonyamevamāhuḥ pravrajitaḥ khalvayaṃ kālabhojī bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: te prasādam pratilabdhāḥ anyonyam evam āhuḥ pravrajitaḥ khalu ayam kālabhojī bhaviṣyati
translated: They attained faith and said to each other, This renunciant will eat at the proper time.

analyzed: asti kiṃcid
translated: Is there anything?

original: āhuḥ asti madhutarpaṇaṃ likhitakāścekṣavaḥ /🔽te madhutarpaṇamikṣulikhitakāṃścādāya yena tathāgatastenopasaṃkrāman /
analyzed: āhuḥ asti madhu tarpaṇam likhitakāḥ ca ikṣavaḥ  te madhu tarpaṇam ikṣu likhitakān ca ādāya yena tathāgataḥ tena upasaṃkrāman
translated: They said, There is honey, water, and sugarcane.🔽Taking the honey, water, and sugarcane, they approached the Tathāgata.

original: upasaṃkramya tathāgatasya pādau śirasābhivanditvā tripradakṣiṇīkṛtyaikānte tasthuḥ /
analyzed: upasaṃkramya tathāgatasya pādau śirasā abhivanditvā tri pradakṣiṇīkṛtya ekānte tasthuḥ
translated: Having approached, they bowed their heads at the feet of the Tathāgata, circumambulated him three times, and stood to one side.

original: ekānte sthitāste tathāgatamevamāhuḥ pratigṛhṇātu bhagavannidaṃ piṇḍapātramasmākamanukampāmupādāya //
analyzed: ekānte sthitāḥ te tathāgatam evam āhuḥ pratigṛhṇātu bhagavan idam piṇḍa pātram asmākam anukampām upādāya
translated: They stood to one side and said to the Thus-Gone One, “Blessed One, please accept this alms-offering out of compassion for us.”

original: atha khalu bhikṣavastathāgatasyaitadabhūat sādhu khalvidaṃ syādyadahaṃ hastābhyāṃ pratigṛhṇīyām /
analyzed: atha khalu bhikṣavaḥ tathāgatasya etat abhūat sādhu khalu idam syāt yat aham hastābhyām pratigṛhṇīyām
translated: “Monks, the Thus-Gone One thought, ‘It would be good if I could receive this with my hands.’

analyzed: kasmin khalu pūrvakaiḥ tathāgataiḥ samyaksaṃbuddhaiḥ pratigṛhītam
translated: ‘Where did the previous thus-gone ones, the perfect buddhas, receive it?’

original: pātreṇetyajñāsīt //🔽iti hi bhikṣavastathāgatasya bhojanakālasamaya iti viditvā tatkṣaṇameva catasṛbhyo
analyzed: pātreṇa iti ajñāsīt  iti hi bhikṣavaḥ tathāgatasya bhojana kāla samayaḥ iti viditvā tad kṣaṇam eva catasṛbhyaḥ
translated: ‘In a bowl,’ he knew.🔽“Monks, the Thus-Gone One knew it was time for his meal. At that very moment, the four great kings came from the four directions

original: digbhyaścatvāro mahārājā āgatya catvāri sauvarṇāni pātrāṇyādāya tathāgatasyopanāmayanti🔽sma pratigṛhṇātu bhagavannimāni sauvarṇānicatvāri
analyzed: digbhyaḥ catvāraḥ mahā rājāḥ āgatya catvāri sauvarṇāni pātrāṇi ādāya tathāgatasya upanāmayanti  sma pratigṛhṇātu bhagavan imāni sauvarṇāni catvāri
translated: and presented the Thus-Gone One with four golden bowls.

analyzed: pātrāṇi asmākam anukampām upādāya
translated: They said, ‘Blessed One, please accept these four golden bowls out of compassion for us.’

original: tāni na śramaṇapratirūpāṇi iti kṛtvā tathāgato na pratigṛhṇīte sma /
analyzed: tāni na śramaṇa pratirūpāṇi iti kṛtvā tathāgataḥ na pratigṛhṇīte sma
translated: The Thus-Gone One did not accept them, thinking, ‘These are not suitable for an ascetic.’

original: evaṃ catvāri rūpyamayāni catvāri vaiḍūryamayāni sphaṭikamayāni musāragalvamayāni aśmagarbhamayāni /
analyzed: evam catvāri rūpya mayāni catvāri vaiḍūrya mayāni sphaṭika mayāni musāragalva mayāni aśmagarbha mayāni
translated: In the same way, there were four made of silver, four made of beryl, four made of crystal, four made of coral, and four made of emerald.

original: tataścatvāri sarvaratnamayāni pātrāṇi gṛhītvā tathāgatasyopanāmayanti sma /
analyzed: tatas catvāri sarva ratna mayāni pātrāṇi gṛhītvā tathāgatasya upanāmayanti sma
translated: Then, taking the four bowls made of all jewels, they presented them to the Thus-Gone One.

original: na śramaṇasya sārūpyāṇi iti kṛtvā tathāgato na pratigṛhṇīte sma //
analyzed: na śramaṇasya sārūpyāṇi iti kṛtvā tathāgataḥ na pratigṛhṇīte sma
translated: But the Thus-Gone One did not accept them, thinking that they were not suitable for an ascetic.

original: atha khalu bhikṣavastathāgatasya punaretadabhūt evaṃ katamadvidhaiḥ pātraiḥ pūrvakaistathāgatairarhadbhiḥ samyaksaṃbuddhaiḥ pratigṛhītam /
analyzed: atha khalu bhikṣavaḥ tathāgatasya punar etat abhūt evam katamadvidhaiḥ pātraiḥ pūrvakaiḥ tathāgataiḥ arhadbhiḥ samyaksaṃbuddhaiḥ pratigṛhītam
translated: Then, monks, the Thus-Gone One thought again, In what kind of bowls did the past thus-gone ones, the worthy ones, the perfect buddhas accept alms?

analyzed: śaila pātraiḥ iti ajñāsīt
translated: He knew that it was in stone bowls.

analyzed: evam ca cittam utpannam tathāgatasya
translated: And so the thought arose in the Thus-Gone One:

analyzed: vaidya
translated: Vidy

original: atha khalu vaiśravaṇo mahārājastadanyāstrīn mahārājānāmantrayate sma imāni khalu
analyzed: atha khalu vaiśravaṇaḥ mahā rājaḥ tad anyāḥ trīn mahā rājān āmantrayate smaḥ imāni khalu
translated: Then, monks, the great king Vaiśravaṇa addressed the other three great kings, saying, Friends,

analyzed: punar mārṣāḥ catvāri śaila pātrāṇi nīlakāyikaiḥ dava putraiḥ asmabhyam dattāni tatra asmākam etat abhūt
translated: these four stone bowls have been given to us by the blue-clad gods. We thought,

analyzed: eṣu vayam paribhokṣyāmaḥ iti
translated: 'We will use these.'

original: tato vairocano nāma nīlakāyiko devaputraḥ so 'smānevamāha
analyzed: tatas vairocanaḥ nāma nīla kāyikaḥ deva putraḥ saḥ smān evam āha
translated: Then a god named Vairocana, belonging to the blue class, said to us:

original: ma eṣu bhokṣyatha bhājaneṣu dhāretibhe cetiyasaṃmatīte /
analyzed: me eṣu bhokṣyatha bhājaneṣu
translated: You will not eat from these bowls, which are considered to be sacred.

original: bhavitā jinaḥ śākyamunīti nāmnā tasyeti pātrāṇyupanāmayethā // / //
analyzed: bhavitā jinaḥ śākyamuni iti nāmnā tasya iti pātrāṇi upanāmayethāḥ
translated: There will be a Victor named Shakyamuni. You should offer these bowls to him.

original: ayaṃ sa kālaḥ samayaśca mārṣā upanāmituṃ śākyamunerhi bhājanā /
analyzed: ayam sa kālaḥ samayaḥ ca mārṣāḥ upanāmitum śākyamuneḥ hi bhājanā
translated: This is the time, friends, the occasion, to offer the bowls to Shakyamuni.

analyzed: saṃgīti tūrya svara nāditena dāsyāma pātrāṇi vidhāya pūjām
translated: We will offer the bowls, having made offerings with the sounds of music and musical instruments.

original: sa bhājanaṃ dharmamayaṃ hyabhedyaṃ ime ca śailāmaya bhedya bhājanā /
analyzed: sa bhājanam dharma mayam hi abhedyam ime ca śaila āmaya bhedya bhājanā
translated: That bowl is made of Dharma, which is indestructible, and these bowls are made of stone, which are destructible.

original: pratigrahītuṃ kṣamate na cānyaḥ pratigrahārthāya vrajāma hanta // / //
analyzed: pratigrahītum kṣamate na ca anyaḥ pratigraha arthāya vrajāma hanta
translated: No one else is able to receive them. Let us go to receive them.

analyzed: atha khalu catvāraḥ mahārājāḥ sva sva jana pārṣadyāḥ puṣpa dhūpa gandha mālya vilepana tūrya tāḍāva cara saṃgīti saṃprabhāṇitena
translated: Then the Four Great Kings, with their own retinues, with the sound of flowers, incense, perfume, garlands, ointments, musical instruments, percussion, and singing,

original: svaiḥ svaiḥ pāṇibhistāni pātrāṇi parigṛhya yena tathāgatastenopasaṃkrāman /
analyzed: svaiḥ svaiḥ pāṇibhiḥ tāni pātrāṇi parigṛhya yena tathāgataḥ tena upasaṃkrāman
translated: with their own hands took those bowls and approached the Tathagata.

original: upasaṃkramya tathāgatasya pūjāṃ kṛtvā tāni pātrāṇi divyakusumapratipūrṇāni tathāgatāyopanāmayanti sma //
analyzed: upasaṃkramya tathāgatasya pūjām kṛtvā tāni pātrāṇi divya kusuma pratipūrṇāni tathāgatāya upanāmayanti sma
translated: Having approached and made offerings to the Tathāgata, they presented those bowls filled with divine flowers to the Tathāgata.

original: atha khalu bhikṣavastathāgatasyaitadabhavat amī khalu punaścatvāro mahārājāḥ śraddhāḥ prasannāḥ mama catvāri śailapātrāṇyupanāmayanti /
analyzed: atha khalu bhikṣavaḥ tathāgatasya etat abhavat amī khalu punar catvāraḥ mahā rājāḥ śraddhāḥ prasannāḥ mama catvāri śaila pātrāṇi upanāmayanti
translated: Then, monks, the Tathāgata thought, These four great kings have faith and are devoted, and they have presented me with four stone bowls.

original: na ca me catvāri śailapātrāṇi kalpante /
analyzed: na ca me catvāri śaila pātrāṇi kalpante
translated: But I do not need four stone bowls.

analyzed: atha ekasya pratigṛhīṣyāmi
translated: If I accept one,

analyzed: trayāṇām vaimanasyam syāt
translated: the other three will be disappointed.

analyzed: yat nu aham imāni catvāri pātrāṇi pratigṛhya ekam pātram adhitiṣṭheyam
translated: So I will accept these four bowls and transform them into a single bowl.

original: atha khalu bhikṣavastathāgato dakṣiṇaṃ pāṇiṃ prasārya vaiśravaṇaṃ mahārājaṃ gāthayādhyabhāṣata
analyzed: atha khalu bhikṣavaḥ tathāgataḥ dakṣiṇam pāṇim prasārya vaiśravaṇam mahā rājam gāthayā adhyabhāṣata
translated: Then, monks, the Tathāgata extended his right hand and addressed the great king Vaiśravaṇa with this verse:

original: upanāmayasva sugatasya bhājanaṃ tvaṃ bheṣyase bhājanamagrayāne /
analyzed: upanāmayasva sugatasya bhājanam tvam bheṣyase bhājanam agra yāne
translated: Present a vessel to the Well-Gone One, and you will become a vessel for the supreme vehicle.

original: asmadvidhebhyo hi pradāya bhājanaṃ smṛtirmatiścaiva na jātu hīyate // / //
analyzed: asmadvidhebhyaḥ hi pradāya bhājanam smṛtiḥ matiḥ ca eva na jātu hīyate
translated: For when one gives a vessel to someone like me, mindfulness and wisdom never decline.

original: atha khalu bhikṣavastathāgato vaiśravaṇasya mahārājasyāntikāttatpātraṃ pratigṛhṇīte sma anukampāmupādāya /
analyzed: atha khalu bhikṣavaḥ tathāgataḥ vaiśravaṇasya mahā rājasya antikāt tat pātram pratigṛhṇīte sma anukampām upādāya
translated: Then, monks, the Thus-Gone One accepted that alms bowl from the great king Vaiśravaṇa out of compassion.

analyzed: pratigṛhya ca dhṛtarāṣṭram mahā rājam gāthayā adhyabhāṣata  vaidya
translated: Having accepted it, he spoke this verse to the great king Dhṛtarāṣṭra:

original: yo bhājanaṃ deti tathāgatasya na tasya jātu smṛti prajña hīyate /
analyzed: yaḥ bhājanam deti tathāgatasya na tasya jātu smṛti hīyate
translated: The one who offers a vessel to the Thus-Gone One, their mindfulness and wisdom will never decline.

original: atināmya kālaṃ ca sukhaṃsukhena yāvatpadaṃ budhyati śītibhāvam // / //
analyzed: atināmya kālam ca sukham sukhena yāvat padam budhyati śīti bhāvam
translated: Having passed beyond time, they will attain bliss and the state of cool tranquility with ease.

original: atha khalu bhikṣavastathāgato dhṛtarāṣṭrasya mahārājasyāntikāttatpātraṃ pratigṛhṇīte sma anukampāmupādāya /
analyzed: atha khalu bhikṣavaḥ tathāgataḥ dhṛtarāṣṭrasya mahā rājasya antikāt tat pātram pratigṛhṇīte sma anukampām upādāya
translated: Then, monks, the Thus-Gone One accepted that alms bowl from the great king Dhṛtarāṣṭra out of compassion.

analyzed: pratigṛhya ca virūḍhakam mahā rājam gāthayā adhyabhāṣata
translated: Having accepted it, he spoke this verse to the great king Virūḍhaka:

analyzed: dadāsi yaḥ tvam pariśuddha bhājanam viśuddhacittāya tathāgatāya
translated: You offer a pure vessel to the Thus-Gone One with a pure mind.

original: bhaviṣyasi tvaṃ laghu śuddhacittaḥ praśaṃsito devamanuṣyaloke // / //
analyzed: bhaviṣyasi tvam laghu śuddha cittaḥ praśaṃsitaḥ deva manuṣya loke
translated: You will quickly become pure-minded, praised in the world of gods and humans.

original: atha khalu bhikṣavastathāgato virūḍhakasya mahārājasyāntikāttatpātraṃ pratigṛhṇīte sma anukampāmupādāya /
analyzed: atha khalu bhikṣavaḥ tathāgataḥ virūḍhakasya mahā rājasya antikāt tat pātram pratigṛhṇīte sma anukampām upādāya
translated: Then, monks, the Thus-Gone One accepted that alms bowl from the great king Virūḍhaka out of compassion.

analyzed: pratigṛhya ca virūpākṣam mahā rājam gāthayā adhyabhāṣata
translated: Having accepted it, he spoke this verse to King Virūpākṣa:

analyzed: acchidra śīlasya tathāgatasya acchidra vṛttasya acchidra bhājanam
translated: The Tathāgata, who has flawless morality, flawless conduct, and a flawless vessel,

original: acchidracittaḥ pradadāsi śraddhayā acchidra te bheṣyati puṇyadakṣiṇā // / //🔽pratigṛhṇīte sma bhikṣavastathāgato virūpākṣasya mahārājasyāntikāttatpātraṃ anukampāmupādāya /
analyzed: acchidra cittaḥ pradadāsi śraddhayā acchidra te puṇya dakṣiṇā  pratigṛhṇīte sma bhikṣavaḥ tathāgataḥ virūpākṣasya mahā rājasya antikāt tat pātram anukampām upādāya
translated: With a flawless mind, you give with faith. Your flawless offering of merit will be flawless.🔽Monks, the Tathāgata accepted the alms bowl from King Virūpākṣa out of compassion.

analyzed: pratigṛhya ca ekam pātram adhitiṣṭhati sma adhimukti balena
translated: Having accepted it, he blessed it to become a single bowl through the power of his resolve.

analyzed: tasyām ca velāyām idam udānam udānayati sma
translated: At that time, he uttered this verse:

original: dattāni pātrāṇi pure bhave mayā phalapūritā premaṇiyā ca kṛtvā /
analyzed: dattāni pātrāṇi pure bhave mayā phala pūritā ca kṛtvā
translated: In the past, I gave away alms bowls, filling them with fruits and making them lovable.

original: tenemi pātrāścaturaḥ susaṃsthitā dadanti devāścaturo maharddhikāḥ // / //
analyzed: tena imi pātrāḥ caturaḥ su saṃsthitāḥ dadanti devāḥ caturaḥ maharddhikāḥ
translated: Therefore, these four well-formed alms bowls are given by the four gods of great power.

analyzed: tatra idam ucyate
translated: Regarding this, it is said:

original: sa saptarātraṃ varabodhivṛkṣaṃ saṃprekṣya dhīraḥ paramārthadarśī /
analyzed: sa sapta rātram vara bodhivṛkṣam saṃprekṣya dhīraḥ parama artha darśī
translated: That wise one, the Lion among Men, who sees the highest truth, looked at the supreme Bodhi tree for seven nights.

original: ṣaḍbhiḥ prakāraiḥ pravikampya corvī abhutthitaḥ siṃhagatirnṛsiṃhaḥ // / //
analyzed: ṣaḍbhiḥ prakāraiḥ pravikampya ca urvī abhutthitaḥ siṃha gatiḥ nṛ siṃhaḥ
translated: Shaking the earth in six ways, he arose with the gait of a lion.

analyzed: samanta nāga indra vilamba gāmī krameṇa tārāyaṇa mūlam etya  vaidya
translated: Walking slowly like the king of elephants, he eventually reached the foot of the Tārāyana tree.

original: upāviśanmeruvadaprakampyo dhyānaṃ samādhiṃ ca muniḥ pradadhyau // / //
analyzed: upāviśat meru vat aprakampyaḥ dhyānam samādhim ca muniḥ pradadhyau
translated: The Sage, unshakable like Mount Meru, sat down and contemplated meditation and concentration.

original: tasmiṃśca kāle trapuṣaśca bhalliko bhrātṛdvayaṃ vaṇijagaṇena sārdham /
analyzed: tasmin ca kāle trapuṣaḥ ca bhallikaḥ bhrātṛ dvayam vaṇija gaṇena sārdham
translated: At that time, the two brothers Trapusa and Bhallika, along with a group of merchants,

original: śakaṭāni te pañca dhanena pūrṇā saṃpuṣpite sālavane praviṣṭāḥ // / //
analyzed: śakaṭāni te pañca dhanena pūrṇā saṃpuṣpite sāla vane praviṣṭāḥ
translated: had five carts filled with wealth that entered the blossoming Sāla forest.

original: maharṣitejena ca akṣamātraṃ cakrāṇi bhūmau viviśuḥ kṣaṇena /
analyzed: mahā ṛṣi tejena ca akṣa mātram cakrāṇi bhūmau viviśuḥ kṣaṇena
translated: Due to the power of the great sage, the wheels sank into the ground up to their axles in an instant.

original: tāṃ tādṛśīṃ prekṣya ca te avasthāṃ mahadbhayaṃ vaṇijagaṇasya jātam // / //
analyzed: tām tādṛśīm prekṣya ca te avasthām mahat bhayam vaṇija gaṇasya jātam
translated: Seeing that state, the group of merchants became greatly frightened.

original: te khaḍgahastāḥ śaraśaktipāṇayo vane mṛgaṃ vā mṛgayan ka eṣaḥ /
analyzed: te khaḍga hastāḥ śara śakti pāṇayaḥ vane mṛgam vā mṛgayan kaḥ eṣaḥ
translated: With swords in hand and arrows and spears, they searched for the deer in the forest, wondering who it was.

analyzed: vīkṣanta te śārada candra vaktram jinam sahasrāṃśum iva abhra muktam
translated: They saw the Victorious One, whose face was like the autumn moon, like a thousand-rayed sun freed from clouds.

original: prahīnakopā apanītadarpāḥ praṇamya mūrdhnā vimṛṣuḥ ka eṣaḥ /
analyzed: prahīna kopāḥ apanīta darpāḥ praṇamya mūrdhnā vimṛṣuḥ kaḥ eṣaḥ
translated: Having abandoned anger and removed pride, they bowed their heads and wondered who he was.

original: nabhastalāddevata vāca bhāṣate buddho hyayaṃ lokahitārthakārī // / //
analyzed: nabhastalāt devata vāca bhāṣate buddhaḥ hi ayam loka hita artha kārī
translated: A deity spoke from the sky, This is the Buddha, who acts for the benefit of the world.

original: rātriṃdivā sapta na cānnapānaṃ anena bhuktaṃ karuṇātmakena /
analyzed: rātriṃdivā sapta na ca anna pānam anena bhuktam karuṇā ātmakena
translated: For seven days and nights, he did not eat food or drink, out of compassion.

analyzed: yat icchathāḥ kleśa śāntim bhojethimam bhāvita kāya cittam
translated: If you wish for the pacification of your own afflictions, you should feed him, whose body and mind are cultivated.

original: śabdaṃ ca te taṃ madhuraṃ niśāmya vanditva kṛtvā ca jinaṃ pradakṣiṇam /
analyzed: śabdam ca te tam madhuram niśāmya vanditvā kṛtvā ca jinam pradakṣiṇam
translated: Having heard that sweet sound, and having paid homage and circumambulated the Victor,

original: prītāstataste sahitaiḥ sahāyaiḥ jinasya piṇḍāya matiṃ pracakruḥ // / //
analyzed: prītāḥ tatas te sahitaiḥ sahāyaiḥ jinasya piṇḍāya matim pracakruḥ
translated: they, being delighted, together with their companions, set their minds on offering alms to the Victor.

original: tena khalu bhikṣavaḥ samayena trapuṣabhallikānāṃ vaṇijāṃ pratyantakarvaṭe goyūthaṃ prativasati sma /
analyzed: tena khalu bhikṣavaḥ samayena trapuṣa bhallikānām vaṇijām pratyanta karvaṭe go yūtham prativasati sma
translated: Monks, at that time, on the outskirts of a town, there was a herd of cows belonging to the merchants Trapuṣa and Bhallika.

original: atha tā gāvastasmin kāle tasmin samaye sarpimaṇḍaṃ pradugdhā abhūvan /
analyzed: atha tāḥ gāvaḥ tasmin kāle tasmin samaye sarpi maṇḍam pradugdhāḥ abhūvan
translated: Then, at that time, those cows became full of ghee.

original: atha gopālāstatsarpimaṇḍamādāya yena trapuṣabhallikau vaṇijau tenopasaṃkrāman /
analyzed: atha gopālāḥ tat sarpi maṇḍam ādāya yena trapuṣa bhallikau vaṇijau tena upasaṃkrāman
translated: Then the cowherds, having taken that ghee, approached the merchants Trapuṣa and Bhallika.

original: upasaṃkramyemāṃ prakṛtimārocayanti sma yatkhalu yūyaṃ bhaṭṭā jānīyāta sarvāstā gāvaḥ sarpimaṇḍaṃ pradugdhāḥ /
analyzed: upasaṃkramya imām prakṛtim ārocayanti sma yat khalu yūyam bhaṭṭāḥ jānīyāta sarvāḥ tāḥ gāvaḥ sarpi maṇḍam pradugdhāḥ
translated: Having approached, they announced this news: Sirs, you should know that all those cows have become full of ghee.

analyzed: tat kim etat praśastam āhosvit na iti
translated: Is this a good thing or not?

analyzed: tatra lolupa jātyāḥ brāhmaṇāḥ evam āhuḥ amaṅgalyam etat bāhmaṇānām

translated: Then, monks, Śikhin the Great Brahmā, knowing that the Thus-Gone One had accepted his request with silence, having sprinkled the Thus-Gone One with divine sandalwood powder and aloeswood powder, being filled with joy and delight, disappeared right there.

original: atha khalu bhikṣavastathāgatasya dharmālokasyādarotpādanārthaṃ śikhinaśca mahābrahmaṇaḥ
analyzed: atha khalu bhikṣavaḥ tathāgatasya dharma ālokasya ādara utpādana artham śikhinaḥ ca mahābrahmaṇaḥ
translated: Then, monks, in order to arouse respect for the Thus-Gone One's light of the Dharma and for Śikhin the Great Brahmā,

analyzed: punar punar tathāgata adhyeṣaṇayā kuśala mūla vivṛddhi artham dharmasya ca ati gambhīra udāra tām upādāya
translated: and in order to increase the roots of virtue through the Thus-Gone One's repeated requests, and because the Dharma is extremely profound and vast,

analyzed: punar api ekasya rahaḥ gatasya pratisaṃlīnasya ayam evaṃrūpam cetaḥ vitarkaḥ bhūt gambhīraḥ
translated: Again, while he was alone in seclusion, this kind of thought arose in his mind: “This Dharma that I have realized is profound,

original: khalvayaṃ mayā dharmo 'bhisaṃbuddhaḥ sūkṣmo nipuṇo duranubodhaḥ atarko 'tarkāvacaraḥ
analyzed: khalu ayam mayā dharmaḥ bhisaṃbuddhaḥ sūkṣmaḥ nipuṇaḥ duranubodhaḥ a tarkaḥ tarka avacaraḥ
translated: subtle, excellent, beyond the intellect, inconceivable,

analyzed: paṇḍita vijña vedanīyaḥ sarva loka vipratyanīkaḥ durdṛśaḥ sarva upadhi niḥsargaḥ sarva saṃskāra upaśamaḥ
translated: to be experienced by the wise and the noble ones, disagreeable to all, difficult to see, the relinquishment of all attachments, the pacification of all conditioned things,

analyzed: sarvatama upacchedaḥ śūnyatā anupalambhaḥ tṛṣṇā kṣayaḥ virāgaḥ nirodhaḥ nirvāṇam
translated: the cutting off of all darkness, emptiness, non-apprehension, the destruction of craving, dispassion, cessation, nirvana.

analyzed: aham ced idam dharmam deśayeyam
translated: If I were to teach this Dharma,

analyzed: pare ca me na vibhāvayeyuḥ
translated: and others did not understand it,

analyzed: sā me paramā viheṭhā bhavet
translated: that would be a great hardship for me.

analyzed: yat nu aham alpa utsuka vihāreṇa eva vihareyam
translated: Therefore, I will dwell with little desire.

original: atha khalu bhikṣavaḥ śikhī mahābrahmā buddhānubhāvena punarapi tathāgatasyetadamevaṃrūpeṇa cetaḥ parivitarkamājñāya yena śakro devānāmindrastenopasaṃkrāmat
analyzed: atha khalu bhikṣavaḥ śikhī mahābrahmā buddha anubhāvena punar api tathāgatasya etat am evaṃrūpeṇa cetaḥ parivitarkam ājñāya yena śakraḥ devānām indraḥ tena upasaṃkrāmat
translated: Then, monks, Śikhin the Great Brahmā, through the Buddha's power, again understood the Tathāgata's thought with this kind of mental reflection, and he approached Śakra, Lord of the Gods,

original: upasaṃkramya śakraṃ devānāmindrametadavocat yatkhalu kauśika jānīyāstathāgatasyārhataḥ samyaksaṃbuddhasyālpotsukatāyai cittaṃ nataṃ na dharmadeśanāyām🔽nakṣyate batāyaṃ kauśika lokaḥ /
analyzed: upasaṃkramya śakram devānām indram etat avocat yat khalu kauśika jānīyāḥ tathāgatasya arhataḥ samyaksaṃbuddhasya alpa utsuka tāyai cittam natam na dharma deśanāyām  nakṣyate bata ayam kauśika lokaḥ
translated: Having approached, he said this to Śakra, Lord of the Gods: Kauśika, you should know that the mind of the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Enlightened One, is inclined towards fewness of wishes, not towards teaching the Dharma.🔽Alas, Kauśika, this world will perish.

analyzed: vinakṣyate bata ayam kauśika lokaḥ
translated: Alas, Kauśika, this world will be destroyed.

analyzed: mahā vidyā andhakāra kṣiptaḥ bata ayam kauśika lokaḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: Alas, Kauśika, this world will be plunged into the great darkness of ignorance,

original: yatra hi nāma tathāgatasyārhataḥ samyaksaṃbuddhasyālpotsukatāyai cittaṃ nataṃ na dharmasaṃprakāśanāyām /
analyzed: yatra hi nāma tathāgatasya arhataḥ samyaksaṃbuddhasya alpa utsuka tāyai cittam natam na dharma saṃprakāśanāyām
translated: where the mind of the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Enlightened One, is inclined towards fewness of wishes, not towards revealing the Dharma.

analyzed: kasmāt vayam na gacchāmaḥ tathāgatam arhantam samyaksaṃbuddham dharmacakra pravartanāya adhyeṣitum
translated: For what reason should we not go to request the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Enlightened One, to turn the wheel of the Dharma?

analyzed: tat kasmāt
translated: Why is that?

analyzed: na hi an adhyeṣitāḥ tathāgatāḥ dharmacakram pravartayanti
translated: For the Tathāgatas do not turn the wheel of the Dharma without being requested.

original: sādhu mārṣeti śakro brahmā bhaumāśca devā antarīkṣāścāturmahārājakāyikāstrāyatriṃśā
analyzed: sādhu mārṣa iti śakraḥ brahmā bhaumāḥ ca devāḥ antarīkṣāḥ cāturmahārājakāyikāḥ trāyatriṃśā
translated: Good, friend! said Śakra, Brahmā, the Earth Gods, the Space Gods, the Gods of the Four Great Kings, the Gods of the Thirty-Three,

original: yāmāstuṣitā nirmāṇaratayaḥ paranirmitavaśavartino brahmakāyikā ābhāsvarā bṛhatphalā
analyzed: yāmāḥ tuṣitāḥ nirmāṇaratayaḥ paranirmitavaśavartinaḥ brahmakāyikāḥ ābhāsvarāḥ bṛhatphalā
translated: the Yāma gods, the Tuṣita gods, the Nirmāṇarati gods, the Paranirmitavaśavartin gods, the gods of the Brahmā group, the Ābhāsvara gods, the Bṛhatphala gods,

analyzed: śubhakṛtsnā saṃbahulāni ca śuddhāvāsa kāyika devaputra śata sahasrāṇi atikrānta varṇā
translated: the Śubhakṛtsna gods, and many hundreds of thousands of Śuddhāvāsa gods of surpassing appearance,

original: atikrāntāyāṃ rātrau kevalaṃ tārāyaṇamūlaṃ divyena varṇena divyenāvabhāsenāvabhāsya
analyzed: atikrāntāyām rātrau kevalam tārāyaṇa mūlam divyena varṇena divyena avabhāsena avabhāsya
translated: after the night had passed, illuminated the foot of the Pūrvavideha tree with divine appearance and radiance,

analyzed: yena tathāgataḥ tena upasaṃkrāman
translated: and approached the Tathāgata.

original: upasaṃkramya tathāgatasya pādau śirasābhivandya pradakṣiṇīkṛtya caikānte tasthuḥ //
analyzed: upasaṃkramya tathāgatasya pādau śirasā abhivandya pradakṣiṇīkṛtya ca ekānte tasthuḥ
translated: Having approached, they bowed their heads at the feet of the Tathāgata, circumambulated him, and stood to one side.

original: atha khalu śakro devānāmindro yena tathāgatastenāñjaliṃ praṇamya tathāgataṃ gāthayābhituṣṭāva
analyzed: atha khalu śakraḥ devānām indraḥ yena tathāgataḥ tena añjalim praṇamya tathāgatam gāthayā abhituṣṭāva
translated: Then Śakra, Lord of the Gods, with palms joined in respect towards the Tathāgata, praised the Tathāgata with this verse:

original: uttiṣṭha vijitasaṃgrāma prajñākārā timisrā vivara loke /
analyzed: uttiṣṭha vijita saṃgrāma prajñā kārā timisrā vivara loke
translated: Rise, O Victorious One in Battle, O Light-Maker, open the darkness in the world.

original: cittaṃ hi te vimuktaṃ śaśiriva pūrṇo grahavimuktaḥ // / //
analyzed: cittam hi te vimuktam śaśiḥ iva pūrṇaḥ graha vimuktaḥ
translated: Your mind is liberated, like the full moon released from an eclipse.

analyzed: vaidya
translated: Vidy

analyzed: evam ukte tathāgataḥ tūṣṇīm eva asthāt
translated: When this was said, the Tathāgata remained silent.

original: atha khalu śikhī mahābrahmā śakraṃ devānāmindrametadavocat naiva kauśika tathāgatā arhantaḥ samyaksaṃbuddhā adhyeṣyante dharmacakrapravartanatāyai
analyzed: atha khalu śikhī mahābrahmā śakram devānām indram etat avocat na eva kauśika tathāgatāḥ arhantaḥ samyaksaṃbuddhāḥ adhyeṣyante dharma cakra pravartana tāyai
translated: Then the Great Brahma Shikhin said to Shakra, Lord of the Gods, Kaushhika, the Tathagatas, the Arhats, the Perfectly Enlightened Ones are not requested to turn the wheel of the Dharma

analyzed: yathā tvam adhyeṣase
translated: as you are requesting.

original: atha khalu śikhī mahābrahmā ekāṃsamuttarāsaṅgaṃ kṛtvā dakṣiṇajānumaṇḍalaṃ pṛthivyāṃ pratiṣṭhāpya yena tathāgatastenāñjaliṃ praṇamya tathāgataṃ
analyzed: atha khalu śikhī mahābrahmā eka aṃsam uttarāsaṅgam kṛtvā dakṣiṇa jānu maṇḍalam pṛthivyām pratiṣṭhāpya yena tathāgataḥ tena añjalim praṇamya tathāgatam
translated: Then the Great Brahma Shikhin, arranging his upper robe on one shoulder, placing his right knee on the ground, bowing to the Tathagata with palms joined,

analyzed: gāthayā adhyabhāṣata
translated: addressed the Tathagata with this verse:

original: uttiṣṭha vijitasaṃgrāma prajñākārā timisrā vivara loke /
analyzed: uttiṣṭha vijita saṃgrāma prajñā kārā timisrā vivara loke
translated: Arise, O Victorious One in Battle, O Light-Maker, open the darkness in the world.

original: deśaya tvaṃ mune dharmaṃ ājñātāro bhaviṣyanti // / //
analyzed: deśaya tvam mune dharmam ājñātāraḥ bhaviṣyanti
translated: Teach the Dharma, O Sage, there will be those who understand.

original: evamukte bhikṣavastathāgataḥ śikhinaṃ mahābrahmāṇametadavocat gambhīraḥ khalvayaṃ mahābrahman mayā dharmo 'bhisaṃbuddhaḥ sūkṣmo nipuṇaḥ peyālaṃ
analyzed: evam ukte bhikṣavaḥ tathāgataḥ śikhinam mahābrahmāṇam etat avocat gambhīraḥ khalu ayam mahābrahman mayā dharmaḥ bhisaṃbuddhaḥ sūkṣmaḥ nipuṇaḥ peyālam
translated: When this was said, monks, the Tathagata said to the Great Brahma Shikhin, This Dharma, O Great Brahma, which I have realized is profound, subtle, excellent, beyond the sphere of reasoning, imperceptible, and not within the sphere of logic.

analyzed: yāvat sā me syāt paramā viheṭhā
translated: It would be a great disappointment to me if I were to teach it.

original: api ca me brahmannime gāthe 'bhīkṣṇaṃ pratibhāsaḥ
analyzed: api ca me brahman ime gāthe bhīkṣṇam
translated: Moreover, O Brahma, these two verses have frequently appeared to me:🔽The Dharma that I have realized is profound, subtle, excellent, beyond the sphere of reasoning, imperceptible, and not within the sphere of logic.

analyzed: pratisrota gāmi mārgaḥ gambhīraḥ durdṛśaḥ mama
translated: The path that goes against the stream is profound and difficult to see for me.

original: na taṃ drakṣyanti rāgāndhā alaṃ tasmātprakāśitum // / //
analyzed: na tam drakṣyanti rāga andhāḥ alam tasmāt prakāśitum
translated: Those blinded by passion will not see it. It is enough, therefore, not to reveal it.

analyzed: anusrotam pravāhyante kāmeṣu patitā prajāḥ
translated: The people have fallen into desires, flowing along with the stream.

analyzed: kṛcchreṇa me yam saṃprāptam alam tasmāt prakāśitum
translated: This has been attained by me with difficulty. It is enough, therefore, not to reveal it.

original: atha khalu bhikṣavaḥ śikhī mahābrahmā śakraśca devānāmindrastathāgataṃ tūṣṇībhūtaṃ viditvā sārdhaṃ tairdevaputrairduḥkhitā durmanāstatraivāntaradhāyiṣuḥ
analyzed: atha khalu bhikṣavaḥ śikhī mahābrahmā śakraḥ ca devānām indraḥ tathāgatam tūṣṇībhūtam viditvā sārdham taiḥ devaputraiḥ duḥkhitāḥ durmanāḥ tatra eva antaradhāyiṣuḥ
translated: Then, monks, Śikhin the Great Brahmā and Śakra, lord of the gods, knowing that the Tathāgata remained silent, together with those sons of gods, being sorrowful and dejected, disappeared right there.

original: trirapi ca tathāgatasyālpotsukatāyai cittaṃ namayati sma //
analyzed: tris api ca tathāgatasya alpa utsuka tāyai cittam namayati sma
translated: And for the third time, the Tathāgata inclined his mind to indifference.

original: tena khalu punarbhikṣavaḥ samayena māgadhakānāṃ manuṣyāṇāmimānyevaṃrūpāṇi pāpakāni akuśalāni dṛṣṭigatānyutpannānyabhūvan /
analyzed: tena khalu punar bhikṣavaḥ samayena māgadhakānām manuṣyāṇām imāni evaṃrūpāṇi pāpakāni akuśalāni dṛṣṭi gatāni utpannāni abhūvan
translated: At that time, monks, these kinds of evil, unwholesome views arose among the people of Magadha:

analyzed: tat yathā  kecid evam āhuḥ vātāḥ na vāsyanti
translated: Namely:🔽Some said: The winds will not blow.

analyzed: kecid evam āhuḥ agniḥ na jvaliṣyati
translated: Some said: The fire will not burn.

analyzed: kecid āhuḥ devaḥ na varṣiṣyati
translated: Some said: The god will not rain.

analyzed: kecid āhuḥ nadyaḥ na vahyanti
translated: Some said: The rivers will not flow.

original: kecidāhuḥ śasyāni na prajāsyanti /🔽kecidāhu pakṣiṇa ākāśe na kramiṣyanti /
analyzed: kecid āhuḥ śasyāni na  kecid āhuḥ pakṣiṇaḥ ākāśe na kramiṣyanti
translated: Some said, 'The crops will not ripen.'🔽Some said, 'Birds will not fly in the sky.'

analyzed: kecid āhuḥ gurviṇyaḥ na ārogyeṇa prasaviṣyanti
translated: Some said, 'Pregnant women will not give birth without illness.'

original: atha khalu bhikṣavaḥ śikhī mahābrahmā tathāgatasyaivamevaṃrūpaṃ cittavitarkamājñāya
analyzed: atha khalu bhikṣavaḥ śikhī mahābrahmā tathāgatasya evam evaṃrūpam citta vitarkam ājñāya
translated: Then, monks, Śikhin, the Great Brahmā, having understood the Tathāgata's thoughts in this way,

original: māgadhakānāṃ ca manuṣyāṇāmimāni dṛṣṭigatāni viditvā atikrāntāyāṃ rātrāvabhisaṃkrāntena
analyzed: māgadhakānām ca manuṣyāṇām imāni dṛṣṭi gatāni viditvā atikrāntāyām rātrau abhisaṃkrāntena
translated: and knowing these views of the Magadhan people, in the morning

original: varṇena sarvāvantaṃ tārāyaṇamūlaṃ divyenāvabhāsenāvabhāsya yena tathāgatastenopasaṃkrāmat /🔽upasaṃkramya tathāgatasya pādau śirasābhivandyaikāṃsamuttarāsaṅgaṃ kṛtvā dakṣiṇaṃ
analyzed: varṇena sarvāvantam tārāyaṇa mūlam divyena avabhāsena avabhāsya yena tathāgataḥ tena upasaṃkrāmat  upasaṃkramya tathāgatasya pādau śirasā abhivandya eka aṃsam uttarāsaṅgam kṛtvā dakṣiṇam
translated: he approached the Tathāgata, illuminating the entire Bodhi tree with divine radiance.🔽Having approached, he bowed his head at the feet of the Tathāgata, arranged his upper robe over one shoulder,🔽placed his right knee on the ground,

original: jānumaṇḍalaṃ pṛthivyāṃ pratiṣṭhāpya yena tathāgatastenāñjaliṃ praṇamya tathāgataṃ
analyzed: jānu maṇḍalam pṛthivyām pratiṣṭhāpya yena tathāgataḥ tena añjalim praṇamya tathāgatam
translated: joined his palms in reverence to the Tathāgata,

analyzed: gāthābhiḥ adhyabhāṣata
translated: and addressed the Tathāgata in verses:

original: vādo babhūva samalairvicintito dharmo 'viśuddho magadheṣu pūrvam /
analyzed: vādaḥ babhūva sa malaiḥ vicintitaḥ dharmaḥ viśuddhaḥ magadheṣu pūrvam
translated: 'The doctrine, impure, was previously thought by the defiled in Magadha.

original: amṛtaṃ mune tadvivṛṇīṣva dvāraṃ śṛṇvanti dharmaṃ vimalena buddham // / //
analyzed: amṛtam mune tat vivṛṇīṣva dvāram śṛṇvanti dharmam vimalena buddham
translated: O Sage, please open that door to immortality. They listen to the Dharma with pure understanding.

analyzed: vaidya
translated: Vidy

analyzed: kṛta svaka arthaḥ si bhujiṣya tām gataḥ duḥkha abhisaṃskāra mala apakṛṣṭaḥ
translated: You have accomplished your own purpose and attained mastery, having removed the impurities of painful conditioning.

original: na hānivṛddhī kuśalasya te 'sti tvamagradharmeṣviha pāramiṃ gataḥ // / //
analyzed: na hāni vṛddhī kuśalasya te sti tvam agra dharmeṣu iha pāramim gataḥ
translated: You have neither loss nor increase of virtue. You have reached perfection in the supreme dharmas.

original: na te mune sadṛśa ihāsti loke kuto 'dhikaḥ syādiha te maharṣe /
analyzed: na te mune sadṛśaḥ iha asti loke kutas dhikaḥ syāt iha te mahā ṛṣe
translated: O Sage, there is no one equal to you in this world, let alone anyone greater, O Great Sage.

analyzed: bhavān iha agraḥ tri bhave virocate giriḥ yathā saḥ asura ālaya sthaḥ
translated: You shine here in the three worlds, like that mountain located in the abode of the Asuras.

original: mahākṛpāṃ jānaya duḥkhite jane na tvādṛśā jātu bhavantyupekṣakāḥ /
analyzed: mahā kṛpām jānaya duḥkhite jane na tvādṛśāḥ jātu bhavanti upekṣakāḥ
translated: Generate great compassion for the suffering people. Those like you are never indifferent.

original: bhavān viśāradyabalaiḥ samanvitaḥ tvameva śakto janatāṃ pratāritum // / //
analyzed: bhavān viśāradya balaiḥ samanvitaḥ tvam eva śaktaḥ janatām pratāritum
translated: You are endowed with the powers of fearlessness. You alone are able to deliver the people.

original: iyaṃ suśalyā sucirāturā prajā sadevakā saśramaṇā dvijākhilā /
analyzed: iyam su śalyā su cira āturā prajā sa devakā sa śramaṇā dvija akhilā
translated: This afflicted and long-suffering people, together with the gods, ascetics, Brahmins and all,

original: āroginī bhotu nirāturajvarā na cāparaḥ śaraṇamihāsya vidyate // / //
analyzed: āroginī nirātura jvarā na ca aparaḥ śaraṇam iha asya vidyate
translated: May they be healthy and free from fever and distress. There is no other refuge for them here.

analyzed: cira anubaddhāḥ tava deva mānuṣāḥ kalyāṇa cittāḥ amṛta arthinaḥ ca
translated: For a long time, gods and humans have been bound to you, with wholesome minds, seeking immortality.

analyzed: dharmam yam eva adhigamiṣyate jinaḥ yathāvat anyūnam udāhariṣyati
translated: The Dharma that the Victor will realize, he will proclaim as it is, without deficiency.

original: tasmāddhiyā cāmisu vikrama tvāṃ vinayasva sattvāṃ ciranaṣṭamārgāṃ /
analyzed: tasmāt dhiyā ca āmisu vikrama tvām vinayasva sattvām cira naṣṭa mārgām
translated: Therefore, with your mind, you should show compassion to the world, and discipline the beings who have long been lost on the path.

original: aviśrutārthā śamanāya kāṅkṣitāḥ sudurbalā bṛṃhaṇakāṅkṣiṇo vā // / //
analyzed: a viśruta arthā śamanāya kāṅkṣitāḥ su durbalāḥ bṛṃhaṇa kāṅkṣiṇaḥ vā
translated: They are not well-known, desired for peace, or very weak, desiring nourishment.

original: iyaṃ tṛṣārtā janatā mahāmune udīkṣate dharmajalaṃ tavāntike /
analyzed: iyam tṛṣā ārtā janatā mahā mune udīkṣate dharma jalam tava antike
translated: This thirsty multitude, O Great Sage, looks up to you for the water of the Dharma.

original: megho yathā saṃtṛṣitāṃ vasuṃdharāṃ kuru tarpaṇāṃ nāyaka dharmavṛṣṭyā // / //
analyzed: meghaḥ yathā saṃtṛṣitām vasuṃdharām kuru tarpaṇām nāyaka dharma vṛṣṭyā
translated: Like a cloud to the thirsty earth, O Leader, satisfy them with the rain of the Dharma.

original: cirapraṇaṣṭā vicaranti mānavā bhave kudṛṣṭīgahane sakaṇṭake /
analyzed: cira praṇaṣṭāḥ vicaranti mānavāḥ bhave kudṛṣṭī gahane sa kaṇṭake
translated: Men wander for a long time, lost in the dense thicket of wrong views, with its thorns.

analyzed: vaidya
translated: Doctor

original: akaṇṭakaṃ mārgamṛjuṃ pracakṣva taṃ yaṃ bhāvayitvā hyamṛtaṃ labheyam // / //
analyzed: akaṇṭakam mārgam ṛjum pracakṣva tam yam bhāvayitvā hi amṛtam labheyam
translated: Declare that thornless, straight path, contemplating which one may attain immortality.

analyzed: andhā prapāte patitāḥ hi anāyakāḥ na uddhartum anyaiḥ iha śakyam ete
translated: They have fallen into a blind abyss, without a guide, they cannot be rescued by others here.

original: mahāprapāte patitāṃ samuddhara chandaṃ samutpādya vṛṣo 'si buddhimān // / //
